column2: ["The teacher's are pretty pog and are always supportive of their students and work to help them become successful. The F,H and G wing intersection is a nightmare though lol a renovation for that could be useful along with new paint. Otherwise I can't complain, i've made really good relationships and developed existing ones at EMHS and always have the chance to get involved in something if I wanted to. Very good HS", 'I loved all four years at East Meadow and I made lifelong friends along the way. Practically every single teacher cares tremendously about every student and it shows. I am forever grateful for those years of my life.', 'East Meadow High School is a diverse school that puts a lot of effort on music and arts. We have some nice and some amazing and some OK teachers. The two biggest problems in my opinion are vaping/drugs in gym lockers, bathrooms etc and lack of interest from administration. EMHS provides so much less opportunities than Clark HS that is also in East Meadow.', 'East Meadow High is a good school, but could use some changes. Athletically we are below average with poor facilities. Academically EMHS is very good in offering classes to us. The school needs a modern renovation, but overall a good school.', "I really liked my time at East Meadow HS. I felt that the teachers were caring and that the environment was positive. The school helped me feel prepared for college and offered many resources to help it's students. I would change minor things such as the heating and cooling and old gym gear.", 'More recreational activities and more divers activitiesMore activities for the seniorsMore pep-ralliesDance team', 'Great school, proud alum. This school will prepare their students very well for college as long as the student takes advantage of all that the school offers and the excellent faculty', 'I made plenty of good memories with my friends at East Meadow High School and I enjoyed my classes especially art and social studies.', 'I liked that East Meadow High School offered a safe learning environment and all the teachers were great. Everyone is friendly and there are many ways to get involved in activities going on throughout the year.', 'The school is very diverse. There are many opportunities to take Honor, Ap, College classes and they even have a  Boces program. There are many clubs and activities for every hobby or interest.', "Some teachers really care about you as an individual and for your future, but most guidance counselors don't actually help at all. Most teachers are understanding and prepared to teach every day. They're organized and clearly have everything organized for the students. For the most part, the students are welcoming and friendly, but this year, we've had problems with vaping in the bathrooms. In addition, there are no air conditioners in some classrooms, which makes it extremely difficult to learn in the summer when you're sweating buckets and overheating.", 'Had a great time while in school here. My teachers overall were very dedicated and helpful. My counselor helped me find the right college for me and  my courses prepared me for success in college. I always had things to do, ranging from Battle of the Classes to sporting events.', "I wouldn't be who I am today without East Meadow High School and I am thankful for the opportunities and friends it gave me.", 'Overall a good experience, nothing would make it worse or better if it was changed immediately. Some great memories with some great people add to the overall experience. Though there are improvements that could be made the positive aspects of the school and the community outweigh the negative ones.', 'The teachers are all so intuitive and caring, as well as the staff. The facility itself could use improvement but other than that being a Jet is great!!', 'I had a good experience at the school. I was blessed with the teachers I got, all nice, all understandings, and all good at their job.', 'I like my carpentry class and taking orchestra a lot. Both of my teachers are awesome. My guidance counselor is very helpful and thought of me when she saw a college course that I would like and she was right. I took the course in the summer at NYIT.', 'Overall East Meadow provided a well rounded education compared to other schools. I wish they gave more information regarding college sooner. I hope they can implement an "how to succeed in college and what to expect" class in high school.', "I'm just a student at EMHS, and it's not a bad school, but it could be better. The teachers are very nice, but they aren't very caring about you or your future. The teacher do their jobs, and they do it well; however, if they cared a little bit more, My review would be higher. Sadly, 3 stars are the best I can do.", 'Amazing school. Great teachers. A step above the rest. ***** STARS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!']

column6: ['Very strict faculty. Kida are getting wilder each generation. When I went to this school we actually had a fun time in high school. Now everything is different.', 'East Meadow High School was an over-all great school to be a part of. There were many extra-curricular activities and events to take part in, and a lot of truly invested teachers that strive to help the kids succeed.', 'Caring and progressive administration, great food options, and plenty of extracurricular activities to choose from.', 'Many opportunities such as Model Congress and Theatre Guild being some of the best and well funded clubs in the school. Highly reccomend those clubs. the cafeteria needs a coffee machine btw. Sports is glorified, and they dont win that much. Model Congress is composed of some of the most intelligent students in the school, and we debate competitively against 6 other schools, 7 times a year. East Meadow Theatre guild puts on exceptional productions, 2 shows a year. Needs more shows per year.', "East Meadow High School is a great place for academics and extra curricular activities. They offer a lot of sports and clubs for students to participate in. The teachers are absolutely amazing and are very helpful. The guidance department also makes the students more prepared for college because they makes sure the student is on top of they're work from day one of freshman year to the last day of their senior year.", 'I love East Meadow High School and I am sad that I am going to be graduating this year. I have had the best teachers who have provided me with an amazing education these past four years. I have not only made the best friends here, but the best memories. The experiences that I have had here have prepared me for the rest of my life and I am eternally grateful to have gone to such a great school.', 'I love East Meadow High School! Most of the teachers are great and I really feel prepared for high school. Some improvements that the school needs are mainly superficial, like better heating/air conditioning, fixing leaky roofs, getting better classroom technology (the class laptops are pretty bad and the iPads are not much better).', 'East Meadow High School provided me with a great education. I have to say that it prepared me greatly for my higher education and the University of Arizona. It also gave me the options of numerous clubs and after school activities, rewarding me with lifetime friends and possible work connections.', 'Great school neighborhood and people. Curriculum is great and has high standards for education and diversity. Sports are great and wonderful.  Neiborhood has great stores and schools. Has 5 elementary 2 milled and 2 high schools   All are great schools and neeiborhoods are great. High,y recommend schools here and housing in not too bad. Taxes are high for Nassau county but schools are wonderful', "East Meadow High School has great teachers and great extracurricular activities. It is more than just a place to learn from it's friendly environment to its phenomenal programs.", 'I liked all the elective classes and club options, also having the opportunity to attend a BOCES program. The schools do not really have bullying going on, for the most part everyone is friendly. Most of the teachers were good and nice.', 'Great school & great experience. teachers and administration are always willing to help. sports have won numerous championships and facilities are well taken care of.', 'East Meadow High School offers a wide variety of courses and programs to engage students academically. Their athletic programs also engage the students to encourage individual growth and team building.', 'East Meadow was a close knit high school regardless of its large class size, which is usually over 400. The sports were good, and many of the teachers were kind and always willing to help.', 'I personally believe that I had a good experience at this school due to the lack of bullying I experienced. However, I do believe that there should be a bit more guidance in the college application process as even though there are guidance counselors, it is a bit daunting sometimes to make an appointment earlier on to start talking about college even if you feel like you need the guidance. It is especially difficult for the first child of the family and/or the first in the family to go to college either in America or at all.', "guidance counselor amazing in prepping students for college.administration and board's first rule is to protect their teachers.overall an above average education and very good opportunities for students to participate in clubs and sports. The best program by far is its music program.", "East Meadow High School is the best high school on Long Island. From it's inclusiveness in LGBT+ issues to the excelling sports programs. East Meadow High's teachers are also truly dedicated to making sure students succeed in every way imaginable. East Meadow High School has helped me grow into the person i am today, and has taught me how to prepare for college and the real world.", 'I went to east meadow high school for four years. My experience there was overall positive. The atmosphere is welcoming and the people there are very kind and caring. There are also many opportunities there as well, like sports, clubs and honor societies. There is always something to do! And when at times I struggled in a certain subject, there was always someone there to help. There is nothing that I would change about east meadow high school except for maybe moving the prison that is right across from it!', 'The teachers are very nice and they are available for extra help. Their regents review classes are great since they exist for a prolonged period of a few weeks. The tests are tough though but many of the resources are great. There is good amount of diversity and you can see all different cultures. There is a friendly environment for all the different types of children. Overall it is a good place to study.', 'I had an amazing experience at East Meadow High School.  I always felt connected to my teachers, who prepared me so well to take on my next steps as a college student.']
column8: ['It is a decent school, 3 stars pretty much encapsulates everything I could say. The music dept. is exceptional.', "So far I've enjoyed my time at East Meadow High School. The teachers are very supportive and the environment of the school is very welcoming and friendly.", "East Meadow High School is somewhat diverse but it lacks a focused education. Students are placed into classes they don't belong in and the guidance counselors are no help whatsoever. The teachers are not well coordinated and while they are extremely intelligent, they cannot teach well. Students do not place their focus on their studies and the faculty members do not emphasize the importance of some classes. I would like some classes to be mandatory, such as Careers and Finance or College Accounting, as they are crucial to understanding the real world.", 'I would like to see their policy of bullying to be changed. Basically their policy works like this : if the principals or any of the teachers don\'t see it , then they don\'t do anything to help it. And also they need to hire coaches that will make sure everyone is included , and treated with respect. I was on the cheerleading team for 4 years and my coach never cared about all of the cliques that were made. Nor did she care that I was left out of everything, and ignored by everyone. And even out of multiple times talking to her about the situation , she did nothing. And neither did the athletic director , what he said to me was " What do you want me to hold your hand". Now let those words sink in. Thats what the athletic director said to me when i was being bullied and felt so alone.', 'My experience at east meadow high school is very well. We have an wonderful athletics program, as I participate in a sport every season and as of now am on varsity for volleyball. My teachers are all excellent and help me excel in my area of education and I would not rather be at any other high school.', 'East Meadow High School was a great place to get my education. Most teachers made a huge impact on my life and shaped my work ethics to prepare me for life in college.', 'East Meadow High School was hell on earth for me.  I was bullied all through my time at Woodland Middle School and then it continued through parts of high school.  The administration did nothing.  I was sent to the school psychologist and he not once told anyone about the bullying.  Not a single administrator cares about any students outside of the ones participating in sports.', 'East Meadow High School has given me nothing but a positive and educational experience.  The feature most important to the beauty of the school is the faculty.  Teachers will go the extra mile to make sure students are well taken care of and are capable of understanding the material.  Guidance councilers will work tirelessly in order for you to have the best plans for your future.  Administration is friendly and helpful.  Programs such as Peer Leaders makes it easier for incoming freshmen to transition to high school. Clubs and sports are extremely diverse and vary.  Our school does an excellent job of keeping students in order and making sure we all feel safe.  Every aspect of this high school is fantastic and I cannot be more thankful for the education i5 has bestowed upon me.', 'Its a great school, the sports teams are incredible and the music programs as well. they have a wide variety of  classes to choose from and it is located in a great community', 'Overall, the high school experience was good. One thing I would like to see change is the mathematics department which failed to prepare me for college. If you are interested pursuing a degree in the STEM field as I did, you may see that you will be unqualified for many of the top schools if you are not placed in accelerated mathematics and science courses. If you get "held back" as the majority of students do as determined by middle school test results, you will be barred from taking many AP courses in mathematics and science, leaving you ill prepared for a college degree in the STEM field. Other than this, teachers were great and there were plenty of clubs to get involved in, some that hosted overseas trips to Europe!', "I enjoyed the minimalist style of the website, especially on mobile. I'm a firm believer that an aesthetically pleasing website is a valuable component to running a successful site, and Niche definitely qualifies. The directions to make an account are clear, and it only takes minutes to potentially save thousands of dollars on my education. Overall, Niche is excellent. ", 'Not only is there a wide variety of club activities, there are opportunities for new clubs to be founded.', "My son is in the honors' program.  Many of the classes are on the college level.  They treat the students respectfully.", 'School is on top of latest health issues and send communication home', "I believe that East Meadow High School offers many opportunities for students if they are interested.  The teachers are willing to offer help and guidance if they are sought out.  There is a great deal of school pride beginning with the principal who is a graduate of the school. My son's high school experiences have been positive and inspirational.", 'There are a lot of different extracurricular activities offered for all different interests. Such as sports, art club, theatre, music, etc.', 'I really liked this school. I was involved in field hockey there which I really enjoyed, and also Battle of the Classes. I made a lot of friends there, including my really close friends and I really enjoyed my four years there.', 'Most of the teachers I had at this school, were very nice and they always helped whenever it was needed. I learned a lot in each class, and if I needed any extra help, it was almost always available to me.', 'The school always does its hardest to make sure that everyone is well and is treated with care. The school does not tolerate bullying and will try to prevent it as much as it can. With medical attention, the school nurse is always on service, and in serious cases, the hospital across the street is always available.', 'My school offers so much for any student in any type of life. We have sports, we have music clubs, safety clubs, challenege clubs, and more. Every one of them offers a unique experience for all students and a challenge to all, and I can always find a new club to enjoy or try out.']

column2: ["Glen Rock High School will hold some of my fondest memories, and some very harsh opinions. I loved my time there, with the school's closely knit community and focus on balancing academics and other activities. However, change is needed to maintain the school's reputation.1.) More dual-enrollment and science/technology classes MUST be offered.  Being a STEM major, I have friends who went to schools that had a ton of these classes. They're all able to take only 1 more class in order to get a Minor because of the DE classes they took. They also know how to code, weld, work on cars, etc.2.) Change the post-HS perception. College is NOT meant for everyone. Some people are better suited to go to a trade school or starting their own venture. Seeing how many people dropped out of college at the end of freshman year confirms this.", 'Glen Rock High School is a good school. The teachers are either great or not so great The majority of the teachers want to see their students succeed, however, their are some that are relying on their tenure. As a sports player, I know that the school invests most of its money into sports related things. This is bad because a lot of other clubs are not properly funded and result with a lack of student participation.', 'Great faculty that genuinely cares about its students. Although, school needs to be more involved and focused on helping students choose a career path prior to university.', 'Glen Rock High School has a good foundation but has some room to grow. Departments are either very strong or weak with no in between. Additionally, some teachers truly care, while others do not. There also seems to be no basis curriculum, so teachers for the same subject vary greatly difficulty wise. It is a nice small town and it is nice that everyone knows your name, so it is hard to feel unnoticed or forgotten about. This could be both a good or bad thing. You always have people looking out for you, but you have no privacy.', 'This school is average. There are some good things, and some bad things. There are some good teachers, but a lot of them are not good and do not teach you or try to explain. The classes are challenging but good. The school cares too much about sports to care much about academic activities. They don\'t really address any of the major problems, like drug use and vaping and just talk about how "Bullying hurts people\'s feelings". I would give it a lower grade if the classes didn\'t make up for all the problems', 'I love how there are always opportunities around my school to get involved in my community and to help others.', "The education is very advanced they have multiple of classes, but there isn't a diversity of students. We are considered a blue ribbon school. The classrooms are high equipped. If you ever need help with something you can always stay after school for help teachers are willing to help. In sports we are really good in soccer.", 'Glen Rock High School is known as a great academic school. I’ve found that the teachers are hit or miss- I’ve had some amazing teachers that help their class succeed and make the subject interesting and teachers that don’t care about the students and know they’re safe because of tenure. The school tends to spend a lot of money on football and somewhat unnecessary school related things (Schoology being one of them). Many other smaller sports and clubs don’t get proper funding. The guidance department is a MESS. Some kids are alright, some aren’t great, but that’s typical with high school. Overall GRHS isn’t an awful school, but not one I really enjoy going to everyday.', 'I very much liked the way the teachers prepared us for college. They challenged us, but not too much where we could not succeed. As a student I struggled a little bit in some of the courses I took and everyone wanted to see me succeed. I went to my teachers for help and when that did not suffice, the principal even offered to tutor me in that subject because it had been a subject he had taught before. The one thing Glen Rock High School needs to work on is making sure their teachers are not over-qualified for the jobs they hold. Some teachers are extremely intelligent, but when they teach the students it can be hard to understand what they are trying to teach. If the teachers are able to simplify their lessons to make sure the students understand, Glen Rock High School would be perfect for every student.', "For a public high school, I left with a great education, but I also left happy that I would never have to go to that school again. Probably your typical privileged upper class homogenous white high school: Looks safe and welcoming from the outside, but brings oppression and aggravates mental health issues of those who are considered different (not white, not cisgender, not heterosexual, not culturally American, etc.) The school has a wonderful educational system, but like many other high schools in America, they need to take their student's concerns more seriously and address systematic oppression and micro aggressions immediately so that students can learn to live as adults in a world that looks a lot different than their high school, and appreciate those differences with an open mind.", 'Teachers cant teach nor care to.  Kids suffer for it. Never help students who need it.  Admin. Hides behind their tenure.  Sports good. Clubs good.  Kids nice. Parents casting.', 'My experience was alright. The teachers cater to the higher achieving students and leave the students that actually need help in the dust. The kids in the school are not favorable.', "I loved Glen Rock High School. For the most part, all the teachers and students were kind. I like how the middle school was connected so it wasn't a big jump from middle school to high school. Once you get to high school the atmosphere is completely different and your teachers actually care about you and want you to do good. The school offers a huge range of different classes, so you can see what you may want o to pursue as a career.", "At Glen Rock High School, everyone is treated as equals. Bullying is a rare occurrence, and the school is very good academically. Although this school isn't the best for hands-on teaching, the teachers help and want you to succeed in the classroom. Throughout the college process, I definitely felt unprepared, however, I later figured everything out for myself. As far as sporting events and clubs, the school is great. Safety, which is many parents main priority, is great at GRHS.", 'While it can be a struggle fitting in, the small, close environment allows students to get to know each other very well, and not just other kids in their grade, but the entire student body. The teachers are mostly very young, which allows students to relate to them more and form relationships.', "At GRHS, there's something for everyone. The school not only has developed and advanced athletics and arts programs, but it pushes students in academics too. Extra help and research opportunities are available to all students in many topics and classes, and teachers are overall very eager to teach.", "I had a great experience at Glen Rock High School. It's a close community where all of the teachers (even the ones you did not have) know all of the students. Academically, its a challenging school. However, there is a countable number of minorities that attend and there is a sense of entitlement among some students. Overall,  strongly recommend.", 'GR schools are welcoming, accepting, and rather difficult.  Average students will struggle in the curriculum', 'GRHS has a small but sizable student body. The community is very involved with the school and teachers are mostly knowledgeable and helpful.', 'Overall the school have me a solid education and prepared my well for college. The students tended to be  cliques and it could have been hard to make friends. The academicsecond were solid academy diverse and had a great sports program.']

The school not only has developed and advanced athletics and arts programs, but it pushes students in academics too. Extra help and research opportunities are available to all students in many topics and classes, and teachers are overall very eager to teach.", "I had a great experience at Glen Rock High School. It's a close community where all of the teachers (even the ones you did not have) know all of the students. Academically, its a challenging school. However, there is a countable number of minorities that attend and there is a sense of entitlement among some students. Overall,  strongly recommend.", 'GR schools are welcoming, accepting, and rather difficult.  Average students will struggle in the curriculum', 'GRHS has a small but sizable student body. The community is very involved with the school and teachers are mostly knowledgeable and helpful.', 'Overall the school have me a solid education and prepared my well for college. The students tended to be  cliques and it could have been hard to make friends. The academicsecond were solid academy diverse and had a great sports program.']
column6: ['Glen Rock High School had many teachers who were absolutely amazing and inspiring, but on the other end there were teachers who made me want to drop out. Sporting events were always fun to attend.', 'Glen Rock High School is an incredibly white place, not that there is anything that can be done about it in that it represents the town population as a whole. However, the student culture, at least for the boys, revolves around objectifying and abusing the girls at Glen Rock High School especially in the current sophomore and junior classes of 2018 and 2019. To make matters worse the faculty has little to no resources to protecting victims of sexual assault and harassment, even blaming and questioning the victims who were brave enough to say something about their experiences, which frankly is a despicable and something that has forever tainted my GRHS experience.', 'The teachers at GRHS are for the most part phenomenal at engaging willing students in lessons.', 'This school challenged me without knowing I was being challenged. It has helped prepare me for further education. There is a good sense of community among students and even teachers. I think this was the best high school I could have attending and I am thankful for the opportunity.', 'Teachers are smart and passionate. They are interesting and well spoken to allow students to be engaged. Grading policy is generally the same school wide, and if a teacher differs, its still straightforward.', 'The teachers are dedicated and mostly approachable', 'The teachers put a lot of time and effort into developing their curriculum and class and it shows!', 'It all depends on your perspectives and what your preference is. If you like a predominantly single race school, Glen Rock is for you.', 'The teachers are great, especially the teachers that teach the AP and Honors courses. They really understand their students and know how much work to give and make hard classes manageable.', 'The is something for everyone.', 'Mobius is the best extracurricular activity.', 'The teachers at Glen Rock High School are, for the most part, very interesting and knowledgeable. Some of them, especially those in the language department, lack such teaching skills and qualities to engage students into their lectures or activities.', 'Door greeters, some security cameras.  It is a safe school environment', 'The most popular clubs are Interact (volunteering) and the GSA (Gay Straight Alliance).  There are may clubs offered that are very casual and do not meet very often.', 'This school is for the most part, a very accepting and intelligent community.  The kids work hard and take challenging classes.  I would recommend this school to a high achieving student.  The teachers are friendly and talented.  Of course there are things that are not perfect about this school, but for the most part it is a positive experience, and this school is more like a private school than a public one.', 'There are some very intelligent and talented teachers at this school, however they usually are the ones teaching AP classes.  The other level classes have good teachers as well, but they do not compare to the AP ones.  I have heard many complaints from the teachers in the Special Education department.', 'The student body is a very tight-knit community', 'Great school that prepared me well for the next chapter of my life', 'The teachers have been great and know their material. They are very passionate about their respective subjects and it allows the students to really interact with the teachers and learn a lot. There are a bunch of AP Courses available to take which I believe is a great thing. I would not do anything over if I started High School over.', "I prefer not to comment, however it's not the most diverse of towns or schools in aspects."]
column8: ["I don't eat school food so I can't comment. Hearing from other people, however, I've heard it's not that great.", 'Our teams are full of devoted players and who are passionate about their sport and strive to do well. As well, students attend most sports games and have great school spirit', 'Some teachers are great and put in a large amount of effort to truly make the students learn, but others put in no effort and the students education relies on videos and worksheets.', 'There are limited clubs and programs that meet consistently at the school other than team sports, and the price to participate in anything at the school is $200 which can be a bit pricey for struggling families.', 'Almost every student has consumed alcohol at least once, and most have also smoked marijuana and are sexually active, as well. Many students come into school under the influence and even store the illegal substances in their lockers or backpacks. Many students take "study drugs" for midterms as well as finals and some even take it just to get their work done in class because of lack of time at home.', 'Again, there are very few class selections and there are very few teachers that actually teach their classes. The hallways are typically not clean or organized, and many school rules are unfair to certain students. For example, the rule of students not being allowed to put their college destination in the school newspaper is unfair because a senior got a personal announcement about her acceptance to Harvard University during the morning announcements. The school rule was meant so students who did not get accepted into the "better" schools did not feel bad about themselves, but it was unfair to those who worked hard and could not show off the success they had worked for.', 'Some days the food looks edible, other days it does not. Often small portions for a hefty price, and there are very few healthy options other than the rotten fruit or the salad that sits out throughout the entire day.', 'Not as many classes offered as I would like, and I feel like I missed out on opportunities because of this. Very few teachers are willing to go out of their way to help students and most teachers act inappropriately during class. For example, some may curse with students and gossip about other students/teachers while the students not participating in the gossip must continue to do their work. Other teachers simply do not care about put zero effort into their lesson plans.', 'There are many different classes you can take, not as many as other schools offer but a good amount. Many of these different courses are in the arts- "drawing and painting", "sculpture", "web design" etc; music- "music theory", "concert choir", and "concert band/marching band". Many of the main courses such as science and English have different options as you advance in grade levels.', 'We all have achieved something we wanted to. Most of us have gone to good colleges and from there have gotten great jobs.', 'teachers make classes fun and always provide proper assistance to students', 'have clubs to fit all different types of students needs', 'a lot better than expected, always like to see smiling faces in the early morning', 'nice clean facilities, quality technology products are always up to par', 'bullying is taken seriously, zero tolerance for bullying', 'most of kitchen made food is good but frozen foods are very greasy and unhealthy', 'college prep courses are fun and very educational while you can also be challenged by diplomatic AP courses.', 'the administrators favor certain social groups and will look away to football players in disciplinary situations.', 'all the sports have a competitive level like any other school, besides the hockey team they are sick', 'Way too many questions! Very tolerant.']

column2: ['cool and nice. academics are good and there are a lot of clubs. not crowded from multiple floors and overall a safe place', "The teachers threaten the students and it almost seems they are trying to make them fail. the teachers are hostile and it seems like the school doesn't care about any of the students at all, 90% of freshman that go there want to transfer or are just constantly sad and stressed. DO NOT GO HERE!!!", 'Great environment, great kids (if you exclude all the ones that JUUL in the bathroom), a little weird because of the office building thing.', "The teachers are super friendly and the kids there as well. Millennium High School offers a bunch of clubs and activities that will interest many kids. Students are also free to start their own clubs if there isn't one they like. The curriculum offered at the Millennium High School will prepare students for college.", "I'm a senior at Millennium, and while there are things I would like to change about it, I am so grateful for the rigorous courses taught by wonderful, qualified teachers who truly care about each student as an individual.", 'Millennium has very good academics and it’s a pretty rigorous school, which pushes the students harder than many other schools in the state. As a senior, I have seen many things change such as a new lounging area for students and new courses added to Millennium. However, I would like the school to change by adding an actual gym for us because we have a “multi-purpose room” that really limits our activities a lot and we barely even go outside to exercise, so the physical education at school lacks. Also, I would like to see more diversion at the school because although there is some sort of diversion, it’s not often you see other races more than others.', "Millennium does really keep you busy. That means it prepares you for college and huge tests that are meant to be taken as you progress through these years. The school is always clean; there's a janitor who cleans every day after school. There is extra help with teachers after school as well as clubs and other extracurriculars. If you aren't interested in them, you could create a club by asking the main office. If you don't have a printer at home, there are printers that students could use. There are also many ways to make friends in this school due to advisories, classes, and clubs. You could bring food in for lunch, go out, or eat the school lunch. However, I would suggest letting everyone take AP classes since only juniors and seniors can.", "I like how the school is connected inside a building, the environment, and the teachers where everything is serious in the matter of school work. But what is not that great is how small it is and there isn't a gym. But in around 2021, there may be another floor avaliable to the school, so more space and etc.", 'My time at MHS was amazing beyond belief reflecting back on it now. When I was in high school is seemed average in the moment however the school has given me a second to know education in NYC which is something that became even more apparent when I got to college. Now in my senior year of college at the University of Vermont, I realized in college I was blessed with many tools and skills that left me world more prepared then those from other NYC high schools. To this day I am forever thankful for this opportunity to attend MHS.', 'I was a private school stupid at the top of my class with very good grades going into to millennium. As I approach the end of the my senior year i can say that Millennium was the hardest experience of my life. It’s a free for all. Everyone is a genius and there is no falling behind. Social life is minimal, sacrifice is inevitable. They the workload of a prestigious college and pass it off as normal. I hated my time but I learned a lot and am prepared for college.', "Teachers are very supportive, they care about you both academically and extracurricularly. But many of them come and go, so it's pretty unstable. The school is small, and it's easy to make friends that will help you.", "It's quite a challenging school, especially if you don't consider yourself to be smart. I myself had a extremely hard time in school and in certain classes because the lessons weren't to my preference so it was hard to follow along and understand the materials given during class. However, the staff and teachers are very helpful once you go up to them for a one-on-one session to discuss on what you are specifically struggling on, whether it's for an upcoming test, project, or just class work they are willing to help. I'd strongly recommend for those that are going to Millennium High School to start developing good relationships with the teachers so you are comfortable to go to them for help in the future as the materials for me were very confusing and difficult. But I had fun! Good Luck!", "Millennium certainly sets high expectations for their students and offers various rigorous courses such as AP classes. And with the emphasis on high achieving grades, the school encourages students to strive for the best, which models an environment that the Specialized High Schools also offer. However, Millennium could certainly improve on training teachers to be more understanding, supportive and helpful in the students' learning process as often times, I would hear students complaining about how certain teachers aren't teaching anything or how they are unreasonably strict.", 'Millennium High School is one of the high school that is known in New York City, the teachers in the school are very helpful and if you have anything that you are struggling with, you can just go to them even if you do not know them.', "Millennium really prepares you to go to college. Everything is organized, and you just have to follow the instructions. I like the school atmosphere, but if you don't like to be a good student, it may be not for you. Everyone seems to care about their grades a lot.", "This school makes it incredibly challenging to do well. They set all of the kids up to fail. Whether that be giving insanely hard tests, grading as if we're seniors in college, or providing ZERO support, this school takes it for the win. As a junior, I recieve over four hours of homework a night. This work, however, is BUSY WORK, not work that will actually help us succeed.", 'The environment is super clean. -allowed to eat outside- has many restaurants nearby-teachers are very nice-location is safe- in the Financial District-lots of sports teams -small school -should have more clubs', "Millennium prepared me for college so well! Throughout the college process I felt like they really explained everything and tried to help students as much as they could. In general Millennium is not an easy school, you are constantly challenged and their are high exceptions set for each student.  The homework load is quite extreme and it only piles on as you move up. One issue that I had was that tests/quizzes were piled onto one day which made it stressful for students to study for multiple exams. Additionally, projects were also stacked on top of each other and due on the same day-- talk about missing sleep! However, this all prepared me for college when I look back at it. It's a breeze for me because I learned how to manage my time and write an effective essay in a night. Do your homework, participate, ask questions and seek out help as well because teachers are more than willing to help out students who want to approve!", "I can say unequivocally that if you like not sleeping and have something to prove about your ability to power through the night then this is the school. Jokes aside: the school while having a great teaching staff and I had an overall great relationship with my teachers I can say that most of them have a notion of how students should act and behave and are harsh when they see even slight outliers to that. In its self, though that wouldn't be a problem, the issue is that there is very little consistency for what is right and wrong.Furthermore, the teachers and the school have no understanding, once scheduling a physics test the day of the SAT. Moreover, if you're not satisfied with a grade your screwed as there is very interest in the teachers in helping you boost your grade even if it wrecks your GPA. In itself, that's not a problem but coupled with the schools unnecessarily high standards makes it all just feel stressful.", 'Most of the teachers here at Millennium High School are very kind and supportive. They are always available after school to help the students who are struggling in class. Although the school does not offer many AP classes, the classes they do offer are challenging and requires a lot of critical thinking and analytical skills. The school is very small as compared to other high schools but this creates a sense of community because we know almost everyone in the school. A change that would be nice is if the school can clean and restock the supplies in the bathrooms more frequently for the students.']

column6: ["Aspects of life at Millennium High School that elevate it above competitors are its commitment to community service and its supportive staff members. Community service is ingrained into the curriculum through Millennium's requirement of community service for a student's overall grade. To facilitate this process, Millennium offers many opportunities both inside and out of school for its students to perform the service they need to do well in class. The community service requirement is a great way for students to learn and gain an appreciation for their communities, and the work that is needed to maintain them. The yearly Foreign Exchange program at Millennium thrives on this ideology, with entire trips dedicated to serving communities outside of New York, such as China, the Dominican Republic, and Peru. The other aspect of Millennium that sets it apart from other high schools is its incredibly supportive staff. The teachers at Millennium have genuine love for their areas of expertise.", 'Millennium is a rigorous high school that gives heavy workload. The school prepares you well for college through the college workshops students have. There are a few AP classes but not a lot to choose from. More spirit and culture involvement should be shown in the school.', 'This is a wonderful school, although small is a good community. It is very safe and diverse. This is a school that prepares you for college through its classes and teachers. The facilities are well equipped for its students.', 'A very rigorous yet friendly academic environment with a small school community. Teachers are also very professional and supportive of their students. There are a variety of clubs and afterschool activities despite it being a small school.', "It's extremely challenging and rigorous, there is no way you could possibly slack there. The teachers truly care, although the homework load and tests/quizzes is a bit much.", "I'm not going to say that this school is terrible because I understand how bad other high schools can get. But for a highly competitive and elite public school, Millennium definitely does not live up to the reputation it so desperately clings too. For starters, the recent demand for this school has led it to accept a larger student body than ever before. The school has now become both underfunded and overcrowded. Some of the classes now have to be taught in the common lounge areas of the school and this can be pretty distracting for students with other students and teachers always wandering the halls.", "A fantastic school environment for anyone. The teachers are kind, welcoming, and caring. They take the time to make sure that each student is understanding the content even if that means staying after school to help them. They really push us to do our very best. The students are also very friendly. The wide variety of clubs really helps to make friends with people of all four grades. In addition, the sports teams at Millennium are all fantastic. The only downside is that the school doesn't have a gym (we use the multipurpose room and fitness room for gym class) so athletes must travel to Millennium Brooklyn to practice since our teams are joint together. And finally, one of the best things about this school is how much effort they put into making sure we're ready for college. Starting in the spring of 11th grade through 12th, we have weekly college meetings with the counselors where we figure out what schools we want to apply to as well as start writing our essay. I love this school.", 'As a current junior, I feel that this school is preparing me for college to a great extent. I hope to see more AP classes offered in the future.', 'The workload is heavy, but absolutely worth it! Though many schools are challenging as well, therefore this is expected. It is in the heart of one of the most important and historic places in America.', 'I like how it is a small school that allows you to get a lot of assistance if you ask. But it does have a lot of homework which matches a college students workload.', 'I really enjoyed how friendly all the teachers are and how the students get along with each others. Due to the schools location it is limited in terms of athletics and typically of any NYC school the food is terrible.Overall high school has been a wonderful experience for me and I have grown a lot and the people at Millennium have had a hand in that.', 'The work is extremely rigorous, but teachers are excellent and are willing to help you. There is a lack of school spirit, but that seems to come with the competitive environment of Millennium. The facilities are basic, but the location is convenient.', 'Millennium High School is a rigorous high school that is distinctive to many other high schools,  as it has a sense of community and bond during advisory and core and elective classes.  Personally,  the teachers at MHS were great,  full of diligence and enthusiasm.  I would truly recommend this to someone who just like making new friends and working hard to attain a good grade.', 'I really like the environment itself since the building is very pristine. Also, the teachers push you to do your best and make sure you get all the support you need. However, I would love if the school was more diverse in terms of the teachers and students.', "Millennium high school is pretty good. Lots of nice teacher and a mix of different students. There is a period where you can literally relax or do some work. Homework isn't overwhelming. You can eat out or eat the school lunch.", 'Millennium has strong academics, but they\'re not rewarding for the students. The work is excessive and the students that are dedicated to their grades have to abandon everything that we enjoy doing out of school. Millennium to me is a huge disappointment because of how they offer a low number of AP courses and have no National Honors Society. However, the school has a calm and safe atmosphere, well... without all of the bullyings that happens here. What\'s confusing is that the classes that have the most bullying take pride in it and say their class is "lit." The classrooms are clean and look new, but a lot of the smart-boards don\'t work. The sports are good and my friends mention how they would have gone to Millennium for the sports teams. The clubs are nice in Millennium, but they should consider forming an environmental club.', 'I think the teachers were amazing, and the school really helped each student figure out where they wanted to go, it helped them prepare for the next years of their lives. This school was really wonderful in this sense.', 'The teachers do give lots of work and expect a lot from you. Projects and tests might be rushed but teachers push you to reach the best of your abilities and never give up on trying to help you.', 'Overall good school. Teachers actually cared about their students. Contained a good amount of after school programs such as different sports clubs and art programs. Students are giving a lot of work load but nothing thats impossible to complete.', 'What did you like / what would you like to see change>I had an overall positive experience at MHS. The school was known for being relatively prestigious and being located in the middle of an office building. Having graduated from MHS for a few years now, I can reflect on what I liked and what I would have liked to see more of. I would have liked to see more cohesion amongst the students. Oftentimes, people gathered and hung around their "cliques," rarely having genuine interactions with others. This could have been accomplished with more student clubs. Although a few clubs existed, more clubs would have increased student cohesion, amongst many other things. However, I will give MHS props for having great teachers, many of whom were involved in students\' academic and social lives!']

They really push us to do our very best. The students are also very friendly. The wide variety of clubs really helps to make friends with people of all four grades. In addition, the sports teams at Millennium are all fantastic. The only downside is that the school doesn't have a gym (we use the multipurpose room and fitness room for gym class) so athletes must travel to Millennium Brooklyn to practice since our teams are joint together. And finally, one of the best things about this school is how much effort they put into making sure we're ready for college. Starting in the spring of 11th grade through 12th, we have weekly college meetings with the counselors where we figure out what schools we want to apply to as well as start writing our essay. I love this school.", 'As a current junior, I feel that this school is preparing me for college to a great extent. I hope to see more AP classes offered in the future.', 'The workload is heavy, but absolutely worth it! Though many schools are challenging as well, therefore this is expected. It is in the heart of one of the most important and historic places in America.', 'I like how it is a small school that allows you to get a lot of assistance if you ask. But it does have a lot of homework which matches a college students workload.', 'I really enjoyed how friendly all the teachers are and how the students get along with each others. Due to the schools location it is limited in terms of athletics and typically of any NYC school the food is terrible.Overall high school has been a wonderful experience for me and I have grown a lot and the people at Millennium have had a hand in that.', 'The work is extremely rigorous, but teachers are excellent and are willing to help you. There is a lack of school spirit, but that seems to come with the competitive environment of Millennium. The facilities are basic, but the location is convenient.', 'Millennium High School is a rigorous high school that is distinctive to many other high schools,  as it has a sense of community and bond during advisory and core and elective classes.  Personally,  the teachers at MHS were great,  full of diligence and enthusiasm.  I would truly recommend this to someone who just like making new friends and working hard to attain a good grade.', 'I really like the environment itself since the building is very pristine. Also, the teachers push you to do your best and make sure you get all the support you need. However, I would love if the school was more diverse in terms of the teachers and students.', "Millennium high school is pretty good. Lots of nice teacher and a mix of different students. There is a period where you can literally relax or do some work. Homework isn't overwhelming. You can eat out or eat the school lunch.", 'Millennium has strong academics, but they\'re not rewarding for the students. The work is excessive and the students that are dedicated to their grades have to abandon everything that we enjoy doing out of school. Millennium to me is a huge disappointment because of how they offer a low number of AP courses and have no National Honors Society. However, the school has a calm and safe atmosphere, well... without all of the bullyings that happens here. What\'s confusing is that the classes that have the most bullying take pride in it and say their class is "lit." The classrooms are clean and look new, but a lot of the smart-boards don\'t work. The sports are good and my friends mention how they would have gone to Millennium for the sports teams. The clubs are nice in Millennium, but they should consider forming an environmental club.', 'I think the teachers were amazing, and the school really helped each student figure out where they wanted to go, it helped them prepare for the next years of their lives. This school was really wonderful in this sense.', 'The teachers do give lots of work and expect a lot from you. Projects and tests might be rushed but teachers push you to reach the best of your abilities and never give up on trying to help you.', 'Overall good school. Teachers actually cared about their students. Contained a good amount of after school programs such as different sports clubs and art programs. Students are giving a lot of work load but nothing thats impossible to complete.', 'What did you like / what would you like to see change>I had an overall positive experience at MHS. The school was known for being relatively prestigious and being located in the middle of an office building. Having graduated from MHS for a few years now, I can reflect on what I liked and what I would have liked to see more of. I would have liked to see more cohesion amongst the students. Oftentimes, people gathered and hung around their "cliques," rarely having genuine interactions with others. This could have been accomplished with more student clubs. Although a few clubs existed, more clubs would have increased student cohesion, amongst many other things. However, I will give MHS props for having great teachers, many of whom were involved in students\' academic and social lives!']

column2: ['Croton Harmon High School has a small town feeling.  Teachers and Administrators are very vested in good outcomes for the children.', 'Education is great, culture and culture awareness needs work. The maths department at the lower levels is full of inexperienced and often uninterested teachers. Once you make it past trig though the teachers are some of the best anyone could ask for.', 'Very high school taxes with mediocre student performance. Very little choice of languages and AP courses. Little to no music or arts opportunities. Very limited science courses. By high school a significant number of district students move to private schools. School does not participate in many state or national competitions. Very few National Scholarship semi finalists or higher.School is safe. Very little student diversity.', 'Croton Harmon high school is a great school. There are great teachers and they prepare you for college very well.', 'Small school. Strong academically. Would like to see greater monitoring of school conduct/safety rules.', 'What I  enjoyed most about my school was the challenging teachers they had there. They taught the curriculum very well and I feel very well prepared for college.', "It's a surreal experience to walk through the hallways of Croton-Harmon High School and be surrounded by leaders on all sides. Everyone at the school is afforded the opportunity to be a leader in the arts, sports, or after school clubs, and the majority of the school's student population takes advantage of those opportunities. Generally, students are also enrolled in very difficult courses, and are able to balance them with their extracurriculars very skillfully. The school also does a great job engaging students in discussions about how to improve the school through the school's Student Faculty Congress, and communication between the school and the community has been on the uprise. Finally, a lunch program was implemented this past year for those who couldn't afford to buy lunch. It would be nice to see some of the athletic facilities upgraded, and to see a bigger emphasis placed on the arts, but other than that, I'm very fortunate to be a student here.", 'The school has great teachers and faculty.  The sports program is easy to get involved in and the school just instituted a school lunch program.', 'Parents: stay away from small high schools. Croton is an isolated community with a tiny population. The high school mirrors this. If you send your child to CHHS, he or she will be limited to a small group of entitled young people who are oblivious about the world. Alumni usually try to forget their time there as the boring and/or painful memory of having attended is useless to them. Larger schools with the same academic quality are better because there is more opportunity for students, socially, academically, and athletically.', 'Croton-Harmon High School was a relatively uneventful experience for me.  Most teachers are very knowledgeable, laid back, and understanding, but the administration is definitely lacking.', "I have never felt unsafe in my school, that's due in part by how safe the town is. It's in a safe neighborhood, and even if I did feel unsafe, the security measures taken to protect students from anyone who is entering the building is quite prominent. All visitors must sign in and be buzzed into the school through the main entrance, other doors are locked during the school day unless you are exiting. We also have an unarmed security guard, but it doesn't really make that much of a difference. The school nurse is great and very understanding of not just physical ailments, but also mental health problems. Also I think our sex education is quite extensive and informative, I just wish they made more references to sexual orientation, gender identity, and same-sex relations.", "I feel as though the overall experience at my high school has been good. I feel privileged to have such a large variety of courses available to me, even though it's a relatively small school. The guidance office is very helpful, especially with helping design your schedule. There's a lot of freedom in the courses we can choose, even with the specific requirements one needs to graduate. Other freedoms are allowed as well, like free periods instead of study halls, and also being allowed to leave campus during lunch and free periods. It gives kids a sense of independence and forces them to figure out how to manage their time properly. I would choose to go to Croton again because of the safe environment it offers and the people that make up the community.", 'Most teachers have a genuine interest in their students and hope that they do well. Consistency in work and grading varies from teacher to teacher, especially if two teachers are teaching the same course to different classes. Often kids in those classes have differing work loads and grades. Some teaching styles are better than others, but overall I feel I have learnt a lot going to this high school. I do feel that student-teacher communication could be better. It is due in part by the students, but also the teachers could put more effort in to making assignments clearer and also responding to student questions faster, especially over email.', 'There are no issues with safety in our school. There are security personnel that always are on guard and not only watch visitors that come in but the students and teachers themselves to be safe. Unfortunately with recent events, new rules have been set into place so that our school can be well protected in case a shooter were to come in.', "There are many different organizations and programs you can attend if you are interested. From Human Rights to Stage Crew there's a variety of options.", 'There has been a lack of diversity, however in recent years many students have been moving in from different places and have added to the ethnicity and cultures of the school.', 'Most of the teachers revery willing to help students if they need it. Our teachers generally follow a set plan they created by themselves so it may be different for every teacher but it helps students understand each and every material better.', 'This school offers almost any club or activity, and if it does not already exist, it is not difficult to create one. I personally do not do any of the clubs, but I participate in cheerleading which does a huge amount of community service, and I volunteer at the local elementary school. The people I know who participate in clubs are very involved and constantly reaching out to the community. Some of our sports are able to compete on a national level, including our cheerleading team.', "If I could do it all over, I would definitely chose this school again. Although the size is very small and we may not have all the resources in the world, I feel that I have received a quality education in my school. The teachers are passionate and helpful, there is a very strong sense of community, and everyone is very friendly. There is a strong focus on avoiding bullying and drugs (we do the DARE program in middle and high school) and there are a lot of events throughout the year that raise awareness to drug and alcohol issues and how to avoid those things happening to us. Overall, I've loved growing up in a school where everyone know's each other's name and is always willing to give help where they can.", "I have always felt that a was learning a lot of valuable lessons in all of my classes. I have only ever had a few teachers that I didn't feel comfortable reaching out to for help, but for the most part, all of my teachers have been exceptional. Each teacher has seemed to be very interested in my education and very helpful."]

column6: ['School has many opportunities to succeed', 'The teacher are very dedicated', 'There is a high safety regard in the school. Sometimes it feels a little over the top and like a prison.', 'There are many clubs and sports offered at CHHS, but clubs heavily depend on student participation. Little participation results in a pissed teacher and a sucky club.', "The parents are absolutely crazy, if a child doesn't get a 90 or higher in a class their parent will become angry and some have been known to meet with teachers. Everyone who cares about school is super competitive and people obsess over their grades. There is a student portal in which you can see your grades for individual assignments for each class, sometimes I feel as if this tool only makes the grade obsession worsen.", 'Teaching styles vary between classes, math department is overall strong, there are only two good science teachers, english curriculum is a joke, and social studies department is average.', 'CHHS just got security updates and so now all doors are secure and there are a lot more cameras.', 'Most kids are involved in a club or two, but there are no resources for extra help after school besides getting your own tutor on your own.', 'CHHS is a solid school but I wish there was an honors program and that the required courses were harder.', "The teachers are good for the most part, but I've had both great teachers and terrible teachers.  It's pretty easy to get good grades and the teachers are very accessible because of helping period after school everyday.", 'For some reason that I am unaware of, the administration seemed to hate my grade and punished us for what was often nothing; or they would punish the entire grade for what a few people did. They said they were serious about bullying but you were far more likely as the victim to get in trouble somehow than the bullies.', 'There are plenty of teachers to hate, and plenty to be bffs with. Not too many really amazing people on the actual "teaching well" front. There\'s a tendency for teachers to have no idea what they\'re doing.', "It's a small school, so it's basically what you'd expect out of a tiny school's extracurriculars. Arts didn't get enough funding of course (what a surprise), but it's not like there was that much funding for everyone else anyways.", "I didn't get as much help as I needed from the school about how to get scholarships and how to pick where I'd go. There was no talk whatsoever about not going to college, either. The CHOOSE internship did somewhat help making me feel more prepared to work, but that was from my mentor, not the school itself.", "There's quite a bit of diversity at CHHS", 'Safety is not an issue, but many students use drugs and consume alcohol.', "The high school is too small. Students feel trapped by knowing everyone's personal business and reputation.", "We have milk available and a few vending machines. That is what's available.", 'There is a lot of inconsistency in the way that punishments are handled and given out to students.', 'Students are not very supportive towards sport teams. They do however attend important playoff or rivalry games.']

column2: ['Scotch Plains-Fanwood High School gives a unique experience to each student. There is a wide variety of classes to choose from with varying levels to accomodate to every student. There are a myriad of extracurriculars offered, ranging from music to philosophy to calligraphy clubs. One thing this school could improve on is the intensity of AP classes and overall environment.', 'I enjoyed my 4 years at the High School.   I have had great teachers and have learned a lot.  They did a lot to help me get ready for college.  I was also very involved with clubs, activities and sports which helped me feel like part of a community within the high school and I met many great friends.  The academics are challenging but manageable.   I feel that I was able to take a diversity of classes to help me in the "real world."   I can see that I have grown to be a better student and a better person through my years at the high school.  Programs such as SMAC and Rep Theater have helped me learn a lot about myself and learn from others.   While I know that going to college will be challenging, I do feel much better equipped having gone to SPFHS.', 'The Scotch Plains Fanwood school system is amazing. The teachers are very well versed knowledgeable in their respective fields of study. The teachers and staff go out of their way to help each child on an individual basis when needed.', "Scotch Plains Fanwood High School is great.  I'd wish the student population were more diverse, other than that it's a school with lots of spirit, with a lot of teachers who care.", 'My over all experience at my high school was a good one.  It is your typical high school.  There are its ups and down, none the less it has prepared me for the future of entering into college and furthering my academic career.', 'I loved how teachers will spend extra time to get to know you as a student and help you find your own path. I enjoyed being apart of Raider Nation, cheering on my sports teams as well as being in the team playing for my school.', 'Excellent culture and good mix of courses. Wish AP program in languages was better. Great music, good school spirit.', "Scotch Plains-Fanwood high school is a good school in helping students receive the education they need. I enjoy working with some of the teachers and how they go out of their way to help you if they see you're not doing well. I find this school to have a very live ambient at its sporting events, specifically soccer games. It gets even better with the rivalry we hold with the neighboring town of Westfield. Some of the negative things I've found in this school are that some teachers aren't supervised enough and aren't doing the best job at teaching their students. I had two teachers in my time who didn't teach much throughout the year or did the bare minimum, but when they had someone come in to supervise them mid-year, it's like they transformed into an actual teacher. I would like to see teachers with tenure to be looked at more closely and not be allowed to decrease teaching quality just because of tenure.", "It's a pretty good school, the teachers and people are nice. The food sucks, but the food sucks at pretty much every school. They seem to have a good art program and stuff too so that's good. My experience so far has been positive overall.", 'Scotch Plains-Fanwood High School is a great school. The only problem is that the student body is not ethnically diverse, which may intimidate those who do not belong to the majority like myself at first.', 'It’s casual, each day is like the next same as always. Usually intrigued me because I get to see many different things throughout the day. In addition I always get to learn something new that will prepare me for my future.', 'As a family we have had a very positive learning experience at Spfhs. I feel that the high level of education and expectations are a great basis for success throughout high school and transition into college. The school offers a wide range of clubs and activities. They also offer plenty of sports. This makes it easy to find extra curricular activities for all interests.', "The things that we learn seem useless, but that's with every school in the state. The food is good if you're an upperclassman, but if you're a freshman it's garbage.", 'I get a good education and am around wonderful people in a safe and welcome environment. There are many teachers who care about me and my success, and wonderful counselors who aid in my road to college.', 'Scotch Plains-Fanwood high school has a great academic program. The teachers are engaged and helpful. They challenge students to explore their limits but are always available if a little extra help is needed. Community parents are involved and the students are great. The community is a great place to grow up. There are a number of clubs and sports teams to get involved in to make a difference in the community and make friends.', 'My experience at Scotch Plains-Fanwood High School has been a mix of both good and bad. While I have met amazing friends they teachers are not as good as I would have hoped. Some teachers are overly strict to the point where they do not answer questions leaving you confused and stressed. Others do not care enough to explain the lessons and then give hard tests on material you did not learn.', 'Overall, a good school with a strong science program. Great music department and soccer team. Not very high security and lots of drug use', 'Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great,Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great,', "I know my school is not perfect; but, as I was thinking back on my experience at my high school, I could think of anything negative about the school itself. Obviously, not everything in the school is upgraded and renovated because that does not greatly affect a student's performance in his or her school. However, what made me choose 5 stars was the fact that my school listens to what they students really want. For example, late this year, before the end of the school year, there was a lot of news going around about school shootings. My school and the students from the school demanded and took action. By the end of the school year, there were rules in place of which doors to leave from, and even police officers came to our school everyday to watch after the school. I do not know if this will be permanent, but what made me think that my school stood out as an excellent school is how much the teacher care for the safety of their students.", "As a recent alumni of Scotch Plains-Fanwood Highschool, I often find myself reliving some of my favorite memories from highschool. My experience, was one not so special, but it was one to remember. I was a member in our debate club, took part in choir and after school women's choir, as well as participating year round in our colorguard/ marching band. Indulging myself in these activities, it allowed me to build a community, a family that I could rely on.With this said the teachers were amazing in their part of making me a better student. Here I learned how effectively write essays, and grasp my audiences attention. Although I was not involved in much outside out schools music program, I can deeply say that my highschool experience is one to remember."]
