Some of the negative things I've found in this school are that some teachers aren't supervised enough and aren't doing the best job at teaching their students. I had two teachers in my time who didn't teach much throughout the year or did the bare minimum, but when they had someone come in to supervise them mid-year, it's like they transformed into an actual teacher. I would like to see teachers with tenure to be looked at more closely and not be allowed to decrease teaching quality just because of tenure.", "It's a pretty good school, the teachers and people are nice. The food sucks, but the food sucks at pretty much every school. They seem to have a good art program and stuff too so that's good. My experience so far has been positive overall.", 'Scotch Plains-Fanwood High School is a great school. The only problem is that the student body is not ethnically diverse, which may intimidate those who do not belong to the majority like myself at first.', 'It’s casual, each day is like the next same as always. Usually intrigued me because I get to see many different things throughout the day. In addition I always get to learn something new that will prepare me for my future.', 'As a family we have had a very positive learning experience at Spfhs. I feel that the high level of education and expectations are a great basis for success throughout high school and transition into college. The school offers a wide range of clubs and activities. They also offer plenty of sports. This makes it easy to find extra curricular activities for all interests.', "The things that we learn seem useless, but that's with every school in the state. The food is good if you're an upperclassman, but if you're a freshman it's garbage.", 'I get a good education and am around wonderful people in a safe and welcome environment. There are many teachers who care about me and my success, and wonderful counselors who aid in my road to college.', 'Scotch Plains-Fanwood high school has a great academic program. The teachers are engaged and helpful. They challenge students to explore their limits but are always available if a little extra help is needed. Community parents are involved and the students are great. The community is a great place to grow up. There are a number of clubs and sports teams to get involved in to make a difference in the community and make friends.', 'My experience at Scotch Plains-Fanwood High School has been a mix of both good and bad. While I have met amazing friends they teachers are not as good as I would have hoped. Some teachers are overly strict to the point where they do not answer questions leaving you confused and stressed. Others do not care enough to explain the lessons and then give hard tests on material you did not learn.', 'Overall, a good school with a strong science program. Great music department and soccer team. Not very high security and lots of drug use', 'Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great,Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great, Classes are great, teachers are great,', "I know my school is not perfect; but, as I was thinking back on my experience at my high school, I could think of anything negative about the school itself. Obviously, not everything in the school is upgraded and renovated because that does not greatly affect a student's performance in his or her school. However, what made me choose 5 stars was the fact that my school listens to what they students really want. For example, late this year, before the end of the school year, there was a lot of news going around about school shootings. My school and the students from the school demanded and took action. By the end of the school year, there were rules in place of which doors to leave from, and even police officers came to our school everyday to watch after the school. I do not know if this will be permanent, but what made me think that my school stood out as an excellent school is how much the teacher care for the safety of their students.", "As a recent alumni of Scotch Plains-Fanwood Highschool, I often find myself reliving some of my favorite memories from highschool. My experience, was one not so special, but it was one to remember. I was a member in our debate club, took part in choir and after school women's choir, as well as participating year round in our colorguard/ marching band. Indulging myself in these activities, it allowed me to build a community, a family that I could rely on.With this said the teachers were amazing in their part of making me a better student. Here I learned how effectively write essays, and grasp my audiences attention. Although I was not involved in much outside out schools music program, I can deeply say that my highschool experience is one to remember."]
column6: ['What I liked about my high school experience at Scotch Plains Fanwood High School is the amount of activities I was able to join to get involved. My activities ranged from music, dance, language clubs, culture clubs honor societies and sports. The wide range of electives and courses  was also a benefit because I was able to take AP courses to my liking and take part in classes that I enjoyed and shared a strong interest in.', 'My experience at Scotch Plains-Fanwood High school is very good. I feel that the  teachers and the sudent are great and helpful.', 'I would like to change the administration and the safety of this school but overall it’s an okay school.', 'My school is a challenging yet enjoyable  school. I feel that the courses they offer are diverse and are appropriate building blocks for higher education.  The overall experience so far is encouraging for anyone who wants to be successful in the near future.', "Overall I feel that my school did a good job of academically preparing me for the next level of education I choose to pursue. I feel that all of my teachers are passionate about what they teach, and want to see their students succeed. Although everybody has one or two teachers they dislike, as a whole I feel that the staff is the best I could ever ask for. Plus, our school has a tight-knit community sort of feeling, where everyone is close with everyone. However, this can work out unfavorably, as being too close means that teachers and staff are a little too knowledgeable/involved in students' personal lives. excluding any sort of privacy we could have wished to have.", 'It was okay. Could be better at preparing for college, especially the English Department. As a student who was in AP English for two years, I expected college english to be a breeze, but I was in a for a surprise when I only received a B+ on my first paper and not the A I was expecting.', 'My most memorable part about this High School experience was my guidance consoler. The guidance offices were always very helpful to me when I struggled staying in class everyday. I was able to talk through my problems and work with any and all staff necessary to accommodate my needs.', "The teachers here are incredibly supportive, and they are a lot of fun. Everyone here-guidance counselors, teachers, even janitors- are all very supportive, and it's easy to strike up a conversation with any of them.  I've spent my entire high school education here, and I'm really glad I had the opportunity to study in such a good district. The only complaint I have is that despite the socioeconomic status of the area, this school is old and kind of ugly. You can't see in the mirrors because they're so foggy and dirty. The hallways and walls are fairly dirty. The bathrooms are just straight up gross. A lot of the school was remade in the 70s-aka an architectural dark age. Still, I'm happy I went and I'm happy to leave.", 'Excellent teachers, for the most part.Great Guidance counselors and support.Big variety of classes to take.', 'My experience at Scotch Plains- Fanwood High School was a little different from my classmates.  I am Filipino and African American, and my high school was predominately white which made me the odd ball out. As a minority in the school, I experienced a lot of cultural differences between students of color and white students. Overall, Scotch Plains- Fanwood High School was extremely helpful in preparing me for the future. The academics were outstanding, and gave me a glimpse of how things would be once go to college.', 'Well spiffy High is not the worst school to be at but it’s certainly not the best. There’s not too much diversity but it’s a predominantly white town that’s fairly wealthy. The school is alright except for that the temperature is never good. Ever. I hang in the music department which is one of the best aspects of the school. Offers a good program, decent instructors, but mainly a really good community. Sports wise we are a soccer and swim town. I long to see the day that the football team is good, but our soccer and swim teams seem to be the most proficient from the school. Courses are alright and there are some teachers that are real gems if you’re lucky enough to get them. Our principal is really chill though. The school could definitely use some renovation but I appreciate the painted ceiling tiles, murals, and other art that appears all around. Overall SPF has served me well enough for my purposes but if you want a really nice school try to head on over to ucvts.', 'I really enjoyed the wide variety of activities that were offered by the school. The sports, music, arts, and school politics departments were all very active and well developed. What I would like to see change is the amount of diversity promoted by the school. I believe that it is important for the students at the school to be more exposed to people that are different from them in order to help them grow into accepting adults.', "The teachers that I met during my time at SPF have been some of the most amazing people that I will ever meet (shoutout to Quack, Krip, and Koegel!). The intellectual community is amazing and everyone will find so much support--you just have to b willing to look for it and accept it however it comes. Some parts of the school are weird, like how you can't use the stairs in the middle of the media center, and how no one uses their hallway lockers. Other things are really cool, like our amazing music and arts department. I would never trade this high school experience for anywhere else. Everyone has something positive to offer, and the security guards can be some of the best people you will get to know (shoutout to Rich!). There are opportunities available to everyone. If there isn't a class for it, then there is a club, and if there isn't a club, then start one.", "My overall experience at Scotch Plains Fanwood High School was average. The things that I liked about going to school here were some of the teachers really enjoyed what they did, so I was able to bond with them and form a good relationship with them. I also enjoyed the diversity in the school, and how down to earth some of the students were. SPFHS was overall a very safe school, and there was never a day I was scared to go in. The school spirit could have been better, but it just wasn't. Some things that I did not like was the cleanliness of the facilities. They had mirrors that I could not see into in the bathroom. Also, toward the end of the year I felt like some of the teachers had given up and stopped teaching, and I feel like for how much tax money is spent on paying these teachers they should do a better job. I feel like they only paid attention or put money into certain programs instead of distributing it equally.", 'My experience has been very unique having been a member of the music department.  Our music department is wildly understaffed but, the teachers we do have are so beyond dedicated to the students.  They empower their students to go above and beyond what the student thinks is possible.  I would not be the same person had I not joined the music department.  The teachers bring in professional musicians to clinic with us and offer advice; which is extremely rare for a high school music department to do.  Outside of the music department, the academics are rigorous and full of competition, which pushes students to work even harder.', 'Overall I had a great experience and enjoyed my four years at SPFHS. All of my teachers were fair in every class. I feel very prepared applying to colleges. School clubs and sports really helped me meet new friends.', "I just moved to Scotch Plains over the summer and so far, I've liked multiple facets about the high school. While it's not perfect, it is a clear step up in how the staff conducts themselves and the overall vibe from the school. The teachers and administration have done the most that they could to make sure that I fit in and feel comfortable.", 'Scotch plains is what you make it. There are a lot of great teachers that you have to find but they will prepare you!', 'Most teachers are dedicated and willing to go the extra mile by offering help as needed before and after school. Supportive supervisory staff.', "It was all around a great school, maybe if I had been apart of the school system sooner then I would've felt more connected with the community but I still greatly enjoyed my time there."]

column2: ['I loved the environment and constant spirit this school has. There is always something new every month that keeps the students entertained. The accelerated classes and push for excellence really prepared me for college.', 'This school has helped me succeed in all of my academic studies. Going to school here is like going to a private school without the large cost. This school is one of the most diverse schools in NYC and lacks all the behavioral issues that other NYC Public schools face. This school has greatly helped prepare me for college and my future.', 'This school is terrible. First off, there\'s no Air conditioner. There were many incidents where I was being bullied and nothing was done no matter how often I reported it. In fact one time I got in trouble when this person had basically gotten physical but apparently it was MY fault. They give loads of homework and what we learn is useless. In gym you can get a bad grade if you can\'t do a certain exercise because your "not trying". Do not go to this school, it\'s awful.', 'The Scholars Academy is a great academic high school, yet like other schools it also has it cons. The school does not own any sports fields, and the high school is basically one floor for 700 students. Students have a few options regarding classes, but for sure there could be more.', 'Scholars’ Academy is a great MS/HS school. The school is one of the most diversified middle/high schools in NYC. The students are mostly well behaved and trying to better themselves academically and to prepare themselves for college and their future occupations. Additionally, most of the students are self motivated and work well with each other. The principal and staff work tirelessly for the benefit of the students every single day. The Scholars’ Academy is the perfect preparatory school for gifted and self motivated students to be challenged and to excel in academics and to be 100% prepared for a highly rated college.', 'Overall, the school itself is alright. Some teachers know what they are doing and are able to teach their kids as well as they should. However, as for the actual school experience, the school itself lacks in some categories. In terms of cleanliness, the bathrooms are alright, but could be in better condition. As for the air conditioning, I rate this as poorly because of the complete lack in air conditioning. During the summer time, all the classrooms and hallways are physically unbearable.', "I am a freshemn at scholars' and I've been in scholars' for 4 years now and I can tell you that it is an amazing school. It is a safe place where I can myself and learn as a family. There has never been a time that I had felt uncomfortable. The teacher will help you along the way as long as you ask. I've learned sk much in my second family and I cant wait to learn more.", "I love the community that we have and the fact that the other kids in school are well-behaved in comparison to other schools I know. The teachers and guidance counselors have honestly changed my life and impacted my self esteem and the quality of education in ways unimaginable. I'm proud to be a part of this school, and I think they have prepared me very well for college & careers.", 'I have had an amazing experience at The Scholars\' Academy because of its flexibility and control over one\'s classes; students can choose the difficulty level of each class, thus creating their own "track" for the remainder of their high school career. On the flip side, not much is offered in terms of extra-curricular activities. That being said, it is a statement for a school to have a consistent 100% graduation rate, regardless if all students are doing something after school.', "Honestly, they have so many issues that just aren't addressed. Racial prejudice, under funding for specific sports, not relatable to the students just to say a few.", "It is generally a very good middle school although as the years progress from sixth grade to eighth grade, the teachers get progressively more strict and there are less opportunities as increasingly less trips. But the high school does not necessarily feel like a real high school but rather a glorified middle school. Most students are depressed, have anxiety, are sleep deprived and are generally just unhappy.  High school students do have slightly more freedom because we get a choice as to whether we want to go outside into the schoolyard during lunch as well as we have our own individual schedules and therefore get to walk through the hallway on our own. But there aren't a lot of opportunities to even have a lot of a high school experience due to the school not having a lot of dances or trips or a football team and lacking teams such as a girls swim team or boys soccer and we are mainly in school a lot of the day and when we're not, we are trying to complete the homework assigned.", "Sign up for years of racism by coming to this school. I feel it everyday and its unfortunate that admin turn a blind eye to it. If you're from the area (breezy point etc.) lucky you! If you're not, expect the worse HS experience", 'Great class sizes, great staff, and great environment. The teachers actually care and that makes all the difference.', "In my experience of attending The Scholars' Academy, I have made many friends with students as well as some teachers and staff.  I feel as if administration worries too much about safety considering we are a very safe school, when they can be funneling those ideas into things such as trips and events that can be a lot of fun for students. They over prepare you for college this way the workload does not overwhelm you once you begin.", 'Something I thoroughly enjoyed about Scholars\' was all the opportunities that my enrollment provided me with. In high school and even in middle school I was able to be at least one step ahead of other schools, regarding academics. Something I would change about this school would be the way they perceive college. For the most part, when you are in high school, all the teachers say such things as: "in college your professors don\'t care about missing work". With all of this negative connotation towards college, it almost doesn\'t pursue a career in college, or to attend college, which isn\'t what teachers should be doing', "Scholars' Academy really prepared me for college by giving me a quality education and a chance to get ahead by doing college credit classes. It gave me the tools I needed to build good study habits while at the same time balancing involvement in various school activities. At times though, I wished we would've had more school activities outside of sports such as school dances, fairs, and trips.", 'I like that Scholars’ Academy guides students to be college ready. There are many opportunities to do better academically whether it never through tutoring, or through the dedicated teachers that make time to ensure that their students fully understand what they teach. I would like to see some changes in the amount of performances that take place because there are so many dancers, performers, people with talent that are ready to show what they can do.', 'A very student based experience that is enjoyable and engaging for all with an abundance of resources such as using technology and helpful staff. Teachers have interesting lesson plans and helpful flipped lessons. A well rounded middle and high school', 'I enjoyed the school probably just because my friends were there but when I went on college and internship interviews they were impressed by my resume and college preparedness so I guess this place helped with that.', "This school may seem excellent compared to its neighboring schools, however the school is worst in its own unique way. This schools feels like it was built for Caucasian people only and only allow the minority to enter because they can't not accept any. The school has a 97% Caucasian faculty and seems to be majority Caucasian students. There is a failure to allow self expression as well cultural appreciation. There are many situations where a Caucasian student will do something derogatory to a student of color and receive little to no consequences. This school is good for teaching your child the racial mistreatment present in the society we live in. Not the best school at all."]

It gave me the tools I needed to build good study habits while at the same time balancing involvement in various school activities. At times though, I wished we would've had more school activities outside of sports such as school dances, fairs, and trips.", 'I like that Scholars’ Academy guides students to be college ready. There are many opportunities to do better academically whether it never through tutoring, or through the dedicated teachers that make time to ensure that their students fully understand what they teach. I would like to see some changes in the amount of performances that take place because there are so many dancers, performers, people with talent that are ready to show what they can do.', 'A very student based experience that is enjoyable and engaging for all with an abundance of resources such as using technology and helpful staff. Teachers have interesting lesson plans and helpful flipped lessons. A well rounded middle and high school', 'I enjoyed the school probably just because my friends were there but when I went on college and internship interviews they were impressed by my resume and college preparedness so I guess this place helped with that.', "This school may seem excellent compared to its neighboring schools, however the school is worst in its own unique way. This schools feels like it was built for Caucasian people only and only allow the minority to enter because they can't not accept any. The school has a 97% Caucasian faculty and seems to be majority Caucasian students. There is a failure to allow self expression as well cultural appreciation. There are many situations where a Caucasian student will do something derogatory to a student of color and receive little to no consequences. This school is good for teaching your child the racial mistreatment present in the society we live in. Not the best school at all."]
column6: ['The scholars academy provides myself and other students an advanced curriculum and a variety of sports and activities to ensure the students satisfaction and educational status.', "Overall, I feel as if I had an advanced education throughout middle school and high school. The students of Scholars' Academy were always one step ahead of other schools. I learned a significant amount, especially in high school, which supported me in figuring out what I wanted to pursue after graduating. The AP and college-level courses challenged me constantly, but they taught me to stay on top of my work, as well as put as much effort into my tasks as possible. I can confidently say that without attending Scholars' Academy for high school, I would not be as prepared for college as I currently am. The teachers asked crucial questions to ensure that we understood the topics, and the work helped our knowledge with materials in each class.", 'The academics are rigorous and challenging, but oftentimes the student body feels overwhelmed as the academics tend to suck the fun out of learning. The administration is terrible, making students feel like they\'re in a prison. The entire administration is extremely unreasonable, playing with their "power" over the students. Every other aspect of the school is average, however, I can admit they do try hard to ensure that the students are ready for college.', 'I personally feel like the best thing about scholars is it’s academics, they offer a lot of college and ap courses. Also, they have many opportunities for learning about college and seeking for help for the college process.', "The Scholars' Academy is an extremely accelerated  school, constantly pushing its students to go above and beyond in all areas. The school offers standards that are above other schools, with a passing grade of an 85 overall. The school is also very involved with extracurriculars that encourage students to help in their community. This school also includes some of the top sports teams, encouraging students to be well rounded. Throughout my time at The Scholars' Academy I have been constantly provided with opportunities to prepare for college including workshops, college visits, and meetings with my counselor. The Scholars' Academy has been a great help in preparing me for the future.", 'It is a diverse community where everyone tries their best and supports each other academically and socially.', 'Scholars wasnt a terrible school. The faculty was annoying as usual. But the schools college readiness is great. they literally held our hands and took us to college', 'Scholars’ Academy was the best school for me. It helped me be ready to go to college. It prepared in a way that I know most high schools would not have done. They provided so many resources and help in order that each one of us gets the opportunity to be college ready. Scholars’ is not the best school if you are looking to put your child into a diverse school. Even though it is one of the top diverse schools, there is a lot of backlash from one race to another from students and even some teachers. It is a wonderful school for academics but not a good environment for a student from a minority background.', 'I was extremely ready for college because of the preparations this school gave me throughout my time as a middle and high school student.', 'I like that it has some good teachers. I would like change on policies because it is very conserved and a lot of things are possible in this school. WE have a limited amount of classes which is bad for many students.', 'Overall, I have enjoyed my time at the scholars academy. The teachers and administration are always willing to help and push you further in your academic career. I believe that there needs to be more student unifying events in order to build a better student community.', 'Very structured school. Love the fact that they teach the children to be responsible and respectful.', 'Scholars was great in helping me become college ready and assisting me throughout the process until I was accepted.', 'The school is very diverse having several different ethnic groups. Being that the school is small in size, it makes it easier for different grades to communicate and get to know each other. Along with its social life, the school is excellent in college preparation, where even college courses are available. These college courses can be bought and used as credits for the colleges that accept them.', "Being a part of the Scholars' Academy community, I enjoyed the community of students that became a family since each grade is small in comparison to other schools around the city. I was granted opportunities to strive in my future as well as being able to be ready for college.", "Throughout your high school career, Scholars' helps in preparing you have all the required credits plus opportunities to take AP courses in order to get AP credits for college. The teachers and staff act as a lending hand, ready to help assist you in your education. The school is relatively small, so you become close with your grade, creating a family away from your real family.", "I felt like I was academically pushed at the Scholars' Academy and the environment there is so uplifting. Scholars' is my family and everybody there including faculty members and students care about one another. Also, there is a great diversity which allowed me to see the beauty that is within New York.", 'The Scholars’ Academy is amazing when it comes to anything academic. They teach you several ways to learn and understand topics and also prepare you for the future. However, the Scholars’ Academy lacks school spirit, communication between teachers/administration and students, and can be very strict on simple matters. They rarely try to put together any events that allows their hardworking students to take a break from academics and have fun. They rarely try to talk about the high percentage of diversity in the school and is very hesitant to institute programs and clubs that can help teach others about different cultures. Often times, it feels like I’m going to a prison instead of going to school. But despite all of this, I would not be academically where I am today  if it wasn’t for attending this elite academic school.', 'Scholar’s academy is an excellent school .I feel that I am challenged academically .Scholar’s prepares students to be college ready .', "The Scholars' Academy has provided me with the resources to go above and beyond in my academic career. They provide a number of advanced classes with very good teachers that know how to teach based on the way the kids learn. It has also provided me with a safe, close-knit environment that I was able to grow in and meet the people that ultimately turned me into the person I am today."]

column2: ['The teachers are all amazingly supportive and extremely helpful when it comes to extra help and making sure we understand what is going on in class. They dedicate so much time and effort into making their classes entertaining and valuable each day. The students are also very nice and we rarely have any problems getting along, even within different grade levels.', 'I love Hills and the environment there. I am a part of theatre, Model UN, and the track team and the culture is amazing! The facilities are great and the teachers are pretty nice.', 'I am now a senior at Pascack Hills High School and I have had a wonderful experience over the past 3 plus years.  I have been a part of several different organizations from theatre to baseball to project Patterson, a project dedicated to helping not so fortunate children.  I have met so many very interesting students and faculty.  I have been exposed to various topics ranging from world hunger to energy conservation and world refugees.  I have developed many great and long lasting friendships.  I have also been a part of the sporting programs that Hills offers from Football to Baseball, Cross Country Running and even the Robotics team.  Although I am looking forward to moving on to college, it will be bittersweet when I leave Pascack Hills.', "The teachers, administration and the system as a whole are involved and take interest in the students. We have always been able to reach out to any of my child's teachers and receive a prompt and courteous reply. The guidance department has been a great help with the College preparation process and very accommodating and flexible with their schedules.  The sports programs are well organized and all the coaches I've seen are level headed, fair and take interest in the students academics. We moved to this school district for the express purpose to have our child attend this school system. After attending for 6 years, we definitely believe we made the right choice.", 'Teachers/staff all around are really amazing. The school is always kept clean and is large enough to never get tired of. Classes are engaging and teachers there really know how to connect with the student body.', 'Pascack Hills High School is one of the top schools in NJ providing an excellent education for students.  Students have a variety of clubs and sports to choose from and the faculty is excellent.', 'I love being a student at Pascack Hills High School.  I feel safe in this school and I feel ready for college.', 'Going to school here was good for me. I came in with only a couple of friends, joined the cross country team sophomore year and made a whole team of friends. High school goes fast, and I was glad I spent it at Hills. Teachers are all nice and most work hard to be there for you when you need it. The students are what is to be expected from this community. Every school has their cliques and groups. The cafeteria food is nasty ngl tho, even though we are "ranked # 2 in the state."', 'High school showed me that I can achieve anything.  I loved play varsity soccer for four years.   I achieved my goal in academics,  I have over a 4.0 and will have about 30 credits when I enter college.  The staff is very supportive and helped me take all the classes that I wanted.   I am pleased to say that I graduated from Pascack Hills High School with honors.', 'I love attending Pascack Hills High School but I wish I had a better opportunity. The teachers never pushed me by recommending a harder level class. I knew I was capable of learning at a higher level but I felt like the staff doubted me. Other than this, the staff was always friendly. Every day I walked into school I was greeted with a good morning. It made me feel like home and was a very comfortable learning environment. I have made the best of friends attending this high school and I would not trade it for the world.', 'It was okay. Being colored had its advantages when it came to bullying most of the time. The education was good, but would have liked more opportunities to feel happy.', 'I\'m in the process of looking at school systems and towns for my children and thought I should take a look here to see how my ol\' school ranked. I graduated a long time ago, but my time at "Hills" really shaped all the things I DON\'T want for my children. Things like weird religious divides, too much money, and in some cases, not enough, a competitive and miserable spirit like none other I have ever witnessed in my life and (very successful) career. Not a single worthwhile teacher. I couldn\'t even name one, and, trust me, I didn\'t graduate that long ago. Hours and hours of mindless and useless homework. An emphasis on test taking and college acceptance letters rather than the things that make a life: friendships, arts, ethics, a sense of belonging and school pride. Cookie cutter people living in a homogeneous cookie cutter world. And yet it\'s ranked as one of the top schools in Jersey. I\'ll stay clear of any top ranked schools for my kids.', "My experience at Pascack Hills was very fulfilling. By my senior year, I made up my mind on a career path and had the opportunity to have an internship during school hours. Meaning, half my day I stayed in school and attending regular classes then, after lunch I would drive to The Valley Hospital and intern there. If it wasn't for the unique opportunity that Pascack Hills offers, I wouldn't have had as many real-life nursing experiences that other nursing majors might have had their senior year of high school.", "My school provides a very solid base for kids to continue their futures. It's like a spring board. But something else is required post graduation, and that's for kids to undergo an experience that challenges what they know inside this little Pascack Valley bubble. This is a very sheltered place. Very helpful and supportive, yes, but very sheltered.", 'A welcoming community that does not have as widespread discrimination as much of society has now. Students, rather than shunning what they do not understand, wish to know more to embrace it.', 'I absolutely hated my time in Pascack Hills High school. The teachers are great but the students are all entitled wealthy brats. They are very judgemental and as a biracial girl in this town, I was cut from the rest of them. To state the elephant in the room, 98% of the student body are white and they are all uncultured and do not know anything that is happening anywhere else in the world. They are all very sheltered and dependent on their parents and are in for a big shock for when they get into college. Academically, the school was amazing and the staff are all great, however, the students are terrible and i would not wish this school on my worst enemy.', 'Pascack Hills has all the the resources necessary to get me ready for my next step for my future education. Most teachers are very passionate about their subjects. There are plenty of activities and sports that will interest any student. The only thing I would change would be that there would be more money going towards the music programs.', 'School is pretty competitive and everyone goes to college.', 'Very "jappy" school. EVERYONE is a jewish american princess. If your not jewish then you\'re italian. There\'s usually that one black kid in the school. Like 5 indians. Then like 3 spanish kids. And like 1.5 asians.', "There's a lot Hills has to offer. If there something that the school doesn't, then it's very easy to start your own club."]

column6: ['Most of the teachers are looking to always help the student. They are fun and relatable and looking to always help the student for their future.', "I've never felt unsafe at this school. Although almost all the student drink and smoke marijuana, it's never really prevalent in school. We have many friendly security guards in our school walking around all the time so the students always feel protected. Montvale and Woodcliff Lake are both very affluent towns so there is not much crime going on in the area.", 'This school has many great teachers who really inspire the students on a daily basis.', "No diversity of any kind in my opinion, which is especially telling since we live in the New York metropolitan area. People strive to look exactly like each other, take the same cookie-cutter paths to college and then apply to the same schools. You're not persecuted for thinking, looking or acting different, but it still feels isolating and often oppressive to live among all these people who are swimming in one direction if you're the only one swimming in the other.", "We have really an incredible range of courses; our school makes sure we satisfy all requirements that prepare us for college. Our administration - particularly the guidance department, because they're the ones we go to for our scheduling, special study options and workload - is the biggest thing to be congratulated for. They are extremely flexible and care about our well being; it's important to them to keep up our school's reputation, so they encourage AP classes and other challenges, but they look out for us just as much to let us know when it's looking like too much. They know exactly what they're talking about and are very reliable for college advice as well. As a personal anecdote, I had a scheduling conflict for the upcoming year, so my guidance counselor and the supervisor of the courses that conflicted met with me multiple times in the same week to accommodate my needs. They brainstormed on their own just to help me, and after we solved the issue, they provided me with helpful links in both subjects, the point here being that not only is la creme de la creme offered, the staff is very flexible in making sure la creme de la creme can be a reality for anyone interested.", "It's not so heavy, but that's because we live in a very safe environment. There is no need for metal detectors or drug searches because no one brings anything dangerous into the school. We come from two fairly affluent towns and are just looking for a good education. Lots of students suffer from anxiety and perfectionism (a statement backed by a speaker that came to talk about Pascack Hills's mental health and gave us specific statistics - something like a stunning 75% of kids at our school dealing with anxiety), but it comes from themselves. When we say our school is competitive, it's not that we feel ill will towards our peers. Since we don't have class rank, it's more of competition for ourselves to do the best we can while ignoring everyone else, like an overworked, overachieving pack of racehorses with blinders. We don't put anyone else in danger.", "Some of the clubs I hoped to really get invested in are run by teachers clearly looking for an easy way to add to their paycheck. The presidents and officers of many clubs are in it solely for the resume line. We have many clubs founded by students who want to put on their college applications that they started a club, but we don't have a lot of nationally available clubs (4-H, Amnesty International, etc.). Many of the extracurriculars are geared towards STEM, but for students who prefer a more diverse offering, we can only frown as we gaze at the long list of Science Olympiads, Math Leagues, Molecular Research in Genetics classes and Climate Stewards courses. There are little to no service clubs, unconventional clubs or creative clubs (those that exist are laughed at by the general public). Students are looking for a conventional high-school education to lead to a conventional college and grad-school education to lead them to a high-paying job where they work all hours of the day trying to ignore the fact that they're trying to avoid depression (and I say this because this is exactly what their parents do). Clubs are taken up if they pertain to science or math, and regarded with pity if they don't.", "Although it's a breeding ground for stress and everyone acts, looks and thinks the same, I'm glad for all the opportunities at Pascack Hills. We have lots of classes to choose from, ranging from extremely lax to the most strenuous possible, and the teachers and administration are thrilled to help us out if we crave a challenge. The kids are torture and I'll be thrilled to get away from that robot culture, but in terms of the school itself, I feel very lucky to attend.", "Teachers are clearly passionate about their subjects. However, most kids (particularly in honors/AP classes) are such stressed-out grade-grubbers that the teachers start to cater to those kids rather than the ones who are genuinely interested in learning. There aren't enough creative projects because they tend to adhere strongly to the core curriculum provided to them. If they don't, they know to expect disgruntled phone calls from their students' parents.", 'I found that the mental health services at this school are strongly lacking.', "There's a large variety of clubs offered, although it can be difficult to manage these activities and school work.", "While the teachers I've had at my school have been very helpful, I find that the higher-up administration lacks the skills of listening to their students. We struggled with issues of racism and homophobia, and I felt that the administration ignored what the students needed.", "While not every teacher I've had has been exceptionally fantastic, there are certain teachers that absolutely go above and beyond what is asked of them. They've helped me immensely to find my path.", 'We have students from every possible background and culture', 'Teachers put alot of effort into their classes.  However, some teacher confuse more information and more work.', 'Overall the school is very cleanly, but the nurse does little to help those who get sick.', "The Theater is where many of the school's outcasts would traditionally go.  However in recent years, the club has been overrun with the preppy kids that I came here to avoid", "We have some of the best teachers in the state at our school.  It's a shame that so few of the students learn everything they can from them.", 'Mr. Goodman may seem to be a teacher who students deal with for an easy grade, but he has an insight which most teachers can only dream of having.', 'There is definitely bullying that occurs throughout the day, however, we have security officers and anti-bullying officers who try to assist. We also have a school nurse and student assistant counselor whom help in any way they can. I believe that my school is safe for the most part and there is rarely any physical violence that occurs.']
column8: ['Most of the teachers are looking to always help the student. They are fun and relatable and looking to always help the student for their future.', "I've never felt unsafe at this school. Although almost all the student drink and smoke marijuana, it's never really prevalent in school. We have many friendly security guards in our school walking around all the time so the students always feel protected. Montvale and Woodcliff Lake are both very affluent towns so there is not much crime going on in the area.", 'This school has many great teachers who really inspire the students on a daily basis.', "No diversity of any kind in my opinion, which is especially telling since we live in the New York metropolitan area. People strive to look exactly like each other, take the same cookie-cutter paths to college and then apply to the same schools. You're not persecuted for thinking, looking or acting different, but it still feels isolating and often oppressive to live among all these people who are swimming in one direction if you're the only one swimming in the other.", "We have really an incredible range of courses; our school makes sure we satisfy all requirements that prepare us for college. Our administration - particularly the guidance department, because they're the ones we go to for our scheduling, special study options and workload - is the biggest thing to be congratulated for. They are extremely flexible and care about our well being; it's important to them to keep up our school's reputation, so they encourage AP classes and other challenges, but they look out for us just as much to let us know when it's looking like too much. They know exactly what they're talking about and are very reliable for college advice as well. As a personal anecdote, I had a scheduling conflict for the upcoming year, so my guidance counselor and the supervisor of the courses that conflicted met with me multiple times in the same week to accommodate my needs. They brainstormed on their own just to help me, and after we solved the issue, they provided me with helpful links in both subjects, the point here being that not only is la creme de la creme offered, the staff is very flexible in making sure la creme de la creme can be a reality for anyone interested.", "It's not so heavy, but that's because we live in a very safe environment. There is no need for metal detectors or drug searches because no one brings anything dangerous into the school. We come from two fairly affluent towns and are just looking for a good education. Lots of students suffer from anxiety and perfectionism (a statement backed by a speaker that came to talk about Pascack Hills's mental health and gave us specific statistics - something like a stunning 75% of kids at our school dealing with anxiety), but it comes from themselves. When we say our school is competitive, it's not that we feel ill will towards our peers. Since we don't have class rank, it's more of competition for ourselves to do the best we can while ignoring everyone else, like an overworked, overachieving pack of racehorses with blinders. We don't put anyone else in danger.", "Some of the clubs I hoped to really get invested in are run by teachers clearly looking for an easy way to add to their paycheck. The presidents and officers of many clubs are in it solely for the resume line. We have many clubs founded by students who want to put on their college applications that they started a club, but we don't have a lot of nationally available clubs (4-H, Amnesty International, etc.). Many of the extracurriculars are geared towards STEM, but for students who prefer a more diverse offering, we can only frown as we gaze at the long list of Science Olympiads, Math Leagues, Molecular Research in Genetics classes and Climate Stewards courses. There are little to no service clubs, unconventional clubs or creative clubs (those that exist are laughed at by the general public). Students are looking for a conventional high-school education to lead to a conventional college and grad-school education to lead them to a high-paying job where they work all hours of the day trying to ignore the fact that they're trying to avoid depression (and I say this because this is exactly what their parents do). Clubs are taken up if they pertain to science or math, and regarded with pity if they don't.", "Although it's a breeding ground for stress and everyone acts, looks and thinks the same, I'm glad for all the opportunities at Pascack Hills. We have lots of classes to choose from, ranging from extremely lax to the most strenuous possible, and the teachers and administration are thrilled to help us out if we crave a challenge. The kids are torture and I'll be thrilled to get away from that robot culture, but in terms of the school itself, I feel very lucky to attend.", "Teachers are clearly passionate about their subjects. However, most kids (particularly in honors/AP classes) are such stressed-out grade-grubbers that the teachers start to cater to those kids rather than the ones who are genuinely interested in learning. There aren't enough creative projects because they tend to adhere strongly to the core curriculum provided to them. If they don't, they know to expect disgruntled phone calls from their students' parents.", 'I found that the mental health services at this school are strongly lacking.', "There's a large variety of clubs offered, although it can be difficult to manage these activities and school work.", "While the teachers I've had at my school have been very helpful, I find that the higher-up administration lacks the skills of listening to their students. We struggled with issues of racism and homophobia, and I felt that the administration ignored what the students needed.", "While not every teacher I've had has been exceptionally fantastic, there are certain teachers that absolutely go above and beyond what is asked of them. They've helped me immensely to find my path.", 'We have students from every possible background and culture', 'Teachers put alot of effort into their classes.  However, some teacher confuse more information and more work.', 'Overall the school is very cleanly, but the nurse does little to help those who get sick.', "The Theater is where many of the school's outcasts would traditionally go.  However in recent years, the club has been overrun with the preppy kids that I came here to avoid", "We have some of the best teachers in the state at our school.  It's a shame that so few of the students learn everything they can from them.", 'Mr. Goodman may seem to be a teacher who students deal with for an easy grade, but he has an insight which most teachers can only dream of having.', 'There is definitely bullying that occurs throughout the day, however, we have security officers and anti-bullying officers who try to assist. We also have a school nurse and student assistant counselor whom help in any way they can. I believe that my school is safe for the most part and there is rarely any physical violence that occurs.']

column2: ["CHS has articulate and knowledgeable honors/AP teachers facilitate success in the classroom and adequately prepare students for the future. Unfortunately, Cranford lacks ethnic diversity, which makes it impossible for students to benefit from different perspectives, which hinders the potential discussion. While the guidance department, when prompted, is a good resource for students that aspire to attend college, it fails to provide satisfactory options for those students that may be looking to continue their education in directions that do not involve a traditional 4 year degree (trade school, a full time job, the military, gap year,etc).The students are generally caring, open minded, considerate individuals that support justice and equality.  Most students are smarter than the grades they earn or GPA they possess, but I suppose that's the definition of most high schools: grades that reflect effort, not intelligence.", "As a senior at Cranford High School, I would say my four years went very well. Cranford High School offers over 200 exciting and interesting courses, including core classes, so there was always a class I looked forward to. The staff is excellent, they are always willing to help you in answering questions, and explaining material. They are also there to assist in any personal problems you might be dealing with. CHS believes strongly against HIB, and radiates a positive learning environment and school spirit. Speaking of which,  they have a diverse athletics program, with boys and girls teams for most sports. However, if you're not into athletics, they offer several diverse clubs suited to your interest, along with an arts department and a technology department. This is a school where a student can truly find where they belong.", 'Cranford high is a good school that heavily encourages evolvement in clubs and other extracurricular activities. however its administration is lacking in common sense and understanding', 'Cranford High School has some great teachers. I do not appreciate, however, the traditional teaching styles, and the reliance on teaching for standardized tests, and teaching from the textbooks.', 'There were many opportunities ranging from academics to athletics to clubs that give back to the community.  A lot of honors and AP classes available .. the teachers really cared about seeing students succeed .', 'I really like the close-knit community.  Most of the students and staff know each other by name and are always willing to help out.  Our sports teams are competitive and there is a lot of school spirit around them.  Whether football, hockey or basketball, there is always a crowd cheering you on.I do find the school strict especially for me at the senior level.  I would like to see more senior privilege options for students who demonstrate responsibility as many of us are legally adults.', 'Cranford High School tries its absolute best to create a domain where all students feel safe and are given equal chance to succeed and take the paths to their dreams. It allows for young students to thrive and grow to find out who they want to be in the future.', 'The teachers and guidance counselors have been very helpful during my school year (I was a new student as a senior) and have helped me with my grades, subject understandings and time with being able to continue.', 'The best thing about Cranford High School is the diversity of course offerings. There was a course offering for anything we wanted to study. Students at Cranford High were fortunate to have these options. Our curriculum opened up new areas of interest for me and gave me the opportunity to explore them at length.', 'I was in the university program.  This program allows for early AP placement, community service and internships.  This is a great program, but I feel that a more robust program would provide other opportunities.  CHS has a great sports program and great teachers.', "The school is wonderful and you get plenty of opportunities regarding academics. Most of the faculty is amazing and are always there to help. I have always had the opportunity to get help from my teachers. You really feel like they care. If a student wants, the school can provide volunteer work information and/or provide opportunity for volunteer work. You can also have the opportunity to teach other students if you are part of the National Honor Society.CHS prepares you for college by having meetings with your counselor several times a year.     There are a lot of clubs and sports. However, it is clear that the sports are of more value than the arts, by the consistent funding into sports. There's even a flat screen TV near the weight room. Meanwhile, the school still hasn't replaced the old carpet in the choir room. Students constantly breath in the dust that has collected in the carpet over the years.", "I like how involved the community, parents, teachers, and students are in the clubs and activities. Cranford High School is known for our football team. Even though there were a few deaths and tragedies in the past 3 years, we all helped on another out and got each others back. We are a family and are always hospitable to the incoming students as well to make them feel like they're at home and that this is a safe place.", 'I thoroughly enjoyed my time at Cranford High School both academically and as a performer. I received a superb education and realized my passion for fitness and acting while attending this high school. I constantly felt challenged by my teachers and motivated to work hard. My weight room teacher inspired me to pursue a career in personal training, and my acting teacher helped me realize my love for performing and decide to further my education in college. I was slightly upset by certain aspects of the performing arts program, as the head of the program is rude and does not work well with students. I also felt that certain directors were very political when casting students in productions or programs.', 'Cranford High School was great. All of the students were great. The teachers really made it a point that they cared about the students. I felt like i really successes at Cranford High School.', 'I like that most of the teachers at Cranford High School care about their students and want to make sure we are getting the best education possible.  The math department, however, lacks good teachers and many of the teachers keep leaving.  Overall, I like Cranford High School and feel like I am getting an extremely good education.', 'Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Cranford High School. They have guided me through the past four years and have been there for me at every step of the way. They provide a quality education and I feel like they have prepared me for my next four years at college.', 'Very fun and friendly school. Teachers are nice, good at teaching, and actually care about the students. The sports and clubs are the best experiences I had in high school. There are so many different clubs to join and different electives to take.', 'My high school experience so far has been an amazing journey. I value my education and so does my school so, Im very appreciative of the great education I have been receiving. Cranford High School has so much to offer and pushed all of its students to be involved  so partaking in sports like basketball, cheerleading, and clubs for sign language has made my experience very memorable!', "The academics and the sports seem to be the overall focus of this school. There isn't much talk about clubs, the performing arts are barely funded, and the overall diversity isn't great. The students are welcoming and accepted, but some of them are very judgmental and pick on you if they feel like you're not good enough. This is coming from a student that transferred during the year, I was welcomed but I didn't connect with a few people and I was picked on my first year here which didn't make my overall school year enjoyable. I love all my friends that I've made here, but I think the culture and diversity of this school can be improved. This school is a good school, but it would be more enjoyable if I didn't feel like I'm being picked on all the time for how I am. ", 'I liked that overall, everyone is very welcoming toward others. Even though there are some cliques, everyone talks to everyone, and no one is excluded. Students are overall very accepting toward others especially new students. One aspect I would change is for the high school to be based on block scheduling. ']
