column6: ['There is an incredible variety or courses to choose from and the teachers are knowledgeable in their areas. Some classes are harder to get into because of popularity. there is quite a variety of electives as well.', 'The school is quite diverse but not as much as others. Some people are accepting of these diversities and some are not. I believe these attitudes can be found anywhere.', 'There are many areas of extracurricular opportunities ranging from performing arts to athletics to clubs. There is an incredible variety of clubs to choose from, for example, a strategist club, foreign language clubs, etc.', 'I was involved in many aspect in the school from athletics to clubs to performing arts. Being a member of the schools choirs and other singing groups had an incredible impact on my decision for my future. I would definitely choose to attend this school again if I had to.', "In the 4 years I attended high school, and of all the teachers I have been involved with in my high school career, I have only had a bad experience with one of them. No one like this teacher so it's not surprising that my experience with her was a negative one.", 'I have never felt unsafe and the nurse is very friendly and you can always go down for whatever you need.', 'Student council always organizes tons of fun events. Relay for Life is big at our school. Good comp sci dept and awesome performing arts department. Excellent guidance counselors who encourage students to get involved.', 'I had a great high schools experience at CHS. Great performing arts department and its one of few schools with comp sci classes. Everyone is friendly and theres a strong athletic communit.', 'My school is very safe. There is nothing to worry about there.', 'There are many different clubs for students to join. I was in the engineering club, and the wood shop club', 'My years at the High School were fun as well as educational. They prepared me for college. I think Lacrosse was one of my favorite activities at CHS.', 'teachers here are very helpful, kind, and smart. they would make it a pleasure to go to class.', 'I would certainly choose to attend this school if I could do it all over again.  I have met some of the post open and kindhearted people and made lifelong relationships.  My experience has been mostly positive and I have grown to love the environment.', 'Most of the teachers love their job and put a lot of effort into teaching.  Other teachers, have stopped trying and do not care about the students learning anymore.', "The variety of courses available here is mind-boggling and all of my teachers have been very supportive. I've taken mostly Honors/AP courses throughout my career and the workload is usually manageable. My only complaint about academics would be the foreign language classes, but you only need to take one language for two years to graduate.", 'Cranford High School is a safe place. There is an in school police officer who is unarmed. However, I mostly credit the high safety rating of the school to the very low crime rate in the town and the towns police department.', 'Sports are good if thats what youre into. Good coaches', 'My overall experience included many struggles through the 4 years that I attended. This may have made me more ready for college, but the overall experience of Cranford High school was OK or sub par compared to other high schools. I mostly blame the administration like the Assistant Principal for student affairs, he seemed to not care about the students and was had a very large ego.', 'Some teachers are very well educated and are good teachers. Other teachers lack the educational ability', "Extracurriculars are what you make of them; the more active you are in your clubs, the more fun you'll have. It is possible for students to start their own clubs, if you can't find something you're interested in."]
column8: ["High school is what you make of it. If you're an academically driven student, the school has the teachers and the resources to challenge you, support you, and prepare you for college and beyond; you just have to be willing to seize the opportunity. There's enough electives and extracurriculars for students to find their niche (pun intended) or even combine interests and build their own. However, the student body is largely apathetic and school spirit is close to nonexistent; if you're looking for a school with a wild student section at friday night football games, you will be dissapointed.", 'I have taken mostly Honors/AP level classes throughout my high school career and I have found all of my teachers at this level to be adequately challenging their students and extremely knowledgable about what they teach; many have masters degrees and some also teach at local colleges. However, the advanced classes often feel removed from the rest of the school and I do not feel that I can assess the teachers of lower-level classes.', 'I love the clubs and sport I participate in at school. They are very fun and I learned a lot by being a part of them.', 'I believe my experience at this school was very good and I really appreciated the support all the parents gave us as students and athletes.', 'The teachers at my school are very involved and knowledgeable. They go above and beyond to help and support their students. There are a few teachers who are not as motivated but the general population of teachers are very good.', "As much as we all complain about Cranford, I would't want to go to any other school. So many activities to get involved in and it is so easy to make friends. Very academically driven but we still love our sports (and are awesome at them).", 'School was always fun because after work was done there was always room to mess around or make friends with new people. My overall experience with the school was good up until my last semester as a senior, things went down hill and work became more important than school. This created a difficulty of attendance which caused me to not graduate or be able to afford summer school.', "The environment that this school provides is safe and secure. However,  there are some students that are involved in drugs, alcohol, and much more. This isn't noticeable in school grounds. Instead, i would hear rumors of certain people doing this or see it first hand outside of school. We would have fire drills and other emergency drills in our school occasionally. Therefore our schools safety preparations are good.", 'The teachers are supportive and have an extensive amount of knowledge. Their lessons in class are easy to understand and the teachers encourage the students to ask answers. The students are overall kind to one another and there is a healthy and positive environment in this school. Furthermore there are a plethora of sports and non-sports afterschool activities, from soccer to the singing clubs. I would chose this school again and attend more of these clubs in order to become a better person, develop my interests, and have new friends.', "They always provide pizza, hamburgers, fries, sandwiches, salads, and much more! There's a lot of variety in picking your lunch, snacks, and drinks! The only problem is the cleanliness can improve a little bit more.", 'Overall the teachers and staff are fair and do not give a lot of detentions, suspensions, or punishments unless the student does something extremely inappropriate. They also do not tolerate bullying.', 'The sports equipment and athletic facilities are decent and well used. The football, soccer, and track fields are excellent and clean.', 'A majority of the teachers are extremely knowledgeable, respectful, and provide lessons that are easily understood.', "The coaches are supportive and always give good advice. There are many organizations such as Model United Nations, Student Council, Art Club, Women's Ensemble and Men's Ensemble, and much more! The environment is nice and most of the students are kind and encouraging with one another.", 'Overall, the good out weighs the bad. Good education, great friends, but looking forward to college!', "I bring lunch most days...don't stray from pizza or a bagel on days I don't.", 'Our Guidance Dept is wonderful. They really get the students and parents prepped for college applications. Fours stars!', 'Average facilities except for the football field which is relatively new,', 'Most of the teachers are great and really care about the students.', "There are many clubs and sports to choose from. That's a big plus. The students, for the most part, are very involved.\r School sports seem to favor the boy's teams in my opinion."]

column2: ['Ngl this school is nasty. I saw someone spit into the floor drain the the bathroom earlier today. The school itself is like a prison as there are no windows. But, it is pretty academically competitive since the top 100 students have a GPA of 94 and up. Some of the teachers are mad annoying and will be on your case about everything but some of the teachers are fun to talk to. Guidance is a complete mess all the time and will almost never see you. They are horrible at being organized and usually always mess up your schedule.', 'This is a very diverse and challenging learning environment. It offers both a range of courses for different types of students. Both its academics and athletics are on the climb, and its four-year academies are stellar. All in all, anyone can find their own "niche" within RBR because of the many opportunities it offers.', 'I liked the diversity and amount of help students received from guidance officers and their determination to help each student grow and become successful.', 'I love this school. The teachers are great and it’s a great environment. The arts program is fantastic and has taught me so much. I value the education that I have received at red bank regional and hope that others feel the same way. If you make the most out of this school, then it truly is an amazing experience.', "Was a good experience considering it is a public school, the faculty should and could be better especially in guidance. Most of the teaching staff is very well suited for the position yet some others, I'm not sure how they are employed here. The idea of academies is very well and prepares for college as it relates to picking a major. Overall, pretty good school but it could be a lot better.", "High school was one of the best experiences for me. I thoroughly enjoyed the friendships that I made and how dedicated the teachers were. They were very devoted into creating the best experience for each individual student, caring for each one's needs. I felt very connected to the school, it became like a second home to me the more I became involved. Being a part of athletics brought school spirit to another level as I had the opportunity to represent my school while doing something I enjoyed.", "Some teachers are very good, others I'm not sure why they haven't been fired yet. I had several teachers that didn't teach at all, lost student work, and assigned way too much work and expected too much of students. The food is okay and the student body is somewhat diverse. The VPA program is above average. However, the guidance department is horrible and does nothing to prepare seniors for college or choosing a career path.", 'Red Bank Regional High School was like any other high school. At times it had its ups and downs, yet I was still able to enjoy my high school years. Most of the staff at RBR are amazing, but sometimes we got a little too much homework haha. I feel like my Senior year teachers really prepared me for college. Hands down AP Physics was one of the best classes ever lol.', 'Overall my high school was pretty good. The teachers were extremely qualified and as for a free education many of the people including myself are very lucky to have received such a good education. The environment was safe and free, as an individual you had the opportunity to act freely when expressing who you were.', 'Red Bank Regional was awesome. The academics were great. The extracurriculars were great. I would recommend RBR to friends.', "RBR is a good school, there isn't really anything bad to say. The teachers can be annoying, but that's about it. There are a variety of classes at the school, including VPA classes and Information Technology classes.", "I'm especially active in clubs and activities. The biggest problem with RBRHS is administration. The way the board goes about the student body is more about controlling then helping. On another note, I am a senior and my college process completely blindsided me, literally we were given one presentation on the college process in one hour and a half block and expected to squeeze everything in! Thankfully, a lot of the teachers and staff are especially considerate and kind of their students (not the case for everybody, of course) but I was only really upset with my RBRHS experience this year, I have no option to transfer anywhere else really.", 'RBR has been excellent for both of my children.My son graduates this year and my daughter is a sophmore.They love their teachers and feel the school really cares.There are enough acivities and sports for all the students.', 'I was in the VPA program studying creative writing, and for a school that advertised Performing Arts so much they lacked in funding and other spending when it came to the VPA program. They give other programs more attention when it comes to materials and trips. So I’d like to see them treat each program equally.', 'The teachers are what make the academic aspect great because most are passionate about their subject, with a few outliers who seem to just teach from the book. As stated earlier, most everything else at RBR is average at best. The sports teams have a good run or two but, usually nothing comes of it. Most clubs are similar in that fashion. There is nothing really big or outstanding at RBR, and most clubs seem to not even be active. Nothing really happens at RBR, unless driven by both the students and teachers. RBR has a better than average diversity than most schools in New Jersey. The food is generic high school food (not the best) and you either get along with the administration or hate them. RBR has taken a lot of security measures in the past couple of years due to the recent events involving schools around the world.', 'I really enjoyed attending Red Bank Regional High School. I met a lot of resourceful teachers, who were always willing to help. I had a very helpful and very nice guidance counselor who helped me with a lot. I met a lot friends who were also very helpful. This school overall was a very diverse school and found a way to make every single one of safe and protected.', 'Overall, my RBR experience has been great, but there have been a few things that rubbed me the wrong way.  I find that the teachers genuinely love teaching and try their hardest, but because of the uninvolved administration, teachers tend to get held back from performing to the best of their abilities. The administration has no clue what is going on at a student to teacher level, so they make decisions that benefit no one.', "I think Red Bank Regional is a great high school because of the many activities and classes there are. There are so many different types of clubs and academies that students can join. By joining an academy, students are able to find out what they are interested in. Also, there are many clubs and if you don't see one you like, you could create your own.", 'I love this school. The teachers are dedicated and committed to their students and often stay afterschool to help students out. RBR has a great environment and the people walking the halls are great. I have not had any issues while attending this school.', 'There needs to be more preparation for college and the school needs to teach classes that will get students ready for the real world.']
column4: ['Ngl this school is nasty. I saw someone spit into the floor drain the the bathroom earlier today. The school itself is like a prison as there are no windows. But, it is pretty academically competitive since the top 100 students have a GPA of 94 and up. Some of the teachers are mad annoying and will be on your case about everything but some of the teachers are fun to talk to. Guidance is a complete mess all the time and will almost never see you. They are horrible at being organized and usually always mess up your schedule.', 'This is a very diverse and challenging learning environment. It offers both a range of courses for different types of students. Both its academics and athletics are on the climb, and its four-year academies are stellar. All in all, anyone can find their own "niche" within RBR because of the many opportunities it offers.', 'I liked the diversity and amount of help students received from guidance officers and their determination to help each student grow and become successful.', 'I love this school. The teachers are great and it’s a great environment. The arts program is fantastic and has taught me so much. I value the education that I have received at red bank regional and hope that others feel the same way. If you make the most out of this school, then it truly is an amazing experience.', "Was a good experience considering it is a public school, the faculty should and could be better especially in guidance. Most of the teaching staff is very well suited for the position yet some others, I'm not sure how they are employed here. The idea of academies is very well and prepares for college as it relates to picking a major. Overall, pretty good school but it could be a lot better.", "High school was one of the best experiences for me. I thoroughly enjoyed the friendships that I made and how dedicated the teachers were. They were very devoted into creating the best experience for each individual student, caring for each one's needs. I felt very connected to the school, it became like a second home to me the more I became involved. Being a part of athletics brought school spirit to another level as I had the opportunity to represent my school while doing something I enjoyed.", "Some teachers are very good, others I'm not sure why they haven't been fired yet. I had several teachers that didn't teach at all, lost student work, and assigned way too much work and expected too much of students. The food is okay and the student body is somewhat diverse. The VPA program is above average. However, the guidance department is horrible and does nothing to prepare seniors for college or choosing a career path.", 'Red Bank Regional High School was like any other high school. At times it had its ups and downs, yet I was still able to enjoy my high school years. Most of the staff at RBR are amazing, but sometimes we got a little too much homework haha. I feel like my Senior year teachers really prepared me for college. Hands down AP Physics was one of the best classes ever lol.', 'Overall my high school was pretty good. The teachers were extremely qualified and as for a free education many of the people including myself are very lucky to have received such a good education. The environment was safe and free, as an individual you had the opportunity to act freely when expressing who you were.', 'Red Bank Regional was awesome. The academics were great. The extracurriculars were great. I would recommend RBR to friends.', "RBR is a good school, there isn't really anything bad to say. The teachers can be annoying, but that's about it. There are a variety of classes at the school, including VPA classes and Information Technology classes.", "I'm especially active in clubs and activities. The biggest problem with RBRHS is administration. The way the board goes about the student body is more about controlling then helping. On another note, I am a senior and my college process completely blindsided me, literally we were given one presentation on the college process in one hour and a half block and expected to squeeze everything in! Thankfully, a lot of the teachers and staff are especially considerate and kind of their students (not the case for everybody, of course) but I was only really upset with my RBRHS experience this year, I have no option to transfer anywhere else really.", 'RBR has been excellent for both of my children.My son graduates this year and my daughter is a sophmore.They love their teachers and feel the school really cares.There are enough acivities and sports for all the students.', 'I was in the VPA program studying creative writing, and for a school that advertised Performing Arts so much they lacked in funding and other spending when it came to the VPA program. They give other programs more attention when it comes to materials and trips. So I’d like to see them treat each program equally.', 'The teachers are what make the academic aspect great because most are passionate about their subject, with a few outliers who seem to just teach from the book. As stated earlier, most everything else at RBR is average at best. The sports teams have a good run or two but, usually nothing comes of it. Most clubs are similar in that fashion. There is nothing really big or outstanding at RBR, and most clubs seem to not even be active. Nothing really happens at RBR, unless driven by both the students and teachers. RBR has a better than average diversity than most schools in New Jersey. The food is generic high school food (not the best) and you either get along with the administration or hate them. RBR has taken a lot of security measures in the past couple of years due to the recent events involving schools around the world.', 'I really enjoyed attending Red Bank Regional High School. I met a lot of resourceful teachers, who were always willing to help. I had a very helpful and very nice guidance counselor who helped me with a lot. I met a lot friends who were also very helpful. This school overall was a very diverse school and found a way to make every single one of safe and protected.', 'Overall, my RBR experience has been great, but there have been a few things that rubbed me the wrong way.  I find that the teachers genuinely love teaching and try their hardest, but because of the uninvolved administration, teachers tend to get held back from performing to the best of their abilities. The administration has no clue what is going on at a student to teacher level, so they make decisions that benefit no one.', "I think Red Bank Regional is a great high school because of the many activities and classes there are. There are so many different types of clubs and academies that students can join. By joining an academy, students are able to find out what they are interested in. Also, there are many clubs and if you don't see one you like, you could create your own.", 'I love this school. The teachers are dedicated and committed to their students and often stay afterschool to help students out. RBR has a great environment and the people walking the halls are great. I have not had any issues while attending this school.', 'There needs to be more preparation for college and the school needs to teach classes that will get students ready for the real world.']
column6: ['In my 3 years at Red Bank Regional I have been exposed to many new people and ideas. Red Bank Regional provides an encouraging environment for students to learn and share ideas. The school provides an abundance of classes: college prep, IB, AP, and honors. The cafeteria has a wide selection of meals and snacks. however, the guidance department lacks to aid students in picking classes and helping guide students to do the best they can.', 'During my time at Red Bank Regional the school was constantly improving.  The emotional support from the Source was unparalleled.  Academics well prepared me for college especially with the International Baccalaureate Program.  Athletics were rising but could use continued support and organization.', 'My experience as a student at RBR has been awesome. For the most part teachers are great, they really make an effort to help you with the staff you are having a difficult time with, they are knowledgable of their subject. The school also offers tons of advance classes such as AP, IB and Honors. Socially, there are a lot of diversity and kids come from different districts, you get the chance to meet people than otherwise you may not meet.', "Red Bank Regional has been a pretty good experience. There is a very diverse student body in addition to a wide array of classes. Teachers are fifty-fifty, they can be invested in the class or bumbling fools. Similarly with the students, in many higher level classes there are unqualified students. The academies offered here are superficially appealing. With the exception of maybe the vocal program and a couple more, the academies are nothing special. The athletics here are not too great either. Yet, in my experience here I've found great teachers who have shaped me as a student and more importantly as an individual. Red Bank Regional is a school in which driven individuals can work to prosper, yet, one where the average student can easily slug along.", 'Red Bank Regional is a very fine school. Depending on the students you make friends with, you can either have the best four years of your life or the worst four years of your life. The teachers are very good at their job, except for a select few who are childish and petty. I, personally, have had no problems with any teachers or staff. The janitors and cafeteria staff are very kind and friendly as well. My favorite part of RBR is the VPA (Visual Performing Arts) Program is very very good. It is the sole reason I go because I am out-of-district.', 'A lot of the teachers are very easy to form bonds with, and they genuinely care about how you do both academically and beyond. The school provides a lot for students from The Source to peer tutoring; anything a student might need guidance with, there is some form of guidance available. Classes are on average, challenging but not impossible, depending on the level of class a student takes.', 'Red Bank Regional is a great school in Monmouth County with teachers who are very passionate about their jobs as teachers, and care about their relationship with students. The food may be mediocre but school spirit is very high and not only are sports games well-celebrated but academic competitions as well. Teachers know and care about students who attempt to achieve high and make their way to college, and work with students to make sure they get there.', 'Red Bank Regional has a very diverse atmosphere that I really enjoyed. There are many challenging classes and fun clubs there is something for everyone.', 'Great environment. Teachers and Staff are all eager to help, RBR as a school brings together the community in a good way as seen through sports and fundraisers. My last 4 years here have helped shape me into a better person and has made me thankful to have lived in this community. RBR is a great school that deserves more recognition.', 'Overall, I found RBR rather depressing.  Most classrooms have no windows.  I have never understood how this passes fire code.   If I could rate the facility as less than one star I would.  The math department is extremely poor.', 'There are so many options at RBR in challenging classes, interesting clubs and sports.  Something for everyone.  I am impressed with the teachers,  leadership and all the support available to the students.', 'I met a lot of great mentors and amazing teachers who have gone above and beyond to help me succeed.', 'Red Bank Regional High School was overall a good high school, and provided me with a valuable 4 years. The teachers in your academy often end up becoming great support systems, and most of the other teachers are happy to help you and aim to further your knowledge to the best of their abilities.', 'Great school. Love the environment. Everyone is so nice here. I am comfortable around everyone and have a good group of friends. The snacks here are awesome and I love the teachers. Clubs are great and being involved in them is even better.', 'It is a very diverse atmosphere where all types of learning is available. You do have to decide to push yourself because the CP classes are extremely easy. If you decide to push yourself, it is very challenging and rewarding. The teachers are chill and they want to help you do well.', 'Great school/great teachersFellowship of Christian Athletes wonderful experience Teachers really care about their students. Principal and Superintendent Excellent very involved in school community.', 'Greatest choice I’ve ever made. Teachers are nice and are there to help! I made the mistake of not going for help and I regret it. Would actually want to repeat high school just for the experiences', 'I definitely grew as a person at Red Bank Regional High School. The Creative Writing Program taught me to speak out and the difficult IB Program allowed me to manage my time and stay organized.', "RBR experiences vary from person to person. There are a lot of opportunities that a student can take advantage of, if they are willing to put the time in. I'd recommend taking IB/AP courses and taking advice from upperclassmen to try to find a teacher who fits your learning style.", 'Red bank regional has given me the best high school education that has fully prepared me for college. Tutoring is available throughout the week, during school and after school. The school cafeteria has exceptional food that i will definitely miss after graduation, each day of the week has a theme, my personal favorite ... Taco tuesday!']

column2: ['Educational experience is very good.  Teachers are very passionate about their area of expertise, so I am able to acquire a lot of knowledge from them.  However, the district/school does lacks diversity.', 'I felt my children received or are receiving an excellent education which is preparing them not only for college but for life in general.  Randolph High School has fostered an inclusive environment and enabled my children to grow as individuals.', 'Being in Randolph High school was great to achieve new learning experience and getting ready for college and also I meet with many people from different cultures. However, as alumni in the school, there were some changes that need to be the environment. There were many times that I would not even have a breath of fresh air because of how contain the school was. Also, the food in schools is not the best thing when it comes to school because it feels very fake. Although there needs some changes about Randolph High school, it is a school that has the most interesting teachers and students to have ever met.', 'Randolph High School is a very good school that offers many possibilities and opportunities to its students. Teachers often put their highest efforts to help students pass and succeed in their class. The Music program is stellar with incredible teachers and resources, although budgets could be increased for the music program it is still a major part of the school. Administration is often single minded and very oblivious to various problems in the school, while issues are solved, they are often solved by the students themselves. Overall Randolph High School is a great school that prepares students to work hard in the real world.', "RHS is what you make of it. It can be the best or the worst. Sometimes it can get frustrating but the positives outweigh the negative. It has some of the most driven, hardworking, and compassionate students. There is a place for everyone, and if there isn't the students are there to offer a seat at lunch. RHS is great", 'I graduated from Randolph High School. I liked how diverse the school was and the environment. RHS helped me a lot in a way. The school need to change the food that is being offered and stop doing tardy halls.', 'Randolph High School is a fantastic place with an amazing group of students and faculty members. You truly feel a sense of family and we often consider each other a RAMily. The academics are strong and the athletics always impress.', 'I spent all four years of high school at Randolph as a top student in the class, involved in both sports and academic extracurriculars. Randolph more heavily supports and funds the sports teams while neglecting other activities, such as the music department and clubs such as debate and speech. The administration is widely viewed by students as nonresponsive and generally unreachable. As a student wanting to excel I hoped to move into more advanced courses only to be met by opposition from administration because they felt students should not try to move ahead of the set curriculums. Perhaps the average student would have a good experience here, but as a top student, I often felt held back by the lack of support from administration to take more challenging courses, the lack of funding for important clubs leading to fewer activities, and overemphasis on sports teams.', 'After having the opportunity of attending Randolph High School, I have come out with a strong education. It is what you choose to make of the experience. I feel prepared for college.', 'I honestly could not have asked for a better high school experience coming from this school. However, as the years go by, the administration becomes more and more strict. The one thing I would like to see a change in is the overall excessive rules being placed every year. A couple of years ago, there were barely any rules (other than the obvious ones that have been maintained for tens of years). These kids managed just fine in a school with little to no harsh rules. Like having to sign three different pieces of papers and ask for a teacher signature just to walk 3 doors down the hall to the bathroom is highly excessive. Other than this complaint, I honestly do love this school and the spirit it embodies. The teachers are all so loving and kind (the majority of them at least), there are an abundance of clubs, activities, and sports literally any student can participate in, and the school has some great resources.', 'Randolph High School is rated very good because of the amount of clubs and classes that are available to students, and because of the expertise of the staff.', 'Love the teachers at Randolph High School: they truly want you to learn. However, there have been many budget changes that have affected the music program, which affects many students.', "Not 5 stars because of the rules that are existing within our school borders that just don't make any sense. There are some amazing staff members that are making this place fun but there should be better communication between the administration and the students so that both sides can have a better experience. If some specific teachers, guidance counselors, vice principals, and other staff member working at the cafeteria weren't there this school experience would probably suck. It's the people that you spend your time with that shapes your experience. I have learnt a lot here and mostly not through classes, but through my conversations with the people here that allowed me to learn through their own experiencesin life as well.", 'I believe the administration at Randolph High school made my experience there way worse than it could have been. I graduated last year and am grateful for the memories and definitely had some great times there, but there have been a lot of complaints from me and my peers as well. Even a handful of my teachers have complained about their work conditions.', 'I really like how many clubs there were at the school. The school also has a really strong music program. The extra help the teacher would porvide help me a lot.', 'The teachers need to prepare students more for college when not taking AP courses. Admin needs to spend money on school not themselves. The school is very old style and needs a more modern remodel.', 'Overall, my experience at Randolph High School was very memorable. I have enjoyed High School very much and it makes me very sad realizing I am graduation very soon. Like all schools, there have been ups and downs, but Randolph High School has prepared me for the real world in many aspects. I am thankful to have spent my four high school years at Randolph High School.', 'The music program is fabulous. I would like to see a change in a more organized athletic program as well as a more vertical and horizontal articulation between common core classes at each grade level.', "I would say I had a pretty good experience overall. Most of the teachers taught in a way that prepared me for college, but, like many schools, a few teachers were not very good. I didn't enjoy the overall student population of RHS while I was there. Randolph is a pretty well off town, while most people are relatively grounded, there were many people that came off as entitled. I will say though, RHS always goes hard for spirit week with crazy school pride which is something I feel most schools lack.", 'I really think that Randolph has a very solid academic program.  We have a ton of different course offerings from the normal courses like biology and history to some more specific and less common ones like criminal law and public speaking.  To go along with the courses, we have so many great teachers.  For the most part, the teachers are very knowledgeable and available for students.  They want students to succeed.  One thing that should change about Randolph is the clubs and activities.  We have a bunch of cool ones, but most members are just there for the college resume.  I wish students were more invested in the clubs they join.']

I will say though, RHS always goes hard for spirit week with crazy school pride which is something I feel most schools lack.", 'I really think that Randolph has a very solid academic program.  We have a ton of different course offerings from the normal courses like biology and history to some more specific and less common ones like criminal law and public speaking.  To go along with the courses, we have so many great teachers.  For the most part, the teachers are very knowledgeable and available for students.  They want students to succeed.  One thing that should change about Randolph is the clubs and activities.  We have a bunch of cool ones, but most members are just there for the college resume.  I wish students were more invested in the clubs they join.']
column6: ['My time at Randolph High School was one that greatly exceeded my expectations. The faculty, as well as my fellow students, provided me with an encouraging environment that set me up for nothing less that success. Although I was sad to leave, I have since gone on to achieve great things in both furthering my education and beginning my career.', 'Great school district with great staff. I am truly going to miss it next year. This school has taught me so much and has definitely prepared me for college. All the teachers and staff are very respectful and understanding about your situation. 10/10 experience, would definitely relive my high school years one more time', 'RHS has been a wonderful experience on many levels. Academically, I have been exposed to wonderful teachers who have helped to guide me toward an impressive GPA but more importantly they have mentored me so I am confident that I can stretch myself and accomplish far more than I would have expected of myself when I was first coming into RHS.  The groups that I have belonged to while at RHS, whether it was Marching Band or Chamber Choir, Swim Team or Track and Field have all given me the feeling of community, acceptance and belonging that bolstered my confidence and helped me to realize that I can accomplish anything especially if I work with a team and do my part.', 'Randolph high school has the greatest public education system in Morris County. The teachers are great as is the guidance departement. Everyone is so helpful and really knows what they are doing.', 'RHS prepares its students for college and overall success. It seems fairly common to hear that past RHS students excel in college because of the "training" and good habits that RHS has instilled. Personal experience: great teachers and great resources within the school.', 'At Randolph High School, I had a great experience. I made lots of lasting friendships and made meaningful connections with many of my teachers.', 'It’s a good acedemic school but the the teachers are all moody, the sports aren’t too good at winning but the acedemic side is amazing I have a 85 gpa through my Highschool years and I’m in the back of my class', 'Randolph High School has given my daughter so many opportunities to grow from creating documentaries to internships.  She has not only grown in her academic skills but as a person.', 'wow I never regret going to Randolph high school, Randolph high school provides a safe learning environment where student can when a lot of skills to become productive and creative members in the community, they teach about morals which is very important in the lives of every students. I we like them to improve in there cafeteria because there food taste so bad', 'learned a lot, very involved-- had a positive curriculum experience, but the culture was very bland and uniform', 'We are very happy here.  There are many  AP classes and elective options.  The music department wins awards every year.  We love the hockey team too.', 'An overall great school. All of the teachers are very nice and respectful, and I feel like I have learned a lot over these past few years. The school is very clean and safe, and I have had a great time meeting new friends and fostering new realtionships.', 'The school has many outstanding courses for students that expose them to a wide variety of academics that prepares them for college.', "My friends are what make Randolph a good school.  Most of the teachers are pretty good too.  There isn't enough time between classes to get from one end of the school to the other though.  Also I use crutches and the elevator is always broken, which is a pain.", "Randolph High School offers a solid high school education. Spirit week has to be the highlight of my high school career because the whole school is so involved with it. Most teachers are great and truly care about their students. However, there are some teachers who aren't the best. Overall, I have had a very positive experience at RHS.", "Full of snobs and teachers who couldn't care less about you. The school has no soul or personality. Better off transferring to Roxbury or Dover", 'Randolph High School offers opportunities for a wide variety of interests: academics, sports, arts, etc. The teachers are influential and make an effort to help all students that ask for it. The career center offers get advice and chances to further your education and the guidance department helps get you where you want to be.  Randolph helps students to become the best people they can be, as long as they are willing to put in some elbow grease as well.', 'The majority of students at the school are involved in clubs', 'Teachers are amazing. They love working with students and open with them with topics discuss in class.', 'There is a lot of unique things that make Randolph High School unique. The atmosphere is amazing in the school, students are always smiling in the hallways and everyone is looking out for one another. The school athletics is very competitive. I would go to this school again if I could do it all over again.']

column2: ['Huntington High School is very supportive and offers a surprisingly large amount of clubs. Also, staff are very supportive and often work around your schedule if you have interest in attending extra help.', "At Huntington High School there's something for everyone. There are a variety of clubs, sports, and activities to get involved in. I like the sense of community and broad diversity. There are great programs available and great resources; if you're having a rough day, there are people to talk to, if you have questions about college, you can utilize the college office, if you need community service, you can go to the main office and see where you can help out, and the list goes on and on.  I feel like most of the teachers truly care about their students and their success. Students are able to have their suggestions heard by the principal/administration and sometimes even implemented! I personally love going to school events and programs and I think my school and district, in general, have a significant amount of school pride and spirit.", 'Huntington High school is a school that is neither good nor bad. While some aspects are great, others not so much', 'Huntington high is the most racist school I know. The teachers, the coaches are the worst. The only way to succeed in that school is to have white skin', 'The teachers and AP programs are amazing. I have enjoyed my experience in Huntington. I have taken part in several great clubs and honors societies and appreciate the attention our district places on the arts.', 'I liked some of the teachers at Huntington. The buildings are a little dirty, stuff leaks from the ceiling sometimes. We have a lot of diversity which is really cool. The school has a huge budget but seems to waste it somehow. We don’t need the pickup trucks you are buying. Would love to see more money put into the arts. Our school has a lot of controversy, basically 2-3 weird/scary events every year. I would say it’s poor in quality, but I like the positives of the school.', "I feel privileged to have grown up in the Huntington Union Free School District and Huntington High School has been instrumental in shaping who I am as a person. The diversity of the student body has opened my eyes to new perspectives and fostered an environment rich with collaboration. The school's administration could not have been more considerate and accommodating. The vast opportunities in music and the arts (marching band, chamber choir, orchestra, drama club) combined with a myriad of STEM exposure (namely the robotics team, science olympiad, etc.)  along with humanities programs (National History, School Newspaper) ensure that any student can pursue their passions. AP courses have prepared me for college curriculum. The school's security team succeeds in providing a safe and welcoming educational environment. I love Huntington; Go Blue Devils!", 'My experiences thus far at Huntington have been amazing. As a current Junior, I already feel prepared enough for college and the college process. I thoroughly enjoy the flexibility of courses, day to day life, and the interconnected student body. However, I feel as though improvements could be made, for example, the horrendous bathroom policy that does little to enforce school rules, and the crowding of multiple hallways at all times of the day.', 'Lots of classes offered, not the best academic environment or school spirit. Attracts lots of media attention, not a good thing', "I think its a pretty average high school. There is a big emphasis on the sports a music program which can be annoying when you're not apart of either but there are plenty other clubs and activities available. The school is a community and everyone is usually pretty civil. Of course it has its up and downs and controversies but overall its not a bad school.", 'Lack of advanced stem classes, otherwise a great school!  Great teachers, tons of opportunities to get involved in clubs, and excellent school spirit!', 'The experience attending Huntington High School is great! You are given opportunities to clubs, sports teams, and the education is free or reduced depending on your average income.', "Overall great place. I enjoy the most of the teacher. Friendly people, pretty much everyone cares how your doing.  It's surprising how compassionate most people are. The school is pretty large with  the amount of students, there's plenty of students running around.", "I transferred here for my senior year. It was easy to get comfortable and used to it. The people here are nice and teachers are helpful! The college process is a little confusing for students trying to get scholarships because there's not much help, you are kind of on your own.", 'Huntington High School is a diverse school that brings multiple groups of people together, allowing for your children to have a good up bringing in the education side. The teachers in the school district are great and most are willing to help you with whatever you need to get you favored grade. Being a graduate from this school and an alumni I can say I would have not wanted to go to any other school. It helped me become the person I am today a well rounded adult.', 'Huntington High School is a well-rounded high school with many clubs and AP opportunities.  Many teachers are very involved with the success of students--hosting clubs, holding extra help after school, and providing personal support for those who reach out to them.  While some services (such as food) and resources (for the art department and teachers) may be occasionally lacking, the school seems to make an effort to provide for their students.  The college office is dedicated to providing assistance to juniors and seniors to ensure every student has a plan following graduation, and there are many deans and counselors who work to support students.', 'Hungtington is almost like any other school district. It has its cliques, clubs, sports, rigorous classes. It has a lot to offer, as does many other school districts.', 'I love my experience at Huntington high school. They have a lot of afterschool programs a lot of clubs and activities for students to join and feel safe in.', 'I had a great experience at HHS. Teachers were great. They were very flexible and understanding. They will work around their personal life to accommodate a time and date to sit down with you and help you.', "My favorite part of my Huntington High School is definitely all of the wonderful students and teachers that I have met. Joining many of the available clubs that the school has to offer has opened me up to many new experiences. The clubs that I've been a member of have helped guide me to what major I want to pursue in college. I've made life long friends here!"]

column6: ['As a recent graduate of Huntington High School, I can honestly say it was the best experience I could’ve had due to the amazing staff and teachers I grew so close to.', 'Huntington is a very diverse High School and has  a very good life skills program.  There are many AP classes available, however it is a small school with a smaller budget.', 'Amazing teachers, they genuinely care about their students and are always willing to help. A lot of opportunities to be involved in various clubs and sports. Huntington truely has something positive to offer everyone.', 'Huntington high school encourages a successful 4 year career for every student. I love that this school has a lot of pride, spirit, community activities, diverse student body, extra curriculars, art and music programs, sports and more than a lot of other long island school. Here, there is a strong healthy foundation for great opportunities to come about. And much success in life.', 'I had a wonderful experience at Huntington High School.  It prepared me to face the challenges of college and beyond.', "I loved my time spent at Huntington High School. I have met so many different people that I wouldn't have known had I not attended Huntington High School. I am truly able to connect with the faculty and they constantly show that they care about my future success. I have an immense pride for the school I attend and am so proud to be graduating from such an amazing institution. Go Blue Devils!", 'i love my experience here. amazing teachers and education. the teachers here care about your success unlike other schools.', 'There are some great teachers who are very passionate and dedicated. Some of the department heads are not in touch with the students and are caught up in administrative politics. This is very detrimental to the students in my experience.', "I had a great experience at Huntington. The town is so diverse and you learn so much just from the people you're surrounded by. The academics offered have a large range so you have a lot of options for classes.", 'Huntington High School provides a helpful and passionate teachers who generally care and connect to their students. While some departments are better than others, overall, the academics provide many ways for students to become passionate about school and a good start for students looking to attend college. The music and arts departments at the school are particularly successful in engaging students. The various clubs at the school make sure that there is something for everyone who wants to get involved.', "Huntington High School was an interesting place to gain my education. It taught me not only academics but it gave me life experience. I was exposed to so many different walks of life, different people with different socioeconomic backgrounds, different heritages, different personalities and talents. Huntington wasn't perfect, and I'm glad for that. The volleyball team could've gotten more funding from the booster club, and the debate club got discontinued but I'd like to think that the things Huntington lacked helped me and other students gain character.", "It's one of those schools that's diverse, not in terms that we have every race, because it was mainly white students. It's the fact that no one really sees color in the school. Everyone felt like they belonged, because the environment was very nice, comforting and they welcomed everybody. From the students to the staff, you never felt left out no matter what race because there was something for everybody to do and get involved in.", "This school is pretty good because there's a lot of diversity. There are also great teachers there that they will always be there to help you. Also, there are sports for anyone who can participate. Club and Activities that makes you feel like you're not the only one with the same interest. ", "There's many clubs that you can join", 'The teachers care about their students', "They're great teachers to talk to", 'We have so many security guards that are involved in more than just security, and their influence on the students and activities they take part in make them extremely important to the school community and the students as well. There is a level of respect/trust between guards and students', "The school has all different kinds of clubs ranging from solely athletic to sole academic. It's easy to commit to numerous clubs at once because they meet at various times throughout the week, and advisors are mostly understanding about occasional time conflicts.", "During my almost four years at this school, I have grown exponentially as an individual. The school as a community is one of the closest knit schools I've ever walked into and even with the heavy diversity among social groups, we all get along really well. The staff outside of just educators have really given me a sense for belonging because they genuinely care about the wellbeing of every student that walks into their offices. For the people alone, I would relive my four years at this school in a heartbeat.", 'The majority of teachers at the school truly understand not only the curriculum, but they can teach it thoroughly as well. Most of my teachers have been great at preparing me for AP exams and helping me retain knowledge outside of the classroom']

column2: ["It's a very good school still have one more year to go. the teachers make sure that you're ready for the real world by preparing you. the students have a good relationship with the teachers. by going to this school I have passed three regents. I'm lucky to be in this school", 'I genuinely love my school but yes they can improve math staff because many people seem to struggle in the subject that they were once good in.', 'Manhattan Center isn’t a school that is fit for just one type of kid. I believe in this school anyone can excel. However, in order to do so you have to be head strong and not just academically intelligent. If you get along with the teachers you’ll be just fine but if you don’t you’ll have a rough time. Teachers here either like your or they don’t. And even if they say your grade isn’t based on how they feel about you, it is. Besides that the teachers here are very caring. They give out multiple chances and if you mess up you can’t really blame anyone but yourself.', 'Manhattan Center for Science and Mathematics has really impacted my life in a positive way by creating  a new level of independence for me. Being a student at Manhattan Center exposes you too a lot of freedom such as being able to go out for lunch and having the capability to choose the extra curricular activities you would like to participate in.', "This school is really good for students looking to achieve academic greatness. There's a lot of AP classes offered and many ways for once to challenge themselves. Also, student involvement is very high, there's a lot of clubs made by students which are really fun and students can suggest to start a sport club/ team in the school. Last year the senior class of 2019 asked for a bigger college office because the one we had was too small for everyone to fit in when there were deadlines. The school did everything possible to get us a bigger college office and now we have about 30 computers and a big table that serves as a homework station.", "It's a wonderful school with supportive staff however because it's in the city there are some limited opportunities such as a football team or lacrosse team.", 'I’m a senior and I’ve really enjoyed it here! I’ve made really good friends, the teachers are amazing and super supportive and the environment in the school is just amazing !', 'Manhattan center has been an interesting experience however, along with the academics they could have tried to incorporate more fun activities and sports. Overall, it was a safe experience and a good experience that helped further me academically.', 'Personally I would enjoy some more environmental vibrancy, repairs to the workshop and greenhouse, a new fruit tree by the cafeteria entrance and possibly some hallway decor. Yet, the teachers are engaging and are amusing, they can make demonstrations and lectures very entertaining. The student culture can improve from basic helping each other in academics and nearly cliquey, friendship is easy to create though.', "The school invests a lot of time and effort into students. About 1600 students attend this school daily. Want to expand your social network or meet new people everyday? Attend. I took AP Biology and AP Calculus BC, which DEFINITELY prepared me for the college leveled class that I am required to take. Want AP classes, SAT preparations? Attend! There are many sports, except football, and clubs, including dance. There are many school-driven students. Not much drama at the school. Teachers can be strict,  but that's for the best. Most teachers provide after school tutorings if you need extra help. The school is very resourceful. There are computer labs, college advisors, in addition to having counselors. You can also go out for lunch! Target/ Chinese food/ deli sandwiches just a block away. I definitely may have gained some weight LOL. I do not regret attending MCSM at all. Do you want to get into college? Attend this school!", "I've had a good four years at this school, and I've enjoyed each year at it. I wish that there were more opportunities for arts though.", "Manhattan Center is an amazing school that offers many AP classes, clubs, programs that will help you pursue the future you want. On the other hand, the administration is very biased towards certain students. If you do not fit the certain image they have of an MCSM scholar, they won't give you any help you need. They will literally ignore you and lie to your face just to get their favorite student at the top.", "It is a school where you can feel safe! The teachers for the most part care about the students' education and will help you at any turn. They are constantly at tutoring incase you need help. The staff are wonderful, the class choices are great, and overall, this school is above all expectations i had had for a high school-ever.", 'This high school is one of the specialized high schools and most of the students are smart compare to ordinally high school.  We do lot AP classes such as , AP English, history, com science, calc BC, Physics C...etc.You will also meet lots of talented students.  they are so energized and developed various skills, not only study.', "Overall pretty nice. Easy to get into and the school offers enough ap classes. A nice selection of clubs. The people there are cool; however, some don't like to take things seriously.", 'Its a good school and there making an effort to build the culture of the school. the IEP teachers are the best teachers you will ever meet. they always check on you make sure you understand the work , you can talk to them about almost ANYTHING!!! . YOU ARE NOT JUST A NUMBER IN THIS SCHOOL!!!!!!!!!!  theres a place for everyone you just got to find it.', "I loved the people, they were very nice. The teachers were amazing, very involved with the students and their learning of the subject. comprehensive staff. The people really made the place. Going to miss them lots. I made some great friends in there and I'm very grateful.", 'Manhattan Center truly prepared me for college. While high school and college have different atmospheres, Manhattan Center tries their hardest to be similar to colleges in order for us to smoothly transition. This high school is very diverse, provides multiple resources, events, college classes, and welcomes you with opening arms. No wonder Manhattan Center has over a 98% college readiness rate!', 'I love the diversity and community feel of Manhattan Center; students share a similar drive and are generally welcoming. However, I would like to see more student-involved activities and more clubs.', 'Manhattan Center for Science and Mathematics is a school that heavily focuses on math and science. As a freshman you take double periods of math and science. I did basketball and softball which I loved both because it brought me out of my comfort zone and helped me meet other people. It helped me gain a lot of friends in just one year. It is like a community where people have similar interests as you. Although, it can be very disorganized and misleading. They can have tendencies to forget to mention certain information and can be very disorderly. The hallways are very crowded and can take a while to get to class depending on the floor or which part of the hall your class is in.']
column4: ["It's a very good school still have one more year to go. the teachers make sure that you're ready for the real world by preparing you. the students have a good relationship with the teachers. by going to this school I have passed three regents. I'm lucky to be in this school", 'I genuinely love my school but yes they can improve math staff because many people seem to struggle in the subject that they were once good in.', 'Manhattan Center isn’t a school that is fit for just one type of kid. I believe in this school anyone can excel. However, in order to do so you have to be head strong and not just academically intelligent. If you get along with the teachers you’ll be just fine but if you don’t you’ll have a rough time. Teachers here either like your or they don’t. And even if they say your grade isn’t based on how they feel about you, it is. Besides that the teachers here are very caring. They give out multiple chances and if you mess up you can’t really blame anyone but yourself.', 'Manhattan Center for Science and Mathematics has really impacted my life in a positive way by creating  a new level of independence for me. Being a student at Manhattan Center exposes you too a lot of freedom such as being able to go out for lunch and having the capability to choose the extra curricular activities you would like to participate in.', "This school is really good for students looking to achieve academic greatness. There's a lot of AP classes offered and many ways for once to challenge themselves. Also, student involvement is very high, there's a lot of clubs made by students which are really fun and students can suggest to start a sport club/ team in the school. Last year the senior class of 2019 asked for a bigger college office because the one we had was too small for everyone to fit in when there were deadlines. The school did everything possible to get us a bigger college office and now we have about 30 computers and a big table that serves as a homework station.", "It's a wonderful school with supportive staff however because it's in the city there are some limited opportunities such as a football team or lacrosse team.", 'I’m a senior and I’ve really enjoyed it here! I’ve made really good friends, the teachers are amazing and super supportive and the environment in the school is just amazing !', 'Manhattan center has been an interesting experience however, along with the academics they could have tried to incorporate more fun activities and sports. Overall, it was a safe experience and a good experience that helped further me academically.', 'Personally I would enjoy some more environmental vibrancy, repairs to the workshop and greenhouse, a new fruit tree by the cafeteria entrance and possibly some hallway decor. Yet, the teachers are engaging and are amusing, they can make demonstrations and lectures very entertaining. The student culture can improve from basic helping each other in academics and nearly cliquey, friendship is easy to create though.', "The school invests a lot of time and effort into students. column6: ["This is a very good school. It's pretty well known across New York City. One of my favorite things about it is the diversity. There are people from all parts of the city and the world. You will be exposed to many cultures. The teachers are all motivated to give the students their best education possible. There are some teachers that sadly don't care ( as is typical of many high schools ) but overlooking that fact, this is a very great school.  The amount of clubs there are is very good, also there are lots of AP classes that give us students many options.", "Most of the problems of this school are caused by the poor education system of the country. Despite this fact, the teachers could have been better, especially science and math teachers. Some of them barely care about the student and do just enough to hold their spots, giving tons of useless papers and pretending to be teaching. They are protected by unions and it is almost impossible to fire them or replace, what is not the school's fault though.Still, there are some awesome teachers, who passionately do their job, providing great education to their students. It's a lottery, really. The community in the school is amazing: very diverse, everyone is friendly and respects each other. You can freely be yourself, not being afraid of abuse or harassment, whatever your religion, political views, gender, sexual orientation and skin tone are.Overall, if you or your child didn't get to a specialized hs, I would definitely recommend this one, other public hs are even worse.", 'Being a transfer student at MCSM, I was surprisingly treated properly by its community. Compared to my other school, the students adapted to each other rather quickly and had little discrimination toward others.', "It's a great school for education. Many AP's, many clubs. Something I'm not a fan of though is the lack of trips, and how spirit days are reserved for seniors only. Overall though with a student body over 1,000 it's a great place to find your cliche and get a great education!", 'I like MCSM because it is very involved and gives many academic opportunities.  There is also many clubs and friends to interact with.', "We are a very diverse school that offers many opportunities that most schools don't. We have many clubs to choose from and many advanced placement classes.", 'This school is amazing let your child go there if you’re thinking of applying. The area is safe the teachers are nice and it is a lot of diversity.  The only thing is the food it’s okay but that is not a big issue in my opinion .', 'It is a really good school and a hidden gem. Def go there if you want to graduate hs. Jakajakajjakaaajjanwnwnwjdjdnbdbdbdbdbdbd dhejjenenen dndjdjdjdnbd d djjdndjd ddjdjdndnndndnd dnndndndndnd. D', 'Manhattan Center for Science and Math is a great school if you love the STEM field. With so many AP classes you are guaranteed a good preparation you for college. This school also has many sports teams and clubs that will allow the students to do more than just study. Over the years the diversity has been on a constant increase which is great considering we are in Harlem.', 'The diversity is great; within this school, there is a place for mainly everyone. However, I would like to see administration make a more effort in bettering senior culture. As a graduating class, not everyone was connected or as united.', 'Overall MCSM is a great school. Free SAT prep in junior year, ample AP classes, many clubs, and organizations. MCSM will guide you to be very successful for college', 'I liked the variety of AP classes that were offered at Manhattan Center. These were important for me as they gave me a sense of what college would be like, and while college is impossible to understand before actually going through it, it was good preparation.', "I am a current senior at MCSM. The school has progressed since freshman year. For example, the college office was moved into the basement computer lab. Before that, it was a small cramped room with barely any computers. Also, lunchtime used to be very hectic. We would have to swipe our ID's just to get into the lunchroom and the basement would get so crowded. Now, there is a separator and we do not have to swipe our IDs. The social life is very cliquey, like any other high school. The teachers vary. Some are strict and others are very laid back and understanding. All of my teachers have motivated me and have pushed me to go above and beyond. I would say that the school should improve the number of sports they have, the guidance counselors, how they handle conflict and SAT prep.", 'I feel comfortable in MCSM! Teachers are polite and inviting, many of whom are very dedicated to their work. I think diversity is one of its many outstanding qualities.', 'Good choice of AP classes to choose from. Fond of being able to go outside for lunch. Many students have very high grades as it is a very smart school.', 'The school was great when I attended. They had a large variety of Advanced Placement classes. The teachers were mostly helpful. There were a few that clearly hated working there, about three or four of them.', "This was my number one pick for high school. I chose it because of convenience, as I live only a few blocks away. Overall the school is great. The staff are able to create a very friendly and respectful environment for the student. Throughout my four years in this school I have been able to build strong relationships with many of my teachers. The school provides students with a variety of opportunities, from special programs like STEP to clubs like soccer.  The teachers and staff are extremely helpful and create a welcoming experience. Many of the teachers make time just for you as long as you ask for it. Although the school is very crowded, 1500+ students, it's as if everyone knows and respects each other. Lastly, everyone is treated equally and respectfully.", "My experience as a student attending Manhattan Center for Science and Mathematics are overall good. My school has a lot of resources, including, college prep classes, after school tutoring and having access to teachers whether it's after school hours or via email. Although my school lacked school spirit, the clubs were an alternative for unity amongst us student .", 'Manhattan Center location has to be the worse part about it. Its nearest train is the 6 train and the walk from the 6 train to the school is pretty long. Other than that the people in the school arent violent or aggressive. I consider this school to be good cause the majority of the students there are really educated and is on top of there grades. There is not much distractions there.', 'I am currently a senior at MCSM and my experience so far has had some ups and downs. When it comes to academics, math and science classes are insanely good. You can tell teachers are well qualified and know how to prepare students for regents exams. On the other hand, the English and Social Studies departments need a clean up. You either get a really good teacher or a disimpassioned teacher- no in between. Aside from academics- the school provides many outside resources to help with college readiness and many other things that fit your interest. There are rarely any fights and you can always find a school safety officer.']

column2: ['River Dell is a really good high school. It offers many diverse opportunities for its students. It also has great athletics programs.', "Although I've only been in this school district for less than 4 years, my experience here has been rewarding and mostly positive. The football team is amazing, and the teachers are mostly helpful and genuinely care for their students.", 'I like the environment. I, personally, have had a great experience at River Dell High School. I have picked the right friends to hang out with, and I have made the right decisions in what to and what not to participate in. I think that the facilities could be updated and that some of the teachers could be a little less demanding and non-understanding. But, overall, I have had a wonderful time at River Dell Regional High School, and I personally believe that I will deeply miss it once I go to college next year.', 'it was close knit and fairly small. I had fun and I also learned to push myself to knew limits. I will always remember high school and the lessons I learned between freshamn year and graduation', 'I enjoyed it but I would like to see better teachers. Teachers were poorly trained especially for important classes that could count for college credit.', 'River Dell is a great school with an amazing faculty who adequately do their jobs. The school itself is nice and the classrooms have top notch desks as well as technology. There is a lack of seating during the lunch period, causing many students to have to sit on the floor, but other than that the cafeteria itself is nice.', 'I think this school is awesome and it really has a lot to offer! Overall, I am happy I go here because most of the teachers are really great and there is really a lot of activities, clubs, and classes to take for anybody, including pretty much all interests and talents.', 'Fantastic teachers, classes and students!  My father and sister graduated from here as well and we all had such wonderful experiences.  From academics to top rated sports programs, this school has it all!', 'Really enjoyed my time here. All the teachers are from around here so everyone knows everyone. My classes were challenging and i learned a lot. if i could do it again i would.', "River Dell is a school that offers plenty of resources--it's your job to get out there and take advantage of them. For instance, there are clubs from History Club to Debate Team, Cooking Club to Anime Club, but these clubs are often not known to most students. In terms of academics, River Dell never fails to fall short of providing top-notch curricula in the arts and sciences, with a math track that goes up to AP Calculus BC and AP Statistics. There is also a culture that emphasizes taking everything easy and slow. Internships are often not advertised or encouraged until the student's senior year, at which point it is often too late to reveal one's work to colleges. Finally, at its core, River Dell is an athletic powerhouse, winning the State Championship title 2 years in a row.", 'Good teachers, great gym and fields but should offer better communication for seniors for summer internship or programs.', 'River Dell was an amazing high school to attend.  They have great sports teams, motivating coaches, and excellent teachers.  There are a myriad of clubs to join and great access to resources.  The school really focuses on the students and prepares students for adulthood.', "I'm currently a senior. I've had a great (almost) 4 years at River Dell.  Met best friends and awesome teachers.", "The quality of teachers here is very diverse. There are many teachers here that genuinely care for their students and they will do anything to ensure that you succeed in their class. Others are smart and they will do more from time to time. Then there are those that are so bad at what they do, they make you wonder why they decided to become a teacher in the first place. But I'd say that 95% of the teachers here fall in the first and second categories. They definitely make my time here enjoyable", 'We have a great nursing staff and our trained on how to handle emergencies in the classroom.', 'The yearbook club was fun to be apart of because my friends and I were in a lot of the pictures. I also took part in drama club and worked back stage during all the plays.', "It's a very cliquey school so if you don't know where you belong it's not exactly easy to fit in.", 'The teachers worked well with the students and tried to help them as best as they could.', "I think that there's a variety of extracurricular activities offered however there are not any intramural level sports for the students who want to play but who do not make the varsity level team.", 'I think some teachers are better than other but they do genuinely care about the students. I believe that the quality of the courses and material presented are above average. The students receive a well rounded education and are prepared for college.']
