I believe that the quality of the courses and material presented are above average. The students receive a well rounded education and are prepared for college.']
column6: ['My children feel safe at the school and we have not had any issues.', "There's a wide variety of courses offered in business, technology, arts, life skills, sciences and math that appeal to most student's interests.  The various course levels (remedial, regular, AP,honors) allows the student to take classes that are appropriate for their aptitude and challenging ones for the advanced learner. The college levels SUPA courses that are offered are a terrific way to get college credits while still in high school.", 'The student involvement is high in this school for most of the population. Peer pressure is somewhat prevalent and the school is mostly accepting. There is an ethnically diverse student body especially in recent years. Students with different sexual orientation are safe.', 'There is a wide selection of classes offered at this class from business to art. Everyone has a chance to explore their interests and try out new classes.', 'Overall a safe school in a safe town. Many individuals are not involved in gang activities or other dangerous activities. Safety is a priority and lock down drills are practiced regularly.', "They're is a large variety of school clubs and organizations to chose from. The more fun options to administration positions, or after-school activities and sports.", "I've enjoyed my experience at this school because I was able to be an individual without being judged. Generally an accepting school with a warm welcoming environment.", 'Teachers generally have a lot of knowledge when they teach. They want students to do well and are supportive. They will take extra time off their own to help students.', 'All of my experiences although not that many have been positive with no complaints.', "One daughter loved her high school experience and my other daughter couldn't wait to get out.", 'Fire drill and other drills occur regularly on monthly basis, very close to police station and fire department', 'The after school activities are excellent. Students can even create their own club if its legitimate', 'It has been fun and worthy to remember', 'wonderful atomsphere, friendly and bully-free', 'Great administration, and always a ton of opportunities to take advantage of- though obvious over-reliance on technology,,', 'Although I have a couple complaints, my school has provided me with a good education and a lot of social opportunities. There is very little bullying, and there is a club or activity for every student.', 'The school relies on laptops which may deteriorate learning and focusing skills. However, the laptops are very handy. It is an easy way to complete assignments and get everything done on time.', 'At my school there is a wide variety of extracurricular activities. There are clubs from nature club to fashion club.', 'This high school has given me such a great experience so far. The students are fantastic and really care about each other. Most of the teachers really care about their students and make it so that the students feel comfortable and intelligent.', "I personally think that our lunch period is too early in the day. I also don't eat food from the cafeteria often, so it is difficult for me to properly assess this."]

column2: ['The academics, teachers and policies of this school are great, along with the extracurricular activities, clubs and sports. Days are very reasonable and homework is too. Safety in the neighbourhood is guaranteed through the presence of great school security.', 'My experience at Commack High School has been tremendous. The variety of classes offered at the school are limitless. i have made countless friends and formed relationships that will last a lifetime. Nearly every teacher I have had has been extremely helpful, and is always willing to help with a problem I may have. The clubs offered also know no bounds, as I see hundreds of students staying after school daily for athletics, clubs, honor societies, and more.', "Commack High School is one of those schools that focuses on what's important and somewhat ignores everything else. As I noted below, the school's programs, clubs, classes, and college preparedness are spectacular. In whatever I am doing at school, I enjoy my time and get a lot out of it. I have loved almost every one of my teachers, and my favorite part of the day is after school when I get to play sports or go to my clubs. the only issue I have is the quality of the minor things. The food is pretty bad, but there are a few gems. The worst is the facilities. Bathroom stalls have no doors and most of the water fountains don't work. Other than that, Commack is amazing in every way.", 'more diversity and less judgemental. also some students are very homophobic, xenophobic, and racist. but it has very good academic and amazing opportunities for students. for example, the school is an IB school and they can take the full diploma for credit', "Commack high school was really a great school experience. Something that stands out between them and other high schools is that they make community service mandatory or you can join school sports and clubs to count as community service hours. I didn't realize it at the time but it is really great for when you are filling out college applications and you have been so involved in the community and school.", "I love going to school here! The staff constantly tries to improve themselves everyday! Teachers always try their best to ensure every student gets the help they need. Unfortunately they are lacking in language, I loved taking German one, but I can't continue with the program because it was cancelled. They also offer every sport their division allows and encourages students to get involved.", 'I like all of the opportunities for getting involved in the school through academics, school clubs and sports.  There is a tremendous amount of support from faculty and fellow students.  The school should work on more communication with their students so that they are more aware of anything going on inside and outside the school during the school year.', "Every high school has their ups and downs; Commack High School may be better than some. Commack really pushes their students to be the best, academically and in the aspect of volunteering. Many teachers are pretty nice and are always open to help kids out when they're struggling. With regards to clubs and sports, Commack has a wide variety of sports and oppurtunties to volunteer in the community. This really helps students in their last year of high school since they can add any experiences to their resume for college. They also have the oppurtunity to take part in internships, ranging from education to the health field. It really allows students to get a glimpse of their future before officially commiting. If there were some things I could change about Commack High School, it would be the ability to freely roam during homeroom so that students could actually get things done and adding a lounge area for students since most kids just sit on the floor before and after school,", 'There are many advantages Commack High School offered that any student who attends could benefit from. As far as academics, I found it easy to enroll in classes that I was able to challenge myself, with that said, every teacher was eager to help me if I was struggling in any area. There is an overwhelming sense of school spirit, as even the teachers dress up for spirit week.', "The teachers and resources at the school are very good and lead to a positive learning environment. The equipment for learning activities and PE are suitable. Students tend to form groups and aren't very willing to include others. Drugs and vaping have become a problem and are widespread. A large majority of the school vapes and this has destroyed the bathroom. Most of the students are middle upper class, white, and either Jewish or Catholic. Food is bad.", 'Large school but has lots of opportunities for students to get involved and work with others in the community', 'Commack High School provides a great education for all of their students in a safe environment. The teachers and staff were always very helpful and always making sure that each and everyone of their students were successful in the class. If there could be one change to the High School I would wish for more electives to be added in because I find that these make school more interesting and it helps people find out more about a profession.', 'This is my forth year at Commack High School. Overall, this has been a positive experience for me. There are many things you can do here, like clubs, honor societies, and sports, and the possibilities are endless. They also have an excellent music program as well. I feel very prepared for college in the future as the administration is always there to help. I will definitely remember my amazing experience at Commack High School.', 'Most teachers are truly wonderful and really want their student to succeed. Administration, on the other hand, is a wildly different story. Despite offering a number of ways for student to voice their complaints, they are continuously ignored and dismissed. The large family of crickets living in the walls could use some work too.', 'The school prepares you well for college with their curriculum, IB classes and college credit classes. It has a great varsity program in many sports. The teachers care about the students. There are many social activities and events for the students.', 'Over the course of my high school years,I have enjoyed participating in clubs and college level classes. Particularly, I enjoyed setting up for school events with my classmates in the Class Of 2020 clubs. It has taught me how to build upon my teamwork and communication skills. Although not every school is outstanding , I personally believe that Commack High School has provided me with amazing opportunities, and certainly thousands of connections everyday. I couldn’t be more proud of my school, and I will continue taking many clubs throughout college.', "I liked how engaged and friendly the teachers are and how they understand the pressures and chaos of a high school student's life. I wish the school offered more AP classes to make it easier to earn college credits rather than the much lesser known IB courses.", 'I only gave it a four star because, first off. They just took away some electives that are art related and some people like me need these electives such as fashion design to further experience what it’s like and an alibi for college. The school also just allows some of the rich kids to get away with detention just because they’re scared of getting sued. Other than that, commack is a great school. Most of my teachers were great and commack offers varieties of electives and clubs that some schools don’t have and they really prepare you for college.', 'One thing that I liked about the school was that I felt prepared for college once I left high school.', 'Large school with a lot of opportunities that interest everyone. Supportive staff and great departments for all students!']

column6: ["Commack High School provides a welcoming environment to its students through its well trained staff. Its numerous clubs and course options allow students to have a positive and interactive experience. Regardless of what school you go to, students will encounter at least one teacher they have trouble with whether its because of their teaching style or personality. I feel that my school should have better protocol when it comes to removing a student from an ill environment in the classroom. For example, a friend of mine last year was unable to learn the material because she didn't understand the teachers teaching style and failed the midterm as a result.Unable to change teachers her transcript would now show that she dropped out of a class. I understand there is a problem with students changing teachers to be with friends, but there should be some sort of investigation of grades and the students relationship with teachers before a final answer is provided.", 'It is great. IB program excellent though challenging. Sad that the experience is almost over. Teachers are always ready to help when needed and very close friendships can be created in this school, both with the other students as well as the teachers.', 'I can’t imagine how hard college would have been for me if I had not gone through some of the programs they have at commack high school. (I specifically went through the IB program) All the teachers are fabulous and offer excessive opportunities for extra help. If you show that you care about your education they will never let you fail. The school community feels very connect by sports, clubs and activities.  The food is pretty good but I always brought my own lunch. Online the school has hundreds of resources for just about anything. I loved my experience there.', 'What I liked about Commack High School is that you have the opportunity for early dismissal during senior year. The clubs are not bad but it is very clicky. Diversity is almost nonexistent. Most teachers and administrator do not really listen to students, rather they are concerned about repeating the politically correct mantra.', 'Commack High School has a lot of amazing teachers who care about their students, are passionate in what they teach and always try their hardest. There is a deep connection between the students and teachers for the most part, as the teachers are always there for support in any aspect of life.', 'My Commack High School experience has been everything I could have hoped for in a high school, in that the teachers and administration helped me get on track and prepare me for college. They gave me all of the necessary tools I needed to succeed in the next chapter of my life as well as offering help both in and out of the classroom in their spare time. There are numerous clubs and activities available for every student to take part in and enjoy which will ensure an exciting and thrilling high school career as well as getting you ready for college.', 'Commack high School. Started in 2012 and graduate in 2016. I was nervous being in a new school but when I went I got stuck with my sister and cousin. We had great moments and she grandulated 2 years early then me. My teacher would catch on to me because of my sister that was in the school with me. They just saw the name and knew I had an older sister. In Commack I was also know as the face where every teacher would know me for my involvement of volunteers to help the sport teams and for my community work raising money for clubs. I really enjoy working for clubs raising money for events and working for the sport teams. Wiring with the team in sports open me up to learn more about basketball, football and mostly important lacrosse. Stuff I didn’t know about these sports open a world for me in high school. I really enjoy high school of what I have learn, what I did and what affect it has on me today and I won’t for get those day and what I learn.', 'Loved the experience. Did not love how pretentious and rude the students were. The teachers were great and helped prepare me for college.', 'Overall Commack High School has given me countless amazing academic opportunities such as being part of honor societies or taking IB/college level classes. Along with outstanding academics, there are also tons of clubs and sports to join so that everyone can fit in somewhere! staff is super helpful and involved with students and parents. My only critique is that there are often problems with the bathrooms, such as flooding. But, it is always taken care of within 24 hours.', 'My experience at Commack High School was a positive influence on who I am today.  They push you hard to be successful in all we do at the school. Teachers a re dedicated and caring.  Things I would change at Commack School would be nothing , I was happy with my 4 years at the high school.', 'I like the class sizes and the options for elective classes. Staff would be improved if it was more diverse.  I would like to see more AP classes, Fewer IB classes because the credits transfer more easily. Improvement in food choices and quality of food.', "Commack High School has great resources and has positivity regarding education for thousands of students. However, a lot of kids take drugs,  the school isn't very clean and has ugly grounds. I get bullied however the dean is really good at taking care of them. Overall, this school is okay.", 'I would like to see more nice teachers and more safety. we have good academics but a lot of kids do drugs in the school', 'Commack High School is a great place to go to school. Everyone goes above and beyond to make sure the needs of the students are met. Sports and extra curricular are fantastic and gives people of all interests the opportunities to pursue what they love.', 'Commack High School is. Avery good school with nice teachers and is known for their IB diplomas. I feel that some may pressure the students too much to take higher level classes due to it being an IB school, but other than that it’s good. The teachers teach very well and the school lunch varies on a day to day basis, not the same food everyday. Also, bullying is a no tolerance and they try to limit the happening of it. They also recently this year make the students wear id tags for another safety precaution due to the recent events in schools.', 'What I liked about Commack High School was that there were tons of opportunities to get involved in whatever you liked to do-they pretty much have every club, every organization, every sport to participate it. There is a very diverse student body and most of the teachers are incredible and helpful. What I wish I could change are the new ID badge rule, the overemphasis on sports, the excess of assistant principals, and the disorganization of many events such as prom, graduation, etc.', "Commack has good and friendly teachers.  It's nice to be an IB school, but the teachers don't seem to be trained.  The school spirit is alright at best but when compared to other schools, it is nothing.  The culture and environment at the school is absolutely terrible.  It actually feels like a prison.  Everyone is stuck in a clique, and it feels stiff and competitive.  Everyone feels superior and it makes me want to leave.  This year, the school forced the students to wear identification badges, along with changing everyone's ID code and removing the eboards.  Now everything is switched to Microsoft 365, which is undoubtedly worse than Google.  Why exactly are the toilets in the JUUL room?  There was a period where we had to sign into each bathroom with a security guard because of the vaping.  I've been given a sufficient education, but it's about time I get out of here.", 'I attended Commack Schools from K-12 and overall had a great experience. My teachers are always very nice and offer a great amount of help whenever I needed it. I have always enjoyed playing sports and Commack has a great athletic program. The coaches are all very enthusiastic and really focus on making you the best athlete you could be. My only negative about the sports program are the fields. Most of them are in need of updates. Besides sports, Commack offers many other extra-curricular activities and clubs to get involved in. I have always felt very safe in the Commack Schools. There are always security personnel visible around the schools all day.', "Commack High School is a great school!  Although the school itself is big,  the teachers  are excellent.  It's a division 1 school in relation to sports.  The dance team is very competitive.  The school prepares you 100% for college.", 'Overall an enjoyable experience. Very large range of programs for most, if not all interests. IB diploma is very difficult, and there is no AP diploma offered, however there are many AP classes. Additionally, there are plenty of dual enrollment programs that can give you college credit if you perform well in the class.']

Everyone feels superior and it makes me want to leave.  This year, the school forced the students to wear identification badges, along with changing everyone's ID code and removing the eboards.  Now everything is switched to Microsoft 365, which is undoubtedly worse than Google.  Why exactly are the toilets in the JUUL room?  There was a period where we had to sign into each bathroom with a security guard because of the vaping.  I've been given a sufficient education, but it's about time I get out of here.", 'I attended Commack Schools from K-12 and overall had a great experience. My teachers are always very nice and offer a great amount of help whenever I needed it. I have always enjoyed playing sports and Commack has a great athletic program. The coaches are all very enthusiastic and really focus on making you the best athlete you could be. My only negative about the sports program are the fields. Most of them are in need of updates. Besides sports, Commack offers many other extra-curricular activities and clubs to get involved in. I have always felt very safe in the Commack Schools. There are always security personnel visible around the schools all day.', "Commack High School is a great school!  Although the school itself is big,  the teachers  are excellent.  It's a division 1 school in relation to sports.  The dance team is very competitive.  The school prepares you 100% for college.", 'Overall an enjoyable experience. Very large range of programs for most, if not all interests. IB diploma is very difficult, and there is no AP diploma offered, however there are many AP classes. Additionally, there are plenty of dual enrollment programs that can give you college credit if you perform well in the class.']

column2: ["It's a good school, but the focus here is really either on sports or taking the hardest classes you can. There are many really difficult classes, and there is not much variety when it comes to electives. It's a good school, and many of the teachers are incredibly knowledgeable, but there is definitely a push to take as many IB classes as you can fit into your schedule.", 'It’s alright but it has all the failing of every other public school, lack of individual attention, the kids suck, lack of mental health attention, stressful, trying to commodify us the best way possible. But luckily in this town we have a decent bit of money and helicopter parents, so they tend to get things done and make this school just slightly better, ofc just for their priorities but sometimes it works out for you too.', 'South Side High School is one of the best schools on all of Long Island and I am glad I got my education from here. The IB program is very rigorous and stressful at times but the material that we learn is essential and the way the IB program is handled here is very good. It really prepares you for college.', 'i liked that they were open to diversity but they were lacking in the ap classes. the ib program was also a little disorganized.', 'Guidance and social workers aren’t  helpful. They barely help with cyberbullying issues. Give hard time about 504 plans and make assumptions about needs of students instead of listening to their needs.', 'I love the experience of being part of a community school. I enjoyed the time spent building friendships.', "I have very much fun in school playing games and talking to my friends and when there is a sub in a class I go down to the lunch room to talk with friends and the teachers don't care what you do", 'I liked my experience at South Side  High School in and average way. I like being with my friends and how in this school they have IB Theatre Becuase I love Theatre. I love the clubs and all the art classes because they brighten up your day and let creative juices flow. But I don’t like how clicky this school is, In means of popularity if u don’t make certain cuts in this school like the perfect mold u won’t fit in and feel odd. This is what I would change because I feel this is not right and puts so much pressure on the kids.', 'South Side High School is a great school that provides resources and courses for its students to succeed. It has a number of amazing clubs, sports teams, and organizations.', 'The education you get here is one of the best. I felt very prepared going into college and at no point did I feel that my college courses were too difficult to handle. The school had helped me obtain a wonderful work ethic that makes me stand out to my college professors. Although the IB program was definitely a struggle, I feel that it had helped me fulfill many of my general education requirements by allowing me to bring in a semesters worth of credits into college. The school can feel very cliquey, but eventually you will find your way. Join any activities that you have any interest in and you will meet great people within them.', 'Overall positive experience, unless otherwise stated in this review I have no complaints. School spirit is lacking, the school culture seems to value personal achievement resulting in a student body more involved with themselves than each other. Largely a competent and helpful body of teachers, with very few incompetent instructors (though they do exist). Great four years overall, very little I would change.', 'At SSHS, I always received the help I needed from councilors, teachers and administrators. They go to great lengths to ensure the safety and happiness of every student. South Side provides a very inclusive and safe environment for students. The college level courses included in the curriculum help students excel in life and provide opportunities in education after high school.', 'The environment in the school is very friendly. There is no cut throat culture; all of the students just want to help each other. The teachers offer help to everyone that asks for it, but some are not as knowledgeable on the subjects as you would expect them to be.', "South Side is an amazing high school that provides its students with many opportunities. The only thing I have a complaint about is the IB program. It depends on the person but for me personally, it isn't beneficial. Great counselors that will guide you every step of the way towards college. I also feel very safe at this school as many new measures of security were added this year.", 'South Side High School is the place to be when it comes to accelerating and being a top candidate in college admissions. Academic work is challenging but with resources in all areas to facilitate full understanding. With one of the top IB programs, South Side High School provided me with confidence when applying to colleges. If you put yourself in the proper mindset to succeed, put in a decent amount of hard work and set goals for yourself, you will be very pleased when acceptance letters come your way. Nothing in life is worth having if you did not work for it and I have never been happier with how my life has unfolded after graduation.', 'Amazing school with supportive teachers and administrators. Tons of different opportunities both academic and extra curricular. Classses are challenging but fully worthwhile.', 'South Side High School has always and will continue to provide a phenomenal education and opportunity to its students. With dedicated teachers, students are able to create relationships outside of their lessons and develope interpersonal skills. Though South Side is known for its excellence, the community in itself has a lack of exposure to diversity, causing some prejudice towards peers. The administration will combat what they see, but have contributed to the problem themselves. Overall, I feel South Side is on its way to becoming a more accepting community and will one day serve as a 5 star School.', 'South Side High School is a great institution for learning. There are nice teachers coupled with a friendly atmosphere. There are excellent sporting facilities including a well-equipped weight room and gym. The school offers IB, making it stand out among other schools. One thing the school needs though is more AP courses, of which it only offers three. AP is more recognized in America than IB and thus looks more legitimate on a college resumé.', 'The IB program, while tedious and often a heavy work load, has helped me be prepared and feel ready for college. South Side has been a very accepting and friendly place for me and has helped me find my niche. The musics programs are somethings I am a part of and they are really good.', 'Really great school teachers for the most part really know what their doing. During Homecoming week their is a really awesome school spirit among the students. Ton of clubs to be apart of, you think it we probably have it. Also try the muffins in the cafeteria highly recommended.']

column8: ['South Side yields amazing academic results, but students can often struggle with the IB program. It is a lot of stress - perhaps too much - to put teenagers under, and should be thought through before pershing.', 'South Side High School is one of the best high schools. The IB program is a big aspect of the school. Many students are IB full diploma candidates and take a double IB Science or many additional classes. Students are very competitive, which can be beneficial because it raises the standards in SSHS. The school is beautiful and has two brand new wings with amazing art rooms, and state of the art science labs. SSHS has many clubs and activities for students. This school helps to prepare students for college the first day they enter the building. Truly an amazing school', 'The teachers are amazing. The enitre school got a complete make over. 2 new wings allow for many new classes. The after school and sports really made South Side High School the best HIgh School.', 'I liked their offering of the IB diploma and how it allowed me to challenge myself while in high school. However, I feel that the school does not offer enough options for the students who do not wish to pursue this track. I wish that there were more AP classes available for those not interested in IB. The emphasis on the IB diploma makes students who are not enrolled in the full diploma program feel less intelligent than their classmates, which is not only unfortunate, it is wholly untrue.', "I really like South Side, for a high school it wasn't necessarily a horrible experience. However, the lack of diversity is troublesome, and there is definitely a competitiveness to the school. College ready-ness and a focus on sending children to college sort of eclipses a comfortable learning environment. South Side loves to push kids, which works well for some and causes others a lot of trouble.", 'The teachers are good, includes both IB and AP courses. Most students take full IB courses which are extremely difficult but good preparation for the future. New construction recently done which has made the school bigger and given it much more resources. Students are all hard workers, very judgmental towards those who do not excel in most classes. Large variety of extracurricular activities. Do provide multiple opportunities to take out of country trips to Spain, England, France and more. One of the best public schools on Long Island with a very high regarded name. Most students go to one of their top choices for college, most of the guidance counselors are very helpful with the college application process.', "It's hard to play sports and be involved in activities after school", 'Are school only offers ib.   I think I would prefer a school that offered ap classes', "Most of the teachers are willing to help students if they don't understand the material.   There is extra help in the mornings and you can make an appointment with most teachers for after school", "The school provides a great amount of concern in the student's health. The school nurses make sure every student is feeling well and is taken care of- but also makes sure no one is faking an illness to get out of class. Students who suffer from diabetes or other health conditions feel welcomed by the nurses, who are very friendly and approachable in all situations. I personally always feel safe in school, with security guards and security cameras I never feel vulnerable. In addition to this, the school is strict about people leaving the school and coming inside of the school.", "There is an abundance of extracurricular activities, such as Red and Blue, clubs, and sports. A high majority of students take place in at least two of these activities, whether it's playing an after school sport, or participating in Theatre. The school is well rounded making it easy for students to feel welcomed in finding what they enjoy doing the most. The teachers are very organized and participate a great amount of their time in coaching sports, and being well involved in after school activities which the students appreciate greatly.", 'What makes South Side unique is the great amount of electives to be involved in. Electives such as photography, art classes, sculpture and ceramics, ect; give students a wide variety of opportunities to discover what the student is most interested in.', 'A majority of the teachers are understanding and well engaged.', "The school offers a lot in terms of sports and clubs and there is good support for all activities.  Kids are encouraged to start clubs, so there are lots of options and if a student's interest isn't met, they can start their own club.  Parents are very supportive of most of their kid's activities, and tend to be very involved, i.t.o. fundraising, providing food/snacks and showing up at events.", 'For the most part, the teachers my children have had have been very good.  \r There have been a few who may not be particularly happy teaching, or may just not enjoy teenagers, and that has come across.\r There seemed to be a time when it was difficult to find good language teachers, and as a result my older son was quite turned off to the foreign language he was studying, however, to be fair, the school did dismiss two language teachers during his years at the school, so the administration did recognize the issue and responded appropriately. \r There are many teachers at SSHS who clearly love teaching, and who go above and beyond for the students, taking their own time to accompany them on local and international trips, who have a warm rapport with the students, and who really nurture learning.', 'The school is as safe as a school can be these days.\r There is a sense that the school cares for the safety of the students, faculty and staff.', "I think that SSHS is a great school, and I'm happy that my children had the opportunity to attend.\r I think the IB program challenges the students well.\r Having said that, in an effort to get as many students as possible to take the most rigorous coursework possible, sometimes students are pushed into courses they can't handle, which causes undue stress for both the students and the parents.\r On the other hand SSHS is one of the few schools that still honors the trades - they have wonderful wood shop facilities and a beloved instructor who made my oldest son fall in love with woodworking.", 'it has a lot of extracurricular activities', 'it was a pleasure going to South Side the environment is great, you really get to learn the material your being taught.', 'Its a great school. Most teachers are very kind and always trying to help you as a student.']

column2: ["The school has a mental health crisis and covers it up and provides minimal help for students who are suffering. The competitive nature creatures an unsafe environment and students do not feel comfortable enough to share ideas. The school recently hired people that wear vests, use walkies and patrol the hallways. It makes the campus feel like a prison since most students are not allowed out of the building at any point during the day. These patrolling people also sit outside of bathrooms, making it uncomfortable and intrusive for students. Teachers either don't care at all or take personal pleasure from students suffering academically. I have never been somewhere so unwelcoming and isolating. I can't wait to never come back to this place. If you have a child who is already feeling anxious and isolated, DO NOT bring them here.", "I don't love school, but it was an overall good school.  I wish it was more diverse like some of the neighboring districts.  Parents were sometime overly involved.  The grounds are nicely kept and some of the fields were kept nice.  Baseball didn't seem to get as much attention as other sports. I guess I was fortunate to have a school like Somers High School. Time to move on and see the real world!", 'I had a great 4 years there. All the teachers helped me grow in many aspects of my life and I joined clubs that allowed me to get to know people and make friends to last for years to come. The only thing I would change would be how the school handles certain problems like drugs.', "OVERALL: RATING: GOOD (3.5 Stars)- education is really good if you apply yourself, take harder classes, and actually care- most teachers are pretty good, a couple are concerning- social atmosphere can be a little too white and wealthy at times but for the most part pretty good- resources are there you just need to reach out and use them- Administration cares about student but does a trash job at showing it- Administration is a mess, their egos get in the way of progress and there is way too much drama especially in the counseling department - Helicopter parents exist in droves and NY is competitive this school isn't an exception - funding doesn't usually go where it is neededRATING: GOOD (3.5 Stars)If you find your people, and take advantage of all Somers has to offer, it is really good, just know that vaping, drug use, administration, and privilege tend to be the worst problems.", 'As a freshman, I found it easy to get into the swing of things at school. The teachers I had this year were phenomenal and I enjoyed every class. The teachers were also dedicated and I could see that they loved teaching students. They try their best to help their students when they need help and go on long discussions in class with topics related to ones that we learn, such as experiments that were made or current events in the news, which I think was very important as I became more aware of what was going on and I now check the news more often on my phone. The students at school are okay, most of my classmates are nice and love to crack jokes once in a while in class, which makes it interesting and fun.  There are also many clubs and events that unite the school, the most popular one being during homecoming and spirit week. I look forward to the next few years!', "My experience at Somers High School was great. I transferred in my senior year and I haven't felt more at home at any other school. This school is great in academics, athletics, and making students feel connected. This has been one of my favorite years of high school.", "I liked my school because the teachers really gave it their all with kids who were interested in learning. You could tell that many teachers there were passionate  about who they were teaching, and gave help to those who didn't have as much success in their class than others. While the academics are good however, some of the college readiness could use improvement. While there is a seminar and timeline given out to what students have to do for college, but the guidance given in regards to scholarships is fairly minimal.", 'My experience with Somers High School has been amazing as I have been offered major opportunities such as the IB Diploma Program which has been proven to increase my college readiness. However, I would say that teacher aid with the program should increase with coming years as the program becomes more prominent in the school. I would also say that there should be more events that promote diversity of students.', 'High School needs a change of leadership or in the least a shakeup. Principal is not visible and does not get to know the whole child!  Administration lacks accountability to the taxpayers and parents.', 'One thing I would like to see change at Somers Senior High School is the diversity level. Somers Senior High School is only 10% minority students, which is very low.', 'I have had a very good four years at Somers Senior High School.  The school has prepared me for the next chapter of my life, college.  For the most part, the teachers were engaging and approachable.  The classroom sizes were anywhere’s from twenty-five to thirty students.  We always had homework and I would spent a good two to three hours a night on it.  The school spirit is high and a good majority of the students would attend the varsity sporting events.', 'Somers High School does a very good job of combining academic rigor with excellent athletics. The school has many Honors, AP and IB courses. There is an abundance of clubs and volunteer opportunities. The arts are all well-represented, with choir, band, jazz band, orchestra, dance and theater having lots of active participants. The athletics are great. Our boys soccer team just went to the state final again (won a couple of years back), and a couple of years ago we won the state football championship. Girls soccer also won the state championship. I love the principal, Mark Bayer, and the support administrators. The teachers are largely excellent. The guidance counselors are mostly all very helpful. The college and career center is very helpful too. Both of children have had an exceptional experience at Somers High school.', 'The teachers at Somers are very passionate about what they do and are more than willing to help their students. My time at Somers High School prepared me extremely well for college life. Additionally, it is a great school community with lots of school spirit. The one thing that I would improve is the funding and support for the music programs.', 'Somers Senior High School is equipped with faculty and staff that do nothing but supply students with exceptional knowledge and positive energy! The school is very spirited and is a safe place to be in. I would not have wanted to spend my high school career at any other school!!', 'This is a great high school, with great teachers.  There are lots of clubs, sports and activities to participate in.  One of my favorite things in the mentor program through the football teams.  A senior player gets to mentor an incoming freshman football player, and help them get acquainted with the program, etc.', 'Somers High School has a good focus on academics and has passionate, skilled teachers in all subjects. All students are supported by the faculty, and there are dozens of clubs and sports in which students can be involved with.', "There are many awesome teachers. Most of the teachers I had seemed to try to make the class comfortable for all students, and when we ask the questions, they explained us really neatly so that we can completely understand. Personally, I did not have any tutor teacher, but I totally satisfy about my grade and understanding on curriculum I learned thank to teachers' supports.", 'Somers Central School District is an accepting place with a top notch staff. Somers provides seemingly endless opportunities to succeed after high school. The faculty and staff are for the most part considerate and truly care about their students success.', "I love Somers High School because there's so much school spirit! Everyone surrounding you is well-rounded in academics, extra curricular activities, and sports that it makes you feel proud and want to do just as well or maybe even better.", "Somers High School was a great place to spend my high school years. No other high school has spirit like this one, or teachers and faculty that care about the students more than they do here. I've been involved in different clubs and sports my past 3 and a half years, and have experienced nothing but great things."]
column4: ["The school has a mental health crisis and covers it up and provides minimal help for students who are suffering. The competitive nature creatures an unsafe environment and students do not feel comfortable enough to share ideas. The school recently hired people that wear vests, use walkies and patrol the hallways. It makes the campus feel like a prison since most students are not allowed out of the building at any point during the day. These patrolling people also sit outside of bathrooms, making it uncomfortable and intrusive for students. Teachers either don't care at all or take personal pleasure from students suffering academically. I have never been somewhere so unwelcoming and isolating. I can't wait to never come back to this place. If you have a child who is already feeling anxious and isolated, DO NOT bring them here.", "I don't love school, but it was an overall good school.  I wish it was more diverse like some of the neighboring districts.  Parents were sometime overly involved.  The grounds are nicely kept and some of the fields were kept nice.  Baseball didn't seem to get as much attention as other sports. I guess I was fortunate to have a school like Somers High School. Time to move on and see the real world!", 'I had a great 4 years there. All the teachers helped me grow in many aspects of my life and I joined clubs that allowed me to get to know people and make friends to last for years to come. The only thing I would change would be how the school handles certain problems like drugs.', "OVERALL: RATING: GOOD (3.5 Stars)- education is really good if you apply yourself, take harder classes, and actually care- most teachers are pretty good, a couple are concerning- social atmosphere can be a little too white and wealthy at times but for the most part pretty good- resources are there you just need to reach out and use them- Administration cares about student but does a trash job at showing it- Administration is a mess, their egos get in the way of progress and there is way too much drama especially in the counseling department - Helicopter parents exist in droves and NY is competitive this school isn't an exception - funding doesn't usually go where it is neededRATING: GOOD (3.5 Stars)If you find your people, and take advantage of all Somers has to offer, it is really good, just know that vaping, drug use, administration, and privilege tend to be the worst problems.", 'As a freshman, I found it easy to get into the swing of things at school. The teachers I had this year were phenomenal and I enjoyed every class. The teachers were also dedicated and I could see that they loved teaching students. They try their best to help their students when they need help and go on long discussions in class with topics related to ones that we learn, such as experiments that were made or current events in the news, which I think was very important as I became more aware of what was going on and I now check the news more often on my phone. The students at school are okay, most of my classmates are nice and love to crack jokes once in a while in class, which makes it interesting and fun.  There are also many clubs and events that unite the school, the most popular one being during homecoming and spirit week. I look forward to the next few years!', "My experience at Somers High School was great. I transferred in my senior year and I haven't felt more at home at any other school. This school is great in academics, athletics, and making students feel connected. This has been one of my favorite years of high school.", "I liked my school because the teachers really gave it their all with kids who were interested in learning. You could tell that many teachers there were passionate  about who they were teaching, and gave help to those who didn't have as much success in their class than others. While the academics are good however, some of the college readiness could use improvement. While there is a seminar and timeline given out to what students have to do for college, but the guidance given in regards to scholarships is fairly minimal.", 'My experience with Somers High School has been amazing as I have been offered major opportunities such as the IB Diploma Program which has been proven to increase my college readiness. However, I would say that teacher aid with the program should increase with coming years as the program becomes more prominent in the school. I would also say that there should be more events that promote diversity of students.', 'High School needs a change of leadership or in the least a shakeup. Principal is not visible and does not get to know the whole child!  Administration lacks accountability to the taxpayers and parents.', 'One thing I would like to see change at Somers Senior High School is the diversity level. Somers Senior High School is only 10% minority students, which is very low.', 'I have had a very good four years at Somers Senior High School.  The school has prepared me for the next chapter of my life, college.  For the most part, the teachers were engaging and approachable.  The classroom sizes were anywhere’s from twenty-five to thirty students.  We always had homework and I would spent a good two to three hours a night on it.  The school spirit is high and a good majority of the students would attend the varsity sporting events.', 'Somers High School does a very good job of combining academic rigor with excellent athletics. The school has many Honors, AP and IB courses. There is an abundance of clubs and volunteer opportunities. The arts are all well-represented, with choir, band, jazz band, orchestra, dance and theater having lots of active participants. The athletics are great. Our boys soccer team just went to the state final again (won a couple of years back), and a couple of years ago we won the state football championship. Girls soccer also won the state championship. I love the principal, Mark Bayer, and the support administrators. The teachers are largely excellent. The guidance counselors are mostly all very helpful. The college and career center is very helpful too. Both of children have had an exceptional experience at Somers High school.', 'The teachers at Somers are very passionate about what they do and are more than willing to help their students. My time at Somers High School prepared me extremely well for college life. Additionally, it is a great school community with lots of school spirit. The one thing that I would improve is the funding and support for the music programs.', 'Somers Senior High School is equipped with faculty and staff that do nothing but supply students with exceptional knowledge and positive energy! The school is very spirited and is a safe place to be in. I would not have wanted to spend my high school career at any other school!!', 'This is a great high school, with great teachers.  There are lots of clubs, sports and activities to participate in.  One of my favorite things in the mentor program through the football teams.  A senior player gets to mentor an incoming freshman football player, and help them get acquainted with the program, etc.', 'Somers High School has a good focus on academics and has passionate, skilled teachers in all subjects. All students are supported by the faculty, and there are dozens of clubs and sports in which students can be involved with.', "There are many awesome teachers. Most of the teachers I had seemed to try to make the class comfortable for all students, and when we ask the questions, they explained us really neatly so that we can completely understand. Personally, I did not have any tutor teacher, but I totally satisfy about my grade and understanding on curriculum I learned thank to teachers' supports.", 'Somers Central School District is an accepting place with a top notch staff. Somers provides seemingly endless opportunities to succeed after high school. The faculty and staff are for the most part considerate and truly care about their students success.', "I love Somers High School because there's so much school spirit! Everyone surrounding you is well-rounded in academics, extra curricular activities, and sports that it makes you feel proud and want to do just as well or maybe even better.", "Somers High School was a great place to spend my high school years. No other high school has spirit like this one, or teachers and faculty that care about the students more than they do here. I've been involved in different clubs and sports my past 3 and a half years, and have experienced nothing but great things."]
column6: ["Somers highschool is a very community-based school that values individuality and integrated learning. I love the support system our school has as well as the inclusive staff. Our many schooI sanctioned events gets the community involved. I don't like how our school has a lot of rules such as who can leave campus and parking pass privileges but overall, I've had a very good experience at  somers high school. ", 'There were a pretty decent amount of after school clubs and activities to participate in. They were not all very popular or well managed though.', "A lot of emphasis was placed on our school's athletic teams and not much else. I was not in favor of this as I did not play sports and I always felt like I was on the outside a bit.", 'The school had a wide variety of teachers. Some of my teachers were absolutely amazing and put a lot of effort into their work and truly wanted to see their students succeed as well as tried to relate to their students and make class as enjoyable as possible while still very educational. Other teachers did the bare minimum and showed favoritism to some students while neglecting other students.', 'My choir teacher is equally as much of a mother to me as my own mother is. My AP Biology teacher is one of my biggest motivators.', "I'm not a big fan of watching sporting events no matter where I am but at Somers High School I'm not left out.  They have excellent drama productions that draw big audiences every year that come support the hard working students.  I make sure I'm there every time because it is the least I can do after what this School has given me to help me grow and learn as a student and as a person.  As I said the teachers are wonderful and they show support in every way they can.  I belong to a Social Action Club at the High School and they are always willing to help me with fundraising for different causes.  The administration not only cares about how you develop as a student but as a well rounded person by the time you leave Somers High School.", "All the teachers at Somers High School are superb.  They always make time for their students and are always there when the students need a tremendous amount of help.  They implement exemplary examples into the classroom relating it perfectly to what we are learning about. I couldn't've asked for a better panel of teachers who not only are your teachers but role models in life.   Everyone should come to Somers High School to get their education.", 'Great community and schools are very very good.', 'My overall experience at Somers High School have been great. I love the football games, it always makes everyone come together. But, you can strongly tell where most administrators proiprites are at... SPORTS. Some students are favored or taken out of class to talk about football, and football and male sports have been seen as a superior sport compared to many female sports. The funds are mostly spent on football. I loved my experience here but most students and athletes find this unfair and even parents have noticed. If I could do this all over again I would chose Somers all over again every. I am so sad to leave ! I made the best of friends and most people are friendly and tend not to leave anyone out or feel unwanted.', 'Most teachers make plenty of time for extra help, especially the math teachers and science. We also have a writing workshop now which I attend bey often to ensure that my essays I am handing in are perfect. Overall most teachers are always there but there are other teachers that are rarely available and are not always the happiest. Also, some teachers I feel are overqualified making it harder to understand the lessons because of the highly intelligent example. I am pleased with my education at Somers High School and am very fond or many of the teachers I have had.', 'It\'s a great school with really great teachers and administrators.  Your rating with respect to "diversity" is nonsense.', "Somers has one of the best English programs out there, but its Foreign Language department is seriously lacking.  Also, the counselors aren't very helpful except for the head of the department, Dr. Hardy, who is the best.  Overall I have felt challenged, but I have heard that the program works best for the best and the worst students, the middle of the pack tends to be left out, having a less stellar experience.", 'The school is nice, however it is not very diverse. The majority of people are rich and white. The school building is too big for a high school and is very confusing. The football jocks rule the school and can get away with everything because everyone worships them.', 'Fantastic teachers for the most part. Math and science courses are rigorous and challenging, with mostly great teachers. English department also mostly very good. If you push yourself into honors and AP classes, you will be surrounded by hard-working people. School is de facto all white. Administration recently wasted tons of money on tablets that no one uses.', "The Honors and AP classes at this school are full of dedicated students who want to learn, but the flip side is that the non-Honors/AP classes I'm in have students that prefer to mess around, making it hard for the other students to learn", 'The education is really great. The adults really care for the students, not just the guidance counselors.', "Technology is fine, but outdated. Guidance counselors are the worst and have obvious favorites. The rest of those things aren't apparent", 'Some teachers are great, but some are downright awful.', 'The food in the cafeteria is decent. I know of schools that have better food, but it is pretty good.', 'The policy of staying on campus until the school day is over is very prominent. If you break this policy, chances are you will get detention.']

column2: ['The staff at West Morris is very nice. Some stay after school to help students who need it. The students there are also very nice and everybody gets along. You feel comfortable in class with your classmates. They are academic-oriented, so they focus on helping everybody succeed.', 'West Morris Central has amazing academics and teachers to get students ready for college. Multiple rigorous programs are available. The sports are great and have been having many successful years. WMC offers the IB program as well as AP classes.', 'I love my school, and I feel grateful everyday that my parents worked hard so I could have the opportunity to go here. I always feel challenged, and the people at this school, both students and faculty, genuinely care. They care about the school and what they do, and they care about everyone in the school. Everyone wants the best for me here, and I always feel encouraged. I feel prepared for college and will certainly miss the many crazy, fun, and joyful memories I have made here. It has taught me to work hard, and stay positive, something that I will always take with me in the future.', '-great arts, music programs-heavily invested in sports-some teachers are very passionate and love teaching, other not so much', 'WMC has exceptional teachers who go above and beyond to make sure their students succeed inside and outside of the classroom.', 'West Morris Central High School is a wonderful high school located in Long Valley, New Jersey. I spent four years and received my high school diploma from this institution. The staff, guidance, and education provided prepared me for my undergraduate degree. The teachers are highly educated and provided me with a base of knowledge prior to starting college. Prior to college I received education in anatomy and physiology, as well as chemistry, and biology which were core classes in my nursing degree. Without this base of knowledge, I would have struggled in my college courses. As well as the education, the advisors were also excellent at West Morris Central High School.  The staff helped prepare me for college entrance exams. They arranged for me to take prep classes at my high school and find test sites near my home town. I was prepared for my undergraduate degree thanks to the help of West Morris Central High School.', 'The school is known for being really good academically, and as long as you do what’s asked of you then you should do well . The school can feel a bit small and crowded sometimes but there’s usually somewhere to escape to and class sizes are good. There’s a clique for everyone so finding friends isn’t a problem, and there’s lots of clubs and sports teams to join. Like all high schools there’s good and bad when it comes to teachers and classmates, just avoid drama and you’ll be okay.', 'West Morris Central has given me a great education over the last 3 years.  As I approach senior year, I feel very prepared for college academically-but also ready for the college application process.  With after school college workshops and attentive guidance counselors, I feel ready to to succeed in college.  As for the school itself, it has its pros and cons.  There are many teachers who are absolute gems and others who are not.  Like any high school, it is hard to navigate a social and academic life but it is possible to do both at West Morris.  This school has taught me life skills by exposing me to different people and has also taught me good habits to continue in college.  I have been very lucky to attend this school.', "The academics at  West Morris Central are above average for a public high school, but its lack of diversity among students and faculty somewhat limit our views and education. Additionally, most of the administrative staff have bad attitudes, are rude to students, and create insufferable rules or codes that do not in any way aid in students' learning.", 'I’m very grateful for the rigorous academics offered at this school; I feel very prepared for college. Facilities could use some work, as it is not unusual for the power or Internet access to go out. The math department is also weak compared to the rest of the school’s academics, and many students are left struggling and/or complaining about their math class. The new administration, based on my experience, is better than the previous one, as they really care about student activities, spirit, and arts programs now.', 'academically challenging & fun. needs VEX Robotics club funding & support to enter competitions. could use more & diverse Engineering courses & equipment. Drama & Choir teachers created outstanding programs.', 'The school is very involved with athletics. The academics are also very good however there is a specific path in which they want students to take. They push the ib program on kids and it makes deviating from this difficult.', "I had an awful experience at this institution. The administration made an effort to go against the rules of IEP and 504. I had an injury followed by severe illness which required mild accommodations according to my doctors. The school essentially ignored my doctors' notes and failed to provide me with the legally justified accommodations. Additionally, the educators are well below average and focus solely on grades and volume of work as opposed to actually education the students. The majority of students see tutors or receive extra help just because the teachers fail to properly explain topics. The focus on numbers and statistics is clearly the priority at this institution.", 'West Morris Central has a very rigorous academic program. Students leave high school well prepared for college courses.', "Graduates have gone on to be extremely prepared for college. The school is really what you make of it...academics are great and a LOT of students are in an IB program or take multiple IB/AP classes. I've had some inspiring teachers as well as some not-so-great teachers, but the majority of the faculty is great in my opinion. I've had a lot of opportunities to challenge myself, especially in the arts: we have a professional, state-renowned theatre program; the director really pushes the envelope and opens our eyes to society. Our sports are pretty great as well: we have some state-renowned and even nationally-renowned athletes. The facilities at the school are just a little above average, and could use some love, but the students are generally pretty high-achieving.", 'Your experience is heavily dependent on the classes the student takes. In my experience, the lower level classes actually end up doing more work than the higher level classes. However that does not necessarily mean that lower level classes are harder than higher level classes. The higher level classes force you to think more, and force you to be able to learn on your own. Throughout the whole school, there is a very welcoming vibe. Everyone is very friendly. As a school, we are very enthusiastic about sports. WMC’s fan section is very well known through morris county. So overall I’d say this is a very good school.', 'Good school, nice selection of courses offered.  Would like to see more hands on science opportunities.', "The school is a great school itself. It's just the students are terrible. Everyone's so fake and competitive and the administrators and teachers (with a few exceptions) turn a total blind eye. The environment they've cultivated is toxic and debilitating to anyone's mental health. For the love of God, please, WMC, get your act together or you're gonna end up with a crisis. You could be great.", "As a student, my bias does not dissuade me from pointing out my views on how great the school is. Overall, the teachers are great. The English department is probably the best in the school, as each teacher I have had has been amazing. One negative comment I can make is that the math department can use some help. There are one or two fantastic teachers, but in general, the math department is the weakest. Also, the overall school spirit is incredible, and I found that extremely important. Students are willing to travel to support and cheer on their sports teams, primarily football and girls soccer. Aside from sports, WMC offers a load of interesting clubs ranging from ones in which you celebrate various cultures (ICA) to learning about and experiencing business (FBLA).The only one star I gave my high school is in diversity. This is surely something we lack. The majority of our school is caucasian, and while this isn't a negative thing, it is still something that should be known.", "What I love most about WMC is the staff. They are all just the most welcoming and personable people I have ever met. Each teacher just wants the best for their students. I have found that it is easy for students to create relationships with teachers, and these relationships are strictly professional but they become someone the students aren't afraid to talk to. Another great aspect of WMC is the curriculum. Though we all complain from time to time because the workload is hard and the content itself is difficult, we all appreciate what it has done for us. Our school is one of the only full IB Schools in New Jersey, and I am so grateful for that. I've learned so much from the program because it makes me think harder and in many different ways. The IB programs that WMC offers have made me more confident in my future in college. I really believe that our staff and the IB programs have truly prepared me for not only college but also life."]
