So overall I’d say this is a very good school.', 'Good school, nice selection of courses offered.  Would like to see more hands on science opportunities.', "The school is a great school itself. It's just the students are terrible. Everyone's so fake and competitive and the administrators and teachers (with a few exceptions) turn a total blind eye. The environment they've cultivated is toxic and debilitating to anyone's mental health. For the love of God, please, WMC, get your act together or you're gonna end up with a crisis. You could be great.", "As a student, my bias does not dissuade me from pointing out my views on how great the school is. Overall, the teachers are great. The English department is probably the best in the school, as each teacher I have had has been amazing. One negative comment I can make is that the math department can use some help. There are one or two fantastic teachers, but in general, the math department is the weakest. Also, the overall school spirit is incredible, and I found that extremely important. Students are willing to travel to support and cheer on their sports teams, primarily football and girls soccer. Aside from sports, WMC offers a load of interesting clubs ranging from ones in which you celebrate various cultures (ICA) to learning about and experiencing business (FBLA).The only one star I gave my high school is in diversity. This is surely something we lack. The majority of our school is caucasian, and while this isn't a negative thing, it is still something that should be known.", "What I love most about WMC is the staff. They are all just the most welcoming and personable people I have ever met. Each teacher just wants the best for their students. I have found that it is easy for students to create relationships with teachers, and these relationships are strictly professional but they become someone the students aren't afraid to talk to. Another great aspect of WMC is the curriculum. Though we all complain from time to time because the workload is hard and the content itself is difficult, we all appreciate what it has done for us. Our school is one of the only full IB Schools in New Jersey, and I am so grateful for that. I've learned so much from the program because it makes me think harder and in many different ways. The IB programs that WMC offers have made me more confident in my future in college. I really believe that our staff and the IB programs have truly prepared me for not only college but also life."]
column6: ['I think the education is definitely challenging and there are a lot of clubs offered at West Morris Central so that we as kids never get bored.', 'What I loved about my school was the quality of the education that it offered one. However, what I disliked was the lack of diversity.', 'West Morris Central has strong academics that definitely prepared me for college. Sports teams were a great way to become close with your peers. Administration, teachers, coaches could be better.', 'West Morris Central offers high-level courses with top-notch teachers... if you are in the correct field. Most English and History teachers are very proficient in their field, however, the math department at WMC is falling apart at the seams. Students are herded into IB programs like cattle and are only told the benfits of the program, and are not showed any alternate route than to join the IB bandwagon that is high school education. Overall, given that it is a highly rated school, I will say I did get a proper education and going to this school helped me in my college admissions process. However, there are still many issues to fix here at WMC.', 'I really enjoyed my time at West Morris Central Regional High School. It is a challenging but rewarding school to attend and it really pushes you to be your best in anything you do. The teachers here are very knowledgeable in their respective fields of teaching and study, the thing that makes them so great though is their ability to transfer their own knowledge to the students. Classes here are very hands on and interactive especially in the science and history fields. The science classes hold labs once or twice a week to demonstrate the understanding of the material gone over during class. Also, the history classes are hands on and interactive where the teacher often opens up class to discussion and let the students take over. I also participated in football and lacrosse, the coaches and players were great and I had an amazing time playing.', "Athletics are sometimes praised more than academics, however the academics are very good for a public high school. School spirit is very high, as there is a high attendance at our sporting events. Clubs and other activities are limited but are available if you look for them. As for preparing for college, I think the school does the best they can do. It's really up to the student to prepare him or herself.", 'I love the academic prestige of the school and how it really helps to prepare you for college. However, the lack of diversity and the lack of cultural awareness really made the four years here very frustrating.', "My experience at West Morris Central has been quite interesting. The dedication to teaching within the school ranges between little to none or teachers who will put in extra time and effort to help their students succeed. There are departments in the school that are frustrating; such as the math department. Many of the math teachers don't do their job well and have no motivation to get any students to like math. On the other hand, our schools English and foreign language departments are fantastic; they put in extra time to help out with anything that you may need and provide us with knowledge of the languages that they teach (Spanish, French and Chinese). The school offers many different electives for students who are looking for any type of degree in college. Our school's music and theater department has significantly grown and increased in level of talent/dedication over the past few years, two of whom are relatively new to the school's staff.", "I loved the friends that I made at WMC. It is a welcoming and encouraging school with wonderful teachers that actually want to be there and help teach the next generation, not just earn a paycheck. The diversity is lacking but that is not the school's fault. Plenty of activities for every type of student to join and flourish in, and if the club doesn't exist you can find a teacher with a similar passion and start it with them! Academics are rigorous but not impossible.", "Wasn't too bad because I didn't let anyone indoctrinate me into the IB program. The school tries to get everyone to do it, even if they aren't right for it.", "Good school, but atmosphere and teaching standards could improve. Overall it's been a good experience thanks to the freedom given to us aswell as the environment we are taught in", "My high school experience was that of a typical student who was not popular. There was discrimination dished out by both teachers and students. My sports career was destroyed when I lost the position I earned on the team to someone who didn't deserve it. The academics were strong, mostly because of my work ethic.", 'My experience has been great so far. There is something about the atmosphere there that makes you feel good to be there. The best thing is our support of extracurricular activities, sports, theater, music. Most of the student body shows up to most events-home or away. I do, however, would like to change some small things such as Wifi and the facilities. Overall, it is a great place to learn and grow.', "I don't believe that every teacher is good, provides a great education or is nice. Many times there are really good and really bad teachers for one class that may decide whether you drop down or go up a class level just to avoid. However, there is enough to learn that I feel prepared somewhat prepared for college, even if that is false belief. I would like to learn more about what college life itself is like, since I've actually never heard a peep from all the college graduate teachers.", "It was pretty good. Good teachers, good faculties. Administration is a bit tyrannical but I suppose that's typical of most high schools.", 'West Morris Central provide top notch academics and is really focused on creating well rounded individuals. I felt extremely prepared for college after graduating.', 'I am a tech girl and all my teachers have been very encouraging and supportive. I have had lots of opportunity to get involved.  We have the usual high school issues and have been allowed the flexibility and resources to get help, socially and academically.', 'West Morris Central High School gives you the tools needed to succeed in your future studies as long as you apply yourself and take advantage of the classes and resources available. There are many engaging extracurricular activities to get involved in that appeal to all types of people. Overall it is a great place to find out more about who you are and transform into the young adult you will be when you graduate.', 'Overall, I felt that I was very lucky to have gone to WMC because of the teachers that were there. The teachers were approachable and willing to help you with whatever it may have been. Every teacher also tried to incorporate multiply ways of teaching/explaining to the class for they know that not everyone learns in the same way.', 'The school offers different levels of classes so you are always challenged.  The teachers make themselves available to support students who need extra help or want to further challenge themselves.  Great learning environment.']
column8: ['there are a ton of different clubs to choose from so there are a lot of options. there are tons of sports teams, lots of things to get involved with in the arts, and there are good science and technology opportunities. overall there is a good balance and blend of extracurricular activities', 'there are a variety of different clubs and organizations to be apart of which give more opportunities to get involved. most of the teachers i have had have been very good at teaching and also very enjoyable people.the teachers and students in the building are easy to have a good relationship with', 'the teachers work to make sure that they cover all required material but also work to make connections to the real world so the material becomes more meaningful. all teachers are willing to make time to help those students that are struggling', 'There is a large variety of clubs available for students and every student is encouraged and welcome to join.', 'The school is very fun and atypical. Because of its size most all people know each other and support each other in events and clubs.', "Pretty much all teachers are very good, they knelt what they're taking about but more importantly they know how to convey their knowledge and are more than willing to help.", 'The clubs that I know of meet during lunch time. I have nothing negative about any clubs', 'The majority of the teachers are great.  However, my child has had 4 years of Spanish and only one good Spanish teacher.  The other three were terrible.', 'A safe school, safe environment.  Bulling is not tolerated.  Any drug problems are quickly handled.', 'The school is safe and drug problems re dealt with quietly.  Teachers care and students are comfortable to speak their opinions and ask questions', "All of the precautions taken in terms of health and safety are in the students and faculty's best interests and are top notch.", 'While there are many clubs available, they are not always run in the best manor and often times meetings are delayed or simply do not take place because the teacher or most students do not fully commit to the club.', 'If I could do it all over again I would attend WMC in a heart beat. This school has provided me not only with a high class education and social skills that will serve me a lifetime, but also I grew stronger social bonds and the activities offered at the school helped me to realizes some of my passions: theatre, community service, cooking and psychology. This is all due to the amazing staff and atmosphere created in the school.', 'The teachers know what their teaching and how to teach it, with the tools available to them. If a student does not understand the teachers way of teaching a lesson, then the teachers at our school can change up the lesson to accommodate student needs. Help is always available and outside learning is always encouraged.', 'Professors are great almost most of the time! The styles differ from one another but this is expected. With what I have experienced, they are very engaging.', 'This school is very safe.', "They have a huge variety of school activities, from chess club all the way to bowling club. The only activity I did was softball my sophomore year. I enjoyed playing the sport it was just my teammates that I did not enjoy as much. My school is very competitive that's why there are JV and V teams.", "I have never interacted with any of my classmates parents so I would not know how they felt about their child's education but I am pretty sure that they take it into consideration.", "The teachers at West Morris are very smart. Many of the teachers don't focus on making the class enjoyable. For an example many of my classes that I am taking don't include student engaging activities.", 'I never felt unsafe at the school, there were always very may alerts if anything happened to go wrong']

column2: ['Maspeth High School has been like a second home for many students. I remember being completely terrified to enter a new school, but the environment felt safe. The teachers really care about their students and try to make sure that he or she understands the class. There is also a no bullying tolerance and the deans and teachers will make sure that everyone feels secure. This school has given me the best high school experience.', 'The teachers are all very nice and good at their job. I know every one of them is willing to help me do my best', "I love Maspeth High School. The school is clean. The teachers teach well and they spend extra time with us if we need more help. The clubs are lots of fun. I love my school's library the most. I get along with the librarian. He's very knowledgeable. If I didn't understand my english homework or a reading, he would help me. I'm very grateful to him helping me for 4 years. I also met my boyfriend at Maspeth High School. He's very nice to me and I love him.", 'Overall, it’s a very good school. You have to socialize and engage in school activities to actually feel the high school experience though. Teachers and staff care about you and look out for you for the most part but some deans have favorites and are easy on students that they like. Also, dress code bothers a lot of students but in reality it isn’t that bad. Besides that Maspeth is a safe and great school to be in.', 'Majority of the teachers are really easy to talk to. They try really hard to get us ready for upcoming regents and AP exams. The environment is really safe and convenient (both buses and trains around). Lots of stores are accessible as well. If anything, there should be more AP courses offered: language, economics, computer science etc.', "It's a pretty good school and there are a ton of resources for college readiness as the advisors are very hands on and always willing to sit down and talk to help you. The teachers are generally really nice and passionate about their subject aside from a bad apple here and there. Lots of clubs and sports, about average food, and really good AP and honors courses. The worst thing is the dress code and the rules they have. It can be a little bit suffocating at times, especially as a senior seeing as they have a new policy of restricting  senior activities based off lateness and absences. Overall not bad as long as you find a good group of friends because the school gets very cliquey very fast so make friends early on.", 'Everyone single teacher and the whole administration have favorites and let them get away with everything. People they favorite could be out of dress code and they don’t care, but when I come in with a skirt that’s short like others I get dress coded. regarding prom, some of the seniors aren’t allowed to go because they exceeded their lateness limits, but then you see some people talking to Ms.P and is being allowed to go to prom. They call prom and leaving early is a privilege for seniors but you see juniors leaving the school at the same time with seniors and going to prom.', "Safeness of the environment that's provided by the school helps to open up and communicate to new people, make friends and enjoy learning. The teachers are creative with how they teach. They plan fun games to review a topic or teach.", 'Don’t go here go to a better school they accept students that are below average that have no ambition unless they accept better students this school is going downhill', 'Many AP opportunities for all students, teachers really care about their students, faculty is very helpful, many clubs and sports available for students, very clean/ good environment to learn in, feels like a big family.', 'I loved that the school genuinely gives all students an opportunity to better themselves and make their time worth it at the school.', "Maspeth High School truly is one of the best high schools in New York City. The core curriculum stresses a unique classical curriculum, especially in literature. Unlike other schools, freshman delve into and challenge themselves with Homer's The Iliad, Sophocles' Antigone, and Apollonius of Rhodes' Jason and the Argonauts. The teachers are incredible cooperative and care about their students. Moreover, there are several clubs and sports for students to be involved in.", 'I liked the wide variety of clubs and sports Maspeth had to offer. It was also evident that the faculty and staff genuinely cared for their students and wanted them to succeed which not a lot of schools have. Something that Maspeth could improve on is offering more language courses: French, Italian, Korean, etc. Maspeth could also improve in becoming a more diverse school with a more diverse population. This can better shape the students to grow in different environments and different social groups.', 'I really liked that the staff at Maspeth High School was always available and ready to help the students regardless of the situation that they were in. Teachers helped with assignments as well as other real life situations. More than staff they were a safe place away from home.', "Maspeth High School is a fairly new school, but it's worth going to. I will be a junior and I have loved my experience here. I'm in two Varsity sports and two clubs. This school definitely challenges you but it prepares you for the real world through Socratic seminars and debates to improve speaking skills. And the staff squishes any problems that occur which makes you feel safe. All in all, this is a very good school and I recommend this very much!", 'Maspeth is open to everyone from all different types of backgrounds and social aspects. There is always someone there for you', 'I love how welcoming and friendly all the students and teachers are, everyone is so accepting of you no matter of your gender, race, or your sexuality. I feel like I can really be myself around my peers; the teachers are patient and genuienly love teaching. Overall, Maspeth has been an amazing experience so far.', "Maspeth High School is a great high school with teachers that love the subject they are teaching. The teachers perform well however the principal and administration office are not present most of the time and PTA meetings are not useful. Maspeth is also crowded due to the oversized freshman class of '22.", 'Very clean, well organized school that focuses on teaching students many values that may be implemented into their everyday lives as well as carried out into their futures.', 'Maspeth High School is a great school - It is new and the teachers are mostly young and extremely dedicated and enthusiastic about what they do. Whenever you need help they are always available. From the teachers to the guidance counselors you always feel like somebody has your back. Maspeth High School is in the middle of Queens NY but somehow they have made it feel like your in High School Musical! The sports and clubs are very supported and encouraged and all the students respect each other and work together.']

column6: ['The overally environment is very welcoming, encouraging, and challenging at the same time, but they could loosen a little on the dress code.', 'There maybe a dress code, but the environment for learning is amazing. The teachers really do care for your future in going to college, and the teachers and staff really encourage their students to go to college and lead a successful life. I really do love the school, wonderful experience that I will take for life.', "I am more than happy that I attended Maspeth High School. I remember not even wanting to apply because of the dress code and because it was a new school. Nevertheless, Maspeth quickly became a second home for me. I didn't care about the dress code at all. The teachers were incredible and very easy individuals to speak to and ask for help. There were so many clubs and sports for everyone so everyone can show their true colors. The building was absolutely beautiful as well. I did always think the dress code was a little dumb, but it didn't ruin my time at Maspeth. I believe that if you try to make something fun, it will be. Joining clubs and trying to make friends in Maspeth really made my High School experience incredible. I will never forget my time in Maspeth.", 'Maspeth High School has such great teachers that are always willing to help. They are very encouraging to all the students. This school allows you to do a lot of activities after school. There is a lot of options available for everyone and anyone.', "I graduated from Maspeth High School just this year and I'm so glad I went there. I really feel like this school helped get me ready for college and forced me to always work my hardest.", 'My experience at Maspeth Highschool has been an enjoyable journey. Not only through learning but also through the great community provided by the staff.', "The school is quite good. Relatively new with friendly teachers and lots to do. Various sport teams and clubs to join. Biggest downside is the principal, not very friendly or a peoples person, I've barely seen him say hi or greet someone in my time at maspeth highschool. Food is pretty bad, but thats the same for most public schools. Gym Is very nice but there seems to be an overemphasis on the basketball team and the other sport teams dont feel the same love or receive the same upgrades and equipment as the basketball team does. Overall a nice new school with a few administration problems", 'The teachers and staff are the best part of Maspeth. They care about every student and always do their best to help students and make them feel as comfortable as possible in school. There are plenty of course options and clubs/ school events to keep everyone active in the community of the school.', 'Loved my experience at Maspeth! Teachers are always available at your disposal. Really prepared me for college. Calm school. A lot of things to do there!', 'Maspeth High School is a school with a great learning environment, multiple sufficient  resources, helpful teachers. The school stresses practicing public speaking skills - Socratic seminars, debates, declamations- to help prepare students for future public speaking. The schools also offer a wide range of AP courses to provide you with college readiness. Teachers  provide office hours in designated dates. More importantly, they have the passion and patience to teach you and give feedback to you for improvement. The teacher and students in Maspeth High School maintain in a close bond which creates a friendly learning environment through office hour and clubs. Maspeth High School, fortunately, seldom has bully incidents. Students are  mostly well-behaved. On the other hand, the school requires a dress code which most students do not like. The school did not create sufficient amount of activities in maintaining school spirit. Overall, I highly recommend Maspeth High School.', "I am so lucky and proud to say I go to Maspeth High School. I strongly believe that it is the best school in it's area. Everything and anything possible is done to keep students involved, safe, happy, etc. The staff in particular is unlike any I've enountered, in all my years of schooling. The teachers really go out of their way to make themselves likeable but also respectable. They also will take as much time needed with you to make sure you really understand what you're being taught. I know I have at least 3 teachers that I feel safe confiding too if I have any issues. In addition, the atmosphere around the school is really welcoming and (for the most part) all students are very friendly. The school is very diverse and you can find life-long friends that have things in common with you, through the hundreds of clubs & sports. I will definitely remember my days at Maspeth for the rest of my life. Thank you for being my second home.", 'My experience at maspeth high school will be the most memorable moments in my life. The teachers are very involved with the students and their work. The teachers develop close relationships where the students can confide in them with their personal problems; they earn our trust and we earn theirs. In addition to having good relationships with the staff, they really focus on our education and making sure that every student thrives; they want us to succeed and make something big out of ourselves. This school has made me open my eyes to the real world and realize that being a grown up is not easy; the school really prepares us for the real world —college. ', 'I loved my experience at this school. It is in my opinion one of the best high schools out there. The teachers are always there for you when you need help. It really helps you get ready for college. It is a safe and friendly environment.', "My experience at maspeth high school, Was at times very challenging academically because i have an I.E.P. I wouldn't have this far if i didn't attend this wonderful  school( Maspeth high school ). Don't get me wrong there are something they lack for a better word.  For example : Respect amongst the staff , Healthier lunches and home ec. Club. I am happy to say i attend one of the best schools in the new york .  ", 'My overall experience at Maspeth High School was amazing. The environment of the school was always positive. Not only did this stimulate the want to learn, but it also gave me a great high school experience. Maspeth students and staff felt like a second family. ', "Maspeth is more than a school for me to go to; it's my second home. The school boasts a strong classical-based curriculum that truly prepares students for education beyond high school. Throughout my years in this school, I have taken a myriad of interesting courses, such as Philosophy, Classical Mythology, Latin, etc. The teachers here are young, but they are dedicated (for the most part) to make sure each and every one of their students perform well and have a passion in learning. Granted, the school has its setbacks. For example, funding goes into unneeded areas and lacks in needed areas. For example, the arts department could certainly use a new kiln and paint, but meanwhile there are flat-screen TV's being installed in the cafeteria in the lobby and an extremely expensive scoreboard being installed in the gymnasium. Scheduling is also a big issue, since many classes get in the way of others.  Despite these setbacks, Maspeth is definitely a great school.", "The extracurricular opportunities at Maspeth are great. They're are many different clubs and activities that kids are able to choose from including things like Key club, future doctors, student government, sports, ect. Being in student government myself I have come to realize that these extra activities have kept Maspeth students busy by helping the community in a positive way. The three years in student government have helped me realize that Masoeth and their staff encourage kids to commit to a club or sport and not only enjoy the time they spend there but to learn something new everyday. These activities have helped the students at Maspeth grow above and beyond what is expected of them.", 'During my three years at Maspeth high school I of course have struggled with keeping up with school work. The reason I think so highly of this school is due the teachers and staff that help guide me through difficult times. If I did not understand something or fully comprehend an idea discussed in class my teachers were always willing to take extra time to work and explain what I did not understand. The atmosphere at Maspeth High School is what makes the school unique and is why I would choose this school again.', 'At Maspeth High School most teachers exceed the standards they are expected to reach. Not only do they teach in a way that all students can understand but they put in effort to to make sure that all students are able to fully undertand the topic at hand. After school help is always offered and if kids are not able to make it after school they find time to help their students during the day. The staff at Maspeth high school is a very kind and knowledgable one.', 'I like that this school prepares you for college by giving the students challenging work.']
column8: ['they were too rigid there']

column2: ["Over the course of the last 4 years, Bethpage High School has become an integral part of my life and given me experiences I'll never forget. I have made some bonds with teachers as if they were my peers, the teaching is fantastic through all subjects and the teachers and staff genuinely care about their students.", 'Bethpage High School is a great place to make close friends and build relationships. Many teachers create personal relationships with the students other than a strict learning environment. The school is very united regardless of the different groups that hang out outside of school. I would change the cafeteria food and some of the school policies but other than that it has been a great place to learn', 'The high school is a good school  to go to however the teachers are average besides a handful. it is like every other high school around', 'My experience was good. There is hardly any diversity and the students are stuck up. But most of the teachers are great and the coursework is good.', 'Not as academically oriented as I would like. Teachers hold you back. I cannot wait to graduate and experience other cultures and other activities. Small town mentality. If you are not a "legacy kid" aka parents/grandparents grew up in town. You need to work hard to be accepted in sports etc.', 'It is a great high school experience, with a lot of community activities. Everyone loves going to the football and ice hockey games. I would like to see the bathrooms and classrooms improved a little bit, air conditioning would be nice.', 'Bethpage High School is a very good school. The teacher are very good and very nice. You will learn something during each class period because of how well they are at teaching their  lessons and helping kids who are confused during class and/or during extra help. Our sport teams a very good too. Watching these athletes display their abilities against other schools is very fascinating.', 'They prepared me well for certain aspects of college. We have Senior Seminar which helps students with the application process. That makes life a little less stressful. The teachers here really do care and look out for their students. They want to help and see you succeed. The teachers teach similarly to college professors which helps prepare you for college. We also have good academics, cubs and safety. At Bethpage High School, there is also something to do.', 'great school, not that diverse but the teachers and staff push you to be the best version of yourself', 'Bethpage is a great school with outstanding teachers and a fantastic student environment. Students from Bethpage are ready for college through the noteworthy education provided.', "100% caring environment. I went to school here and my children went here. I had a popular kid, a physically challenged kid and a kid who was the poster child for a bullied child. All of my kids were taken care of and pushed to meet the best they could be. There was positive reinforcement by teachers, coaches and guidance counselors. My 1 child was bullied from 6th thru 10th grade. The teachers were on top of the situation.  She came out happy and with friends in the end. Can't say enough about this district.", 'Good school, very well educated teachers. An abundance of extracurricular activities to get students and faculty involved. The school is very helpful in preparing students for the future.', 'Bethpage high school has the most dedicated teaching staffAll of my teachers go above and beyond to help all students reach their maximum potential', 'Throughout my four years at Bethpage Senior High School, I have gotten to know some of the most academic, intelligent, talented kids. They have pushed me to be a good student and friend, whether that is in sports or in school or in after school activities. The teachers stay whenever they are needed to make sure I get the best education and help possible for me and have helped me greatly with getting ready for college. The food could be better, but overall is pretty good. The community is okay, of course there are cliques, but were all a big family.', 'it was very small, everyone knew everyone so a lot of familiar faces were around. Teachers were very helpful and it was very easy to get involved because word spread quickly.', 'I have had 2 kids that have gone through the Bethpage schools.  Bethpage is a small district and the schools have a very good reputation.  They offer many clubs and sports programs.  It all depends on how involved the student wants to be.  They also offer a Senior Seminar which is very helpful in getting their college application completed.  I do feel that the school pushes AP and advanced classes a little too much when in reality, they could be hurting the student.  If I had to do it over again, I would encourage my son not to take so many AP classes since it could hurt his GPA.', 'My four years at Bethpage High School have been very memorable.  When I entered the school as an immature freshman, I didnt know what to expect.  As a senior getting ready for college and graduation. I can confidently say that Bethpage High School is a very diverse and positive school,  every single teacher will do whatever they can to ensure students success. The hallways are very clean and the school is taken care of significantly well. The guidance counselors are extremely helpful through the college process and they go out of their way to accommodate any needs a student has.', "Bethpage consists primarily of middle class caucasian people and there isn't really a variation when it comes to race. I wouldn't say everyone is blatantly racist but there are a handful of students that do joke and make racist remarks here and there. Acceptance towards sexual orientation is prevelant and there hasn't been any serious case of ostracizing students in that aspect.", 'The classes offered at this school are not limited to the common science, math, english, social studies classes. There are many different electives as well an opportunity to attend a vocational school if so desired.', 'The school nurse is very kind and they do an organized and efficient way of taking care and managing the students.']

column6: ["the reason for this rating is simple because of the parents who never left Bethpage and think they can do it all over again living vicariously through their children. it's just annoying and sad really. other than that it's whatever.", 'There are definitely those really great teachers that will go above and beyond for their student. Of course there are those who may be lacking a little. But I think the good ones definitely outweighs the bad in numbers.', 'Most teachers do well more than what they get paid to do. They stay much longer than they need to', 'It is often hard to attend meetings for some people due to work and prior commitments, which makes it difficult to get things done in an organized manner. Overall, we have many clubs and organizations to offer and as long as you are involved you will find one that you love to be a part of which I think is wonderful.', "I really like my school, but I don't think I would do this all over again. This school is just like every high school, great at some times and horrible at others. I don't know how anyone would want to relive high school, but if I had to I would probably choose a bigger school for a different experience and larger school spirit.", 'All of my teachers from this school district are amazing and always willing to lend a helping hand to their students. Whether a teacher is stricter, giving a student more stability, or they are easy going, giving a student a new friend, they always find a way to help.', 'I feel very safe at the school. I have never felt like I am not safe', 'From the varsity sports to clubs to trips related to your language major, bethpage high school has been a great experience and it will be sad leaving it behind', 'I have nothing but a positive experience and feel I have grown tremendously in my ability to learn and retain information and have felt supported the entire time', 'There are many different clubs and activities students have the opportunity to participate in. We have a variety of sports including lacrosse, baseball, soccer, tennis, golfing, bowling and many more. We also have many clubs including drama, art, tolerance, philosophy, and many more. I feel like we have a many options and many events for students to partake in.', 'The school provides an opportunity for students to enroll in a vocational program opening new doors for them. I have personally taken part and joined the culinary program and I am very glad I did.', "The teachers are overall very attentive and I've never had an issue while attending here.", 'Safety is their most important thing. The nurses are great!', 'Bethpage cares about the involvement of students. More often than not, teachers are from or live in our town, so they feel a connection and put in a lot for after school activities.', 'What made me somewhat enjoy my High school career was my amazing teachers. My freshman year, I was awkward and chubby. They all saw me for who I actually was. Sadly, that is not something that many people do. Because of some great teachers and coaches that turned into mentors, my life was changed for the better!', 'We have never had a security problem at this school that I know of.  Therefore, I feel safe going to school every day.  However, if there ever was a treat, I am not sure if our school is properly equipped to handle it.', 'The teachers are great. They all care about their students and will offer help to those who struggle.  They seem very passionate about the classes they teach.', 'Students can choose electives each year.  There are tons to choose from.  Even the core classes have different degrees of difficulty.', 'There are a wide variety of clubs to take part in.  They range anywhere from philosophy, ethics, marine science to S.A.D.D.  The teachers are very involved in the clubs.', 'The nurse is very helpful and the lunch is healthy. There are practice fire drills and lock downs for safety.']
column8: ['There are many clubs such as Art Club, Student Civic, Drama Club, Philosophy Club,and more.Most students enjoy philosophy or the language clubs.', "I like that my school has Challenge Day, Safe Halloween, the blood drive, and donations to the poor. I sold ten raffle tickets and the money went to Stony Brook's hospital, which made me feel good. I would like my children to attend this school.", 'There are policies in place', 'The teachers are always in positive moods and provide extra help. They teach very well and care about the students. I am thankful that I am graduating from an excellent high school.', 'There is something for everyone and many students partake', 'The teachers and administrators know every child by name and treat everyone with respect.  They come to our sporting events, concerts, drama productions and support everything we do.', 'I feel very fortunate and lucky to attend BHS, I am going to college to study Social Studies and would lie to come back and teach there someday.  It was an amazing place to grow and learn.', "This school has taught me a lot of things. It has shaped who I have become today, and I am glad I am part of this school district. That being sad, the faculty can be careless at times, and the cafeteria food tastes like I'm licking the floor, but the education the students receive is outstanding, and that is one of the things I love about the school.", 'This school is great because we are in a small town and everyone knows each other. Everyone gets involved and is always there to help others when it is needed. The teachers are amazing and want to help each and every one of their students.', 'Bethpage High School has a lot to offer students.  The teachers are great and there is a variety of classes to take. There is a sport and/or club for everyone and the school encourages you to take part in something.  The school is small, so even the principal will know who your name.', "Great class size that gives you the opportunity to become close to your teachers and to really get the attention and focus that you deserve. Many opportunities to take unique or rigorous classes and many opportunities to engage in clubs, sports, and other extra curriculars. The principal knows everyone's name and so will you after your first year or two which creates a community within the school.", "Bethpage has something for everyone.  Great sports, tons of clubs, a great drama and music department, cool principal, beloved Superintendent.  The kids are genuinely caring and parents are supportive of what we need and want.  There are lots of AP classes, academic centers for extra help, and an open door for anyone who wants to spend time there.  I feel really lucky to have ended up here.  Never met a teacher I didn't like, and they treat us like adults...with respect.  Love it here.  I hope I can find this at college.", 'The school-wide policies are very fair. School is very helpful to all students. The principal is very involved in all students. He knows all their names and families. Guidance counselor are very helpful. Office staff is very friendly.', 'The athletics are great.  There is something to do for every student.  There is a great deal of school spirit, when there is a foot ball game parents and most of the community attended. The football field is a new facility.  Great school spirit.', 'The teaching staff is great.. They are very helpful and you can approach them with anything. They are very understanding. There teaching style is great for the future.  Grading is very fair to all students.', 'We have really nice athletic facilities. The locker rooms were renovated within the last three years, and we have a turf football/lacrosse/soccer field that was done a few years back. The baseball field recently had dugouts built in. There is a weight room that is pretty well-equipped and a pool with locker rooms and a diving board.', 'The teachers here are a very good bunch. At Bethpage we are lucky to have teachers like the ones we have. Some of the stuff they teach is boring but that depends on what the lesson is. Overall they care about the kids and will give help if asked.', 'There are many clubs regarding foreign languages, sciences and community-values. Clubs like SPEC and SADD have many fundraisers to raise money to donate to organizations backing their causes. The administration takes care of these clubs and has a general interest in them.', 'Not much diversity here. Predominately white upper middle class families. Some Hispanic and Indian students, but not many.', 'The security at Bethpage high school is average. Doors remain locked and visitors and students must be buzzed in. There is monitored parking and security on staff.']

column2: ['My experience at W.Tresper Clarke High School has been amazing. The teachers are all so helpful and sacrifice their free time to help you out with work. The school is a safe environment where I know I can trust anyone and feel free to be me. When I graduate, I will miss Clarke so much and I will never forget the memories made through high school.', 'I love the teachers and supportive environment that the school created for me. They gave me the access to equal education that I deserve.', 'Clarke is an small school with a solid music program and a broad diversity of classes and programs. The club selection is well-funded and spans every interest.', 'Wt clarke high school had been an very good experience to me the years i have been here. The amount of AP’s and Duel ed classes they provide is immersive, they have a successful DECA club and very skilled athletic programs with baseball being a two time state champion. The teachers are for the students and will never make the class hard on purpose. The health and safety is the only problem i have had because of the lack of attention to places like bathrooms and hallways. It an amazing school however and im very happy to have gone here', 'This is a pretty average school. Nothing really too fancy about. Some of the teachers are really nice and down to earth but some could be better. There is some what of a balance between sports and the arts. They just got a new track around "natural turf",  new flooring in the gym, renovated the little theater and in the process of getting new roofing. The clubs of the school are pretty involved in the community whether it is at the elementary school down the block or the near by hospital. The students are pretty well rounded and decent people.', 'I would like the building to be renovated a bit to update the facilities and for the food selection to be a bit healthier but other than that, Clarke is great!', "Absolutely love this school! Unlike many other schools I've been to (I've attended 7 different ones), the entire student body is really nice, and we rarely have issues with the teaching staff and administration. And as of this school year, we were ranked a Blue Ribbon school, one of around 300 top schools in the nation!", 'Good communication on important issues and events  diverse classes and electives good sport programs', 'At Clarke H.S the staff and faculty are all about the kids that go there. There sports program is the best around and music & arts programs are top notch!', 'Though small and poorly funded, the community at Clarke is close and well-meaning. The teachers truly want the best for their students, whether they need emotional help or extra tutoring.', "Clarke has many opportunities to join classes and/or clubs that fit with one's future career plans. They have many AP courses and Dual Enrollment classes which allows one to receive college credit at participating universities. They really try to get as many people involved in the school as possible. Although they don't currently have advanced security measures such as metal detectors and bag checks, Clarke still manages to be and feel like a safe environment.", 'This school is a small and safe school to attend. It is an amazing school for the class that they have and the teachers will want to help you do better.', 'Going to this high school has been an okay experience. Academics are ok, but there is more of a focus towards art and music, which not all students would prefer. Students themselves are very clique based and if you are new, it may be difficult to make friends. The facilities are okay, though they could use updating. Resources could also use updating, such as technology and curriculum. Did prepare me for college though. Overall, Clarke High School  was an average experience.', "Clarke has always been such a great school in the begginning, freshman year could get hard because you're finding yourself, seeing whos still your friends and what not, but after you find your crowd it's good. We have a lot of clubs and sports for students to participate in. Teachers are usually good with their students. Party life is pretty bad tho there's rarely any parties", 'All around good. Very good in the main cirricular department but a lot of the electives are taught by teachers who know little to nothing on the subject.', 'All the after school activities and ability to take challenging courses. I have attended to this school for the last 4 years and love the environment and the opportunities offered. I took 5 AP courses and 10 Honor classes.', 'Very small school. You can find yourself in a friend group or you cannot. Due to the size of the school it is quite hard for some to fit in. Also there is not a wide variety of teachers or clubs to participate in. However, if you do find things that you would like , going to this school will be fun.', "Clarke High School was definitely a safe environment when it comes to bullying and things of that nature. No one really faced situations like that. What I loved is that we are a very diverse school. Teacher wise, there were some really great professors and some that weren't so great.  The guidance counselors were okay but I didn't find them too helpful. One thing that I would love to see change are the AP Classes offered. I wish Clarke offered more AP classes. However, due to us being a small school it becomes difficult to get a full class and causes some classes to not run.", 'Throughout my four years at Clarke High School, my grades were high, but my self-esteem and overall well being were not. Overall, the teachers had much passion about their classes, but they did not consider that students receive work from other classes and have extracurricular activities when assigning their workloads. This led to much stress and unhappiness regarding many of my classes (obviously with exceptions) and learning overall. The addition of the Common Core curriculum certainly only contributed to this feeling of negativity and it should be known that it does not at all improve the learning experience. The music program and its teachers are outstanding. The athletics programs are decent, however slightly under-budgeted. This school needs a full-size running-track. The quality of water from the fountains needs much improvement, including the quality of food coming from the cafeteria. Clarke High School offers many superb opportunities, but has some changes it could make.', 'Dedicated teachers and staff for the most part, but there are definitely some things that the school turns a blind eye to.']

column6: ['Clarke High School is a blue ribbon school. Aside from being a blue ribbon school and being located in one of the top school districs, as soon as you walk through those school doors, you imediatly feel welcomed.', 'There are so many clubs and sports to choose from. Clarke has done a great job giving the students these opportunities.', 'My favorite experience was joining several sports teams. I made some of closest friends because of winter track, swim and badminton. What makes Clarke unique is the very diverse environment. I loved meeting new people', 'The school over is safe but a lot of people do get teased and nothing is done.', 'They offer a lot of after school activities that anyone can join.', "What made me love this school is being in the multicultural show and the rock show. I got to perform and work with other people. Also my senior year i went to Spain with my Spanish class which made that year very memorable. \r The only reason i wouldn't choose this school all over again because of all the bullying that goes around and nothing being done, and being discriminated against", 'The teachers at this school are somewhat helpful. Some teachers go above and beyond and help the kids who are struggling. While others could care less about the students.', 'I have had too many bad experiences here. There are good teachers and classes but the poor ones definitely outweigh the good.', 'Not many people get bullied but when people do others act as enablers letting the act continue. The school nurses are very friendly and know many athletes by name. The school only has one athletic trainer who is not so good.', 'While there are a good amount of extracurriculars, many are not engaging and many do not even know what extracurriculars there are', 'If anything has made the experience at the school good, it would be the diversity of students found in such a small school. There are many poor teachers in the small school, making the school experience one that is not too satisfying.', 'Some teachers are great, and are really engaging, making class periods seem too short. However, some teachers have terrible styles of teaching, no justification behind grading, and make periods seem as if they lasted for hours.', 'This school is very safe compared to the nearby East Meadow High School, that even has metal detectors and armed police/security.', 'The activities usually will have a board, whom take care of most of the meetings and such, and they are very compassionate and lenient.', 'Most of the students at this school are very nice and polite, and not just on first sight, but continuously, even if they dislike another. I love this school since it is the school that has had the best teacher to student and student to student relations, compared to any other school that I have been to. The older students will not be mean to the freshmen, on the contrary, they help them out a lot and sincerely care for them. Fights do not break out easily or frequently, because of the good relationship the students have with one another.', "Most of the teachers at this school are very nice and friendly, however some are nicer to some students and favor them over others. A downside to them being so nice would be the juniors and seniors going out of control, and disregarding the teacher's patient warnings. The older students also tend to take advantage of their former teachers and use them for their own purposes.", 'I think my school is relatively safe. We never really hear about any dangerous activity that stems from the students themselves. The school is clean and we have good security.', 'Some of the more popular extracurriculars have a lot of funding and support, but others may lack that same attention and be overlooked.', "There are good and bad aspects of this school. Since we are a smaller school, averaging at about 200 students per grade, some things just aren't possible. Certain courses aren't available to us because there aren't enough students that are interested in taking them. Also, we lack funding in some activities such as our sports team because they are smaller teams that do not necessarily do well in competitions.", "All of the teachers are different, so it's impossible to rate them all the same way. Some go above and beyond and can be your best friend and a great teacher at the same time, while others you may do the best to avoid."]
column8: ['Clarke High School is a blue ribbon school. Aside from being a blue ribbon school and being located in one of the top school districs, as soon as you walk through those school doors, you imediatly feel welcomed.', 'There are so many clubs and sports to choose from. Clarke has done a great job giving the students these opportunities.', 'My favorite experience was joining several sports teams. I made some of closest friends because of winter track, swim and badminton. What makes Clarke unique is the very diverse environment. I loved meeting new people', 'The school over is safe but a lot of people do get teased and nothing is done.', 'They offer a lot of after school activities that anyone can join.', "What made me love this school is being in the multicultural show and the rock show. I got to perform and work with other people. Also my senior year i went to Spain with my Spanish class which made that year very memorable. \r The only reason i wouldn't choose this school all over again because of all the bullying that goes around and nothing being done, and being discriminated against", 'The teachers at this school are somewhat helpful. Some teachers go above and beyond and help the kids who are struggling. While others could care less about the students.', 'I have had too many bad experiences here. There are good teachers and classes but the poor ones definitely outweigh the good.', 'Not many people get bullied but when people do others act as enablers letting the act continue. The school nurses are very friendly and know many athletes by name. The school only has one athletic trainer who is not so good.', 'While there are a good amount of extracurriculars, many are not engaging and many do not even know what extracurriculars there are', 'If anything has made the experience at the school good, it would be the diversity of students found in such a small school. There are many poor teachers in the small school, making the school experience one that is not too satisfying.', 'Some teachers are great, and are really engaging, making class periods seem too short. However, some teachers have terrible styles of teaching, no justification behind grading, and make periods seem as if they lasted for hours.', 'This school is very safe compared to the nearby East Meadow High School, that even has metal detectors and armed police/security.', 'The activities usually will have a board, whom take care of most of the meetings and such, and they are very compassionate and lenient.', 'Most of the students at this school are very nice and polite, and not just on first sight, but continuously, even if they dislike another. I love this school since it is the school that has had the best teacher to student and student to student relations, compared to any other school that I have been to. The older students will not be mean to the freshmen, on the contrary, they help them out a lot and sincerely care for them. Fights do not break out easily or frequently, because of the good relationship the students have with one another.', "Most of the teachers at this school are very nice and friendly, however some are nicer to some students and favor them over others. A downside to them being so nice would be the juniors and seniors going out of control, and disregarding the teacher's patient warnings. The older students also tend to take advantage of their former teachers and use them for their own purposes.", 'I think my school is relatively safe. We never really hear about any dangerous activity that stems from the students themselves. The school is clean and we have good security.', 'Some of the more popular extracurriculars have a lot of funding and support, but others may lack that same attention and be overlooked.', "There are good and bad aspects of this school. Since we are a smaller school, averaging at about 200 students per grade, some things just aren't possible. Certain courses aren't available to us because there aren't enough students that are interested in taking them. Also, we lack funding in some activities such as our sports team because they are smaller teams that do not necessarily do well in competitions.", "All of the teachers are different, so it's impossible to rate them all the same way. Some go above and beyond and can be your best friend and a great teacher at the same time, while others you may do the best to avoid."]

column1: Midwood High School at Brooklyn College
column2: ['Midwood High school is a great school for students who want to pursue in the science field. They have a lot of different clubs such as Red Cross and UNICEF. This school is also really diverse compare to any other schools.', 'The students are really diverse and the classes are great. Most of the teachers are great and the atmosphere is good. I would like to see more classes relating to architecture. I generally enjoy attending midwood high school.', 'At Midwood High School I like how the teachers were mostly really nice and how it’s a very diversed environment (there are people of every race and an equal amount of every race).', 'Overall, was a pretty poor experience.  Some teachers there should not be teaching but are latched on due to tenure.', 'The school provides a very diverse environment where you can meet all types of people with various interests that may match your own. It also adapts to your skill level, as you can take either regular classes, A.P.s and/or honors. Personally, I feel as though I was able to improve my academics through various opportunities and teacher help. On top of taking several APs, I managed to get on a team and join several clubs, all while maintaining my average. Although the halls may be crowded in certain areas, it is the experience that you get with Midwood, as it is about the size of a small college. Overall, Midwood is a school where you can get things done and have many different experiences that vary based on the person you are. It is a great school for anyone and everyone.', 'One of my favorite things in Midwood Highschool is how diverse it is. There are all kinds of people for you to interact with as well as the numerous clubs and after-school activities that you get to choose from. The teachers here are great at teaching too!', 'I liked that I had the opportunity to take AP classes. I also enjoyed being able to take College Now classes to receive high school and college credits.', 'Midwood high school is a very attentive school that will help you excel in academics and grow mentally/socially.', "One thing I like about Midwood is the diversity. There isn't one class I've sat in where it's 100% white or black kids. Every class you walk into, there is a mixture of students whether it be white,asian,black,middle eastern, literally anything you can think of. The diversity factor here is important because not many high schools are like that. One thing I would change however is the staff. The staff here are very unorganized and last minute especially when it comes to planning events or trips.", 'Midwood High School is great for students whom are serious about pursuing something in the medical field, as many of the AP classes they offer are generally for these students but Midwood does offer other fun courses for student not pursing in the sciences as well.', 'I remember I was very excited when I got news that I got into Midwood. It is a very good school, the teachers and student make it very fun, too.', 'it’s a very great school for students looking to follow a medical and humanities track. students here are very diverse and get along quite well.', 'Midwood is genuinely a good school just have to be really good at your work and some teachers are bad but others are great', 'Midwood is a very good school. of course like any other place it may have its handful of bad kids but all in all it is very good. Midwood has a lot of students which makes it very crowded at times, but with very big schools comes a lot of opportunities to do the things you love. they have plenty of clubs and sports that you can participate in.', 'I like how some teachers are passionate about teaching the subject and would try their best to motivate students. What I would like to see changed is that the school offers more activities to get students to involve in hands-on learning.', 'Midwood high is an amazing school. To me it’s my second home, it’s a place I spend almost half of my day at. We have knowledgeable and nice teachers here who are always there to answer any questions you have, very supportive guidance counselors. Nice environment like the library to study and the cafeteria is newly renovated. Excellent resources, offers large range of AP classes, and prepares you for college.', 'Midwood HS has a diverse study body and the teachers are all academically challenging.  The expectations at Midwood are high.  A lot of options for Regents, Honors and AP classes.  The variety of clubs and activities are various.  In senior year you are provided a college counselor and they are very knowledgable and are always ready with suggestions and paths.  I feel very safe at Midwood.', 'I like it a little, however, the school is very crowded. Very little space to walk during class changes in the hallway!', 'my experience at Midwood High School was very good. The teachers were excellent at there job, and if you needed help the help was always available.', 'Midwood High School is a very diverse place. Midwood tries to keep the students in a safe environment while the students explore their interests through classes or afterschool activities such as clubs. However, Midwood does not focus on helping students choose their career path/major for college or offer a large variety of classes that differs from the core classes (english, math, science, etc).']
