column8: ['The diversity in the school is so amazing and unique. You are capable to be introduced to many different people.  In addition, the chance getting great teachers with different approaches on the classwork and homework.', 'Midwood High School is a very prestigious school with determined teachers and staff. Teachers will work beyond their paid hours to ensure that students understand the material. Many AP courses are available at this school also. The school spirit also shown at this school is outstanding. Overall this school is a very high achieving school.', 'The school is OK. I mean some staff are nice, others are not. The kids are cool,  but crazy. And the academics and extracurricular activities are pretty good. I did track for a year and made a lot of friends.', "Midwood High School has great diversity with students from different backgrounds. They are very helpful in assisting students to prepare for college. Recently the school has innovated the school cafeteria. Allowing the student to have more options for their lunch. Midwood also has its own monthly newspaper 'Argus' prepared by the school journalism class. The school newspaper updates Midwood students about events that are ongoing within the school. Midwood also has an excellent sports team. The school also provides many AP classes, clubs activities, as well as events encouraging students involvement.  Although there are many parts of the school that should be improved. I am informed that the school is doing its best to establish an environment that meets the expectation of its students and parents.", "The school is very open. There are many diverse ethnicities. You get to interact with everyone, but the downside of the school is there are too many people. Hallways get too crowded, and sometimes you can get to class late. Some teachers aren't great, but those that are great will make your semester feel like a breeze. One major downside is probably the bad stuff that kids do. Some kids smoke in the staircases, and many skip class while security sometimes doesn't say anything. Other than that, the school is very enjoyable. There are many clubs to join, and everyone seems to be friendly.", "Its very crowded but what can you expect it's a good school. The teachers are nice and helpful it's pretty nice on the inside and out.", 'I really like the dynamic between teachers and students in the building. There are some instances where many teachers will try their best to help students understand the topics. I not only learn from teachers but also from my peers. Everyone in the school is very friendly and approachable. The school offers a wide variety of AP courses and many students are very eager to be accepted in those classes, like me.', 'I considered Midwood High school to be a great school because of the many extracurricular activities and advanced placement classes that were available to me. Additionally, the diversity in the school is huge, so there are many groups that one can be a part of.', 'Midwood High School is a very diverse and engaging school. Everyone is welcome and the environment is very friendly. Once you enter the school your jaw drops. "Wow this is such a big school." Is one of the most common statements I have heard. The classroom environment is very intriguing. Most of the time everyone is working together and conspiring with one another. One thing I would like to see change in the classroom would be the amount of technology use. I feel like bringing more technology into the classrooms would be more captivating for the students and teachers as well.', 'The classes are great and teachers explain things thoroughly. The only thing I expect to see improvement on is the number of students the school accpect each year, because the hallway is overcrowded when we have to transfer to another classroom between each period.', 'My experience at Midwood was very eye opening and a cultural shock. I say this because this school is filled with over 5,000 kids and there are tons of different cultures and religions within that I am constantly learning something new. Although I am a senior now I am still getting to know my school and the many resources that they have to offer from extracurricular activities to academic help.', 'You have teachers who care for you and want to see you thrive. The deans and counselors make sure you are on track to graduate.', 'Midwood High School is competitive and challenging. I would say the rigorous studies and teachers prepare students for college at some extent; however, the large student body definitely has its drawbacks and limits the opportunities of able and diligent students.', 'Midwood High School at Brooklyn College brings a welcoming environment to all students. The teachers in the building are always approachable and kind, the guidance counselors always provide invaluable information and advice to any one who needs help, and the school advocates for respect, responsibility, and honesty.', 'My experience at wasn’t bad at all, I actually enjoyed it. While there were some ups and downs, it was a pretty regular high school. While it wasn’t a spealized high school, it felt pretty close to one. My experience felt similar but without the pressure. At the same time it isn’t hard to succeed nor is it necessarily competitive I am in the Med Science program (Senior 2019) and I felt like I was given many academic chances to succeed. While some schools might’ve had more, the school wasn’t entirely lacking. I had many choices in terms of AP classes, clubs and activities. Some of he teachers I had were some of the teachers I’ve ever met while others didn’t seem as motivated (might be common in many schools). Some practices were definitely not normal and sometimes seemed unnecessary and counterintuitive (such as late passes for 1-3 period classes). Overall my experience wasn’t bad and would recommend the High school for any student who is interested!', "I had a good experience at Midwood. There's a place for everyone and always something to do so you wont feel alone. There's so many sports and even more clubs that are very welcoming to any and everyone. The staff are great and the teachers try to help you as much as they can. Although it is over crowded it just takes some getting used to. We are also a very safe and very diverse school Our annex bridge is also an eye catcher.", 'My experience at midwood high school has been superb. The school is very diverse, with extraordinary teachers. The school has been a fun culture and traditions.', 'I liked the various amount of clubs and sports there are to choose from. You can never feel left out, alone, or bored at midwood. If you want to find people that share the same interests as you there are plenty extracurricular to choose from. If you just want something other to do than academics, your choice of club or team is available as well.', 'So far my experience at Midwood has been interesting. The school has a lot to offer with its variety of clubs and sports teams to the plenty of AP classes you could join.', 'I had a great experience in Midwood High School. My guidance counselor was the best in helping me achieve for greatness. The food wasn’t the best though. Teachers were really nice and always helped out a student in need.']

column2: ['This is a wonderful school, which as many different types of people from very different cultures and religions. There’s not a lot of school like Morris hills.', 'Morris Hills is a highly competitive school which features a large and diverse student body who are committed to excellence with a wide range of teachers who seek to push students to perform their best.', 'Academics are really good, a lot of scholarship opportunities and college readiness. Morris Hills High School has alot of programs like AVID which is a program that myself is involved in and it helps a lot with preparing for college and scholarship opportunities. Theres also programs like Magnet and the Academy.', 'The administration constantly boasts that Morris Hills is in "the top 6 percent". Really? With English teachers with an elementary education background teaching senior English and guiding students on how to write their college essays? The administration is more concerned about enforcing the dress code than controlling students vaping in classrooms and the hallways. It is also perfectly fine that a creepy gym teacher compliments a female student\'s leggings and gym shorts. I did not feel safe at this school especially after the fact that my bus driver repeatedly texted while driving me to and from school. When I reported it to the school resource officer, nothing was done to stop the bus driver. This school was a complete waste of time and only a handful of teachers cared about the students. Very sad!', "When first coming to this school for my program, AVID, I was very nervous to even consider going. It was in a different area of town with different expectations as it was a higher requirement school in our district. Lucky for me everything was as good as I could hope it to be. The teaching environment, classes, everything had a fun approach to the way you learned something. You could tell the teachers really knew what they were talking about as they have all had years of experience prior to entering the school. The sporting events were just as fun! There was always a good sense of comradery and school spirit at these events. Being in marching band, one of the most crazy and fun things to do is go to the football games for that type of energy. The food was alright, could have been better. I'm glad that they improved upon that after my graduation when I went to visit. Overall, a really nice environment to grow up in one of the most crucial years of my life.", 'Morris Hills High School is a facility filled with wonderful, passionate, enthusiastic staff who are passionate about teaching. While the school building is older and slightly overcrowded, its energy can be felt by anyone who walks through its doors. There is a spirit of comradery and unity present that enriches any student in the school community.', 'This school is amazing with its staff, technology and curriculum. Morris Hills has rigorous programs for students who are doing above the standard for education and porgrams and classes for those who are not. Hills includes needs for every type of students. Additonally, Hills offers a variety of classes for careers, levels of classes, and preperatory classes with specific facilities designed for each designated program. The diverse environment has students of a plethora of ethnicities, techers who are always reaching out and a supportive student body. Hills is a highschool like no other academically, sports and club wise. Hills has a zero tolerance policy for misdemeanors and hostile conduct, creating an environment where everyone tries to be kind to one another. Hills parent involvement is also beneficial and crucial to snack stands at games and helping decide what is best for students. Students are always being pushed to do their best by staff that truly cares.', 'Morris Hills has no doubt prepared me for college. The teachers genuinely care about all of their students, and will do anything to make sure they succeed.', 'My experience at Morris Hills High School was phenomenal. I was able to take part in a program offered called AVID, a college preparatory class. I feel as if I am now prepared to take on the challenges that college has for me. I am ready to pursue my Family Nurse Practitioner career.', 'Morris Hills is a fantastic high school that prepared me really well for college. I felt that I really learned a lot during my time here. Morris Hills also did a great job at helping me through the college application process.', 'Wonderful campus with amazing teachers who truly care about you. Made me feel inspired and with its variety of programs, I felt like i found what i like to do and where i could be useful.', 'I would like to see more school spirit, school events that will make the students closer and more comfortable with one another. I would like to see administration try to eliminate the cliques and moreso strive to have the students accept everyone. Also they should hear the students’ voice a little more.', 'I’m in the magnet program and although they changed it I still feel it gave me a great opportunity to do research. I’ve had some exceptional teachers but also some not great ones. It has given me a good high school experience overall. I am captain of the fencing team and the school is very supportive of athletics. There are lots of options for different classes and lots of people to be friends with.', 'The school is very modern as it has a lot of resources and encouragement for academics. There is a high parentage of students who play sports and the school is split into two, Morris Hills and the academy. The food is fine and the water fountains are cool.  Teachers are nice and a lot of spirit in the school.', 'My experience at Morris Hills High School was so excellent, that I knew I hadmade friends for life there. Having done two sports there it was a lesson and a blessing to become a scarlet knight. The teachers there had not only taught the material that is should be expected, but also taught that a relationship between a student and an educator does reflect on their confidence in the classroom and leaving to a more independent source of education. Everyone I had met throughout those 4 years show that we all had shared a path together and now it is almost time to separate, sees we all share a connection. This school makes goodbyes harder to say.', 'Personally, I enjoyed the educational opportunities that they provided as well as the diverse climate that the school offered in activities such as sports, students, and available clubs. However, some of the teachers could be replaced due to concerns of inefficiency.', 'Morris Hills is an excellent schools with good teachers and interesting classes. It is a regional high school that allows for students to meet many new students from diverse backgrounds.', 'It was very overwhelming with the amount of creativity the school had to offer from students, teachers, and even staff. This place had an atmosphere of security and strictness once you walk in however you are immediately welcomed by many of the students at first glance.', 'MHHS is a special place! The opportunities for learning within the self are endless. I have adopted a true growth mindset at this community, learned from my peers. My teachers believe in my potential to succeed. This surrounding is equitable, kind, generous, and truly incredible.', 'High school is an emotional rollercoaster! One day you love it and the next day you wish you never stepped foot inside. In my experience, Morris Hills built me to be the person I am today. I am more confident in myself and in my work, and I thank my wonderful teachers for all of that! One thing that I would change about Morris Hills is "teaching v. tenurd".']

Morris Hills High School has alot of programs like AVID which is a program that myself is involved in and it helps a lot with preparing for college and scholarship opportunities. Theres also programs like Magnet and the Academy.', 'The administration constantly boasts that Morris Hills is in "the top 6 percent". Really? With English teachers with an elementary education background teaching senior English and guiding students on how to write their college essays? The administration is more concerned about enforcing the dress code than controlling students vaping in classrooms and the hallways. It is also perfectly fine that a creepy gym teacher compliments a female student\'s leggings and gym shorts. I did not feel safe at this school especially after the fact that my bus driver repeatedly texted while driving me to and from school. When I reported it to the school resource officer, nothing was done to stop the bus driver. This school was a complete waste of time and only a handful of teachers cared about the students. Very sad!', "When first coming to this school for my program, AVID, I was very nervous to even consider going. It was in a different area of town with different expectations as it was a higher requirement school in our district. Lucky for me everything was as good as I could hope it to be. The teaching environment, classes, everything had a fun approach to the way you learned something. You could tell the teachers really knew what they were talking about as they have all had years of experience prior to entering the school. The sporting events were just as fun! There was always a good sense of comradery and school spirit at these events. Being in marching band, one of the most crazy and fun things to do is go to the football games for that type of energy. The food was alright, could have been better. I'm glad that they improved upon that after my graduation when I went to visit. Overall, a really nice environment to grow up in one of the most crucial years of my life.", 'Morris Hills High School is a facility filled with wonderful, passionate, enthusiastic staff who are passionate about teaching. While the school building is older and slightly overcrowded, its energy can be felt by anyone who walks through its doors. There is a spirit of comradery and unity present that enriches any student in the school community.', 'This school is amazing with its staff, technology and curriculum. Morris Hills has rigorous programs for students who are doing above the standard for education and porgrams and classes for those who are not. Hills includes needs for every type of students. Additonally, Hills offers a variety of classes for careers, levels of classes, and preperatory classes with specific facilities designed for each designated program. The diverse environment has students of a plethora of ethnicities, techers who are always reaching out and a supportive student body. Hills is a highschool like no other academically, sports and club wise. Hills has a zero tolerance policy for misdemeanors and hostile conduct, creating an environment where everyone tries to be kind to one another. Hills parent involvement is also beneficial and crucial to snack stands at games and helping decide what is best for students. Students are always being pushed to do their best by staff that truly cares.', 'Morris Hills has no doubt prepared me for college. The teachers genuinely care about all of their students, and will do anything to make sure they succeed.', 'My experience at Morris Hills High School was phenomenal. I was able to take part in a program offered called AVID, a college preparatory class. I feel as if I am now prepared to take on the challenges that college has for me. I am ready to pursue my Family Nurse Practitioner career.', 'Morris Hills is a fantastic high school that prepared me really well for college. I felt that I really learned a lot during my time here. Morris Hills also did a great job at helping me through the college application process.', 'Wonderful campus with amazing teachers who truly care about you. Made me feel inspired and with its variety of programs, I felt like i found what i like to do and where i could be useful.', 'I would like to see more school spirit, school events that will make the students closer and more comfortable with one another. I would like to see administration try to eliminate the cliques and moreso strive to have the students accept everyone. Also they should hear the students’ voice a little more.', 'I’m in the magnet program and although they changed it I still feel it gave me a great opportunity to do research. I’ve had some exceptional teachers but also some not great ones. It has given me a good high school experience overall. I am captain of the fencing team and the school is very supportive of athletics. There are lots of options for different classes and lots of people to be friends with.', 'The school is very modern as it has a lot of resources and encouragement for academics. There is a high parentage of students who play sports and the school is split into two, Morris Hills and the academy. The food is fine and the water fountains are cool.  Teachers are nice and a lot of spirit in the school.', 'My experience at Morris Hills High School was so excellent, that I knew I hadmade friends for life there. Having done two sports there it was a lesson and a blessing to become a scarlet knight. The teachers there had not only taught the material that is should be expected, but also taught that a relationship between a student and an educator does reflect on their confidence in the classroom and leaving to a more independent source of education. Everyone I had met throughout those 4 years show that we all had shared a path together and now it is almost time to separate, sees we all share a connection. This school makes goodbyes harder to say.', 'Personally, I enjoyed the educational opportunities that they provided as well as the diverse climate that the school offered in activities such as sports, students, and available clubs. However, some of the teachers could be replaced due to concerns of inefficiency.', 'Morris Hills is an excellent schools with good teachers and interesting classes. It is a regional high school that allows for students to meet many new students from diverse backgrounds.', 'It was very overwhelming with the amount of creativity the school had to offer from students, teachers, and even staff. This place had an atmosphere of security and strictness once you walk in however you are immediately welcomed by many of the students at first glance.', 'MHHS is a special place! The opportunities for learning within the self are endless. I have adopted a true growth mindset at this community, learned from my peers. My teachers believe in my potential to succeed. This surrounding is equitable, kind, generous, and truly incredible.', 'High school is an emotional rollercoaster! One day you love it and the next day you wish you never stepped foot inside. In my experience, Morris Hills built me to be the person I am today. I am more confident in myself and in my work, and I thank my wonderful teachers for all of that! One thing that I would change about Morris Hills is "teaching v. tenurd".']

column8: ['there are numerous activities for the students which hit all types of activities.', 'teachers are quite involved with the life of the student body, whether it be in athletics, clubs, band, etc.  They take a genuine interest in the students and their future.', 'Administration is young and very aggressive in making sure the students have a positive academic and social experience while in a safe secure environment.', 'great teachers who teach well', 'Diverse groups people mostly stay to their groups', 'Very diverse options with high quality', 'Most teachers are extremely knowledgable', "There are few issues involving race and pride in one's country.", 'I have received a broad and challenging education that will help me prepare for college.', 'I feel safe in my school. The on-campus police are kind and approachable.', 'There are a couple of students that are continuing their sports into college.', 'We really praise the athletes and have many different opportunities to play and find your strengths.', 'Most teachers are straight forward and even predictable.', 'There are a wide variety of extracurriculars available at this school. There is truly something suitable for everyone!', 'Morris Hills is a unique school. It has students from all over New Jersey in attendance with a variety of specialized programs both to aid struggling students and to encourage students to excel.', 'There are a variety of different teaching styles at Morris Hills; however, every teacher is willing to go above and beyond to aid their students both within and out of the classroom.', "There is a policy against bullying but many people are still bullied everyday. I'm not sure what needs to happen, but something does. Many people suffer from depression and on top of all the academic stress, they come to school and get made fun of. Something needs to change.", "I only know of a few extra curricular activities and not many people that I know of participate in them. I feel as if they're not pushed enough and people don't have enough information on these activities besides the athletics.", "My high school experience has been great so far. Of course there are things I wish I could've done differently but who knows what the outcome would've been. I'm very happy where I am today and this high school is a major part of that.", "Some of the teachers go above and beyond to help you out and make sure you succeed and achieve anything possible. Other teachers seem miserable and don't bother to help when you have a question."]

column2: ['The school provide a vast list of elective courses, such as: drafting & drawing , SAT prep courses ,wood shop, etc.They also had a resource center, for any student who needed extra help.', 'My four years at Oceanside High School have been good. I like that teachers and guidance counselors know each student on an individual level.', "Oceanside High School (NY) offers a lot of courses and extracurriculars. While high school is inherently a challenging period of time in any young person's life, this school offers activities that can make it better. In order to get the most out of such a school, one should get as involved as possible. It will not always be smooth sailing as students and adults alike can be ridiculously immature, if you are able to push past this it will be an enjoyable time. There are so many lessons not in the curriculum that I learned at this school and while some years were especially tiring, I would not trade my experiences for the world.", 'Oceanside High School has been nothing but a great experience. My teachers have always been willing to help me and other students out in need. The teachers have almost acted like friends and always are willing to listen to student issues. I love that OHS is very accepting and a diverse building, and have many clubs and sports students can be apart of. In addition to a talented music department. The only thing that needs to be changed about the school would be the cleanliness of the building, which is not kept well.', 'Decent. You could do anything you want if you push bureaucracy hard enough. The teachers have the best of intentions, too. Again, you might have to push to learn and do well.', 'I had a great time with my friends. I had a couple of great teachers.  Overall I think it was a typical expierence. Good days, bad days.', 'Starting off with drug/health regulations, Oceanside is #1 for use of drug/vapes on grounds in nassau county. As a student of the school, stepping on empty pods on my track aswell as the smell in the bathroom becomes quite revolting. The school doesn’t put in effort to show the importance of health. Along with Spider Beetle incidents and constant rats around the school, there still tends to be no  exterminator. Oceanside school district even with all its funding through differnt programs used the money towards the wrong causes. While there’s disgusting bathrooms and no air conditioning in 80% of the school they decide to put money and effort into places like the locker room and new gym equipment. The activities and clubs available become a disadvantage as Students here bully through cliques and discourage those of the LGBTQ community and many others.When I was younger I dreamed of it here and in reality I’m investing in private school.These are only a few issues out of many.', 'I would like to see student involvement change. Students should be more involved with school decision making as younger generations are running the world today. I am currently attending the school.', 'I enjoy the atmosphere of Oceanside High School and the many events that occur here. I enjoy hearing about different activities that go on during the month so I am able to join them. The school does a great job with trying to incorporate and involve everyone in many school activities. Overall i enjoy how the atmosphere gives off a positive vibe throughout the school.', 'Based on the teachers I’ve had the education here is very good. The students have their cliques so when coming into the the HS in the middle of the year it’s hard to make friends, especially if ur part of the minority. Idk why this school got a B in diversity it’s literally all white here with very little pockets of Hispanics and then a smaller circle of black students. I was told that the OHS moms have their own little clique too? Not too sure about that but they were said to have a Facebook page where they bash peoples children and sometimes talk about the parents; talk about moms of the year lol. The school lunch is okay, we have a boars head station which is really popular with the students but most upper class students go out for Lunch since we have an off- campus policy.  There are teachers and guidance counselors who really care here. The bathrooms should be cleaned more often as there is usually stalls without toilet paper which leads to long lines in the bathroom.', 'Oceanside High School did a great job allowing kids to express themselves the way they please to and bullying was never tolerated. Teachers were always helpful and if your teacher wasn’t available, another teacher would volunteer their assistance. Clubs and activities were attention grabbing, which caused so many students to get more involved.', "Oceanside High School offers hundreds of courses, including many AP courses. There are plenty of resources for students who may be struggling academically or personally. OHS offers an array of clubs, such as the Thespians, DECA, WIC, the Sider Press, Video Production club, and many more. I'd recommend joining Oceanside Model Congress. Each teacher at OHS is unique; they can be great, terrible, or weird (either in a good and bad way). There is an LGBTQ community in the school, and bullying is not really a problem. Most people in OHS belong to a clique. Students of OHS, particularly seniors, follow several traditions like attending football games. The school district keeps its students safe by mandating that all students and personnel wear IDs whenever on school grounds. OHS has the highest rate of vaping of all the high schools in Nassau County. There is a degree of nepotism, as the School Board, the PTA, and the Teacher’s Union compete for influence within the district.", 'i believe oceanside high school one of the best in nassau county but should bring back its riffle team', 'The best part about this school is the Math Department. They are very helpful and a few of the teachers led me to pursue a math major. I would like to see better food and new fields besides the turf.', 'My overall experience with Oceanside High School has been satisfactory. I’ve gone to classes and met other students. The school has done its job.', "My favorite part about going to Oceanside high school was the atmosphere and the school pride we had. I was on the cheer team which also gave me leadership roles as I was a Captain senior year. One thing that upset me about Oceanside High school is how hard it was for us as a cheer team to get some things done. We had argue as why we should be able to go to Disney to compete, even though the school didn't pay a cent and after we already got the bid. We also had to fight for new uniforms because the ones we were using were over 10 years old.", 'Oceanside High School is a family and community friendly school. The teachers are great and amazing to their students. They have provided the students well in preparation to college and the assistance that the students are getting from the teachers and specifically from the counsellors are tremendous.', "I liked the convenience of how close to home it was and the quality of food and teachers. Some teachers were amazing and others didn't quiet care about there jobs.", 'what I love moody about my school  are the sports teams. Mostly our football team which did amazing this year. All of my teachers are willing to help when ever you need it you can schedule and appointment or see the on there off period.', 'Great programs and staff. We have a resource center, which means there’s always a teacher who can help you with any school-related questions. There are a variety of clubs. Sports and performing arts programs are  very well-funded. The food isn’t too great, and there’s little variety, but most students just bring lunch from home anyway.']

Not too sure about that but they were said to have a Facebook page where they bash peoples children and sometimes talk about the parents; talk about moms of the year lol. The school lunch is okay, we have a boars head station which is really popular with the students but most upper class students go out for Lunch since we have an off- campus policy.  There are teachers and guidance counselors who really care here. The bathrooms should be cleaned more often as there is usually stalls without toilet paper which leads to long lines in the bathroom.', 'Oceanside High School did a great job allowing kids to express themselves the way they please to and bullying was never tolerated. Teachers were always helpful and if your teacher wasn’t available, another teacher would volunteer their assistance. Clubs and activities were attention grabbing, which caused so many students to get more involved.', "Oceanside High School offers hundreds of courses, including many AP courses. There are plenty of resources for students who may be struggling academically or personally. OHS offers an array of clubs, such as the Thespians, DECA, WIC, the Sider Press, Video Production club, and many more. I'd recommend joining Oceanside Model Congress. Each teacher at OHS is unique; they can be great, terrible, or weird (either in a good and bad way). There is an LGBTQ community in the school, and bullying is not really a problem. Most people in OHS belong to a clique. Students of OHS, particularly seniors, follow several traditions like attending football games. The school district keeps its students safe by mandating that all students and personnel wear IDs whenever on school grounds. OHS has the highest rate of vaping of all the high schools in Nassau County. There is a degree of nepotism, as the School Board, the PTA, and the Teacher’s Union compete for influence within the district.", 'i believe oceanside high school one of the best in nassau county but should bring back its riffle team', 'The best part about this school is the Math Department. They are very helpful and a few of the teachers led me to pursue a math major. I would like to see better food and new fields besides the turf.', 'My overall experience with Oceanside High School has been satisfactory. I’ve gone to classes and met other students. The school has done its job.', "My favorite part about going to Oceanside high school was the atmosphere and the school pride we had. I was on the cheer team which also gave me leadership roles as I was a Captain senior year. One thing that upset me about Oceanside High school is how hard it was for us as a cheer team to get some things done. We had argue as why we should be able to go to Disney to compete, even though the school didn't pay a cent and after we already got the bid. We also had to fight for new uniforms because the ones we were using were over 10 years old.", 'Oceanside High School is a family and community friendly school. The teachers are great and amazing to their students. They have provided the students well in preparation to college and the assistance that the students are getting from the teachers and specifically from the counsellors are tremendous.', "I liked the convenience of how close to home it was and the quality of food and teachers. Some teachers were amazing and others didn't quiet care about there jobs.", 'what I love moody about my school  are the sports teams. Mostly our football team which did amazing this year. All of my teachers are willing to help when ever you need it you can schedule and appointment or see the on there off period.', 'Great programs and staff. We have a resource center, which means there’s always a teacher who can help you with any school-related questions. There are a variety of clubs. Sports and performing arts programs are  very well-funded. The food isn’t too great, and there’s little variety, but most students just bring lunch from home anyway.']
column8: ['Blue and white permeate throughout Oceanside High School and contribute to create a sense of unity and togetherness within the student body and faculty. After attending Oceanside High School for the past four years I am going to miss collaborating with the many different clubs offered, sitting front row at sporting events and always being involved in every school event. I received an impeccable education from teachers who are so passionate about their jobs. They are perpetually dedicating their time to students and give them all the support they need to be successful not only in high school, but after as well. I cannot thank them enough for all that they do. There is not much I would change about Oceanside High School, but I sure do hope that the school spirit continues to percolate through the air and that the friendships made will last a lifetime.', 'Oceanside offers many things for students to be envolved and allows you to challenge yourself academically. Like all schools, OHS has its fair share of bad teachers and corrupt administration.', "Oceanside High School is basically my second home between academic studies and a variety of school activities I'm always there which I don't mind. In fact I enjoy going to school everyday despite the long hours of homework that come along with it. The teachers are amazing which is probably a understatement but having NBCT makes the whole experience better. Not only that you walk into class knowing that the teachers care about you and all of them are willing to go over the material as many times as needed until its fully comprehended also they get to know you as a person too. This helps a lot in extra help because teachers are able to help me based off how I learn best. But also since they know who you are as a person they know a bit about your life outside of school and it makes you feel like more then a student. There  a variety of student activities and clubs.", 'Since I am a senior at Oceanside High School, I have been able to decide what are the best aspects of this school and what factors can be improved. For instance, I really enjoyed being on the cross-country team and am currently enjoying being in the track and field team. The main critique I would make is that I did not feel like I was educated enough about the college application process.', 'I would like to see updated building and food services, a larger student parking lot and better desks .  There are a wide variety of elective classes to take', 'It honestly offers so much to do! Teachers are very nice and want to help you. Overall had a good experience. Only thing is Oceanside is super cliquey.', 'I loved ny experience at Oceanside High school.  I received a valuable education with plenty of activities to get involved.  Also, we had school spirit activities which were lots of fun.  I would suggested more character building activities such as reaching out to the community.', 'They have a mentoring program where seniors get the opportunity to mentor freshmen, but not all freshmen can be in the mentoring program. I feel that if I was in the mentoring program, I would have had a better ninth grade experience.', "OHS has been a great experience. While I haven't loved all my teachers, all of them are extremely intelligent and often innovators of education with prestigious awards. There are tons of clubs and they are mostly well funded. Guidance counselors here are extremely helpful and I feel like OHS has prepared me well for college. I am extremely fortunate to say I went here.", "It has been an interesting 4 years here. If you go here I'd recommend getting to know your teachers as mentors. I liked the teachers a lot, the library is a wonderful place to and there are a lot of new skills to learn by taking electives. I would hope for is for AP classes (sciences) to be offered without taking physics, it is a rigorous, unnecessary requirement. Some teachers have inefficient methods of teaching, making it hard for students to understand, they should be evaluated more often. It is also very unnecessary for seniors to write 4 research papers to graduate, maybe 2-3, and should be required to be done before 4th quarter. Theatre is awesome here but the teacher constantly picks favorites. The guidance staff is very helpful and resourceful.", 'Oceanside High School is a pretty great school! In my opinion, it was a great place to spend 4 years of my adolescence learning and making friends all in preparation for college and my future!', 'Oceanside High School is a great school. The faculty there is very helpful in helping freshman transition into their new school, as well as helping seniors get ready for college. There are many resources in the school to help with SAT prep and college admissions letters and essays. In addition to being strong academically, OHS goes above and beyond with their clubs, activities, and team spirit. In regard to feeling safe at the school, there are several security guards around to help with guidance and to help you feel secure.', "What I liked most about high school was battle and sports night. It's so fun to come together as a grade and work with people you might not otherwise find yourself with.", "I absolutely loved my High School! I always felt like I was being challenged and had every opportunity made available to me. Outside of academics, I found my passion for theatre within my school's Thespian Troupe and made all of my friends through this society. The overall social atmosphere at OHS is incredibly welcoming and unified, unlike any other high school I know of! ", 'My school does this thing called sports night which are two teams (white and blue) of all females from 9th-12th grade and its just a great bonding experience. You get to make up a dance and cheer and then preform it for your family and engage in competitive sports and relay races. Also the athletic events get such a great turnout, the student sections are always filled and show so much support for our teams. I would definitely go to this school again.', "From the teachers I've had they have all been great teachers and people. I really retained a lot of information. Grading could always be better especially for some teachers but overall everything is fair.", 'The teachers at Oceanside High School are always there when you need them. They will help you until you understand the material, and will go even further with that.', 'OHS has some of the best academics on Long Island.', 'We have decent diversity considering the area we live in and the families living here.', 'The safety at OHS has been increasing as the years go on and will only get safer.']

column2: ['I really like that at Millennium Brooklyn High School they really strive to prepare you for college through the heavy coursework. The coursework may be very difficult to handle but in the end it pays off since it all leaves you in a very good place for college. However, something that I would like to see change is the amount of help we get for the application process.', 'Millennium Brooklyn High School offered me a hands on learning environment that allowed me to thrive as a student. I was very happy with all of my teachers and academic advisors. The school is relatively small therefore everyone pretty much knew each other.', 'Millennium Brooklyn High School is an amazing high school in New York City. We are ranked in the top 50 high schools in New York. Teachers are highly skilled educators that encourage students to do their best and provide their utmost in helping students succeed. The school provides advisory and office hours for students to become the most successful that they can be. The school celebrates diversity and cultural differences. We host school and student-led events to celebrate diversity, from spirit week to cultural diversity week. There are also tons of clubs and activities that allow students to become involved within the school. The school is extremely safe and there are no cliques or bullying present. Millennium Brooklyn High School is one of the best high schools that you can choose to go to.', 'Millennium was a great fit because it was a small school that allowed for close friendships and had teachers that cared for their students. Teachers and faculty were always there to help with my grades, applying to college and SAT prep. This school is great.', 'The teachers in Millennium Brooklyn High School are top quality for the most part. A lot of them know the material they are teaching except for a couple of teachers. However all teachers are nice to the students and always offer help. Millennium Brooklyn High School also puts all the students on track to graduate with an excellent education and provides tremendous help in the college application process. The students there can get a bit boring as many of them have the same behaviors, however the school does not lack diversity as there are many students with different ethnic backgrounds.', 'MBHS is a great school for those who want college readiness. I’ve learned how to write essays and even developed my own style of writing. The school also forces its students to get better at time management. Overall, I’ve learned skills I would need both as an adult and as a college student.', 'I am extremely proud to attend Millennium Brooklyn High School. The teachers are always open to discuss any questions regarding a class during office hours or through emails. The students care about their grades and school performances, as well as motivate one another to stay on task. The school security and faculty are always making sure that students are where they are supposed to be, as well as making sure everyone feels safe. I for sure am going to miss MBHS once I graduate in a few months, but would love to come back and visit.', 'Millennium Brooklyn, in Park Slope, is a very good high school. The school itself is very organized and does its best to help students who are planning on going to college. College readiness starts off early in freshman year and students immediately get help from their advisors and many of the faculty members. Millennium Brooklyn is very diverse and also accommodates students with disabilities. AP courses are offered to students who want to get college credit early. The neighborhood itself is very safe and is easy to navigate with the busses and trains nearby. One of the major downsides of this high school is that it is very small in size. Space for classes is limited to one floor and small parts of other floors. Metal detecting, unfortunately, is required and this can be a hassle for students that arrive later than 7:45am.', 'Millennium Brooklyn Highschool is a very challenging school with a very heavy work load. Yes, we get a lot of homework but because the curriculum is so rigorous this school prepares its student for college and the real world.', "Millennium is the most supportive and amazing school I've been to. I transferred here and was immediately welcomed with open arms by all students and faculty. The teachers are extremely happy to be there and helping everyone and the inclusivity of the environment is heart-warming. It makes me so sad that I have to leave this place and everyone with it behind soon when I graduate, this school is near and dear to my heart.", 'The classes at  millennium are very challenging, in a good way. One change would be that the school claims that it is "diverse" but in all reality Caucasians dominate the school.', 'Millennium Brooklyn high school is very welcoming and open to all types of people and life styles. Students are able to feel very comfortable.', 'I like that Millennium Brooklyn High school is very organized with giving out homework. This school does not allow the average amount of credits needed to graduate. Senior do not get free periods, we need more than the average amount of credits to pass.', 'Millennium Brooklyn High School is the best. The teachers and the help that I have had during my school years at the Nest program. My school counselors are always there for me giving me advice. The Culture and Travel club organized a trip to Europe where I have the best memories.', 'I enjoyed the fact that we were given a lot of opportunities to get involved in the neighborhood or even within the country. We have been able to make changes to the school rules while we were there and even now we continue to support one another as we transition to college. As a school that is integrated within a building with other schools, we have done a good job in standing out but I wish we had a space of our own.', 'Overall I very much enjoyed my experience at Millennium Brooklyn. The school made me take a diverse number of course in order to help me figure out what I was interested in. This was all done so I could have a good idea what I wanted to study in college. They also made sure we did some community service in hopes of us getting more involved in our community. Somethings I would change about this school are the teachers. Some teachers I had in this school didnt teach the subject they went to college for and you could tell they had no idea what they were talking about.', 'My school, though very small, is a great opportunity center for all the students. the faculty believes in your interest and safety as the priority.', 'The teachers and administration pay close attention to how students are doing academically and emotionally and work hard to make them feel that the school is their space in which to learn.', 'I enjoyed every moment spent at my high school. Though the work load is a lot I know it’s preparing me for the next step, college. The teachers sre their yo assist you in any way possible. We each have individual advisors and collrge sdvisors that care a lot about our future. Our principal, and admin, take the time out to know and learn about students on an individual basis. The students all have the same mindset, which makes it easier to thrive and excel. I love Millennium and I would recommend my high school to anyone.', 'While attending, I had a wonderful time. Although, we were all struggling together, we eventually made a family at the end of it all. Senior year is when everyone comes together and appreciates each other. Although, sometimes administration isn’t always the best. You can try to ask for help at some points to be at ease with some teachers, but they usually don’t do much. I can’t speak for how much it’s changed since I’ve left but it was overall pleasant while attending.']

column6: ['Best decision ever! MBHS is exceptional and pushes students to excel within their classes, social interactions, community service, and extracurricular activities. The administration, teachers, students, clubs, PSAL, and overall environment is amazing.', "Millennium offers a diverse atmosphere with teachers that a passionate about their work. Teachers go out of their way for the students to assure they are understanding the material and don't fall behind.", 'I really liked that the teachers in the school provided a lot of support. However, I wish the classes offered were more enjoyable.', 'MBHS is an academically vigorous school with plenty of clubs and sports for you to be involved in. The building is shared with other schools so this is one draw back but overall it is a always positive place to be among a very diverse student body.', "I genuinely love being a student at MBHS. I cannot imagine being anywhere else because I believe that I've found my niche here. I've met so many wonderful people that I get to call friends and the support system here for students is wonderful. The teachers are caring and easy to talk to. At Millennium Brooklyn, I've gotten the chance to do research, intern, take AP classes, and do large presentations. The school is smaller than many high schools in NYC and we have really strong academics that challenge students to do their best. The only bad thing I can think of is that we are kind of cramped in the hall ways but I really do love MBHS. Go Phoenix!", "It's great for the most part, but definitely a lot of room for improvement. Most teachers are incredible at what they do and very obviously care a lot about their students and what they're teaching. However, a very small handful of teachers are very clearly inexperienced and could be doing a lot better at connecting with their students and teaching the course in a way that makes sense for everyone.", 'It is a small yet, very big in terms of diversity. All kinds of people of all backgrounds study here. Teachers are extremely caring and very involved with  students.', 'I am now a senior in Millennium Brooklyn High School. I have learned a lot throughout these four years and I am proud to be apart of this community.', 'The teachers are always helpful and do their best to assist students. The school is very small. There are a variety of AP and regular classes offered.  Overall, the school provided a great and supportive environment for students to feel comfortable in.', 'It’s diverse and full of different, exciting classes. You are also surrounded by people who like to excel and yet provide a fun atmosphere.', 'Overall, my experience has been great. The only complaint I have is the homework overload and lack of teacher support in certain classes.', 'I liked the amount of activities millennium provided the amount of connection the teachers had with the students. There are different ways teachers would teach the class and all methods helped better the students.', 'As a current senior, my experience with Millennium Brooklyn High School has been amazing!Having an advisor really helped my transition from middle school to high school. On the first day as a freshman you get assigned to an advisor with a small group of students for all four years! Your advisor helps you keep track of your assignments, gives advice on how to improve, and you even get close with them!', 'This school has very good teachers that encourage you to do better and give you challenging work that allows you to expand your knowledge. Being a small school, it offers good academic courses and the teachers know how to adjust their teaching style to help their students understand the lesson being taught.', 'Millennium Brooklyn High School is a interactive school. I feel like I am apart of a community. Like any other high school, the experience is what you make of it. Feel free to join clubs and be very social.', 'The school is very diverse. It is proud of its diversity, we embrace it. Everyone is encouraged to be all they can be. They ensure that we not only have the skills to succeed in high school and college, but in life as well.', 'Being a student at MBHS was an overall great experience. I was always pushed by my teachers to succeed no matter how hard the obstacle was. MBHS was more than a school, it became a home. The staff truly made the students feel welcomed and loved. Also, the school embraces diversity and supports every student 100%. I will sincerely MBHS and it will always have a place in my heart.', 'Millennium Brooklyn High School is not your usual high school. The diversity is so strong and in which causes the school to have a good relationship. The academics are powerful classes which prepare students for college. The college counsoulers are so helpful and help ease a very stressful time period.', 'Millennium HS is a relatively new school based on the philosophy of inclusion and diversity of its sister school Millennium HS in Manhattan.  The fact that we go to school with students from all parts of Brooklyn and Manhattan - this includes from all economic stratas, racial and ethnic backgrounds as well as family professional background - makes the experience the best possible.  Of course, in addition Millennium supports a rigorous path to college and has recently been lauded all around town as well as the state for being one of the top public high schools in New York City.  My experience has been topped by the very involved (and sometimes annoying) staff of teachers who put all their energy and commitment into making sure we meet the standards and reach far above even the expected.  They have really taught me a lot.  I am so happy that I was there. In Ny amongst all the really terrible schools there are also some shining stars.', "Walking into school for the first time in 9th grade, I would have never imagined the growth and opportunity this school would give me. I'll be the first to admit I wasn't the greatest student; I often struggled with my work and understanding the core curriculum, but my teachers were there to guide me through my years here. As a senior, I can honestly say I would have never gotten the chance to attend college had I gone to another high school. This school works tirelessly to prepare each student for the next step since the day we first walk through the entrance doors as a freshman. The college counselors specifically have done a great job making sure the college admissions process is simple, clear, and as painless as can be. I am so grateful to have lived out my high school career here at MBHS, and I wouldn't have wanted to do it anywhere else."]

I will sincerely MBHS and it will always have a place in my heart.', 'Millennium Brooklyn High School is not your usual high school. The diversity is so strong and in which causes the school to have a good relationship. The academics are powerful classes which prepare students for college. The college counsoulers are so helpful and help ease a very stressful time period.', 'Millennium HS is a relatively new school based on the philosophy of inclusion and diversity of its sister school Millennium HS in Manhattan.  The fact that we go to school with students from all parts of Brooklyn and Manhattan - this includes from all economic stratas, racial and ethnic backgrounds as well as family professional background - makes the experience the best possible.  Of course, in addition Millennium supports a rigorous path to college and has recently been lauded all around town as well as the state for being one of the top public high schools in New York City.  My experience has been topped by the very involved (and sometimes annoying) staff of teachers who put all their energy and commitment into making sure we meet the standards and reach far above even the expected.  They have really taught me a lot.  I am so happy that I was there. In Ny amongst all the really terrible schools there are also some shining stars.', "Walking into school for the first time in 9th grade, I would have never imagined the growth and opportunity this school would give me. I'll be the first to admit I wasn't the greatest student; I often struggled with my work and understanding the core curriculum, but my teachers were there to guide me through my years here. As a senior, I can honestly say I would have never gotten the chance to attend college had I gone to another high school. This school works tirelessly to prepare each student for the next step since the day we first walk through the entrance doors as a freshman. The college counselors specifically have done a great job making sure the college admissions process is simple, clear, and as painless as can be. I am so grateful to have lived out my high school career here at MBHS, and I wouldn't have wanted to do it anywhere else."]

column2: ['I liked that Francis Lewis has cool teacher and I like the ways they teach. I would want the school lunch room to be improved since it is really disgusting.', 'I like Francis Lewis High School because of the sense of community and support felt in this school even though this school is overcrowded. This school offers so many opportunities for students of all different talents and interests from dance to science research to law and so much more.', 'I like the diversity of the school and the various classes offered to students, as well as clubs and extracurriculars.', 'This high school actually provided a lot of great opportunities and programs. What I liked most about this school was its famous JROTC program. It  really helps you develop leadership skills that can be extremely relevant in the future. If you are someone with low self esteem, the program really helps establish confidence in you.  However, some of the staff could be a bit hard to cope with in the school but the principal Dr. Marmor is amazing.  He really runs the school well. Overall, the school is pretty decent.', "Overall, my experience at Francis Lewis High School was okay. I did enjoy the challenging classes that they offered and the friends and relationships that I made. I was pretty successful at Lewis, overall. However, the school wasn't clean and didn't provide students with some of the necessities and freedoms that make school bearable. For example, there would no place for students to sit comfortably. Their only resort was to shove 1,000 kids into a smelly cafeteria and punish us if we went outside.", "Very diverse school where you have the opportunity to figure out what you love to do. Although the school is large, it is one that includes every student and makes sure that you are a part of something. Whether it is the academics, sports, or clubs, Francis Lewis offers different ways to express your interests. The area the school is in, is a nice area with many shops and food places nearby. The programs they offer are very interesting and aren't forced upon any student. Students have the freedom to choose their program, or if they would like to change it. All in all, it is a school that guarantees readiness for college, along with an unforgettable four years.", 'Francis Lewis High School is one of the safest New York City public high school. There aren’t enough fundings being provided so resources are poor. This school is very over crowded which is a major downfall because it affects numerous factors. The school is removing parts of the tennis field to make space for more classrooms. The diversity here is exceptional, you will never feel like the "odd one out", and the academics are fair. You are provided with numerous AP classes and college classes. The administration isn\'t the best. There are many faculties that are rude and not helpful, but there are some that will do their best to help you. The clubs, activities, and sports are average. They do their best to provide enough for the students but it isn\'t anything exceptional. Most of these opportunities are provided in most schools, but I am still grateful that we have it. One of the best advice I can give is to involve yourself and take as much college classes as you can.', 'Francis Lees High School has offered me so many opportunities to explore my interests and discover what I want to be in the future. It’s full of great sports teams and many events to keep everyone involved.', 'It is a Very crowded school. Most teachers are good. A lot of random events happen unexpectedly. There are a lot of teams and clubs available. If they don’t have one your interested in you are able to create your own. There are problems moving through hallways on second floor', 'They have a very good support system. They make sure you are ready Nd prepared for college or any decision you decide to make after high school.', 'Francis Lewis High School offers a lot of extracurriculars, like law, forensics, robotics, VE, and many more. The staff members there are really nice. The school itself is a really huge school, but it is a bit overcrowded, the hallways are always packed with people.', 'Francis Lewis is a highly diverse, and academic school. It has personally taught me to become more independent as a person. It has given me all resources necessary for my future. Most of the teachers that I have encountered have always aimed to help me for my next journey in life. It is a however, a very crowded school, and people do push you, but for the most part it is safe. There are barely any fights and people for the most part are kind-hearted to each other.  One of the best parts about the school is there many events, pep rally, art show, dances, shows, performances and so much more. The school also, has a variety of clubs and organizations that influences you to participate.', 'I am senior at my high school. I hate to admit it but it saddens me to say that I will be leaving this school next year. I have made so many friends here that I am so thankful for from all different cultures. The food is pretty average. The teachers are not, they are beyond amazing. They  have prepared me for life in more ways than one, some teachers have become second parents to me. My school has clubs for every type of person that helps people find their place in our large school. PTA meetings are held every month so parents can stay involved and are connected through teachers with an app. I know I am ready for college because this school has prepared me since I walked in the first day of my freshmen year. I have so many memories in this school cause of all the events they have had throughout the year such as pep-rallies, games, and so many more.', 'All the staffs are very enthusiastic and friendly. Just started but seems like school has a lot to offer.', 'What I like about Francis Lewis High School is the diversity of its population and the different kinds of people that you are able to meet at this school. There are people with many different goals in life. Academics, athletics, businesses, music and art all having an impact in our school community. Some things that I want to change are the lack of rooms and space. Classes are overcrowded and some sports teams are forced to compromise with others to share space. I would like to see more facilities and classrooms with revamped layouts. I also believe that food can be improved in this school to have healthier options that are also not very bad tasting or bland.', 'It has been great so far. The teachers and counselors really help you in any way you want. They make sure that they provide students with everything. The students and peers are nice too. The atmosphere of the school makes me feel safe.', 'I liked the many activities they had also the basketball games. One thing I would change is the over crowded people in the school.', "In my 4 years attending Francis Lewis High School, the staff and administration make it easy for you to explore yourself as young adult, with plenty of guidance to help achieve your goals. They want to  make sure you're on the road to success as soon as you step in the halls as a freshman.", 'The teachers are truly committed though they are overwhelmed.  The student body is incredibly diverse.  The school is huge, but keeps a very positive feel about it.', "Even though it's a large school, I never felt small in here. From freshman year till now I've felt a connection to my teachers and all staff.  There is tutoring available every period for several different subjects.  In addition, the school adds regents prep given on Saturdays just before those exams.  I feel administration really cares about giving their students the utmost advantage during their time at FLHS."]

column6: ['Francis Lewis HIgh School is an amazing place for both academics and social life. I have met so many people, whether teachers, other students, or alumni. My favorite part of the school is the diversity and atmosphere. The school has brought me out of my shell and helped me develop as a person. Throughout my three years, I have been exposed to new cultures and ideologies which allowed me to see the world in a new perspective. The only suggestion I would make is to find a way to accomodate the large student body in the overcrowded facility.', 'I was in a program called gateway. In this program you are put into this group of kids and you go though the four years within this group . This specific program did help me a lot . It was nice to know u had a team of people supporting you . However the school is majorly over crowded. Due to this overcrowding many students do not get the help they need to . The programs sometimes lack structure in what they are teaching . For  instance I was in the law program and due to teachers leaving or being fired we didn’t learn much about law . Overall I had a good experience but to be in this school you have to learn to be independent and not rely on anyone but yourself .', 'The guidance counselors have to manage a lot of students, and so the experience with them may not be personalized or be unable to get the assurance you need unless you know what you want (ex: college readiness, college search, career exploration, work).The school has good sports teams and art and music clubs. A lot of people slack during gym and there could be more activities to do during this time to really help people grow and develop good traits. Standard bullying applies to this school as well.', 'Francis Lewis is a big school with tons of opportunities to make friends and connections. There is always something for everyone. The various amounts of clubs and sports teams, as well as programs, ensures that students have a chance to be active within the school.', 'It’s a very crowded school but it offers a variety of academic options as well as clubs and teams. Since the school is so large, you get a meet a lot of new people and make a lot of friends. The teachers are very interesting and most of them have a unique personality, not like your typical boring teachers.', 'Francis Lewis is a high school unlike most other high schools. In this high school, there are many students. By many students, there are around 4,000+ students with many different ethnic backgrounds. Due to the amount of students in this school, students have a really hard time getting to class because of the crowded hallways. Try to avoid the second floor whenever possible. That floor is a nightmare when getting to class. Also, the school makes students attend school at different times. Freshman usually start later in the day and as you progress as a student, you start school earlier.', 'Francis Lewis High School is very diverse and offers many opportunities. However, one disadvantage is that the school is overly populated.', 'The school was way too crowded but That helped me make plenty of friends. Looking back at my experience there, I wish there were more opportunities for me to make new friends. However, I loved my teachers and I learned things I will never forget.', "Francis Lewis is a great school that offers a lot of AP's, clubs, teams, and programs. Most of the teachers are nice there and they really put the effort into making their own students pass and making sure they understand. Few minor problems can be students that are misbehaving aren't being dealt with the school staffs.", 'While it is an amazing school with caring staff members, the overpopulation is absolutely insane. There is not much space to house 5,000 kids- especially transferring from class to class. I love the variety in programs they have. From science research, to robotics - the possibilities are endless.', 'Very diverse and friendly cast. Able to support a variety of ambitions and caters to everyone. Amazing experience.', 'It was a great experience and great mentors. My teachers were very patient most times and understanding. I also enjoyed being part of the soccer team and playing our heart out. Although, we only made it to semifinals it felt great to hear people cheering us on always.', 'This school is very diverse and has a lot of resources for students to use. There are many clubs and activities for the students such as chorus, sing, drama. There are also a lot of sports teams as well such as soccer, football, basketball, and wrestling. The arts program is average.', 'It was a good school. Although, the staff can be rude. If you want to get classes changed after the first 6 weeks of school, it is very difficult. Depending on who your AP teacher is, it will be a very easy or very hard class. It’s is a great location with many buses, but no train. There are many good places to enjoy food as well as AMC nearby.', 'Francis Lewis High School is an alright school. The academics and resources there are fine and the teachers there are by no means terrible. The biggest issue with the school comes as a result of how many students there are. Often times the amount of students would just make it so that the administration and some teachers are just unable to keep up with the demands of the student body so academics and guidance suffers. Overall, Francis Lewis High School is just an average high school that suffers from too many students.', 'At Francis Lewis High school, there are so many programs like law, forensics, science research, international relations and more that can help prepare you for college. The school is diverse and has many activities like jrotc, volleyball, basketball, and clubs that you can join as well. My experience so far at Francis Lewis has been pretty good and met new people and friend.', "Overall, Francis Lewis High School is a great place to get your education and eventually your diploma. The students are without a doubt the best part of the school. I've been fortunate enough to meet some amazing friends during my 3 years at FLHS. Although there's more than 4,500 students, it's not hard at all to build relationships and find small communities within certain sectors of the school. Personally, I spend most of my time with my extra-curricular families (ie. the play production, string orchestra, journalism, etc.). I can confidently say that there's something for everyone at Francis Lewis. Coming in at a close second are the teachers of FLHS. The majority genuinely care about their students, both academically and as people. My biggest piece of advice for incoming freshman would be to get involved. Like I mentioned before, there's so many options; it's pretty much impossible to be excluded. Don't be shy!", 'I mostly enjoyed my time at Francis Lewis High School. The school offers many programs for students to join, and has many courses to sign up for such as AP classes. Outside of class you can join clubs and/or sport teams after school. Gripes I do have with this school are the maintenance and the spacing. In one of my classrooms this past year, the ceiling’s a bit collapsed and has leaked water until the custodian has decided to patch it up. Also the spacing, as many people know it, has always been a problem among students especially on the 2nd floor. Overall, if you can look past the overcrowding and subpar maintenance , then the programs and teachers this schools offers is fine.', "What can you say about the most overcrowded high school in Queens. The staff are overwhelmed and parents and administration bend the rules to get Title I and don't know the students. It is a  brutal 4 years and worst of all, college admissions are bleak with most going to mediocre schools. Should go to another high school.", "I like all the opportunities and programs available at Francis Lewis, however the amount of students is very high and it's very overcrowded. The teachers overall are very good and are always willing to help out the students."]
