column2: ['Some of the teachers do not care about the students but overall it is a good community. This school has taught me a lot over the past few years and I was happy to be apart of it.', 'I feel very luck to have been able to attend Governor Livingston High School because of all of the amazing teachers and students there are in the school. I have met my best friends in this school and I have had teachers that made a tremendous impact on my acidemic life.', 'Overall a good school. Very good for teens who are academically gifted or need additional support. Governor Livingston is definitely a good high school. There is something for everyone no matter what your interests.', 'GL is a great school if you are an honors student or have special needs.  For everyone else, if they student works hard on their own, they can succeed.', 'I had a pretty good time here. While of course I had one teacher for a lack of better words that was bad, overall the staff was helpful throughout the years and helped me greatly. Only thing I would recommend was to manage some things better such as clubs, because some I enjoyed died out early on and unless they were a sport or basic club like music or photography they did not get much support from the school.', 'School is  good academically, there is a lack of diversity.  A lot of opportunities are provided due to the large amount of privialgs in this school. Students are rude and obnoxious.', 'The teachers are helpful and are always ready to help. The building itself has very dark hallways and as a student I hardly go outside or see much sunlight through the day.', 'Teachers kinda suck and the school itself is bad but the people are chill and I’m v exicited to leave', 'Governor Livingston HS has been an excellent experience for my children. It offers an extensive range of extracurricular activities and it’s teachers and academic curriculum are world class. It’s college preparation offering has been amazing, as well. My daughter is feeling confident as she applies to colleges because of the resources that the school has provided, from college fairs to instruction for SAT/ACT and application process. It’s a top ranked NJ high school.', 'Governor Livingston Highschool offers a great education for its students. They offer classes that challenges students and pushes them to do the best they can. Each and every teacher is great and only want to see the students do better.', 'The majority of the teachers were very good. I did not love the social stigmas and la k of diversity.', 'This is a great school that offers a wide variety of academics, athletics, and extracurriculars. It is easy to get involved in any sort of club or interest. The teachers love to teach for the most part and help students in and out of the classroom.', 'Governor Livingston High School is an excellent school of high academic involvement, diverse forms of clubs and sports to participate in, and offers a positive environment for learning and developing skills. The teachers at Governor Livingston are easily accessible, and always willing to provide extra help. I rate my experience at GL "excellent"!', 'GLHS offers a wide variety of diverse class selections and the teaching staff raises the bar, encouraging students to challenge themselves in class.', 'The school is very small in mostly a negative way. Many of the teachers do a poor job teaching their classes, and the administration is way too overbearing.', 'I enjoyed my four years at GLHS.  I not only progressed academically but as a person thanks to my fellow classmates and teachers.', 'Overall, Governor Livingston is a great high school, the education I am receiving is good, the teachers are friendly and look at for the students best interest. The food is okay, nothing special. Senior year, you can go out for lunch which is a great perk . The guidance department does the best they can to help you with the college process. The students and teachers are friendly. The school spirit is good. There are a wide variety of clubs, from TREND - turning recreational events in new directions to the red cross club. Governor Livingston is a safe school, I feel comfortable going there everyday.', "GL is pretty good. It's mostly white kids from rich towns which is annoying because everybody tends to think they're someone. However, the education is pretty good and I feel confident applying to colleges that my AP classes have been challenging. That being said you need to apply yourself to be challenged and if you don't feel like trying, GL wont force you too.", 'I have had a very good experience with my school because it truly prepares you for college with very rigorous classes and programs. It also has a very good sports program where many students continue to excel onto college teams.', 'Governor Livingston High school fostered a community where education was the most important aspect. I liked that aspect because it pushed me to do better in school. What I would like to see change is that I want them to emphasize students to do other activities, outside world activities. They need more required life skills classes, because personal finance and knowing how to live on your own are key in the real world. We need to prepare the future generation for the real world. Also the administration needs to carefully select the teachers because it seems as though they let a few teachers in who do not teach well. Some teachers do not understand that students have other obligations such as a job or other things that will push them forward in the future. Classes should curve the curriculum to the world moving forward, so life skills and common sense should be included.']
column4: ['Some of the teachers do not care about the students but overall it is a good community. This school has taught me a lot over the past few years and I was happy to be apart of it.', 'I feel very luck to have been able to attend Governor Livingston High School because of all of the amazing teachers and students there are in the school. I have met my best friends in this school and I have had teachers that made a tremendous impact on my acidemic life.', 'Overall a good school. Very good for teens who are academically gifted or need additional support. Governor Livingston is definitely a good high school. There is something for everyone no matter what your interests.', 'GL is a great school if you are an honors student or have special needs.  For everyone else, if they student works hard on their own, they can succeed.', 'I had a pretty good time here. While of course I had one teacher for a lack of better words that was bad, overall the staff was helpful throughout the years and helped me greatly. Only thing I would recommend was to manage some things better such as clubs, because some I enjoyed died out early on and unless they were a sport or basic club like music or photography they did not get much support from the school.', 'School is  good academically, there is a lack of diversity.  A lot of opportunities are provided due to the large amount of privialgs in this school. Students are rude and obnoxious.', 'The teachers are helpful and are always ready to help. The building itself has very dark hallways and as a student I hardly go outside or see much sunlight through the day.', 'Teachers kinda suck and the school itself is bad but the people are chill and I’m v exicited to leave', 'Governor Livingston HS has been an excellent experience for my children. It offers an extensive range of extracurricular activities and it’s teachers and academic curriculum are world class. It’s college preparation offering has been amazing, as well. My daughter is feeling confident as she applies to colleges because of the resources that the school has provided, from college fairs to instruction for SAT/ACT and application process. It’s a top ranked NJ high school.', 'Governor Livingston Highschool offers a great education for its students. They offer classes that challenges students and pushes them to do the best they can. Each and every teacher is great and only want to see the students do better.', 'The majority of the teachers were very good. I did not love the social stigmas and la k of diversity.', 'This is a great school that offers a wide variety of academics, athletics, and extracurriculars. It is easy to get involved in any sort of club or interest. The teachers love to teach for the most part and help students in and out of the classroom.', 'Governor Livingston High School is an excellent school of high academic involvement, diverse forms of clubs and sports to participate in, and offers a positive environment for learning and developing skills. The teachers at Governor Livingston are easily accessible, and always willing to provide extra help. I rate my experience at GL "excellent"!', 'GLHS offers a wide variety of diverse class selections and the teaching staff raises the bar, encouraging students to challenge themselves in class.', 'The school is very small in mostly a negative way. Many of the teachers do a poor job teaching their classes, and the administration is way too overbearing.', 'I enjoyed my four years at GLHS.  I not only progressed academically but as a person thanks to my fellow classmates and teachers.', 'Overall, Governor Livingston is a great high school, the education I am receiving is good, the teachers are friendly and look at for the students best interest. The food is okay, nothing special. Senior year, you can go out for lunch which is a great perk . The guidance department does the best they can to help you with the college process. The students and teachers are friendly. The school spirit is good. There are a wide variety of clubs, from TREND - turning recreational events in new directions to the red cross club. Governor Livingston is a safe school, I feel comfortable going there everyday.', "GL is pretty good. It's mostly white kids from rich towns which is annoying because everybody tends to think they're someone. However, the education is pretty good and I feel confident applying to colleges that my AP classes have been challenging. That being said you need to apply yourself to be challenged and if you don't feel like trying, GL wont force you too.", 'I have had a very good experience with my school because it truly prepares you for college with very rigorous classes and programs. It also has a very good sports program where many students continue to excel onto college teams.', 'Governor Livingston High school fostered a community where education was the most important aspect. I liked that aspect because it pushed me to do better in school. What I would like to see change is that I want them to emphasize students to do other activities, outside world activities. They need more required life skills classes, because personal finance and knowing how to live on your own are key in the real world. We need to prepare the future generation for the real world. Also the administration needs to carefully select the teachers because it seems as though they let a few teachers in who do not teach well. Some teachers do not understand that students have other obligations such as a job or other things that will push them forward in the future. Classes should curve the curriculum to the world moving forward, so life skills and common sense should be included.']
column6: ['GL really prepares you for college. Teachers and other staff really push you to do your best in every subject.', 'I thoroughly enjoyed Gov. Livingston High throughout my 4 years as a student. Most teachers go above and beyond for students when needed when many do not do the same. The administration is fair but very difficult to deal with on many occasions and is getting tougher every year. The school is all around pretty clean everyday. The Caf. offers decent food and plenty of vending machines in the lunch room that cant be used during class periods(pointless).  The sports and athletics are strong and definitely competitive. No matter what level of athletics you get into you will find yourself surprised with the level of athleticism shown from many students in a fairly small school.', 'This public high school is an overall amazing school with a fantastic academic program, great teachers and a positive learning environment', "Govenor Livjngstong High school has amazing teachers, faculty , classes, clubs, sports, and opportunities. From freshman year to senior year i have enjoyed my time here. Whenever I had a question concern or even trouble in class there was always someone to talk to and get help. I enjoyed the freedom of choosing from what seemed like countless electives. GL offers classes for everybody from concepts to AP and even though the idea of so many options may be intimidating guidance counselor a and teachers are alway ready to help you choose what classes are best for you. In addition to acedemics the extracurricular oprotunites at Governor Livingston are seemingly endless. The fall play and spring musical are must-sees. The clubs at GL that are supervised by leaches propt students to be leaders and get involved in the community and explore their passions. Based on my experience as a student at GL I can say it is a great school and I wouldn't want to go anywhere else.", "Governor Livingston is a small but large school. The football games are so fun and so are the parties. However if your a freshman don't paint up because it's not a good idea. The teachers are really chill and cool!! I love gl and I'm honestly so happy I went there.", 'Great School- not very diverse but most everyone is friendly. Food here is great. Teachers are mostly good- some odd ones come around. Sporting events are mediocre. Friday night lights is very fun.', 'Governor Livingston provides students with a great education and great preparation for college. The teachers are willing to help students as long as they put in the effort. The sports teams are average, but the fan section has a lot of GL spirit. There is not a lot of diversity. The food selections are very good, with a variety of food available everyday. The school is beyond safe. The clubs and activities are apart of the GL community and there are an endless amount of clubs to choose from. Many people are accepting, but cliques are present. The school is very clean and the athletic facilities are great. Parents are very involved. I had a good experience with my counselor, but there are guidance counselors who have trouble with students. Overall, the school is great and I enjoyed my time there.', 'Overall, my experience at Governor Livingston High School was great! I was offered a challenging work course that enabled me to prepare myself for college. Almost all of my teachers were always available for extra help, whether it was before, during or after school. I never felt unsafe while being at school and the administration was extremely nice and helpful. The cafeteria always offers a variety of food that allows anyone to feel comfortable eating.  The sports teams are not that great, except for baseball. Regardless, students still show support at sporting events. ', 'What makes this school unique is that there are opportunities and activities for almost any person to have an interest and get involved.', "The best teachers I've had care the most about students walking away with knowledge, not just a requirement for graduating.", 'Berkeley Heights - Kids are for the most part respectful, parent involvement and great police force.', 'Rigorous but inclusive academic program.  Have the ability to really challenge yourself at every level.  School does not limit the number of A/P classes or students that can take A/P classes like some of the top schools looking to improve there rankings.', "A lot of clubs.  Diverse offering to meet everyone's needs.  High emphasis on academic clubs like model UN, Junior businessmen, junior statesman, math challenge, etc,  Band is highly ranked, theater is great", 'School is very academically oriented.  Parents are competitive in this area but do not go overboard.   Not a big emphasis on sports.  No Friday night lights attitude here.  The student theater on the other hand sells out and the band is top notch.', "Teacher's are dedicated and knowledgeable.  Advance Placement teachers go above and beyond and the AP testing results show.  Rigorous and challenging.", "There is zero tolerance about bullying. I think the school is very safe, never have been any issues, the school nurse is nice and competent. Drink and drugs are a problem everywhere, but I don't think is anything special at this High school That has a 99% graduation rate and most of the students go to  a 4 year college after graduating.", 'There are about 40 clubs. Marching band with 45 members and 13 times winner of ACC and 8 times winer of US Bands and drama club , are the most popular ones. Robotic club Was new this year and did wel on the competition.', 'Most teachers are involve in extracurricular activities. Those activities are no limited to sport. Even thoug sport are very important this school has many other cultural oriented activities, like consumer bowl, robotics club and most important it has a very strong music program. Choir, Orchestra, Concert band, Jazz Band and the very well known Hilander Marchine Band.', 'The teachers always willing to help if you need it. Teachers in genera at this school are very good, of course some more than others. In my case most of my classes are AP clases, so is on their best interest that most or if it possible all their student past their AP test.  So their are willing to dedicate all the extra time necessary to achieve this goal. Like organize and leading study group during the weekend before the exams or being available during lunch time or before/after school to answer any question.', 'There are so many different extracurriculars to join at this school. They range from clubs to sports to plays. In each of those options, you have so many different options. Clubs range from art clubs to cancer fundraising clubs. There is a wide variety of sports. Some sports are football, wrestling, track, baseball, cheerleading and basketball.  GL plays are also very popular. The students at GL dedicate a lot of time into these plays and have lots of people watch them.']
column8: ["I like this school because all of my teachers are unique and caring. If I am struggling with a class lesson, my teachers will do whatever they can to help me. I like the students that attend this school because they are friendly. Also, most of the student body is motivated to get good grades and go to a good college, which I like. I think when the school is in a positive spirit, it encourages others to do well. Even sometimes when I'm feeling lazy, I look around me and I see a lot of hardworking student, so it motivates me to do my work.", 'The teachers at GLHS care a lot about each and every student. They do their best to make sure everyone understands lessons and is comfortable. Teachers are human, just like students, so they do not know everything. The teachers at GL are very well educated in what they are teaching. If they are unsure of the answer to a question a student has, they will research the answer via computer or book after they finish their lesson.. The teachers at GL are very much involved in their students education, making sure they are learning and understanding the material that is being taught.', 'I have always felt safe and healthy at the school.', 'My school offers a great and wide range of clubs.', 'My school offered me a place to grow and shine.', 'All teachers are unique and great.', 'While some teachers graded us easily, some graded fairly, and some graded harshly.', "I always felt very physically safe at school.  Most teachers are understanding about personal issues, some aren't. The nurse is very caring and helpful.", 'I think a lot of the opinions students have will depend on personal experience.  I was never challenged that much at this school, but teachers did help you when you asked and cared about your grades.  The people you make friends with and stay friends with have a lot to do with sports, from what I experienced.  And the sporty kids are the popular kids.', "Gl sucks, the coaches and teachers don't care about there jobs. All they do is picket for more money, which they don't deserve. Only football gets funding from the booster club and they are the worst gl sport.", 'The atmoshere is overly competivtive, but people either care way to much about school or not nearly enough. There is no middle ground.', 'Close knit community, some stuck up students, very friendly teachers', 'The overall academics of the school area great. All departments have their teachers that people hope they do not get, but there are always other teachers willing to help you even if you are not in their class. Most teachers are very caring and help you all they can. There is not much diversity on the school, it is mostly prep-wannabes and there are very defined cliques in the school. Getting into a new friend group is hard because they are very exclusive. Joining a sports team definitely opens up more opportunities in the school and there is very much school spirit.', 'Governor Livingston is a great school, academically speaking. The teachers are amazing, and most students are smart and competitive. Aside from the classroom, GL is a miserable place. Most of the kids that go to GL are what I\'d call "fake rich". They\'re wealthier than the average middle class family, but not rich enough to afford a private school. All of the students are really preppy and stuck up, no one is nice or inviting. Every grade has several exclusive cliques. The girls are very judgmental and fake, and most of the guys are just jerks. Berkeley Heights is a religious white community filled with republicans and conservative views. Unfortunately those views are also present at school. Not only is the LGBTQ+ community discriminated against, but even the few minorities such as the African Americans that attend Governor Livingston are singled out. \r If you want to go to a good public school to get a good education, Governor Livingston is a great place to be. If you want to make friends and meet nice people, don\'t go here. You will only be disappointed by the vineyard vines wearing republicans that think they are too good for the rest of society.', 'Without some of the students that attend Governor Livingston High School, this school would be a great one. I have had outstanding teachers, especially during junior year, and I have learned a lot in the past three years. One of my favorite learning experiences was my freshman World History Honors class. My history teacher was the best that I ever had, and although the workload was much more than I was used to, the knowledge that I gained from that class--both historically and currently--set the tone for the rest of my high school academic career.\r I know I am receiving a good education, but the actions of other students frequently hinder my opinion of my high school. Many students here are ignorant or rude; there are only a few that I know I can trust. Students here do not reach out to help others automatically. If they do, they do it so that they can benefit themselves. My friend once told me about a freshman boy on crutches, struggling to hold all his books. He subsequently dropped them in the middle of a crowded hallway, yet no one stopped to help him; she was the only one who approached him and aided him. The fact that something as simple as helping someone who is injured is overlooked bothers me greatly about the student body. I have also heard some offensive things over the years, especially about the LGBTQ+ community and other ethnic and racial minorities.\r Despite the academic excellence that I have experienced, I would not choose Governor Livingston High School again if I could do it all over; the students that attend the school are ignorant, bigoted, and selfish. There are other schools that strive for the same academic rigor that my high school does, but who also have a kinder student body.', 'The majority is still white but we do have some Asian and some black people now.', 'The main lunches are a little sketchy sometimes, but there are a lot of pre-made sandwiches and salads that you can just get but those are usually expensive ranging from $3.50-$5.00. Everything is pretty expensive, including snacks which are $1 now. Most people buy snacks and sometimes drinks in the vending machines since they are cheaper. We do have a system now where you can pay beforehand for lunches and just punch in your code and go.', "It's sort of obnoxious the way the new vice principle works things. One random week, they decided to switch things up and give literally everyone detentions for being late (3 or more lates = detention). Otherwise, I don't usually get into much trouble and they spend a lot of time talking about the drug punishments and stuff.", "From what I know, the equipment if fine. The weight room, though, I don't know if the janitors clean that stuff. They do clean the fitness room where the guys have wrestling or else that would be gross. The tennis courts are near the middle school which is an inconvenience because we have our own tennis courts (that are unusable). The track and turf field are also in pretty good condition.", 'The teachers are not horrible. Some teachers are pretty boring and some pretty strict with grading, but overall, most of the teachers are pretty good and they know what they are teaching.']

column2: ['Wayne Hills High School is located in a suburban area, filled with many white students and residents. It is safe, relatively unproblematic, but a generally unwelcoming environment. Its lack of diversity can make it difficult for new students to fit in.', 'I really enjoy this school and have liked my past 4 years. Its easy to become involved and most teachers are helpful and want to see you succeed. Sometimes classes can be difficult and it can be overwhelming but overall the school does a good job providing resources to make high school the best it can be.', 'I enjoyed the newfound freedom that I began to experience throughout high school, being able to go out for lunch as a senior and park in our own parking lot. I also enjoyed the relationships I made with some of my teachers who truly cared about me. I wish that the preparation for college was better, it would have been very useful.', "The atmosphere in Wayne Hills is great, the teachers and students look out for each other. The sports in Wayne Hills are out of the world as well. The coaches always want the best out of you and always push to your very best. The clubs and the programs are also very good, there are clubs that fit everyone's interest.", 'Wayne Hills is a very positive atmosphere and community to be a part of. The school offers many clubs and activities for students to part-take in as well as athletics.', 'This is the best highschool. The best 4 years of my life. Everyone that goes here is so nice and the teachers really care about the students!', "Wayne Hills High School is a place where you could find friends and meet new people easily. There are many sports, clubs, and activities you can sign up for that interests you. You receive an education that can prepare you for college. Although some of the teachers here don't teach as well as others, the high school still a great place to learn.", "The school is a big size which I like. There are many things to be involved in. Sports are big and you will most likely be popular if you play a sport. Academics are good as well. The only thing I don't like are the people. Wayne is typically an upperclass town and you really can tell how spoiled some of the kids are.", 'I like Wayne Hills High School.  Especially the Robotics Club and the CAD classes.  I will miss it when I graduate.', 'The Best four years of my life,  enjoyed being around fiends I have known since Elementary School and also making new friends from other schools.  I have been a part of Varsity Soccer Team for 4 years of HS and it has been a pleasure and passion of mine to play the sport.   These four years I have  molded me to be a respected young man,    If it weren’t for high school I would have never realized that I could become so interested in so many different things. I would have never escaped the trap of a shyness that had confined me all my life.', 'I went to Wayne Hills for about the year. I didn’t really like my experience at WH and was happy to leave. I found the teachers to be disrespectful and had their favorites. Many students vape and the teachers see this and could not care less. I also found some students to be very obnoxious. Only positive I saw was that my guidance counselor was very knowledgeable and would help with college. I came from a very unique background going into WH so it was much harder to adjust than an other kid going in. If you are a good football or baseball player than WH is a good school for you.', 'Wayne Hills is an amazing school to go to if you get involved. It’s not the most ideal learning environment, but it is certainly satisfactory. Most activities are extremely fun to get into (I’m personally in band and track and field) and I enjoy my experience here.', 'Wayne Hills High School has great sport opportunities, an abundance of clubs and activities, and challenging academics.', 'I like that the school is rated very well.  They should communicate a little better especially when applying for colleges.', 'Wayne Hills High School is a great school. I enjoyed everything and I do not want to change one thing about my high school experience.', 'Wayne Hills has a lot of school spirit. It has several clubs and sports. It also has  several clubs and sports. However, more care to educate students about the college process can be taken.', "Most teachers are down to earth and are willing to do whatever it takes to help you. The education you're getting will honestly help you in the future. Overall, Wayne Hills has so much to offer for everyone and it is a good school in terms of environment and education.", 'The best part of going to Wayne Hills has been my experience with marching band and color guard.  Going into freshman year I was pretty nervous, but when you join band, you become  a family.  Before I had my first class, I knew almost 100 band members.  I also like that Hills offers a variety of different electives and clubs and sports to join.  There is great school spirit at Hills. I will miss it when I graduate.', 'Wayne Hills High School is a great school for all around activities. Bu I must say that it most revolves around football and they give the most money to the team. No money goes to art or theatre.', 'I was part of the football and track team for 4 years and every season was always a chance at a state championship. Academics are key as we are rated as one of the top schools in the country in this category, and we have one of the best mixes of academics and athletics in the country. Everyone works together on everything and there is always something fun to do at the school, whether it is during school or after. There are plenty of clubs and extracurricular activities that can keep everyone involved.']

column6: ["Wayne Hills is  great school. There is a ton of resources if you need them and they are all available to you. Staff is very nice and they are always around if you have a problem. I was there for 4 years and I had a great high school experience. It is bittersweet that I am graduating soon because I don't want to leave high school.", 'My experience at Wayne Hills High School is one I will never forget. I loved High School and I feel prepared and ready to go college. Wayne Hills is an amazing School and has so many great activities for students and the teachers are very good and help.', 'As a junior, I have enjoyed all 3 years so far. The teachers are always helpful and respectful. The guidance counselors are helpful in preparing for the future and planning out your path.', 'Wonderful school. Opportunities to challenge all students in many different areas of study , sports and after school clubs.', "A very positive school, however the building itself is a bit outdated. Very positive and educated faculty, generally speaking. The food at the school isn't very good, but that is the case with most public schools. I find the school has prepared me for college and a career.", 'I have been fortunate enough to be in classes with intelligent and tremendously dedicated teachers whom I knew I could always come to for help. This isn’t the case for everyone, but my experience was great in that regard.', 'Curriculum is challenging. Most teachers are invested in your future. Like the variety of electives so you have a chance to see what you are interested in.   So many clubs and activities, something for everyone.  Sports teams are some of the best in the area and a lot of fun to attend.', 'I liked the size of the school, all of the teachers making sure that we are ready for college, and I like all of the students in the school and how they are willing to help others.', 'Wayne Hills High school is a typical high school with typical teachers, students and activities.  I have enjoyed my time here but can not wait to graduate.', 'Great experience all four years that I attended WHHS. My teachers are all extremely helpful and available for extra help and always very supportive! Our sports teams are highly competitive and very well run by the coaches/staff.  I would only suggest more guidance from the guidance department on college recommendations and having more meetings with the students as it very overwhelming!', "Wayne Hills is quite possibly one of the best high schools in the state. With all the activities, clubs and sports, there really is something here for everyone. The sports teams are incredible, as I am currently part of the Cross Country and Track teams. I run all three seasons for Wayne Hills and I'm proud to do so.  The friends that I've made here are some of my best friends now, and we'll continue to be friends outside of high school.", 'I had a wonderful four year educational experience at Wayne Hills both academically, socially and in participating in sports activities. My high school experience at Hills helped me to mature from a naive freshman to a smart and well rounded senior. The teachers encourage and challenge you to strive the best for you as a student.  I was lucky to attend the Wayne Hills High School and have the opportunity for a quality education with teachers that care.', "My time at  Wayne Hills High School has definitely changed my life in a positive direction. The environment of the school really helps students make new friends from all different backgrounds and let's students break out of their shell from junior high. I feel as though my high school has prepared me for college and I can't wait to apply all that I have learned in my further education. I appreciate all that the faculty has to offer and they truly do care about their students. Overall, I had a great experience at Wayne Hills, and I wouldn't change anything about it.", "Many of the teachers are very nice and helpful. They care about whether their students are failing or not, and tries to help their students' grades by giving extra practice work to count as a grade and credit back when student correct answers for tests. The school is also very welcoming because it offers clubs, sports, and events for students of all interest and background to fit in and interact. However, the school can really get some use of air conditioning in the summer or at least try to fix the broken ones in the school. And also to fix the heating in the winter, so that students aren't freezing all the time.", 'We have some excellent teachers, but it is a toss up on whether you will get them. The school cares way too much about sports in general and especially football.', 'Wayne Hills High School is an excellent school for academics and athletics. The teachers are all very nice and helpful. The school is "the gem of Passaic County", being the best school in the county. I am proud to go here. Wayne Hills has been great so far, can\'t wait for the next year!', 'I am currently enrolled in Wayne Hills in my junior year. It is a pretty good school. The teachers are nice and the facility is clean. The students are friendly and everyone gets along.', "I loved the different people you could meet at Wayne Hills. There are some incredible teachers in that school who are passionate about what they do and helping all of us achieve and be our best. There are also a lot of great students to meet and the relationships I have created with them is irreplaceable. I need to emphasize that the best part of the school is the people and the culture that the school creates for the people. It's an environment for us all to thrive and work hard at whatever we choose. The recourses are there and I would argue the people here are very unique and talented. So it is only a matter of us utilizing the resources in order to achieve because the potential is there.", "There is so much to do here! I've met some of the most amazing people. The teachers here are amazing and they care about you, even if you think they don't. You also have plenty of classes/electives to choose from and many of them can help you realize or understand the career that you plan on entering in.", 'Great overall atmosphere, supportive, spirited students.  Teachers are very good and helpful. Administration does a swell job of keeping the community safe for all students of all backgrounds. Trips are well organized, and always a great experience.']
column8: ["Wayne Hills is  great school. There is a ton of resources if you need them and they are all available to you. Staff is very nice and they are always around if you have a problem. I was there for 4 years and I had a great high school experience. It is bittersweet that I am graduating soon because I don't want to leave high school.", 'My experience at Wayne Hills High School is one I will never forget. I loved High School and I feel prepared and ready to go college. Wayne Hills is an amazing School and has so many great activities for students and the teachers are very good and help.', 'As a junior, I have enjoyed all 3 years so far. The teachers are always helpful and respectful. The guidance counselors are helpful in preparing for the future and planning out your path.', 'Wonderful school. Opportunities to challenge all students in many different areas of study , sports and after school clubs.', "A very positive school, however the building itself is a bit outdated. Very positive and educated faculty, generally speaking. The food at the school isn't very good, but that is the case with most public schools. I find the school has prepared me for college and a career.", 'I have been fortunate enough to be in classes with intelligent and tremendously dedicated teachers whom I knew I could always come to for help. This isn’t the case for everyone, but my experience was great in that regard.', 'Curriculum is challenging. Most teachers are invested in your future. Like the variety of electives so you have a chance to see what you are interested in.   So many clubs and activities, something for everyone.  Sports teams are some of the best in the area and a lot of fun to attend.', 'I liked the size of the school, all of the teachers making sure that we are ready for college, and I like all of the students in the school and how they are willing to help others.', 'Wayne Hills High school is a typical high school with typical teachers, students and activities.  I have enjoyed my time here but can not wait to graduate.', 'Great experience all four years that I attended WHHS. My teachers are all extremely helpful and available for extra help and always very supportive! Our sports teams are highly competitive and very well run by the coaches/staff.  I would only suggest more guidance from the guidance department on college recommendations and having more meetings with the students as it very overwhelming!', "Wayne Hills is quite possibly one of the best high schools in the state. With all the activities, clubs and sports, there really is something here for everyone. The sports teams are incredible, as I am currently part of the Cross Country and Track teams. I run all three seasons for Wayne Hills and I'm proud to do so.  The friends that I've made here are some of my best friends now, and we'll continue to be friends outside of high school.", 'I had a wonderful four year educational experience at Wayne Hills both academically, socially and in participating in sports activities. column2: ['Good academics but teachers do not care much about students. There is no air conditioning and the heat does not work either, so it can get very uncomfortable for students when they are trying to work in school. Lunch is very chaotic and disorganized. The food is not very healthy either. Overall the school is decent, but I do not feel that it prepares students very well for college or the real world at all.', "Marlboro High School has many opportunities for students to succeed, no matter one's interests. Marlboro High School is also known for their business program that has teachers and curriculums that challenge students and prepare them for college. Overall Marlboro High School is a school that helps students excel beyond high school and provides students with a diverse amount of activities ranging over many different interests. Like many schools, Marlboro High School has room to improve, in areas such as lunch and air conditioning for the hot months. Small improvements here and there will help the learning abilities of the many students at Marlboro High School and maintain the high standards the students are kept at.", 'Marlboro High School is a wonderful school with great teachers. The electives are widespread and there is one for everybody. It is rated the best school out of the FRHSD school district, and has a generally diverse and good climate.', 'Some of the teachers really go above and beyond to teach you and make relationships while others clearly do not want to be there. Overall I had a good experience.', 'The school is of course not perfect, it has some flaws including a few bad teachers, focusing on athletics and math and neglecting other departments, especially language and art. The school is very academically rigorous, students are obsessed with grades and many will consider a C a bad grade despite it being average. The competitive environment pushes the students to do very well and stand out among other schools  in the state and country, however it can sometimes be too intense, placing a lot of pressure on students.', 'Amazing staff and resources are available to all students. You get a great education while making many friends though clubs and activities.', "Marlboro High school is a great school filled with many motivated students and teachers. The environment is competitive and students are recommended to reach out to staff when help is needed. Also, students are given all the resources they need to succeed. Some things I would like for Marlboro to change is the competitive nature of the school. Many students resort to cheating and academic dishonesty to gain a slight edge over their peers. In a more positive light, Marlboro's switch to a rotating block schedule improved the school for many people.", 'Marlboro High School has amazing teachers, a great curriculum, and a diverse student body. This school prepares you well for college and offers a ton of AP and honors level classes. I am really proud to be an MHS graduate!!', 'honestly i do not remember much about MHS, all i  remember is that there was no AC which kinda sucked.  senior year parking lot was a mess of course, teachers forced you to drop everything you were doing for the pledge, some teachers would forget to meet up early and would show up very late before the bell, the PARCC testing was absolutely useless but of course they did it anyways because the district is paid to administer it, but thats all i really remember.', 'Overall my experience at Marlboro High school has been a roller coaster. I started my time there with my friends from middle school spread out among the many schools in the district. Because of this, it took me until my junior year to truly find my place within the school. Since finding my place however, my experience has only been better and better. The teacher especially form a strong core for the school. There are a multitude of amazing teachers for may subjects who not only teach their subjects well, but have a knowledge in other topics and are always there to talk to whether about class or just to kill some time. The school itself is very accommodating and reasonable so long as you explain yourself and have just cause for actions. Overall a 9/10 (as the ranking is out of 5) and highly recommend.', 'Personally, my experience at Marlboro high school will be one to remember. I have made many lifelong friends and have had many people within the school help me through personal decisions about my future.', 'My overall experience at Marlboro High School has been fun. I have met so many people and my best friends. At times it was very hard to keep up with being a student athlete and being a good student but my teachers helped me a lot. High school allowed me to come out my shell and do things I never thought I would do.', 'Marlboro High School provided great resources to prepare me for college along with a great community', 'Lacks school spirit but good in every other aspect. The teachers are all incredibly kind. There are also many opportunities to get involved outside of the classroom.', 'My experience attending Marlboro High School was amazing. Over the course of the last four years, not only have I become much more intelligent, I have also enhanced my social skills. The teachers at Marlboro High School are very intelligent and friendly, and they definitely prepared me very well for college. The students as well as administrators were very easy to connect and interact with. Additionally, I believe the diversity at Marlboro High School allowed me to expand my knowledge and perspective regarding certain societal issues. Marlboro High School has also pushed me to actively participate in numerous community organizations. Moreover, joining various business clubs such as DECA and FBLA greatly sharpened my business acumen to prepare me for college as well as my future in the workforce. Overall, I would say my experience attending Marlboro High School was nothing short of fantastic as it greatly enhanced my abilities as a student as well as an active member of the community.', 'Marlboro High School was an experience like no other, for better or worse. Although I had my fair share of wonderful teachers, I also had a few that wasted my time. In addition, the guidance department is an absolute wreck.', 'I liked how we were all a community, the teachers were always there for your support. They have people that if you need to talk to about literally anything they are there for you. Our spirit is not high but when things like BOTC happens everyone is involved. We have a ton of clubs and fundraisers and they are always open about new ones.', 'Marlboro has a tough education system in which it helps better prepare for college. This school offers many different AP courses. Marlboro Highschool offers many activities.', 'Provides a good education but I wish the students had more school spirit and were more welcoming and inclusive. It also gets quite competitive at times.', 'The curriculum is rigorous and challenging, however I found that its very hard to get involved because they do not announce meetings of clubs or different activities; you just have to figure it out.']

column6: ["The academics are challenging and much of the faculty has high standards, which is appealing--the academic excellence is apparent, and there are many elective classes that can appeal to many students' interests. I've encountered a lot of teachers that are very passionate about their jobs, and it reflects in their teaching, really enriching the student experience.", "When I first started at Marlboro High School, I was faced with many expectations. If you didn't take AP's you were looked down upon. Some teachers connect with the students and aim to help them succeed. Others do not care about you or your future and will just simply push you through. The students were cliquey and it is hard for people to feel accepted. For me, I was fine with my few close friends. My grades thrived and I succeeded academically. I believe being in a school so highly ranked, set me up for success and made me stand out more while I was applying for college.", 'Marlboro High School provides many opportunities such as a variety of classes for an individual to pursue his or her passion. Marlboro High School serves in our cultural diverse community. A majority of our staff, are excellent and have built relationships with their students. Our administration makes sure that their students are on track. Marlboro High School offers a vast amount of sports and extracurricular activities such as clubs that one can involve and participate in. However, our school lacks school spirit. Overall, Marlboro High School is an outstanding school in regards to its academic and athletic achievements.', "I've had a very good high school experience at Marlboro High School.  My teachers have all been very good (for the most part).  The culture at the school is good.  You can be as involved or uninvolved in activities.  There is a broad variety for everyone.", 'Marlboro High School had great academics. I had wonderful teachers and enjoyed taking honors and AP courses.', "Although I am a sophomore, I can say that from my two years here that life moves pretty fast. There will always be the good and the bad, but sometimes one outweighs the other when it all comes down to it. I have made friends and lost friends in the two years of being here as well as watched people grow to be their own person. I have bonded with people I would have never imagined was capable of doing, but I have also have gone on this never-ending path of self-discovery. While it may be hard to judge now my full experience, I can say this; life moves pretty fast, and if you don't stop to look around once in a while, you just might miss it.", 'I really liked attending Marlboro High School. Overall, the teachers were very good; they always put the students before themselves and they made learning fun. I thoroughly enjoyed participating in school activities, like sports and the band. Everyone is very nice and academics are taken seriously.', 'Marlboro High School has ~1800 students and has a special program wich you must apply to that is geared towards studying Business.  Its a great school.', "Excellent teacher that truly care about the students. It's a great school district.  We moved to Marlboro just for the schools. My children are on the right path to success.", "I really enjoyed Marlboro High School! The academics are very good and the teachers are phenomenal, plus the teachers are always working to make sure your grades are the best. My one issue was the school's little spirit, but other than that the school was amazing!", 'I love Marlboro high school in so many different ways. That school is a safe place that I can call my second home.', 'There were some really fantastic teachers at the school and also some really bad ones. Some were disinterested in their students and just seemed to be there for their paycheck. The theatre club was my favorite part, except that a majority of the school and school board did not seem to care much about it unless they won awards. However, this school did push me and prepare me for college. The honors and AP courses were challenging and definitely taught me time management and prepared me for the workload of college.', 'Marlboro high school offers a lot of opportunities to get involved with the school like LEO club, SADD club and many others. It also has some great teachers that educate students pretty well. It definitely is a school that provides students with their own identity and helps them learn responsibility.', 'Needs AC. Overall good school academically and has good teachers and kids.  The school lunch is god awful.', 'The school offers great academics and clubs! Although the curriculum is hard and the teachers push you, it truly makes you college ready.', "Marlboro High school offers amazing teachers and academic opportunities. It's spirit is unbreakable despite not having a winning football team. Students support each other's diversity and competition challenges them to be their best self.", "School is fun. Most of the teachers are nice. They give you a lot of opportunities that you wouldn't expect. For myself the High School gave me the opportunity to go to Washington DC. However they have a lot of dumb rules that takes away from our education.", 'My experience at Marlboro High School was enjoyable and memorable. Personally, the academics the school offered were above average and each class I took challenged me throughout the whole year. The school did struggle with the importance and credibility of its clubs and extracurriculars, however, being a student athlete allowed me to make the most out of playing my sport and my high school experience.', 'What I appreciate about Marlboro High School is the teacher and student communication, how they are open to help you and will do anything in their power to make you successful and college ready etc. The academics are hard if you do not keep up with the work, but if you are conscientious then you will be just fine. The Music Department is incredible, and the instructor is extremely talented and gifted. I would highly recommend the music courses present at Marlboro. What should change in Marlboro is having an air conditioning system be installed so that in the warmer months everyone is comfortable.', 'Marlboro High School is an engaging and interactive learning environment with experienced, caring staff. There is a plethora of opportunities with activities and clubs, but at times, the administration seems to treat its students as middle school students, and it does not offer the freedoms high school students should be able to handle. It also often places its priorities in unnecessary places, such as funding one particular sport while other activities can rarely obtain any new equipment. While this can be frustrating at times, teachers and leaders in the school consistently overcome these challenges and are supportive of student endeavors.']

It also gets quite competitive at times.', 'The curriculum is rigorous and challenging, however I found that its very hard to get involved because they do not announce meetings of clubs or different activities; you just have to figure it out.']

column2: ['Parsippany Hills High school is a safe and encouraging environment and uplifts kids to do their best. It is a great diverse setting and easy to make friends. Teachers are always there to help and go the extra mile to make sure kids are doing well in their class. If you are having trouble with a class there is tutoring during lunch and after school to provide extra help for struggling students.', 'As a current senior, I have gone through almost 4 years at PHHS. Through this time, I have gotten involved in many of the clubs offered, most notably Student Council. This opened a lot of unique opportunities I believe other schools may not offer, such as running for a State Board position. Additionally, the academic programs offered at Parsippany Hills High School are rigorous and challenging, with many AP classes being offered. Overall, I would rate my school a four out of five stars.', 'My experience at PHHS has been very insightful. Teachers are very helpful and will go the extra mile to make students feel comfortable with studies and other aspects of the school environment. There is much diversity which also contribites to having a comfortable envioronment. If a student is having trouble in a class academic wise, there are tutors available after school to make sure the sutdent can fully grasp the information that they are struggling with. There are a variety of clubs and extra curricular activities to choose from that spark your interests. Seniors are also fully equiped for the college application process with help from counselors and college meetings with guidance counselors to ensure that you are ready. Overall PHHS is a safe and fun school environment to learn and socialize with other students and teachers.', 'I like how we have some more freedom. Alot more of extra after school activities. We all have these exciting events like Halloween at the hills and many more. I love we haveLike 4 years to get our selves ready for our future with some supporting hands from the staff. I would change nothing about this wonderful school.', 'Teachers are great, friendly and love teaching their students. Environment if welcoming and comfortable.', "Good school, good class selection and mostly good teachers. But has an overall lack of school spirit, which makes it boring sometimes. Principle couldn't care less about students.", 'I am going to be a Junior and my journey so far has been superlative. My teachers, counselor and the staff members have been very supportive and helpful.', 'loved the school! super diverse with very passionate and nice teachers. staff is supportive and helpful as well', 'The teachers at my school insure that we have fun, but also learn the values of high school. They want to make sure that what we learn there, we will take with us through life.', 'I enjoy attending Par Hills, however there are many things I would change and add.First of all, I think the bathrooms need a renovation. So many times I have been in the restroom and there had been rust coming from the sinks and mirrors flooding the room and tampon machines out of order. Things like this need to be fixed before putting in new turf for a football field. Secondly, one thing that is not acceptable is the teachers who work so hard day and night, do not have contracts right now and are getting paid a lot less than they used to. This is unfair for these loving, caring and overall great people who deserve better.  Overall, however Parsippany Hills is a great place to learn and grow with hardworking teachers and a joyful environment.', 'I would like for there to more diversity in the staff and more money into the music and art programs especially drama. There are so many activities and clubs that the schools offer and so many resources to help.  But overall this school has shaped me to have a readiness for college.', 'There seems to be way too much homework, no support and the teachers have no regard for student well being. They keep piling homework upon hoe work and students have to spend more than 3 hours on homework (no joke). the teachers seem a bit sadistic, especially the biology teacgers', 'Parsippany Hills High School has a very friendly staff and faculty as well as the students. This high school offers countless clubs, sports and other activities to full in some time after school. PHHS also delivers the challenges necessary for life after high school. Most students that come out of PHHS are intelligent and set out to conquer what comes to them.', "It's a pretty good school. There are many many many nice teachers. You can get some that are not great though, like any school. There are many sports and we are pretty good at sports. We have around on average about one thousand kids at our school. We are rated pretty high in the state academically, and most kids are pretty smart.", 'It is a pretty average High School. Though there is a sense of community and a willingness to help each other out.', 'Since Freshman Year I was able to observe the changes made by the administration to make the school safer and better.', 'Parsippany Hills High School is an excellent school. The administration is always willing to communicate with students and solve problems. The school offers healthy options, but I would request more vegetarian options. Overall, I am satisfied with my high school career.', 'Awesome school with caring staff and good education god range of subjects (has astronomy yay) but sometimes I feel the amount of diversity is really bad due to the overwhelming amount of Asian students, poor diversity.', 'I graduated Parsippany Hills High School in 2015 and found that it prepared me enough for my college career without really going above and beyond with it. However, I did have several teachers who were able to help me find the career choice that was right for me.', "The culture, the teachers and the variety of activities that our school offers is mind blowing.  I came to the school last year and I feel like I know the school and the people there since forever. Parsippany hills high school has a very warm and inviting environment and the teachers and staff members make you very comfortable. The school academically is also excellent. There's huge list of electives that the school provides. The teachers consistently encourage students to take up the path that would lead to success. Apart from that, the school has a variety of sports including lacrosse, field hockey and shot put."]

column6: ["Parsippany Hills High School is a really great school. All of the teachers and faculty truly care about each and every student's learning experience. This school is far above the state average in key measures of college and career readiness. Even at schools with strong college and career readiness, there may be students who are not getting the opportunities they need to succeed.", "Since I'm a senior at Parsippany Hills High School I learned a lot throughout the years. From learning computer programming to college readiness, I would say that this school is very well-rounded in the sense that you are getting a quality education from an urban high school. I would like to see some changes in the facilities and some more help with college readiness. I feel like there should be a semester course or something like a class or such that does help prepare us better for college and what's ahead.", 'I liked the faculty and the guidance staff. All have been very helpful as I prepare for college. I also enjoy the variety of courses one can take as a student. There are endless electives and several classes per subject.', "I love that teachers are so passionate about their jobs and are willing to help a student in need. They are accommodating to everyone's needs and make school a safe learning space for kids. They prepare their students for the real world, especially college. I thought I would be overwhelmed with the college work load but having a high school that takes its studies seriously, I was very prepared. The student body was also extremely diverse which helped me interact with new people from different cultures.", 'I think the schools is okay but the main issue is that they don’t give enough importance to some sports. Tennis, for example. The tennis courts are in horrible condition with cracks,  hole and plants growing out everywhere.', 'Above average education-- excellent teachers. Tightening security is good, but some measures leave students wondering if they have any freedom left.', 'I really think that Parsippany Hills, and even just the Parsippany School District is very good. It is a good community with a good environment and the schools only add to that. The teachers and administration are positive and I think that they truly care about the students at their school. I would add a few more classes just so that everyone has something that they want to take, every year. I would especially add American Sign Language as a class and I am honestly surprised that PHHS does not already offer it. I think that course would be a great learning experience and provide even more diversity and inclusion to the school.', 'I liked the student aspect of Parsippany hills high school. The teachers do not  ignore their students,they take the time to teach them and help them out whenever the student is struggling. Furthermore, they do not disregard the concerns of the students and they actually try to find ways to solve the problems.The part that I would recommend needed to be changed is the control of the school. It can be sometimes too controlling like signing into the bathrooms or staying in the school. It does not allow for a lot of room to feel that you are free.', "I think the school is nice but it is lack of diversity.I've had a hard time at that school mainly because it is hard to find a lot of people who look like me and who come from my culture. Some teachers are strict, but they are very accessible and willing to help you.", 'Good diversity of students, efficient resources for students, quality teaching staff, lots of extracurricular opportunities, great education', "It's a nice school, a nice curriculum but honestly, it's lack of diversity is astonishing. I've had a hard time at that school mainly because it is hard to find a lot of people who look like me and who come from my culture. Also, it's ability for the counselors to empathize with the students is kind of sad. Instead of offering actual help, they just scare you into not coming forward with anything. This really needs to be worked on.", "I have nothing bad to say about this school because I had a wonderful and memorable experience. The only thing I wish was different was my classmates, but that is not the school's fault. Some people were just more mature than others.", 'I’ve had a very successful high school academic career. Teachers and staff are very accessible and eager to help you with any challenges you face.', "PHHS is a pretty good school in comparison to a lot of other schools. The teachers can be good or difficult, depending on who you get. Administration doesn't really do much, but school spirit isn't terrible.", "Parsippany Hills High has been a great experience for me for the past three years. I'm currently going through my fourth year in this school, and I can safely say that the teachers, students, and staff have made it all a great learning experience. I am prepared to continue my journey and life thanks to the amazing teachers and staff that supported and helped me throughout the way. Go Vikings!", 'This school is a place that the community comes together along with people of different cultures. This is a fun place to go to school. The teachers are almost as welcoming as the students. Go here and it will make high school a blast!', "Academically, Parsippany Hills is a great school because of the passionate teachers and highly-motivated students. Teachers don't like to teach for tests, rather to further students' knowledge which pushes the students out of their comfort zone to learn, not for grades, instead for the wisdom and experience. The school spirit is through the roof and racial and ethnic diversity is one of the best parts of the school.", 'I love Parsippany Hills. The teachers genuinely care about us students and are committed to teaching. The principals, health department, custodians, and cafeteria staff are also very pleasant and caring. There is nothing in particular I have a problem with.', "A great high school with a lot of academic and co-curricular activities. The teachers are also great and it's a lot of fun.", 'I like that this high school has great teachers and most of the other students are great too. The teachers definitely know the subjects they are in charge of. The school also is very diverse which I think is helpful in preparing for the "real world". Many students are friendly and likable. Despite a recent addition, the school is still older, so it is not in the best condition in certain areas like the bathrooms. However, every year I\'ve been at this school, we have had a real incident when we needed police, fire department, etc. I would say I am ready for college after 4 years at Parsippany Hills High School.']

column2: ['HHHS is a great place to learn and grow as a student. There are many clubs and activities you can join to become more involved and make new friends. There is also many sports team to choose from and are all kind and supportive. The teachers at hhhs are very kind and will help you if you ask for it. Some, like all schools are a little more strict but are still very nice. As for the food, there are many options to choose from, although some lunches may be questionable. Lastly, the School is very safe. Administration has taken many precautions to guarantee the students safety.', 'I loved being involved in the theatre and music programs and loved watching them grow at my time at HHHS.', 'Support for the arts is amazing.  Facilities could use an upgrade, especially the auditorium.  Faculty is great, very supportive.', "My experience at Hen Hud was a very fruitful experience over my four years-- a time of great growth and great understanding about myself. While there are many great things to say about the school itself, notably the number of great clubs and activities to choose from, what takes the metaphorical cake in this instance is the people. Hen Hud would not be what it is without the people, kind students, facilitated by many kind teachers-- teachers who genuinely care about the next generation's education. While there are many bad teachers there too, and the administration fails to deal with them, the overall experience is not spoiled by their bad deeds.", 'The school itself, and the education *generally* provided is acceptable. The English department throughout the district is above average. The administrators at the high school are historically terrible.', 'I have highly enjoyed my time at Hendrick Hudson and not only did I gain knowledge from my experience I was also able to meets the friends who turned me into the person I am today. The school offers great classes and many great sports programs.', 'The administration is horrible, the food is bad, most of the teachers suck and there disciplining system is terrible. Overall it’s one of the worst schools in Westchester County.', 'Hen hud is a terrible school. Being there sucks, half the teachers suck and everything about it sucks.', "it's not the worst school but the administration is very blind to all the issues like no diversity at all none its just Hispanics and Caucasians.there are so many drugs and sex it's like a college frat so many fight drama knives. the food is cringy I feel like the students make it bad but the administration doesn't help make it better and racism is a huge problem as well as homophobia and general discrimination. The stuff that happens sometimes is appaling", 'My experience as a student at Hendrick Hudson High School has been excellent. The teachers genuinely care about the betterment of their students, and I have found them very easy to approach and talk to throughout my four years. The only things I would change is the quality of the food served to the students, and the attendance system.', 'I had a great experience at Hendrick Hudson High School. Our nation has been struck with several tragedies regarding school shootings and casualties, and luckily, I never felt unsafe coming to school. We have bodyguards, have practiced lockdown drills several times, and know the rules around the school. With the school environment, bullying has never been an issue. I have never experienced harassment and unfair treatment from others myself, but I have not seen any instances of bullying occurring in the school. Peer Leadership, a program I have been a part of for two years, enables upperclassmen to interact and help first-year students throughout their incoming year into high school. We also have great teachers and students who all contribute to making the sailor community a great one! I am very thankful for being a student here for four years and look forward to my journey at Sacred Heart University.', 'Hendrick Hudson, like most every other school and environment is an example of "You get out what you put in."  I had a great experience there, and felt fully-prepared when I went off to college. I made great friends, and always found the teachers to be not only available, but extremely attentive and proactive in my education.  I am moving back to the district so that my children will get to benefit from this experience.', 'Hendrick Hudson School District has the most incredible staff that are always willing to go above and beyond working with their students to ensure they succeed.   The music department and drama club are superb. The numerous extracurricular opportunities that are available to our children is a great way to have them be involved in the school.  Thank you to our dedicated teachers who truly make our children flourish by being so involved and caring.  It is also a tremendous support to see administration attend all events in the district.', 'Attending Hed Hud was  positive experience overall. They have good sports teams, great teachers and involved guidance counselors. They offered a variety of AP programs and science programs. Being able to take AP courses early on greatly helped me save money and be prepared for college. Hen Hud was relatively diverse and had many clubs available for students.', 'I would not say my time at handpick hudson high school was the best experience of my life, but I learned a lot and developed close relationships with my teachers and friends.', 'The teachers and staff are incredible. The classes have given me an enormous amount of knowledge that I will be forever grateful for.', 'Health and Safety is not an issue here.', 'Lots of options, great for everyone.', 'Parents make change happen in the district.', 'Teachers care for your education if you care too.']

The classes have given me an enormous amount of knowledge that I will be forever grateful for.', 'Health and Safety is not an issue here.', 'Lots of options, great for everyone.', 'Parents make change happen in the district.', 'Teachers care for your education if you care too.']
column6: ['No one really notices that people do drugs after school and they all do it behind school which and I think there should be security behind the school and when people walk behind the school and when they are smelling what people are talking it also puts their life at rist', 'there should be a winter pep rally too and more sprit weeks', "Mrs. Zenon is very rude even though I didn't want to change classes she changes my classes and shes not my guidance concealer but Mr. Yee and other teachers are the best", "Teachers need to ask students after class if they need help with anything for then the teachers help them because students won't say anything because the might feel weird asking but not getting asked.", 'This school is very secure.  You must buzz in to the front desk and all visitors must sign in as a guest.  I feel very safe because the staff is very aware of the possible dangers.', "There are many clubs offered for many different types of people in the school.  Popular clubs include SEED, Student Government, and the different honor societies.  There are a wide variety of sports offered as well.  The most popular are football, soccer, lacrosse, and track.  The whole school is very involved in sports teams as well as the different clubs, including drama and the orchestra.  Overall, I would say that the people in this school are very supportive of everyone's interests.", "Everyone at my school has been nothing but kind, supportive, and helpful.  There is always someone there that you can rely on and that has made my high school experience so great.  I wouldn't be the person I am today without my teachers, family, and peers.  I feel that I have been well prepared for college.", 'My teachers go above and beyond whenever I need help with the subject material.  They are always there to listen and they have given me great knowledge.  I know that if I ever need anything, they will be more than willing to help me.  They only want to see their students succeed and I really appreciate that.', 'Many service, music, sports clubs available.', 'The teachers I have had go above and beyond.', 'I feel safe in my school but there are some incidents that happen where I think that my safety is on the line', "I love my after school activities. I'm in the green team and the gay straight alliance. I love them both equally. They are so fun and informative. They both teach me to be more respectful towards the environment and the LGBT community.", "The teachers are cool. They always help when you're not understanding the topic. They even help you when you have problems outside the classroom.", 'although there are some clubs for students to join, there could be a wider variety. There should be funding for almost all activities as well', 'Being an alumni from Hendrick Hudson High School I can say that this school built me for the work load that I would have entering college, showed me time management, and the importance of prioritizing my future', 'This school can use some upgrading in the athletic department', "There is a wide variety of clubs and organizations for this school's students", 'Health and Safety Policies are are a priority in this school district.', 'I cannot complain about my 4 yrs at Hen Hud.  I have participated in sports, clubs have great friends and have done great academically.', "to be honest I rarely eat the food from the cafeteria and bring lunch.  I have a life threatening peanut / tree nut allergy so since I was little I've always brought my own lunch and am more comfortable in doing so"]
