column2: ['The teachers were heavily engaging and extremely involved in student life. Education quality was outstanding. Lots of school spirit activities. Sports are inescapable. Pretty competitive environment, but faculty/counselors are attentive and encouraging. Disability support services are exceptional. Administration allows students to go out on their lunch periods [freshmen excluded].Lack of diversity, not only in ethnicity, but in individuality as well. There are a lot of cliquish girls and guys who are all into "the same thing".  Bullying, especially indirect harassment, is an issue. Typical teenage attitude is reinforced by students and staff. Little wiggle room at this school. It isn\'t just hobby/academic based; if you break high school stereotypes, you\'re either  monstrously loved or nothing more than a background prop.', 'Overall I believe that Wantagh Senior High School is a wonderful learning facility with lots of amazing opportunities for many young adults as long as they put their minds and hearts towards it! The staff here is amazing, the guidance counselors are people that I feel fully comfortable going to to have a nice conversation and to go for help with anything I need. In addition the teachers are great, there are multiple teachers in this school that have really had a lasting positive impact on myself. The only thing I would like to see change in this school is more support of the Drama, Arts, and Music departments as it sometimes feels they are overshadowed by the sports departments, but overall Wantagh is a wonderful school!!', 'I have made so many friends in Wantagh. We have such a good community and the high School is an extension of that. Our towns sports are one of the best on the island. Almost all sporting events have big crowds at Wantagh. We have so much help from parents, teachers and students. At all events, there are items being sold like food and clothing attire. The academics here are great. The teachers are always giving help whenever it is needed. There is extra help three days a week after school that many students attend. Wantagh is a very safe place to live and go to school. There is security at all entrances of the building at all times and all the doors are always locked. We have many clubs and activities for students to get involved in.', 'Wantagh Senior High School is a great school within an excellent school district. Awesome teachers and staff make the school day not that bad. There are lots of activities to choose from and there was never a boring day.', 'Wantagh High School gave me the opportunity to push myself and see what I am truly capable of both academically and personally. It is an average high school with not many resources, however if you use what is offered to you, you can make the best out of it. The faculty is dedicated and want students to succeed, especially in the AP and honors courses. I have had a great experience here.', 'My experience was amazing! Loves the School, teachers, Staff, and students. The teachers prepared us well for college. Best experience ever!!', 'My four years at Wantagh High school have been enjoyable. All of the teachers will go out of their way to help you no matter what you need. Another plus is that everyone that I was in elementary and middle school with stays together throughout the years. The marching band is an excellent and fun program, I participated three out of my four years. Model Congress and chess club were also a good addition to after school activities, that a group of kids can bond over a common interest. If I were to see one thing change at wantagh it would be that it is very sports oriented.', 'Wantagh Senior High School is an wonderful high school with very friendly people, a great staff, and has the best athletics in the county. This school is always equip for what you need on a daily basis. Wantagh football, baseball, hockey, soccer teams, etc. are always fun to watch and the student section is always loud and ready for the other team. School lunches aren’t that great but what public school has off the chart food? None is the answer! But our lunch ladies are still nice and helpful with getting what you want hot and fresh. We offer many clubs and activities to join from academic clubs to Christianity clubs to language clubs. Our school has many security guards that come to the games and are with us throughout the school time and even after hours making sure we are safe and being respectful. I wouldn’t trade my high school for anything my experience here has been one I will never forget.', 'Wantagh High School was a school where everyone got along.  Made great friends and sports were amazing.', 'My overall experience with Wantagh High School is pretty good as being a Senior there now, I have learned many new thing with having fun on the side.', 'Very good school. The teachers are always available to help you and provide you with the skills you need for college.', 'For the most part, the school is very nice.  The teachers are helpful and usually look to help students better understand topics.  The bathrooms, however, need major improvements.  The technology is so-so.  The Wi-Fi is terrible and the many laptops/computers are out of date.', "Teachers are extremely approachable and easy to talk to. I am never nervous to ask a question or write an answer on the board. The students are nice as well, although they tend to stay in their groups. There is always something going on that is talked about for a week then completely forgotten about. The cafeteria food isn't bad, definitely need to go for the deli section though. The new dean is very strict and takes attendance very seriously.", 'Wantagh Senior High School is the best place I could ever imagine my high school education to be at. Their emphasis on not only academics but also athletics and extracurriculars is extraordinary. Wantagh Senior High School truly offers the best, most balanced education.', 'Wantagh provides a good education however there is a clear lack of diversity and the food is also very poor', 'I had a great experience here at Wantagh High School.  I loved all my teachers, all the sports, and all my friends.  Although it was a lot of work at times, everyone was there to help.  It always felt very safe and it was like one big happy family.  Wantagh High School prepared me for college tremendously and if i had to do another four years in that school, I would do it in a heartbeat.', 'Very cliquey, and very conformed.  Everyone here is obsessed with Mr. Benner, Bango Bowls, Moe\'s and sports.  Sportsnite is insanity: girls in tutus everywhere running around screaming with their faces colored half black or gold (Gold & Black are our school colors).  Our school spirit is ridiculous.  You will occasionally hear a drama kid belt out Bohemian Rhapsody in the hallway.  In my opinion, I think that the art department is superb, and deserves a lot more resources.  There is constant political warfare and it\'s really annoying.  Students consume copious amounts of alcohol and like to go to "Coors Island".  I would say that high school has been pretty awful, but the administration is very good and wants to keep us safe.  Counselors don\'t exactly know what is going on all the time.  Academics are pretty competitive.', 'Wantagh High School was great. The faculty helped me progress to the apt individual I am today, and my Guidance Counselor helped me along the way.', 'Wantagh High School has totally prepared me for college. I had so many opportunities in high school which have led me to determine my future career path. Starting my junior year I was given the opportunity to take college and AP level classes. Coming into college I had 27 credits letting my come in as a Sophomore. Wantagh High School was a friendly community with such awesome teachers who challenged our intelligence and prepared us for the future.', 'My experience at Wantagh High School was great. They prepared me well for college and made sure I was on track to go to college. The teachers at Wantagh High School were great and made the learning experience amazing. They taught the material well and prepared you for the future. There were various clubs and activities that a person could join. They were experiential and a good time. The sports at Wantagh are also very competitive. The team is in the highest division and place in the top almost all the time. Wantagh is also a very safe place. I felt safe and not scared like I was going to get attacked at any moment. The overall experience at Wantagh was great.']

column6: ['Most of the funding for clubs and extracurricular activities goes to sports but there are also a variety of other clubs and academic groups you can be a part of.', "My overall experience here was good and bad. High school isn't the easiest time for most, but there were some great things that made it all worth it. I met lifelong friends here. Teachers have inspired my greatly. My art teacher was my favorite, she went above and beyond and put her all into helping her students.", 'I have had some of the best teachers in this high school who inspired me with not only schoolwork but in life to be a better person. They care, are knowledgeable, and approachable. Willing to help you every step of the way', 'If I had the choice of repeating my high school experience or going to a new school, I would not change a thing. We have so many clubs to choose from, sports teams from football to badminton, and teachers who really try to help you the best they can. Students preform amazing plays, and we have clubs like sportsnite that allow girls to gain an experience that they might not get anywhere else.', 'Most teachers are willing to go the extra mile helping students to get the best education they can. They try to relate real life situation to the ones we are currently learning about, so the topics seem relevant and interesting.', 'This school truly provides everything one needs to succeed, you just have to work hard.', 'Wantagh High School isn\'t called the "School of Excellence" for no reason. When you walk into the double doors at the front of the school I can guarantee that the first person you see will greet you with a warm smile. The 6 or so hours that I am at school, I feel safe and happy. Most kids dread waking up for school in the morning, but I didn\'t at all because it\'s not even like school. Sure you learn, but the teachers make it exciting where students want to engage in the conversation/lesson. Wantagh is just like one big family.', 'there is something for everyone', 'the school is strict on their policies for students', 'there are so many opportunities for sports and school teams, etc.', 'The teachers and staff are very compassionate and understanding and are there for their students and parents', 'Many clubs and after school activities available', 'Some teachers are better than others', 'There are a variety of clubs', 'There are policies in place to keep the chiledren safe', 'I really enjoyed how supportive all of my teachers and classmates were to me throughout my high school experience.  Truthfully, no one has ever been forgotten.', "The food isn't terrible but its isn't desirable either.  There is no salad option and most of the fool served has been frozen. Next to nothing is freshly prepared.", 'The guidance councelors are difficult to get a hold of but when they are in their offices, they are very helpful.  I am Miss Wantagh 2014 and as Miss Wantagh, my principal let me lead an anti bullying day where all of the students wore the color orange and pledged against bullying', "I am not involved with a sports team but from what I've seen from events like Homecoming, the school spirit is high and the field is heated.  Every year, the football team gets new uniforms and equipment.", 'There is a smartboard in almost every classroom and the teachers use them appropriately and often incorporate student participation.  Each teacher individually analyzes the needs of their students and provides them with the assistance that tjey need to learn and grow as both students and people.']

column2: ['It was a great experience being in this school.Everyone was very nice and very caring. I love our sports team because we are very talented. The teachers were down to earth and taught us very well. Not a bad bone in my high school', "Pompton Lakes High School is a warm, welcoming environment where you're encouraged to create life long relationships with teachers, as well as peers. I've personally been able to connect and relate to so many trustworthy and influential teachers who I can always turn to in any situation.", 'A very prideful school built on traditions. Always felt like home. Teachers and staff were personable, and highly intellectual. Great support system all around, especially from principal and vice principal. Academics were always promising, and easy to get extra help in. The students are looked after educationally, mentally, and any other aspect that a parent could hope for when sending their children to school. Any small town drama that may have happened, was easily handled and hugged out.', 'My experience at Pompton Lakes High School has been great. Teachers are warm and welcoming and are willing to help you with anything you may need. It is the type of school where everyone knows everyone, which overall gives the school a welcoming environment.', 'Tradition is what makes Pompton Lakes High School stand out amongst all the other high schools around. The high school traditions have been around since the school first opened in 1933.', 'Pompton Lakes High School was great for a variety of different reasons. First of all: OPEN LUNCH! What’s more exciting then that! You get to walk out to town and get lunch, or drive home rather then eat in a stuffy cafeteria. Second the school is very personable, meaning all of the teachers, staff, and even the principal and vice principal knew everyone by name ! It made each student feel like they were important and an individual not just a number. Sports were a big thing for PLHS and our bird cage was always cheering at every sporting event. The thing that makes PLHS really special though is that you won’t find many schools like it, you feel at home and like you’re part of this big family.', 'PLHS is a very close and family-like community. You will not find one teacher or staff member that does not care for you as if you are one of their own. Everyone would like to see you strive and be the best that you could be. Everyone is rooting for you. You will always have a family and a support team at PLHS.', 'This high school is all about pride and tradition, making it feel like a home right from the start. The teachers and faculty are caring and inspirational role models.', 'Pompton Lakes High School is a great school where students can connect with teachers and administration and have meaningful relationships with them. It is one of the safest schools and the culture there is amazing.', 'I like how involved the teachers and principle is. They are many opportunities to be involved and excel at Pompton. However, it is not the most diverse place, so when going to college it is a bit of a shock being introduced to a whole new setting.', 'This is my last year at the High School and the time flew by. Looking back, I have many found memories from the 12 years I have been in this school district. It has certainty left a lasting impression on how I will live my life. I would not choose anywhere else to grow up then in Pompton lakes.', 'I would change nothing about this high school. Though it took much adjustment, PLHS has made me push boundaries and really challenge myself to search for my limits. It gives every student a second home may I say. I would change the amount of clubs PLHS consists of; maybe an LGBT club or a glee club. All of these possibilities would attract more people to the school and really make kids feel more at home.', "I really enjoy niche. While I'm slimming my college choices down, niche is assisting me in that process with all the amazing options where I can view certain things on each college. I really like what this website offers and how it is legitimate information on each college.", "I'm very happy in this school, and it is definitely a great place to go to high school. With the help of teachers, I have grown into the person I am today. The atmosphere here is great, and our school is full of tradition and pride.  The teachers are friendly, and I always look forward to school. ", "For its size, there are quite a few AP classes to choose from as well as clubs, reputable athletic programs, and other opportunities to get involved. The worst part by far would be the guidance department. They push you towards local schools even if you're grades and activities are well above average. They really don't worth with you all that well and If what you want isn't offered, forget about having them help you figure it out; you're better off taking a class online on your own time. However, the guidance dept. is only a small part of the school. The teachers, staff, and administrators are, for the most part, absolutely amazing. If you need help with your work, a personal problem, or even if you just need someone to complain about the guidance department to, you will find a teacher that will listen and probably be able to help. ", 'There are many clubs and sports available at PLHS', 'The majority of the teachers treat the students with respect and are truly interested in listening to their needs and concerns. They will go above and beyond for the students if asked by either student or parent and follow through.  I am very happy with our family oriented high school', 'I attended this school as well as my husband. I never had issues as a student 30 + years ago, but I have noticed the administration has no tolerance policy and all students are acceptive of students individual choices', 'The community works together closely. Like any town there will be differences, but as a tight community we work together with the school system to create a positive environment.  I feel the students at Pompton Lakes are given every opportunity to achieve their goals with guidance from both home and educators.', 'I feel safe in this school, we have lock down drills often to make sure this school stays secure.']
column4: ['It was a great experience being in this school.Everyone was very nice and very caring. I love our sports team because we are very talented. The teachers were down to earth and taught us very well. Not a bad bone in my high school', "Pompton Lakes High School is a warm, welcoming environment where you're encouraged to create life long relationships with teachers, as well as peers. I've personally been able to connect and relate to so many trustworthy and influential teachers who I can always turn to in any situation.", 'A very prideful school built on traditions. Always felt like home. Teachers and staff were personable, and highly intellectual. Great support system all around, especially from principal and vice principal. Academics were always promising, and easy to get extra help in. The students are looked after educationally, mentally, and any other aspect that a parent could hope for when sending their children to school. Any small town drama that may have happened, was easily handled and hugged out.', 'My experience at Pompton Lakes High School has been great. Teachers are warm and welcoming and are willing to help you with anything you may need. It is the type of school where everyone knows everyone, which overall gives the school a welcoming environment.', 'Tradition is what makes Pompton Lakes High School stand out amongst all the other high schools around. The high school traditions have been around since the school first opened in 1933.', 'Pompton Lakes High School was great for a variety of different reasons. First of all: OPEN LUNCH! What’s more exciting then that! You get to walk out to town and get lunch, or drive home rather then eat in a stuffy cafeteria. Second the school is very personable, meaning all of the teachers, staff, and even the principal and vice principal knew everyone by name ! It made each student feel like they were important and an individual not just a number. Sports were a big thing for PLHS and our bird cage was always cheering at every sporting event. The thing that makes PLHS really special though is that you won’t find many schools like it, you feel at home and like you’re part of this big family.', 'PLHS is a very close and family-like community. You will not find one teacher or staff member that does not care for you as if you are one of their own. Everyone would like to see you strive and be the best that you could be. Everyone is rooting for you. You will always have a family and a support team at PLHS.', 'This high school is all about pride and tradition, making it feel like a home right from the start. The teachers and faculty are caring and inspirational role models.', 'Pompton Lakes High School is a great school where students can connect with teachers and administration and have meaningful relationships with them. It is one of the safest schools and the culture there is amazing.', 'I like how involved the teachers and principle is. They are many opportunities to be involved and excel at Pompton. However, it is not the most diverse place, so when going to college it is a bit of a shock being introduced to a whole new setting.', 'This is my last year at the High School and the time flew by. Looking back, I have many found memories from the 12 years I have been in this school district. It has certainty left a lasting impression on how I will live my life. I would not choose anywhere else to grow up then in Pompton lakes.', 'I would change nothing about this high school. Though it took much adjustment, PLHS has made me push boundaries and really challenge myself to search for my limits. It gives every student a second home may I say. I would change the amount of clubs PLHS consists of; maybe an LGBT club or a glee club. All of these possibilities would attract more people to the school and really make kids feel more at home.', "I really enjoy niche. While I'm slimming my college choices down, niche is assisting me in that process with all the amazing options where I can view certain things on each college. I really like what this website offers and how it is legitimate information on each college.", "I'm very happy in this school, and it is definitely a great place to go to high school. With the help of teachers, I have grown into the person I am today. The atmosphere here is great, and our school is full of tradition and pride.  The teachers are friendly, and I always look forward to school. ", "For its size, there are quite a few AP classes to choose from as well as clubs, reputable athletic programs, and other opportunities to get involved. The worst part by far would be the guidance department. They push you towards local schools even if you're grades and activities are well above average. They really don't worth with you all that well and If what you want isn't offered, forget about having them help you figure it out; you're better off taking a class online on your own time. However, the guidance dept. is only a small part of the school. The teachers, staff, and administrators are, for the most part, absolutely amazing. If you need help with your work, a personal problem, or even if you just need someone to complain about the guidance department to, you will find a teacher that will listen and probably be able to help. ", 'There are many clubs and sports available at PLHS', 'The majority of the teachers treat the students with respect and are truly interested in listening to their needs and concerns. They will go above and beyond for the students if asked by either student or parent and follow through.  I am very happy with our family oriented high school', 'I attended this school as well as my husband. I never had issues as a student 30 + years ago, but I have noticed the administration has no tolerance policy and all students are acceptive of students individual choices', 'The community works together closely. Like any town there will be differences, but as a tight community we work together with the school system to create a positive environment.  I feel the students at Pompton Lakes are given every opportunity to achieve their goals with guidance from both home and educators.', 'I feel safe in this school, we have lock down drills often to make sure this school stays secure.']
column6: ['There are always kids in the music/art rooms after school. Kids will stay at school for as long as the teacher in the room does and it is a great way to make friends.', "I love how my school has traditions of having assembly's during special times of the school year. Students get to start the school year together, and end it together in assemblies. Our principal also started the tradition of having a Halloween assembly, and a Christmas/new year assembly. My school is also unique because it is one of the few schools in New Jersey that allows all students to leave the building for lunch.  I would choose to start back at freshmen year if I could, because of all the freedom you're allowed in this school", 'The teachers at this school are amazing!! Each teacher has their different personality, and it is very effective in achieving the grades that I currently am. They are extremely friendly, and if you put the effort in, they love taking the time to get to know you!', 'I have attended multiple parent / teacher events where the staff stresses the importance of having a variety of options and ensuring that each and every child joins something to be involved. They slightly push involvement which is great.  There are options for athletes and science kids - variety for all.', 'I do think the majority of teachers do invest their time and effort into the kids and they do want them to succeed.  My daughter was injured this last year at a team sporting event, and the athletic director and coaches all reached out multiple times and truly helped her in and out of school while she healed up.  I do think the school sends a family vibe of caring about the kids and their education.  I think our front office is clueless and definitely needs to be more informed and operate as a professional office - speaking to the high school kids as young adults.  You cannot expect the kids to address adults respectfully, unless you speak to them in the same fashion and show by example.  The office should be kept aware of teacher policies and more aware of details in my opinion.', 'I know they hold a few conferences throughout the year for anti- bullying and sensitive topics.  They bring in speakers and also have the kids watch films.  I think they put a real effort into addressing these issues and make it known that there is a zero tolerance rule.', 'I believe our school has a great sense of pride and tradition and they do put strong effort into the kids experience and growth.  They try to engage them in a variety of sports and clubs to ensure the kids are involved outside the classroom.  If the kids are part of a team or club they are more likely to feel included, needed responsible and involved.  The teachers do make time for the kids, but I think they could work on streamlining all the classroom rules as many teachers grading policies / extra credit / make up work all differ.  I believe process should be more uniform between teachers especially during testing times.', 'The police officers everyday walk through the halls to check the doors to make sure they are locked. Also falling asleep in class the student is sent to get a drug test.', 'There are many clubs, sports, and other activities such as book club that students have formed in the school.', 'I would do it all over again because my high school experience was the best. The teachers and staff were very helpful with any student that needed help.', 'The teachers in the school are outstanding and do not stop teaching or helping until the student understands what is going on', 'Being at Pompton Lakes High School for the past 4 years has really shaped me to be a better person. The teachers at this school really go the extra mile to make sure their students know the material being taught. Many times I have stayed after school for hours to get extra help in classes. The principal and vice principal are essential in this school, if a student is having a hard time or just needs to talk to someone, they will clear their schedule to help out. The guidance department however is one of the worst departments I\'ve seen in my 13 years old schooling (K-12). They only started to care about my senior class at the end of junior year when a good portion of the class failed the PARCC test. Also as a student athlete the guidance department has little to no knowledge about playing sports in college and how to approach colleges concerning that. Also they will force students to apply to 3 schools. Also as a committed DII athlete my guidance counselor did not understand that being "committed" means that I applied to the school, filled out a FAFSA, got into the school and said I will be attending there in the fall. The issue got so bad my parents got involved and I haven\'t got an apology yet. \r The sports in Pompton Lakes High School are a critical part of the school and student body. The students in this school only attend football games, but even of the students that do attend, its the same groups of kids every game. I am involved with the marching band and the varsity field hockey team and the amount of student support for the band is little to none. The only time where there is support shown is when the band plays "Uptown Funk" by Bruno Mars in the football stands. For field hockey, we went to our county final and state sectional final. At both these games there was a good student fan section in attendance but a regular season game had maybe 3 students show up.', 'Going to school in Pompton helped me decide what I want to go to college for and also highlighted many other hidden interests of mine.', 'My school is ranked very well in my state and has many programs and activities to participate in.  The reason it gets a 4 star rating is because of its lack of STEM related programs.', "The sports programs are coached by dedicated staff and the student body supports the athletes tremendously. There are a lot of clicks within the school, but the administration is very diligent with regards to maintaining order within the school. Bullying is not tolerated and is handled efficiently. Overall the teachers are approachable and they give 100% to the students.It's a great school and I would attend this school if I had to do it all over again.", 'there is a variety in  foods. \r there was certain days i could not eat meet or other dairy products and i was able to find food to eat', 'bullying is now being taken seriously now opposed to my freshman year. \r The cops are called in depending on the situation. \r The dress code is taken seriously. if a staff members considers that you are violating the dress code they will make you go change.', 'a lot of the teams(soccer, tennis, football, baseball, wrestling, bowling, cheerleading, fencing) go to finals or have members who win high honor awards in certain fields as best players of the year', "they are always there when you need them.\r they are there to help you succeed. \r if a student was to fail it is definitely due to the student's lack of interest.\r You can get get all Fs on a tests, but if you work hard in class and do all your homework the teachers will work with you so you won't receive an F", 'i was in book club, band, tutoring (spanish/english), stage crew, and assembly committee']

column2: ['The interactions between the students and the teachers is unmatched. The teachers truly care about their students and want them to be as successful as possible. The teachers put in time with their students, since the school is not as large as other high schools, that builds a connection between them. There are many memorable teachers that I know are loved by their students.', 'It was an alright experience. There are definitely some social issues that needed to be fixed such as bullying and some discrimination. The teachers were usually friendly in my experience but the administration not as much.', 'Very small school which is better because you know everyone in the school which is easier to make friends. The teachers and staff are very friendly and understanding. The teachers will go out of their way to help a student understand the material. The staff are friendly and very easy to get along with. Overall this school is outstanding', 'John Glenn is considered a small school.  Our graduating class is just under 200 students.  So, you pretty much know all of your classmates.  Most all I have been going to school with since kindergarten. I have been involved in community service club, Italian club, international club and have joined a few school teams.  In the winter I run on the cross country team.  There aren’t too late on our school team. In my senior year there were only 7 of us.  We had a great time running together.  In the winter of my freshman year I participated in winter track.   I joined the girls softball team in middle school and played throughout my high school years.  It was my favorite sport.  Although these are the clubs and teams I participated in there is so many other clubs and teams for all to enjoy.  I’m glad I was able to attend John Glenn high school.', 'My two kids currently attend the middle school and soon will be joining John Glenn. I have not heard anything negative. I even know a very prestigious doctor that went to this school district and graduated from Harvard! Also, his son followed his path and also graduated Harvard! It really all depends on the ability you of the child along with the help they have to achieve what they want to. I’m more than happy with the school district and cannot wait until my kids attend John Glenn.', "Glenn is a great place don't get me wrong. I love it but the biggest problem is we don't have a lot of kids. We are a very small district. Nevertheless most of the teachers are great, sports are taken seriously but also we have a lot of honors kids that play sports too. We have gotten the student athlete awards many times in a row for pretty much every sport.", 'I have had an incredible experience at John H. Glenn High School. With only 200 students per grade, everyone knows each other  which calls for personal and special memories. Teachers form valuable bonds with their students which results in greater success. At John Glenn, there are numerous events in which all students attend and have a great time; such as pep rally, homecoming, volleyball-a-thon, and prom. Going off to college is going to be a great experience, but I will certainly miss everything John H. Glenn has to offer.', 'I have enjoyed my experience here a lot. When i started wearing hijab, everyone was supportive and the community supported me. I have never had an issue regarding my skin color or my hijab. I am grateful to my school for giving me and amazing experience and allowing me to create relationships with my friends and family.', 'I like most of the relationships I made with other students and teachers. As you get older you really realize who is really your friend, and by junior year your surrounded by real people because you filter out everyone else. Your guidance counselors really help you when it comes to preparing for college. Even the nurse is incredibly understanding and sweet.', 'I love the fact that John H. Glenn High School is a small school and that as a student I am able to build a relationship between my teachers and I. In addition I was able to create friendships that will last forever. However, I would like to get a turf field for our sports teams because all of the fields have terrible drainage problems and are always wet, and I believe it would be a huge asset to the school for years to come. I would love to see this change even if I am leaving next year for the future generations of students.', 'John H. Glenn High School is a quality place to obtain a great american education. It is a small district and school which is beneficial to the student because the teacher to student ratio is 20 to 1. This allows for more one on one interactions between students and teachers in the education process. The teachers that the school hires are good ones because they love their jobs and are willing to help out the students wherever possible. This is a great school to send your kids to.', 'Elwood is a small, but diverse community for the students. One setback is that they offer the basic AP and Honors courses and have not made improvements to expand upon there classes in years. Because of the small number of students, teachers seem to invest a lot of their time in the kids.', "John H Glenn High school is a great school, with a small and supportive environment. The small student population makes it easy to foster meaningful relationships with teachers, helping them have a better understanding of your learning process. What is unfortunate about the small size is the lack of variety in classes and AP courses. Elwood offers pretty much the bare minimum in honor's and AP's, and it is a struggle to find a balance of classes as an above average student.Through my experience, I have found that having such a small environment lends difficult when entering the school in a later year, as the students have been together since kindergarten. Overall, Elwood is a great school that truly cares about it's students, but lacks  variety in classes. ", "The teachers at John Glenn high school are really knowledgeable and if anyone needs help the will help the student during class or before or after schools. The teachers's lessons are really engaging and almost everything the students understand the new topic or information. Teachers engage and push students to reach for the sky and they support everyone to reach success.", 'There has always been an extracurricular opportunity for every one.  I love that there are different options to chose from.', 'The reason why I like this school is because all of my teachers were available to me and my parent when we needed them.  All of the teachers that I had truly cared about their students.', 'All of the teachers that I have had are/were very helpful.  Any time that myself needed to contact them or my parent they were always available to us.  At times where I needed extra help, they all offered to help.', 'We have young and energetic teachers', 'I stared a guitar club last year and it was fun', 'We are a small school so everyone knows everyone.  My experience has been a good one as there are many clubs and sports are very competitive.  Coaches and staff are caring.']

column6: ['Teachers keep us engaged in conversations and relate everything to today happenings.', 'They have a variety of clubs available for students', 'I came from another school district and since I have been at John Glenn, my grades have improved so much.  The teachers have all been a great support for me.  I was able to get into a technical program that I will be continuing in college after I graduate.  I feel that this school has given me my career path and helped me to overcome some of my fears and challenges.  This was the best change I could have ever made for myself.  I made the change because I came to live with my dad and stepmom.', 'Teachers are very knowledgeable and learned. they range in skill and prefessionalism', 'School is very good academically but size is small. Not diverse student body', 'My experience has been great for the most part. most of the teachers go the extra mile in helping the student get through an area they may be struggling in. They have kept me in the loop and posted on progress.', 'The doors are locked at all times. To enter school you go to front entrance buzz the bell look at camera they buzz you in if you show license. They take a picture of you. You sign in and place your going. Fill out and wear\r Tag. Guard is always at door too.', 'I can only speak for myself and parents that i am close to since the start of high school. The principal and staff at john glenn are very supportive of our student body and they are in great hands!', 'The academics as a whole are decent. They have a variety of advanced classes for people interested in math and science. Although this may be true, until you are a senior, you will be pretty much taking the same classes as everyone else aside from honor choices.', "Bullying is a major issue in this school. Some teachers and staff even witness it and continue to ignore its existence and act like nothing had happened. This school is extremely difficult to work with if your child has a medical issue or needs special treatment in either food or medicine needs. The school will require copious amounts of paperwork for simple things and still will refuse to help your child in an attempt to cover themselves. If you or your child has severe allergies, good luck getting it through to the health office that they are real. If he needs medicine, good luck getting the health office to provide the medicine when he/she needs it the most. It's a redundant and demeaning system.", 'The extracurriculars are often times taught or lead by teachers who would otherwise not know much about the activity. They are generally poorly structured, underfunded and quite pointless in some respects. A major reason for this is due to the atletics in the school. The football team will get new uniforms and helmets every year while the teachers of science and mathematics clubs are forced to use their own earned money to register the club into events.', 'This school, although it may be prestigious in education results, is simply not a place where you can be comfortable or happy for 7 hours per day. The overall environment is not one where you would want to express yourself or try your hardest.', 'There are the teachers that go above and beyond, and then there are the teachers who only care about the end bell. Some allow students to freely express their thoughts and actually teach while others will treat the class room as if it were a dictatorship in which learning is hard to achieve.', 'There are always security guards around to make sure everything is running smoothly. There a nurse who accommodates to different types of medical needs.', "There is a wide variety of extracurricular activities meant to fit everyone's different preferences, abilities, and interest.", "We have a a amazing atmosphere during sporting events and we all come together as a big family in times of need and also in fun events we have to raise money such as our Relay For Life, Volleyball Athon, and Pickleball Athon. Everyone treats others with respect and try their hardest to interact with others outside of their friend groups. I wouldn't want to go to a different school because I love how the school is with each other and how in the end we are one huge family.", 'The teachers always want to get involved and try their hardest to connect with students to help in any way possible to get the students to understand the lessons being taught and they want to see a student fail. They always encourage us to strive for success and never to give up no matter how hard the subject matter is.', 'My overall experience so far has been pretty good. I think that the staff is very nice and helpful. I would say the thing that makes this school unique is the success it has for a very small district. Personally, I would not like to go to high school all over again, but if I was forced to do it over I would choose Glenn.', 'Our school lunch is not the best, and the snacks could be better. They offer a good variety of food. The lunches are not expensive.', 'The principal and vice principals are very good when it comes to discipline. They are also nice and welcoming people. The guidance counselors are excellent, they are very informative and helpful with colleges.']
column8: ['Teachers keep us engaged in conversations and relate everything to today happenings.', 'They have a variety of clubs available for students', 'I came from another school district and since I have been at John Glenn, my grades have improved so much.  The teachers have all been a great support for me.  I was able to get into a technical program that I will be continuing in college after I graduate.  I feel that this school has given me my career path and helped me to overcome some of my fears and challenges.  This was the best change I could have ever made for myself. column2: ["My experience at Bay Shore high School was amazing. There's so many events to go to and so many clubs to join. There's clubs that fit almost any interest a kid can have. you can also create a club at the school if it doesn't exist. The student diversity is awesome.  The school also offers many different kinds of sports that range from football to dance. The teachers there are also very helpful and will try and make their students succeed and we have an AMAZING weight room with all the essentials.", 'Very good teachers and academics. I have an amazing guidance counselor that helps me with every little thing regarding college.', "I loved the high range of opportunities and literal diversity of Bay Shore Senior High School.  Although the school is very diverse, diversity in the literal sense is doesn't deserve the praise it receives. As Bay Shore is diverse, people of color still struggle with the  discriminative nature employees and practices of the  district.", 'Bay Shore High School gives students an abundanceof oportunities to succeed,in multiple different sectors. For one, our sports teams are highly ranked, as well as our national award-winning Model UN, Drama Club, and Literary Magazine. EVERYONE can find something they enjoy to do here, whether its in the arts, academics, sports, or in-between. The staff, while  very busy, are almost always there to help you out, and we have a Peer Support  program that fosters positive messaging and counseling for those with mental health issues. Some downsides is that depending on your graduating class, students can be very competitive.Often times the pressure from peers is more burdensome than the pressure from teachers and administration.Also while  we are relatively diverse in student body, there are only two black/POC faculty members, and only one is a teacher. While Bay Shore is an amazing school, diversity in all of its aspects needs to be addressed. AMAZING!!!!!', 'I loved the diversity in this town and school. It made me enjoy school a bit more than usual. Teachers in the district really do care about you, as a person, not just a student. Teachers put in effort to get to know their students.', "The school was very nice and neat. Some teachers could use work, some were nice and understanding to student's needs.", "The school has a good quality of education I think and things like clubs and student help are pretty good, but there is nothing exceptional about the school and I don't feel like it offered an experience that I could really only get here. Teachers and therefore classes can be hit or miss, there are arbitrary rules and regulations, the facilities and student relationship culture are average to sub-par.", 'Bay Shore High School is the best! I have grown into a person that I love throughout my years at Bay Shore High School. I feel confident and prepared to enter college. My teachers and guidance counselors have greatly aided in my preparation for college and the entire college process.', 'There is no better place to get an education. Bay Shore High School is an incredible school that definitely prepares its students for college and offers a stimulating learning environment. The school offers many programs that are a challenge for its students, such as Advanced Placement and International Baccalaureate  classes. The teachers are able to make learning interesting, and are well educated as well. There are many Clubs to join, there is a place for every student. Bay Shore as a town is incredibly diverse, thus the school is very diverse. No student feels out of place. It is great. The Administration takes safety seriously, and they make sure that students are safe to the best of their ability.', 'What I liked most about Bay shore High School was the teachers, clubs and after school programs such as the dance program with professional dance teachers, Jazz band and how the teachers were always there to help. The schools curriculum definitely prepared students for a good future in there college education careers.', "While the tags we have to wear are a little irritating, you will still get a good high school education here, even for a public school. It's honestly one of the best public schools that make the high tax rate in New York state worth it.", 'On Long Island Bay Shore is one of the may few schools to stay as an Open Campus which is great for those who go out to grab a quick bite to eat. Bay Shore Has AP AND IB routes that students are allowed to explore. They have great facilities such as the "Music Theory Room" Were we have our own professional Studio to record and make music, its very popular. We have Mac computers where we can learn how to use Photoshop, Logic X Pro and Syllabus. The teachers there are great and treat us as adults to prepare us for life after High School. The resources this school has going from all the broad electives they have is amazing, no kid will feel left out. The Extra-Curricular activities in mass, going from Community Service, Debate Clubs,Robotics, E-Sports Gaming ,Drama, Its very open for everyone. IF YOU\'RE LOOKING FOR DIVERSITY, THIS SCHOOL HAS IT. Bay Shore is Athletically, Musically and STEM wise very competitive. It is a very accomplished school. Im Proud to be a Bay Shore student.', "I enjoyed Bay Shore High School because of the diversity, the attention, and the college readiness. Our school is probably one of the most diverse on Long Island, and with the large population of students, there are many different people from all backgrounds. The guidance counselors help to the best of their ability with all of a student's needs, and it is very comfortable. The establishment of the Time Out Room as a place for the peer support club and the school psychiatrists, there is a welcoming atmosphere that lets students know that there is always someone there to listen. The IB Diploma Program and the Advanced Placement classes provide students a chance to earn as many college credits as they want, and the guidance counselors encourage you to test your limits with your classes. Bay Shore Senior High School is truly an outstanding school for preparing students for the future.", "BAY SHORE WAS A GREAT SCHOOL.  MOST OF THE TEACHERS WERE HAPPY TO HELP WHEN NEEDED.  IT'S A DIVERSE SCHOOL WITH SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE.  I PLAYED BASKETBALL AND WAS INVOLVED IN MANY DIFFERENT CLUBS.", 'I love the fact that bay shore is very diverse in itself. You have many people you can meet who are lovely. Also, that bay shore has many opportunities for one being the IB diploma, and AP. I participated in the diploma and was allowed the chance to go to Denmark and as a foreign exchange and learn their culture. Also, I was able to create the first ever Chess Club, then have a car wash for malnourished kids in starving countries raising up to $730 in four hours through a non-profit organization. The athletic program is great and you have many kids who are competitive and push each other to achieve greatness in practice and at games. Overall I had an amazing time at my high school and am very sad that I am leaving, but I am very glad I got to spend my four last years of high school with Bay Shore and I would not like to spend it anywhere else.', "Bay Shore is a very diverse district and it's nice to have everyone be unique in their own way. Each club or sport at Bay Shore is very welcoming to new members. The support for the school and it's programs is amazing.", 'I love the sports and facilities at Bay Shore High. We have two beautiful gyms a wrestling room and two beautiful turf field to play lacrosse on. My friends often think my high school is a college.', 'I liked the fact that the school was very rigorous and pushed the students to be successful. The teachers actually care about you passing the classes and want you to do well in life.', 'I like how Bay Shore High School prepares you for life and beyond. I felt like I was prepared for my classes and my teachers helped with anything I needed help with. The community is very welcoming and they make sure you are provided with everything to make you successful.', 'Having visited other high schools for sporting events, I realize that Bay Shore High School is one of the most diverse school on Long Island. Moreover, Bay Shore offer many AP and IB classes that prep students for college. However, Bay Shore high school  facilities and overall resources can be improve on. better Wi-fi is needed to allow students to easily connect their phones or labtops for academic work and better funding is needed for afterschool club, taking away the need for fundraisers.']

column6: ["I wouldn't want to go to high school all over again because they're cutting the budget for most activities. Some clubs can only afford to meet once or twice a month. The school can't afford to buy vocabulary books for the AP Language and Composition class anymore either. I was lucky that I was part of the last year that recevied the books but the next coming class did not.", "Most teachers give engaging lessons in which one is able to learn about the topic and not feel left out. My physics teacher for example, tried to use comedy to bring people into the conversations. People who don't usually speak want to participate and those who usually sit in the back of the classroom and don't pay attention have the desire to learn. It's an adequately competitive environment in which people don't want to feel left behind, but don't feel pressure to overextend themselves and put themselves in an uncomfortable or too stressing situation.", "School tries to keep us informed and when theres a serious threat they calmly act as if it's ok.", 'Drama has been and will always be a large impact on students. All the money goes to the Arts', 'My favorite part of my education is drama and the arts. My school is big on things and ive learned so much about getting along with people and priorities', "The teachers are good but there are some who act as if they support you in the arts however fail you if you don't come to class. They know you're excused for the arts but don't care.", "I only started attending this school in the 11th grade, but it was a whole lot better than the other school I attended before I went here. I wish I had attended this school from grade 9, so I would have been better prepared for college. I really liked how clean the school was kept, and that the school trusted it's students enough to leave on off periods and return back when they had class", 'The teachers at this school are very knowledgeable and have the resources to teach with high tech capabilities.', 'There are many different classes that are offered.  The workload is manageable but will be very difficult if you procrastinate.', "There are so many different types of students.  This include different races, religion, economic status, ethnicity, sexual orientation.  You'll find them all at this school.", "There are so many activities to take part in.  The sports are awesome and very competitive and enable you to interact and make friends with people who you wouldn't normally be with.  The clubs that people join end up being something they commit very highly to and take very serious.", 'The teachers all genuinely care about the students.', "The school is definitely very safe and is very serious in the area of student safety.  Their measures aren't sometimes popular with the students, but the students understand the need for them.", 'Bay Shore has so many options after school.  I can stay after work on my music projects, or photography, or Principles of Engineering class.  But after that when i want to i can stay after for extra help with my teachers or go and work out in the school gym, there is just many after school options.', "In Bay Shore High School the teachers truly are fantastic.  The teachers care about the students and will do all they can to help us.  If we are struggling with a lesson they will always be after school to help, or they will have us meet them their lunch if needed.  The teachers for the most part have really good lesson plans for the topics they're teaching.  My Physics teacher is always doing little experiments and show us real life examples of what we will be learning about that day, and how it is useful and applies to things.", 'The field trips the school offers are unique.', 'The teachers are of the highest quality.', 'i love how the school has many extracurricular activities such as AWARENESS WEEKEND !', 'I love the diversity that this school exposed me to.', 'Love the principal and peet support program.']

column2: ['BCCHS is a wonderful place for flourishing minds to reach their full potential. Small class sizes and the overall number of students allow for individuals to have their needs met and connect with faculty and other students. The overall environment is warm and welcoming, and all students feel safe and respected by everyone.', 'Baruch is great. Amazing teachers who are dedicated to their craft, and are very supportive of their students. I truly enjoyed my time here. With a little more funding from the DOE, this school could be phenomenal. We are getting there.', "I like the staff and teachers in the school. They all cared about their students. The classes provided were interesting and engaging. The only downside would be the size of the school. I wish there was more space, that way I would've had more friends in my year. Going to school everyday to meet the same 90 students was really discouraging. Other than that, Baruch High School was an awesome environment with well respected staff and teachers.", 'BCCHS is an amazing school and is a true bright spot of the New York City public school system. The two best parts of the school are its teachers and its community. Throughout high school I was able to make friends that will be with me the rest of my life and always felt safe and at home. This is because of the amazing teachers at Baruch. They are caring, sweet and it is really easy to become friends with your teachers which is an amazing thing. Additionally they will always help you with your problems and are very accommodating. They helped me transition myself from a child who would always lose their papers to someone who is very prepared for college. The biggest problems are the facilities at the school and the overall lack of diversity.', "I am a rising senior at BCCHS and I love it at this school! The teachers are so dedicated and the administration works hard to ensure that the school is running smoothly, and is a safe environment. The school is very small, but it gives the students the chance to build a close-knit community. Students are driven and strive to achieve good grades and are committed to participating in school extra curricular activities. The school is wonderful when it comes to offering opportunities that will help advance a student's involvement in their education.", 'Baruch College Campus High School is a rigorous and zoned district 2 school in the Flatiron District. With only about 450 students, it is one of the smallest public high schools, allowing each student to get a very personalized education from their teachers. Students have an opportunity to take AP classes in their junior and senior years as well as taking regents and honors courses throughout their high school career. Most teachers enjoy their job and genuinely care about their students. However, as is in many, public schools, a few teachers have left and found better paying positions, causing AP Biology to be discontinued. There is a girls volleyball team, a boys and girls soccer team, a wrestling team and many more. 20 hours of community service is required each year so students serve their community and help the less fortunate.', "It's a great school, the curriculum is a bit challenging but they teach the foundations of grit. The workload is heavy but it allows you to see how you deal under stress and how you do with time management. The teachers are all very understanding and are available always if you need help. The one thing I would say that needs to change is the flexibly in regards to certain classes.", 'Everybody there was very friendly and made me feel welcomed. they have a very clenly and well maintained facilty. The teachers there actually take the time to make sure you understand the material.', 'Overall experience of Baruch is pretty good. Because I commute, I didn\'t join any clubs, but I have many friends who dorm who are in clubs and have amazing time. The school seems to promote a less social atmosphere and more just go to class and then o home type of attituede.The most annoying thing for me is the 2 hour breaks on tuesdays and thursdays called "club hours" where from about 12-2 there are no classes going on. The facilities are pretty good, I\'ve hd only great experiences with teachers so far, but I\'ve heard other people with bad experiences, but that would probably be the same with other schools, it depends on the teacher. The are is pretty nice with lots of things to do on your free time, no shortage of places to get food, library is nice and quiet, free gym which is amazing. And i joined a soccer club which had games during club hours which was fun', 'I really like my college, the staff is really friendly. My advisor is the best, he really helped me finding my journey toward my degree. I was really lost the first time I came.', 'Baruch provides students with ivy-league education at an affordable price. Many of my professors have taught at NYU and Columbia. I’m surrounded by ambitious peers and faculty alike, and there are always career panels and networking opportunities.', 'Excellent teachers and  students. Everyone is friendly and helping each others out. I love the variety of classes and club activities.', 'Baruch is a small close with a close welcoming knit community. The school has a rigorous challenging curriculum which is something you should want, you definitely learn how to manage your time and balance multiple assignments at once. The school definitely challenges you academically and pushes you more than the average New York Public school, you are required to take math and science all four years and do a minimum of 20 hours of community service of your choice. You graduate with more credits than the average New York Public school student. Socially the school is great, theres no really divided groups, everyone is included. The staff and students work hard at trying to make all cultures feel accepted.', 'This school is diverse and is located in a great location with endless opportunities. If you are willing to put yourself out there to grab the opportunities, you will be great. For those who are not as proactive, it will be a tough time for you because of the competitive nature of the place.', 'This is a great school. I came in as a transfer and was able to assimilate well. They prepare you for your career field. I have also met some great people. The school is competitive but it pushes you to be better', 'I really felt the benefits of the small school environment. I did not think it was going to work for me at first but within the first two weeks of my freshman year I got to know almost everyone in the entire school. Furthermore, I really like how the teachers are really involved in not just your academics but they also like getting to know the students and help students reach for the stars. Whenever, you need advice from an adult, most students will know at least a handful of teachers that they feel comfortable going to talk to. There is also no bullies at Baruch. In my four years at Baruch, I have never encounter or heard of a bullying situation going on. At Baruch, it is like one big happy family where every kid feels safe and comfortable.', 'Baruch is located in Midtown Manhattan. The location makes the school a very valuable place for potential jobs. The place is very rundown and has very bad wifi. Baruch has good teachers overall depending on what you study. It is mostly known for business majors.', 'I enjoyed how small the school was, it allowed all students and teachers to communicate efficiently. This strengthened our relationship with not only our peers, but also with the staff.', 'Baruch College is a great school if you want to find internships in new york city because of its connection.', "It prepares you for college by giving you a lot of college level books. However, AP classes were really limited. As long as you do your best and constantly try on everything, Baruch College Campus High School shouldn't be a problem."]
column4: ['BCCHS is a wonderful place for flourishing minds to reach their full potential. Small class sizes and the overall number of students allow for individuals to have their needs met and connect with faculty and other students. The overall environment is warm and welcoming, and all students feel safe and respected by everyone.', 'Baruch is great. Amazing teachers who are dedicated to their craft, and are very supportive of their students. I truly enjoyed my time here. With a little more funding from the DOE, this school could be phenomenal. We are getting there.', "I like the staff and teachers in the school. They all cared about their students. The classes provided were interesting and engaging. The only downside would be the size of the school. I wish there was more space, that way I would've had more friends in my year. Going to school everyday to meet the same 90 students was really discouraging. Other than that, Baruch High School was an awesome environment with well respected staff and teachers.", 'BCCHS is an amazing school and is a true bright spot of the New York City public school system. The two best parts of the school are its teachers and its community. Throughout high school I was able to make friends that will be with me the rest of my life and always felt safe and at home. This is because of the amazing teachers at Baruch. They are caring, sweet and it is really easy to become friends with your teachers which is an amazing thing. Additionally they will always help you with your problems and are very accommodating. They helped me transition myself from a child who would always lose their papers to someone who is very prepared for college. The biggest problems are the facilities at the school and the overall lack of diversity.', "I am a rising senior at BCCHS and I love it at this school! The teachers are so dedicated and the administration works hard to ensure that the school is running smoothly, and is a safe environment. The school is very small, but it gives the students the chance to build a close-knit community. column6: ['I loved the dedicated teachers and the community of students. Everyone was very determined to help you succeed and support future endevors.', "There are many great teachers at Baruch, and the academics are solid. However, the English department is a complete joke. Don't expect teachers to teach practical reading and writing skills for standardized tests. Instead, the curriculum for all 4 years will consist of social justice indoctrination even if it is an AP level course . Also, there is absolutely minimal diversity of thought. If you are conservative or even centrist, just keep your mouth shut during class discussions and blend in.  Besides this, the small gym, and bad school food, the school is actually pretty good with great opportunities, such as the College Now classes at Baruch College.", 'Everyone is very friendly to each other. Sometimes teachers communication to students are ok. But teachers comunixation to each other are not that good.', 'The school is decent and offers moderate classes. The community was great, but it would be better if it showed improvements in the academics. I suggest the school offer more AP courses starting Junior or Sophomore Year to offer the students more opportunities to reveal their talents for a particular subject, develop interests for different classes , and prepare them for college courses.', "Baruch College Campus High School is a place that provides an excellent balance of workload and the students' social life.This allows the students to be excited to learn as well as being very competitive and hard working. As a student at Baruch College Campus High School, I feel very safe and motivated. One thing that really stands out to me about Baruch, is the diversity of the students. The environment itself is excellent and very welcoming. The teachers know the students very well. The students at Baruch College Campus High School are very engaged in many of the clubs and activities that the school offers. Baruch College Campus High School is excellent at preparing their students for the real world by giving many useful resources and knowledge for the students.", 'I liked that school safety was prioritized and that the college office was always there if you had some concerns about college. As for what I want to change, I think there should be more variety in the sports available (e.g. Badminton).', "This school is a real gem. The teachers are dedicated, the principal is strong, with clear vision. Yes, the homework burden can feel excessive sometimes, and yes, I wish that the students had more arts and more physical activity. But truthfully, those complaints are minor. There are breaks in the homework, and there is a presence of arts and sports in the school. BCCHS is so good, it makes me greedy for more. There are many supportive teachers to check the well-being of the students as well. It's a friendly environment for all students who get along easily. The small domain is beneficial is the sense that everyone is close to each other and know one another well.", 'At Baruch College Campus High School, you can see a very kind and passionate staff. They love to interact and always try to get involved with the students. But, as for the AP classes they offer, it is not a wide variety. It is very limited to about 5 AP classes and more needs to be offered.', 'I like the facility, however, food could be better.Academics and teachers are also good..Administration is not always pleasant', "Baruch High School is very ideal if you like a small student to teacher ratio. The resources are mainly focused on getting ready for college. The school is very small, there isn't a wide variety of academics. However, it is a good high school.", 'After spending 4 years at this school, it has really become home. The teachers are your friends and the community is like no other.', "Baruch College is a great school and i don't really encounter problems attending there. There are really nice and respectful people.", 'Baruch College offers an vibrant student life experience and indepth curriculum to its students and campus community.', 'High demanded school, a lot of focus on studies but a  great alternative to economics. The school environment works, and is a large population of international students, especially from Asia. The administration is good and fast, the working load is heavy but if you are focusing at school it will eventually help you in the end. The teachers are good.', "At Baruch College Campus High School, it's a very well fit building to students of many different cultural backgrounds. The school does a very good job in supplying their students to be the best they can be for college readiness and beyond. The staff and administrators make sure to keep in check that all of the students are well prepared by providing numerous amounts of courses and extra curricular activities. There are many supportive teachers to check the well-being of the students as well. It's a friendly environment for all students who get along easily. The small domain is beneficial is the sense that everyone is close to each other and know one another well.", "My daughter is graduating from Baruch. I have to say that overall it was a fantastic high school experience for her. She had excellent and caring teachers who got to know her on a personal level and encouraged her to find a voice.  we were disappointed in the college office as they really provide no help. They are nice enough but we're very discouraging to all the kids telling them they couldn't get into a lot of the schools they wanted to apply. They tried to dissuade us from applying to some schools but we did anyway...my daughter is going to a University they said she wouldn't get it. I think reality is great but most kids felt unaided. It is out of the norm for this school. Overall get yourself someone to help with the college processBut know that the education is amazing!", 'Baruch College Campus High School is known for their competitive work loads. Building an community is important especially when we have a small school. We  take on challenges building up our college readiness. It has not only taught us about community, teamwork. But it also taught us how to be responsible for what we do.  Time management is important.', 'I am currently a junior in Baruch College Campus High School and absolutely love the environment and the teachers. I am respected and welcomed by everybody within the community and would recommend having baruch as one of your high school choices.', "It's a really nice small high school and you get to know the teachers quite well. I enjoyed my experience at Baruch and it helped me prepare for life outside of high school. The teachers are passionate in their fields and the community is strong and friendly towards each other.", 'A diverse community that is extremely close-knit. Teachers are incredibly helpful—able to support and advise you within the boundaries of school and beyond the field of education.']
