column2: ["Fort Lee High School's strengths are in its diversity and opulence of opportunity. A student can pick up a sport casually and become a competitive athlete by the end of the year. He/She can also get into art casually and find a new passion for painting or music. Furthermore, that same student can join academic clubs and further his/her knowledge in subjects like physics, mathematics, and literature. Personally, I find the teachers to be all enjoyable. The faculty are usually pleasant and cater to student's necessities while balancing some sort of control.", "Fort Lee High School has not only an abundance of opportunities but a competitive atmosphere that continuously motivates students. When it comes to the academic fields, their standards are higher than most schools in Bergen County. Students are always putting in their best effort to become the best of the best. Transferring to FLHS unveiled a completely different side of myself. My peers were always involved in AP or IB courses, AOF, Theatre, Sports, and more. Every single student worked towards something that made them special. College isn't taken lightly at this school. College acceptances are how Fort Lee High School flaunts their students. Academics are held at a high expectation that it actually stressed me out. The staff diversified in many ways as their teaching methods either helped or confused me. The FLHS community, more or less, shaped me. As a 2019 graduate, I'm honored and proud to say that I once attended Fort Lee High School.", "Fort Lee High School has many academic opportunities as it has a wide variety of AP and IB classes. It also has different extracurricular activity available for pretty much all types of people. A small number of clubs are not very active. The overall environment of the school is okay; it's not fantastic but it is not horrible. Our school is actually very inclusive, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality and religion.", 'My experience at Fort lee high school has been good. There have been many great experiences throughout my years at this school. Of corse this school has its flaws but once i cam to this school i became a better student and a better person.  This school builds you for life and makes you become a better person. Helps you with real life problems .', 'Fort Lee High School changed who I was, from a lazy and tough freshman into a loving, most caring senior. The environment is one myself and others thrive to keep it a positive one.', 'My experience in Fort Lee High School was great. The school is physically safe to be in. There is a lot of diversity in this High School.', "Academics are prioritized, helping students who aren't eligible for elite programs for advancement in their studies.", 'The diversity of this school helps everyone to keep an open mind. There are only a few teachers who are obviously passionate about what they teach.', "Fort Lee High School is one of thosr schools that don't really seem to stand out at first glance but once you enter, your perspective could possibly change. Students with all sorts of diversity walk past you and you can easily feel at home. Extracurriculars are also dominant in the school with over 50% of students taking part in at least one thing. However, two things I would definitely change would be having teachers more involved in getting students ready for college and not just mindlessly teaching subjects that may or may not be relevant to our lives in the future. The food is also only mediocre at best. Students are always complaining about the quality of the food and how they always get everyone sick. Instead of spending all the money of sports and new facilities, some money spent into the quality of the food would greatly benefit the students.", 'I liked the teachers and the overall high school experience. Some changes that would be needed are the lack of events at our school. Project graduation would be a nice addition to the senior year.', "Fort Lee High School's small student population offers a sense of community within the facility. The guidance department should be more proactive when it comes to giving students advice during the college application process, especially informing students on scholarship opportunities.", 'Fort Lee has many diversities. This helped me to get along with classmates of different ethnicities. All of the teachers that I had class with were willing to stay after school for any questions or extra help, which showed committed teachers. If there was one thing that should change is that the dress code is too strictly enforced. During the hot, 90+ degree weather, students are still required to follow strict dress codes. Of course, if shorts are too short, then the individuals who are wearing the shorts should be dress-coded, however, I have seen many students being dress-coded with clothing that simply help alleviate the heat. Only few classrooms have air conditioning at Fort Lee High School, so many of the classrooms and hallways are extremely stuffy and hot. I hope to see reasonable dress codes and more air condit', 'I have to say each and every time i have had great experience with staff and students. I am glad my son went to this school.', "Fort Lee High School was a positive experience.  It has its challenges which forced students to achieve.  Instructors in FLHS took a personal interest with the education of their students, of which I personally benefitted.  The school afforded me exposure to diversity (people and customs) of which I made friendships that I believe will last a lifetime.  In my senior year I joined the Teen Pep Education Program.  I was chosen to join along with approximately 17 fellow students out of 150 applicants.  There, we offered more junior students education on the dangers and pressures surrounding drugs; safe and responsible sex along with work/school ethics.  The thought process was that they would be more comfortable hearing these topics from peers as opposed to educators.  I was happy when I graduated, thankful to be getting to the next chapter in my life.  The building is aging.  Air conditioning and painting are needed.  I'm proud of my allmamatta.   GO BRIDGEMEN!!!", 'Fort Lee high school may seem under par at first, but if you really develop your relationships with teachers and engross yourself in everything the school has to offer, you’ll have an amazing experience.', "Some teachers are excellent educators who I believe that the school doesn't deserve, but there are some that makes me question their competency. The building itself is very old so some rooms get very humid and disgusting in the summer. Also, we have no school spirit.", 'Fort Lee High School offered a little something to everybody. The community itself was very diversity. Ranging from students from all ethnic and religious backgrounds. FLHS had many avenues for students to increase the severity of their studies, including honor classes, AP classes and an IB program. Overall, the school has a great community and is an institution where students can feel safe and accomplish their goals.', 'Fort Lee High School is a small high school minutes from New York City. It’s safe and has an excellent range of classes. It has both an amazing array of sports and clubs to choose from. The teachers are great and informed, however I wish it was a more intellectual environment. There also seems to be a lack of school spirit that many student do not like.', "The only way to describe Fort Lee High School is that it is an okay school. Some teachers are challenging but engaging, while others are easy A's where I can not even tell you what I learned by the end of the year. There are over 20 clubs here, yet I could only name five memorable ones. School spirit is also abysmal until you become a senior. Diversity is great here, though. There is no bullying in this school either, so that is great. Although, fights do break out. Food is horrific.", 'My overall experience with this school has been fairly average. There is a very small percentage of teachers that seem to be motivated to teach and know how to do their job well. The rest seem to be there simply for the pay and nothing more, however administration seems to be making an effort to change this.']

It also has different extracurricular activity available for pretty much all types of people. A small number of clubs are not very active. The overall environment of the school is okay; it's not fantastic but it is not horrible. Our school is actually very inclusive, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality and religion.", 'My experience at Fort lee high school has been good. There have been many great experiences throughout my years at this school. Of corse this school has its flaws but once i cam to this school i became a better student and a better person.  This school builds you for life and makes you become a better person. Helps you with real life problems .', 'Fort Lee High School changed who I was, from a lazy and tough freshman into a loving, most caring senior. The environment is one myself and others thrive to keep it a positive one.', 'My experience in Fort Lee High School was great. The school is physically safe to be in. There is a lot of diversity in this High School.', "Academics are prioritized, helping students who aren't eligible for elite programs for advancement in their studies.", 'The diversity of this school helps everyone to keep an open mind. There are only a few teachers who are obviously passionate about what they teach.', "Fort Lee High School is one of thosr schools that don't really seem to stand out at first glance but once you enter, your perspective could possibly change. Students with all sorts of diversity walk past you and you can easily feel at home. Extracurriculars are also dominant in the school with over 50% of students taking part in at least one thing. However, two things I would definitely change would be having teachers more involved in getting students ready for college and not just mindlessly teaching subjects that may or may not be relevant to our lives in the future. The food is also only mediocre at best. Students are always complaining about the quality of the food and how they always get everyone sick. Instead of spending all the money of sports and new facilities, some money spent into the quality of the food would greatly benefit the students.", 'I liked the teachers and the overall high school experience. Some changes that would be needed are the lack of events at our school. Project graduation would be a nice addition to the senior year.', "Fort Lee High School's small student population offers a sense of community within the facility. The guidance department should be more proactive when it comes to giving students advice during the college application process, especially informing students on scholarship opportunities.", 'Fort Lee has many diversities. This helped me to get along with classmates of different ethnicities. All of the teachers that I had class with were willing to stay after school for any questions or extra help, which showed committed teachers. If there was one thing that should change is that the dress code is too strictly enforced. During the hot, 90+ degree weather, students are still required to follow strict dress codes. Of course, if shorts are too short, then the individuals who are wearing the shorts should be dress-coded, however, I have seen many students being dress-coded with clothing that simply help alleviate the heat. Only few classrooms have air conditioning at Fort Lee High School, so many of the classrooms and hallways are extremely stuffy and hot. I hope to see reasonable dress codes and more air condit', 'I have to say each and every time i have had great experience with staff and students. I am glad my son went to this school.', "Fort Lee High School was a positive experience.  It has its challenges which forced students to achieve.  Instructors in FLHS took a personal interest with the education of their students, of which I personally benefitted.  The school afforded me exposure to diversity (people and customs) of which I made friendships that I believe will last a lifetime.  In my senior year I joined the Teen Pep Education Program.  I was chosen to join along with approximately 17 fellow students out of 150 applicants.  There, we offered more junior students education on the dangers and pressures surrounding drugs; safe and responsible sex along with work/school ethics.  The thought process was that they would be more comfortable hearing these topics from peers as opposed to educators.  I was happy when I graduated, thankful to be getting to the next chapter in my life.  The building is aging.  Air conditioning and painting are needed.  I'm proud of my allmamatta.   GO BRIDGEMEN!!!", 'Fort Lee high school may seem under par at first, but if you really develop your relationships with teachers and engross yourself in everything the school has to offer, you’ll have an amazing experience.', "Some teachers are excellent educators who I believe that the school doesn't deserve, but there are some that makes me question their competency. The building itself is very old so some rooms get very humid and disgusting in the summer. Also, we have no school spirit.", 'Fort Lee High School offered a little something to everybody. The community itself was very diversity. Ranging from students from all ethnic and religious backgrounds. FLHS had many avenues for students to increase the severity of their studies, including honor classes, AP classes and an IB program. Overall, the school has a great community and is an institution where students can feel safe and accomplish their goals.', 'Fort Lee High School is a small high school minutes from New York City. It’s safe and has an excellent range of classes. It has both an amazing array of sports and clubs to choose from. The teachers are great and informed, however I wish it was a more intellectual environment. There also seems to be a lack of school spirit that many student do not like.', "The only way to describe Fort Lee High School is that it is an okay school. Some teachers are challenging but engaging, while others are easy A's where I can not even tell you what I learned by the end of the year. There are over 20 clubs here, yet I could only name five memorable ones. School spirit is also abysmal until you become a senior. Diversity is great here, though. There is no bullying in this school either, so that is great. Although, fights do break out. Food is horrific.", 'My overall experience with this school has been fairly average. There is a very small percentage of teachers that seem to be motivated to teach and know how to do their job well. The rest seem to be there simply for the pay and nothing more, however administration seems to be making an effort to change this.']
column6: ["I liked Fort Lee High School for providing a sense of diversity and giving students a chance to interact with people and cultures they might normally not spend a lot of time around. I didn't experience or observe much bullying between groups that you would normally expect to see it, and I'm not sure if the administration played a role in that or it was just a natural product of students adapting to diversity. The facilities are a bit old but the teachers are mostly good and the school environment was certainly enjoyable. I think that being able to successfully coexist with many different cultures is a great life-skill to develop.", 'Teachers need to empower children to understand that the world is in their hands. 1 year with a bad teacher is a year lost that you cannot regain. Teachers must respect value, morals and experience alongside curriculum. Without real life experience children, teens and adults cannot gain the "magnetic pull" to their desired career in life. On top of learning from your own mistakes, you must be taught to learn from others mistakes and improve.', 'Definitely did not prepare me for college as I had to find out information on my own. Diversity is somewhat an issue as the student body consists of mostly Asian Americans. Typical high school bullying is not an issue at Fort Lee High School. I would like to see some air conditioners being installed in the school because during the summer it gets scorching hot, which results in school being cancelled.', "I came to this school as a sophomore in 2014. Good academics, great people, the food could be better. But I guess you can deal with it until you're a junior since upperclassmen can go out for lunch", "While there are hidden gems of teachers at FLHS, overall, the administration makes this school far worse than it would otherwise be. I enjoyed my teachers, but the curriculum was not up to date, nor was it engaging. The curriculum and material made it agonizing for students who showed potential and wanted to jump ahead. I'd love to see smaller class sizes, up to date curriculum, and more varied electives in the future. Oh, and an administration  change.PS. This school did not prepare for higher education at all.", 'It is a great school with a lot of help, but I would like to see change is the way schedule runs. Also our technology and the interior is too outdated.', "My school's atmosphere is much like the atmosphere of a diverse and loving family. The male teachers can easily be my favorite uncles while the female teachers have overwhelming motherly qualities. The students are incredibly diverse, and all get long with each other as if racial differences do not exist.  Although the social aspect to Fort Lee High School is very positive, there is room for improvement within our academic system. Many teachers may fail to connect with students academically; working through material either too quickly or too slowly. My experience at Fort Lee High School has been otherwise exceptional.", "Fort Lee High School has a great program. Throughout the years I've never had a bad teacher, nor did I hate school everyday. Fort Lee made my high school enjoyable. I love the new types of classes they added like Forensics. I also love the environment; everyone is friendly and kind to each other. ", 'The teachers are very caring towards the students. They are there to help when help is needed. What needs to change is the variety of classes being taught at the school.', 'The Fort Lee School experience was overall a very positive one.  Our educators are highly qualified and classes are well organized.  Our guidance team is strong, caring and always available.  Many classes were removed such as shop.  I wish we had more sports to chose from.  We have basketball, baseball, football, soccer, volleyball (female only), and bowling.  Lacrosse and swimming would be a great addition as well as male volleyball.    Classes are large and the school is aging.  ', 'I feel more classes should be offered', 'Everyone is accepting to all different types of people', 'The coaches are awesome and they are very caring', 'Everyone is very open and its easy to make friends', "Some teachers put their all into helping kids some don't.", "The school is a little lenient when it comes to getting things done. We're really behind in terms of technology, but they try their best to provide students with plenty of resources to suceed.", "Some of the teachers go as far as to helping you but others not so much. The dedicated ones provide you with plenty of materials for your success. Those who don't, often brush away students from their presence and try to make the class come up to their own level.", "There are a lot of clubs but they don't really do anything. Only a handful of them actually do stuff.", "It's completely different from where I used to live, so it's an adjustment.", 'Some teachers really believe in teaching and really want their students to actually learn something. Others are there just to get paid.']

column2: ['I liked that the teachers did everything in their power to make sure that we were learning and performing to the best of our abilities. The school also took us on trips at the end of the year and the teachers always made sure that we were safe and having fun.', "Kings Colliagaite truly helped me become a better student, athlete, and person. The teachers were always so friendly and pushed me academically to do better. It was a terrific experience and now I'm am on an excellent path to becoming a college ready student.", "There are many classes to take, many students are required to take a couple of credits for elective. There's many art, music, writing and more credits to take. The school allows students to explore in what they want to do in life.", "There's many things to do in this college. Many clubs for Gays, Comics, Writing, Journalism, Math. We got them all and if we don't you are allowed to start one up. Alot of teachers are also involved with different clubs. I recommend the journalist club because that way you can go around and talk to people; maybe even make new friends.", "It's a college. Not much for parents to do.", 'Many are good and amazing and others are not so much', 'The extracurricular activities are fair', 'The teachers at the school are very good because they really show interest in the students', 'The health and safety at the school is fair', 'What makes this school unique is that they really prepare the students for college at an early age.', "My overall experience at Kings was just an awesome experience. At first I was scared to enter into a charter school from a public school. I didn't know what it would be like and what they expected from their students. As I became more accustomed to the charter school life, I absolutely loved everything about it. Teachers in the school care some much about their students and have faith in them. They never gave up on us."]

["LVHS academic preparation isn't the best because from Middle School they push taking honors classes, but are only allowed in groups. For example, math and science, and history and english. From choosing these classes as honors, they lead into AP classes which then lead into IB classes. It's nice that students have the option to make this choice, however, most students aren't able to handle the workload/pressure that comes with taking these harder classes. LVHS pushes those classes more than regular level ones. Additionally, as a student who attends BOCES, LVHS doesn't promote BOCES, and really only promotes the IB diploma. They don’t touch on the benefits of BOCES, nor do they allow the students that attend BOCES to give insight about the program to other students. Does that make LVHS a bad school? No, but I do think they should do a better job in informing students on what they’re signing up for when they choose honors classes in Middle School, and they should promote BOCES more.", 'Locust Valley is a great high school for many reasons. First off the teachers are very helpful and want to always help the best that they can. They offer extra help daily and always want to find a time that is best for you. It is a very safe school with security guards at all doors. The guidance counselors are super helpful and always do the best they can to accommodate you with the classes you want and help assisting in your college process. You can meet with them as many times as you want until you feel college ready. The school spirit is also great with homecoming week and prom to involve fun into school.', 'The school is overall very good.  The districts supports both music programs and the arts. Academically, offers the hardest courses available, however should better prepare students for the AP and IB tests.', "The experience of being a Falcon has made me the person I am today. I was able to take some of the most rigorous high school classes in the world, and still have fun while doing so. Teachers are supportive, friendly, smart, and encourage students to truly work their hardest. While the workload can be overwhelming, its truly good material, and allows students to prepare for college to the fullest. Although diligent, the guidance department is unfortunately small, which makes it difficult for them to really spend time with all of their students. Although we lack cultural diversity, we make up for it with a diversity in the kinds of people that come here. It is easy to make lifelong friends, mostly because you can't go anywhere in this town without running into someone you know. On the weekends, traditionally, people go to football/lacrosse games, eat crappy food, and hang out on the beach. I couldn't ask for a better high school experience.", "LVHS is a pillar of long island schools due to its strong focus on academics and its well-rounded approach to athletics, extracurriculars, and student growth. As an alumni of Locust Valley I come back every year for Alumni Panels and to keep in touch with my teachers; they've helped me grow both in academics and maturity.", 'My experience with Locust valley highschool has been great. I have one daughter who graduated with an IB DIPLOMA  and was in top 15 in her class. She had amazing teachers and now I have another daughter who is a junior now and fortunate to have great experience throughout her highschool years. The opportunity to take these college level courses really prepared my daughter for what she will be facing in college. She entered her college in the honors program and majoring in biomedical enegineering.', 'The education and the teachers in this school are horrible besides one social studies, great guy. The food and the facilities are worse than a school in Harlem. I am happy with the administration and the culture and spirit that is shown by the students of LVHS. This school is better than NSHS in my opinion.', "The school is honestly a great place to learn. The grades and classes are small and overall it's very tight knit. Teachers are wonderful and will really put in as much effort as they possibly can to make sure the students learn the material. The IB program and various AP classes definitely prepare students as much as a high school can, I feel.", "My favorite part about attending Locust Valley High School is the tight-knit community and the close relations with the teachers. Whether it's everyone coming together for a football game or the school play, everyone seems to always support each other in what they do. The small class sizes that we have give us the opportunity to speak to teachers one on one about any questions we have. They're always there to answer us and help us and only wish to see us succeed in the future. Being able to take as many rigorous college courses as we want in high school is also a crucial reason why I love Locust Valley High School.", 'we have never had a serious threat to the security of our school. there has been no need for a very prominent security system. however the staff is trained to handle just about any situation.', 'Our sports are the main after school activity participated in. We compete at a high level attending and winning multiple county championships.', 'Parents help support organize and attend every event at Locust Valley. They will voice their opinions in a polite and respectful manner also they love everything the school does and support it to the fullest.', "The teachers are very willing to help any and all students with anything they may need. They are extremely friendly while keeping things professional.One of the top high school's in New York for a reason.", 'MANY EXTRA CURRICULAR ARE AVAILABLE AND STUDENTS HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN AS MANY PROGRAMS AS THEY DESIRE. THERE ARE PROGRAMS THAT FOCUS ON HEALTH LIKE CANCER AWARENESS AND  MANY DIVERSE SPORTS PROGRAMS. THERE ARE MANY COMMUNITY SERVICE AND THE SCHOOL ENCOURAGES ITS STUDENTS TO BE ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN THE COMMUNITY', 'Teachers are very accessible and approachable. Teachers are knowledgeable and concerned and go above the call of duty to support students.', 'the school is very involved and concerned about the health of its students', 'Overall the school is great. My only concern is that diversiy is greatly lacking in the school.', 'We have several meetings about drug use and bullying, just to stay in tact.', 'In freshman year I joined kickline and made a great group of friends, now we talk to eachother all the time and do other clubs together.', 'I have made many memories and many friends due to every opportunity this school has had.']

column6: ['The teachers at my school go above and beyond to help any struggling students. The teachers at my school are always ready to help and never forget a smile.', 'Superior teachers, thoughtful staff, excellent administration.', "Has had a club or need to fill my son's day, everyday.\r Healthy activities, safe surrounding.", "Phenomenal group of teachers.\r Always interested in seeing that you as a parent are aware of your child's progress.\r Phone calls/emails whenever you or they need to be reached.", 'Staff, teachers and students are well aware of what negative acts may happen within a school setting.\r It is a small school \r longstanding, trusted employees and staff\r a school community that looks out for each other', "At a truly critical time in my and Nick's life a change of environment, of home and location had to occur. \r Nicholas was a young boy whose direction, I knew, was in danger.\r I sensed that Locust Valley was where we'd stake roots.\r Once settled, Nick quickly found interest in the sciences and history.\r An avid sportsman he thrived amongst others who shared his enthusiasm for the game, forging friendship tight as brothers would be.\r His personality big as a skyscraper; with school spirit, team spirit, love of community...has thrived under the watchful caring eyes of the teaching staff at Locust Valley High School.", 'Many classes offered, teachers are down to Earth.', 'There are many different clubs and activities.', 'Teachers are helpful, some more than others.', 'Academically challenging, administrators are very keen on being the "best" within test scores and advancing the school rank. Great sprit and sporting activities, tend to favor male sports over female sports. Classes that support the arts, however more classes in this area would be great.', 'I came from small town NC and I being introduced to such a diverse community was a great experience! I take my time to right this because my above all experience at LVHS can be described with a happy gesture!', 'The students receive a lot of personal attention when it comes to their academics as well as can become great friends with many of the teachers, and high grades is something that is aimed for by all. The advanced classes are not something that is taken for granted by either teachers or students.', "I've had a pretty rough couple of year at high school but I had a lot of people helping me through everything. They don't just care about your grades and making sure you graduate they care about you personally. They will do everything they can to help you and I appreciate everything they did for me. When I was depressed my  guidance counselor made me do one sport to help me take my mind of things. Well she was right like always. Softball really made me happy. Even if that meant getting up early on a Saturday morning running the field till I was out of breath then going to work after practice I enjoyed every game even though we lost every single game horribly. The have many clubs to choose from.mi loved culinary club we would bake for causes and we would also make ourselves food which was pretty great. I remember having to decorate cookies with Mrs. First during a storm in the dark. Although I had a lot of personal issues the people around me helped me when I was struggling to get my grades up and thus school offers as many hands to help you get up and that's what's really important in a school. I love this school so I would recommend Locust Valley High School to everyone who wants to see their child enjoy their high school year.", 'It was not the worst high school experience. Students could be friendly, but most of the time everyone stuck to their own group. Most teachers were good, with a few not so great and a few that were excellent. Some teachers really encouraged and pushed their students to do their best, while so teachers just passed their students along to graduation. Overall the school was not that terrible.', "There isn't a great selection, and most of the food tastes poor.  The people that serve it are generally rude too.", 'Well, the dean has to be tough, but we also have security guards.  I disagree with getting detention for forgetting homework.', 'The teachers are allavailable for extra help, and will be there if you need them.  Yes, you can talk to them, and the grade fairly.', 'The teams are fairly average.  Of course there are 1 or 2 kids that excell, but LV is not know for sports.', 'There is a club for everyone, and plenty of opporunities to get involved in something.', "I'm graduating this month (June).  Academically, the school is rated high.  As far as public schools go, we have a very supportive music staff and it was because of the extra effort of my music teachers that I have found my way into a future of music."]
column8: ["i had a typical high school experience and made some good friends and played sports and was involved. I challenged myself with AP and IB classes to help set me up for college, i can't wait to graduate and move on to the next part of my life.", "typical school lunch, its gotten healthier however, i don't eat the school lunch any more because i go home during my free periods but their snacks are good its a little pricey though.", 'very prominent with big discipline however discipline with cutting class and assigning detention is a little all over the place', 'the coaching staff is supportive and dedicated to their teams. the training staffs even more dedicated, helping athletes to prevent injury as well as healing their injuries to get them back to practice. The coaches have led many of their teams to playoffs and state championships. they create a sense of family through out the team. and help motivate their athlete to push them selves to be the best.', 'most if not all teachers are always willing to help students achieve their goals and help them to do better in class. they always create a bond with students and are always there for them when the students need them whether it be school based or not. they are understanding and caring.', "the clubs don't get as much attention as they could, however the after school sports are very popular and the coaching staff and training staff dedicate all their time to helping the athletes become better at their sport and at preventing injuries and healing injuries. Coaches have led many teams to play offs and state championships and easily create a sense of family within the team.", 'Loved the teachers and education, hated the students', "Didn't have a direct experience, but seemed good.", "Didn't care about sports in High School.", 'Most of the teachers I had here were amazing.', 'Good, but too much focus on sports.', 'Locust Valley was a great school with bad people.', "It's not a bad school. My teachers were great.", "The food isn't too bad. Definitely not enough food given for growing kids.", "They're always looking for new people to join teams. It's harder to get into jv and varsity teams if you're new to the sport.", 'Most of the teachers are nice. They want their students to succeed.', 'The transition from high school to college was difficult.', 'The school offers a huge array of extra curricular activities ranging from writing and art to robotics and theater', 'The school has very clear policies for student safety and well being', "there are resources for college but wished it were earlier in child's entry"]

column2: ["The HCST foundation is very crooked and broken. There are so many things that happen in the school that the administration tries to cover up. There are so many male teachers that have had suggestive interactions with female students and the school does nothing about it. The only good thing about this school is the no violence but even then, bullying, racism, sexism, and just overall rudeness still goes on. A lot of teachers threaten students if they try to oppose what the teacher is saying or even if they are just having a bad day. The school has also kicked out a lot of students but mark it as a transfer so that their graduation rates stay high. I feel that if students were to give anonymous evaluations of their teachers, a lot would be different. The guidance counselors harass students about college and don't even consider that some students may not have enough money for college or that they just don't want to go.", "Amazing education in a safety environment, with endless opportunities. College readiness could be a bit better, but overall the education is good. Clubs and diversity are also unique and fit every student's needs.", 'County Prep High School is a wonderful school to attend. I have only attended County Prep for two years now but all I can say about this school is good things. This High School is inclusive of all races and genders. CPHS has wonderful food and fitness facilities. The teachers are great and treat their students like their own kids, guiding them will problems and challenges they face throughout their school year. As a Sophomore I can say County Prep is one of the best high schools in the U.S.', 'I like the school and the medical science internship at the Jersey City Medical Center and the teachers and staff are also nice. Totally recommend.', 'The academics and teachers are very focused on improving their student’s education. There is a lot of diversity in terms of student culture and celebrating the lives of different nationalities.', 'I would love to see a change in the prices for snacks, lunch, breakfast, etc. I do not have a lot of extra cash to spend on food from that I do not even get to finish at times because of poor sanitation. I want County Prep to change the way that they treat minorities in the school, not everyone comes from a rich family.', "I was bullied a lot in high school, and the administration didn't really do much about it. It made going to school difficult for me. However, a lot of the teachers were very friendly, and made learning fun.", 'CPHS is a great alternative to public high school for kids wanting to go into vocations. Overall, it was a great choice and I don’t regret choosing it at all', "I like that county prep high school has a very diverse student body. Even though there are no sports the school spirit is still high because of all the student council events. The only problem I have is that certain teachers aren't nice to all races (to put it lightly) and it makes some students uncomfortable. I am a black student myself and I've experienced this. Also how the dress code is enforced doesn't take different body types into consideration.", "I love County Prep High School's social and academic atmosphere. It is a very diverse school with students from innumerable backgrounds and the teachers are very committed to build bonds with their students. I just wish the school would bring back sports, so students could best represent themselves in their personal talents and interests. All in all, I am pretty impressed and super grateful to be going in as a Junior this fall.", "I have attended many schools and not one compares to county prep. The staff from the teachers to maintenance to lunch, everyone knows everyone and for those 8 hours of a school day, you feel at home just with a different family. Not only are you surrounded by the best people you are offered the greatest opportunities that come with being exposed to possible careers and majors in high school. Along with feeling at home, you can DRESS as if you're at home as well, that freedom contributes to the greatness of county prep as compared to any other school.", "I'm a rising senior in County Prep and honestly, I've enjoyed my time here. County Prep has a wide range of diversity and is accepting of all backgrounds. We have classes here that can accommodate all students, including inclusion classes for those with special needs. The guidance counselors try to help every student and do their best to challenge all students and work with those who learn differently into regular classes eventually if they can. The teachers also do an outstanding job of enforcing student involvement in class with group projects, class discussions, and presentations where everyone is involved. Our teachers are also involved in a lot of our clubs, including Poetry Club and the Debate Club, which teaches us all to have a voice and respect each other. The school culture is absolutely amazing as everyone participates in activities such as Spirit Week, festivals, and various sales. I just adore it.", "There are few teachers who actually try in this school and most of them teach English or Math. Everyone else just doesn't care. The vocations kind of separate the students from knowing one another. I've heard lots of complaints about several smaller vocation teachers. I enjoyed my time there because I was able to find friends that helped make my high school experience fun but most people I know couldn't wait to get out. There's also a vaping problem with a lot of the students. They occasionally vape in the bathrooms, showers, and locker rooms. Some even manage to vape in the gym because there's so many students and not enough teachers to keep track of those students.", "The school tries to make up the lack of a sports program with school activities which can get fun but repetitive at the same time. People get tired of it and start going less and less. The school sadly lacks school spirit more and more each year. Administration also doesn't treat students fairly and definitely show favorites when it comes to behavioral punishment.", 'I am currently in County Prep High School. This High School has a lot of diversity, that helps you understand other ethnicities. Classes are held by regular honors and Advanced Placement.', 'I loved the diversity and the sense of community. It is a small school so everyone knows each other. The teachers were very supportive.', 'County Prep High School was a lot. I really don’t know how to feel about it because I’m about to graduate and I know I’m going to miss it. But in the past years it was a bunch of ups and downs. Some of the teachers here are terrible and some of them are amazing. The food progressively got worst. We don’t have sports at all, which is ridiculous to me. We have really easy going rules but they can be annoying sometimes. But at the end of the day it’s just High School.', "I've attended County Prep High School for 4 years and to be completely honest, I've had such a good experience.  When you picture high school, you usually picture kids being bullied and what not.  County Prep is probably the safest school you can attend, it's the most diverse, and I've learned so much from attending here.  I've gotten really comfortable here to the point where I'm close with a few of my teachers and I'm involved in school clubs while also paying close attention to my school work.", 'What I liked about County Prep High School, is that there is a diverse community with children/staff members all across the county. The guidance staff is amazing and will make sure that all your needs are taken care of.', 'The student population is allowed a voice. The teachers, staff, administrators and students work together to make proper decisions that will take our school to a higher level. We are allowed to choose majors, which is beneficial since we can preview what the career and education of what we want to become in the future. By having majors, we can decide what we want to do with our careers before even going to college.']

column6: ["10/10 come here definitely.  10/10 better than High Tech.  10/10 great words to put here. 10/10 you'll love it here, being serious right now as a senior.  If you're accepted and deciding whether to go or not, COME HERE! You'll love it probably, I hope, I wish, maybe, most certainly greatly yes.", 'Excellent school spirit-- tight-knit and very involved in making sure students have a wonderful experience', 'County Prep High School offers students a friendly and learning environment in which ables students to develop a stronger character. The school itself offers the tools necessary to be prepared for what comes after college and the teachers do an outstanding job helping each and every student.', 'I love the culinary program and I also love tge internship opportunities.  I myself interned in the cafeteria and I learned about school food service', 'I like the diversity in the school, everyone has different backgrounds that I enjoy learning about. Many of the teachers are nice and you can get along well with them.', 'Great environment, so many afterschool activities to join, tons of great staff, new renovated building recently added, and sense of family with your graduating class.', "I like County Prep because it allows us to focus on our academic skills as well as explore vocations we may be interested in. The only thing I wish I could change was allowing students to explore different vocations rather than one specific one. It gets difficult to switch in and out so if there was a system where we could explore them all in our freshmen year I'm sure more students would be less inclined to switch out of vocations numerous times as well as really explore our options since we don't have that in the real world.", 'County Prep High School helped me find my path! What i would change about that school is by adding more clubs and advertise it more!', "What I like about County Prep is the teachers as well as the collection of students that they have. County Prep is definitely not a school that has bullying and there are never fights between students. It is a peaceful place and it's very nice to attend.", 'As a student I do like CP but I find that many other students are stressed and tired. But I believe that is it up to the student. Also the faculty is very scary which stresses out students even more. I would say CP is a place you can have fun but there a lot of limits so having fun can only last so long.', 'County Prep made high school unforgettable and the best experience of my life! Graduated with memories I will always remember. All the staff was very helpful and kind!', "I love County Prep. The teachers there are so kind and welcoming if you allow them to. I only wished that there was a solid sports program where we could compete against other school so hopefully they bring that back.  But overall, CP was my home and I'm so glad to have gone there my 4 years of high school.", 'My years at County Prep are truly unforgetable. It was the place I created bonds with friends and teacher, and most importantly I grew as individual. I loved that County Prep specifically had programs dedicated to the subjects I wanted to major in college. Thos 4 years was great college preparation. County Prep became another home for me since I was there during and after school hours.  The only downside I could honestly say is BRING BACK SPORTS!!!! GO HURRICANES', "It's a really great school if you want to excel and the resources are there and so are the faculty members.Unless you major in culinary you're not going to be eating so good.The school facilities are basically state of the art, it just depends on if you take advantage of it or not.It is around the formerly projects but County prep takes their safety measures very far and they provide transportation from school and back.", 'As a current Graduate from County Prep High School i am proud to say that this 4 year experience is one i will always cherish. It has provided me with close relationships, a mountain of knowledge and a High School experience i will never forget. County Prep High School is a school filled with caring teachers and students who no matter what color, race, gender or how you look matter. Everyone in County Prep is treated equally and I recommend it to anyone who is looking to enjoy there High School years.', "Overall County Prep is a good school. I graduate in the class of 2017 with a good GPA. Most courses taught are decent but not challenging enough. Most teachers are encouraging and helpful. I hope that the school improves their science department by giving the science teachers a laboratory or similar resources so that the future students will have an experience doing experiments. I also hope that they prepare the student more for college. My only problem with the school is during my college application process which my guidance counselor did not send my transcript to the colleges I am applying to. I did all the procedures required for me to send my transcript and even talked to her but only one got send but that application got terminated because she didn't send my recommendation on time. I lucky got accept to my top college choice where I have to my grades manually.", 'My experience as a student at county prep was amazing. Attending CP lead me to many opportunities that I am grateful to have been provided. Now as a senior I know I will miss County Prep and their many activities. The school and staff are wonderful and are hard to compare to anything else.', "I like County Prep High School because I feel as if there is always something to do. The teachers are very nice and understanding so it's always easy to talk to them. There are also many clubs that you can join to take up some of your free time.", "The teachers are very nice and friendly, and the overall atmosphere is great. There is also a lot of diversity. The cafeteria food is amazing. However, there aren't a lot of ordinary clubs, such as Robotics. CPHS also does not have organized sports, which is a huge drawback. They do offer college classes, though, so that is a helpful benefit. The security guards are very strict with IDs, which is very reassuring with everything going on. They are also friendly and easy going. Most of the other students are also engaging, cheerful, and positive.", 'I am currently a senior in county prep and through out these four years i have not regretted coming to county prep high school. It is such a safe environment where i not only connect with students but i also connect with teachers. Before coming to high school they say that we will not be close with our teachers but  i am closer with my teachers in high school then i was in middle school. Although i am excited to graduate i will sincerely miss going to school here.']

column2: ['I had a great experience in the marching band. I met so many people and went to Wahington DC with the band for my first time.', 'Good student counselors who worked hard to keep me motivated to graduate. They even found me a scholarship!', 'Northport High School is a generally inclusive school, with a fantastic art and music department and an abundance of options of classes and electives to take.', "I believe one of Northport's strongest qualities is how encouraging and helpful everyone is. There are so many opportunities to get involved. Students should learn to take advantage of what Northport has to offer because we are very fortunate to have these programs.The faculty does a great job in getting to know the students in order to make them feel they are in a safe environment. In addition to this, Northport doe a great jon ensuring they want the best for their students by looking out for them and providing with many assemblies to increase awareness on social issues. They take drug and alcohol abuse very seriously along with other things and it is very visible. Although, a change I would like to see is possibly expanding  the coordination of big events for all students to participate in that are enjoyable. This is important because high school should be filled with fun and positive memories that the school itself could provide.", 'For the most, teachers are very good. They are willing to work with you and are accessible and ready to help. There are tons of opportunities to get involved,  and there is a club for most interests. Northport is very interested in community outreach and having strong ties to the community to promote student involvement. There is a very strong emphasis on athletics, which if you are not involved in, you may feel a little left out. The bathrooms are falling apart and are very unappealing to use. Overall, I had a great four years at Northport High School, had a successful academic career, and would recommend it to any prospective families.', "Northport High is a great school with a wide array of academics to choose from including AP and IB classes, as well as college courses from Syracuse University and St. John's University. The teachers are top-notch and care for their students and wish to see them succeed. The students are hard-working and care about their grades, as well.", 'Many opportunities available to students for classes, clubs, extra curricular activities, sport, etc. There was something for everyone to join and feel connected.', 'Amazing ! Northport High School has so many diverse activities and classes to choose from! Also it prepares you very well for college!', "The teachers are great. There are a few bad apples but that is expected. Students a cliquey and not very friendly. Social experience was not great. Students keep to their own groups and don't really socialize outside of them. School is in need of a major update. The bathrooms and repulsive. 2% diversity.", 'This school is really odd because the teachers are either really good or really bad and there are very few in between. I like how there are IB/AP options because you generally get the better teachers for those classes. There are cool classes but no room in anyone’s schedule to take them.  I personally have no idea why the art department is raved about. There are a lot of choices but the art’s really not that great and the teachers never show up. The building is falling to crap and it’s so difficult to navigate. On the positive however, the school is a friendly environment. My tips for this school is to make as many friends as possible and take advantage of the friendly environment.', 'Northport is a great high school!  I feel very prepared for college and I LOVED almost every single one of my teachers throughout the four years.  The time spent here will fly by and the school itself is beautiful.  Northport has one of the only common areas left on Long Island, and has many performances and activities that display school spirit and makes you feel a sense of Tiger Pride!', "Being at Northport High School for almost 4 years now, I can see a bright future in front of me. Everyone in this school are freindly, kind, and supportive- including teachers, councilors and other pears. There's not one day where I didn't want to be here. NHS has SO many electives, clubs and sports teams(Robotics Club, Fashion Club, Art Club, Spanish Club, Jazz Club, Tour Choir & every sport you can think of- Badminton, Cross Country, Swimming, Football, Basketball and more)- you will never get bored! Also, it's so easy to make friends here, there is always somebody just like you! The only complaint I have is that the school lunch isn't the greatest. Overall, I love this school and will miss it next year but I hope future students will have a great time!", "There is a lot to offer here at Northport High School. There's a lot of clubs, activities and classes that really let students blossom in their interests. However, there is a huge emphasis on the core academic classes/clubs more than the artist/musical classes where many kids prefer.", 'Northport High school is good because it offers a diverse array of education opportunity. For the most part, teachers are enthusiastic and the counselors are helpful. The only problem i have with the school is the security and administration. Due to the rules set by the administration, security guards are often unreasonable. Also, I notice that often times teachers will be disrupted for unnecessary reasons such as bogus assemblies or meetings that halt teachers in the middle of lessons.', "Northport is a great school. There are many great teachers, who are extremely devoted. However, some teachers simply do not teach, and the counselors, in my opinion, are although nice, don't have that much information and are not overwhelmingly helpful. However,  if you want to go to a super prestigious college or just the best school you can get to, Northport will help you get there.", "I like the amount of opportunities that are offered here such as the IB diploma, AP classes and college credited course. I wish I would have taken advantage of more of these opportunities. I like how Seniors get to leave for lunch. Some teachers actually want you to succeed others don't seem to care as much. The school is very safe there are security guards all over the school grounds.", 'I would like to see more diversity in Northport. I love all of the programs that the high school has to offer. All of the teachers are passionate about teaching and teach well. Northport is a great place.', 'There is a place for everyone. Clubs and activities in all areas, advanced courses in all areas, Northport provides EVERYTHING. Also they have the best marching band in the country.', 'Although I have not graduated or had much time to reflect on my  experience at Northport, I had so far been loving being a student here.', 'The school is a very progressive nurturing environment. The teachers really care about the students. The music and art courses are very enjoyable, and the talents are brought out in the students.']
column4: ['I had a great experience in the marching band. I met so many people and went to Wahington DC with the band for my first time.', 'Good student counselors who worked hard to keep me motivated to graduate. They even found me a scholarship!', 'Northport High School is a generally inclusive school, with a fantastic art and music department and an abundance of options of classes and electives to take.', "I believe one of Northport's strongest qualities is how encouraging and helpful everyone is. There are so many opportunities to get involved. Students should learn to take advantage of what Northport has to offer because we are very fortunate to have these programs.The faculty does a great job in getting to know the students in order to make them feel they are in a safe environment. In addition to this, Northport doe a great jon ensuring they want the best for their students by looking out for them and providing with many assemblies to increase awareness on social issues. They take drug and alcohol abuse very seriously along with other things and it is very visible. Although, a change I would like to see is possibly expanding  the coordination of big events for all students to participate in that are enjoyable. This is important because high school should be filled with fun and positive memories that the school itself could provide.", 'For the most, teachers are very good. They are willing to work with you and are accessible and ready to help. There are tons of opportunities to get involved,  and there is a club for most interests. Northport is very interested in community outreach and having strong ties to the community to promote student involvement. There is a very strong emphasis on athletics, which if you are not involved in, you may feel a little left out. The bathrooms are falling apart and are very unappealing to use. Overall, I had a great four years at Northport High School, had a successful academic career, and would recommend it to any prospective families.', "Northport High is a great school with a wide array of academics to choose from including AP and IB classes, as well as college courses from Syracuse University and St. John's University. The teachers are top-notch and care for their students and wish to see them succeed. The students are hard-working and care about their grades, as well.", 'Many opportunities available to students for classes, clubs, extra curricular activities, sport, etc. There was something for everyone to join and feel connected.', 'Amazing ! Northport High School has so many diverse activities and classes to choose from! Also it prepares you very well for college!', "The teachers are great. There are a few bad apples but that is expected. Students a cliquey and not very friendly. Social experience was not great. Students keep to their own groups and don't really socialize outside of them. School is in need of a major update. The bathrooms and repulsive. 2% diversity.", 'This school is really odd because the teachers are either really good or really bad and there are very few in between. I like how there are IB/AP options because you generally get the better teachers for those classes. There are cool classes but no room in anyone’s schedule to take them.  I personally have no idea why the art department is raved about. There are a lot of choices but the art’s really not that great and the teachers never show up. The building is falling to crap and it’s so difficult to navigate. On the positive however, the school is a friendly environment. My tips for this school is to make as many friends as possible and take advantage of the friendly environment.', 'Northport is a great high school!  I feel very prepared for college and I LOVED almost every single one of my teachers throughout the four years.  The time spent here will fly by and the school itself is beautiful.  Northport has one of the only common areas left on Long Island, and has many performances and activities that display school spirit and makes you feel a sense of Tiger Pride!', "Being at Northport High School for almost 4 years now, I can see a bright future in front of me. Everyone in this school are freindly, kind, and supportive- including teachers, councilors and other pears. There's not one day where I didn't want to be here. NHS has SO many electives, clubs and sports teams(Robotics Club, Fashion Club, Art Club, Spanish Club, Jazz Club, Tour Choir & every sport you can think of- Badminton, Cross Country, Swimming, Football, Basketball and more)- you will never get bored! Also, it's so easy to make friends here, there is always somebody just like you! The only complaint I have is that the school lunch isn't the greatest. Overall, I love this school and will miss it next year but I hope future students will have a great time!", "There is a lot to offer here at Northport High School. There's a lot of clubs, activities and classes that really let students blossom in their interests. However, there is a huge emphasis on the core academic classes/clubs more than the artist/musical classes where many kids prefer.", 'Northport High school is good because it offers a diverse array of education opportunity. For the most part, teachers are enthusiastic and the counselors are helpful. The only problem i have with the school is the security and administration. Due to the rules set by the administration, security guards are often unreasonable. Also, I notice that often times teachers will be disrupted for unnecessary reasons such as bogus assemblies or meetings that halt teachers in the middle of lessons.', "Northport is a great school. There are many great teachers, who are extremely devoted. However, some teachers simply do not teach, and the counselors, in my opinion, are although nice, don't have that much information and are not overwhelmingly helpful. However,  if you want to go to a super prestigious college or just the best school you can get to, Northport will help you get there.", "I like the amount of opportunities that are offered here such as the IB diploma, AP classes and college credited course. I wish I would have taken advantage of more of these opportunities. I like how Seniors get to leave for lunch. Some teachers actually want you to succeed others don't seem to care as much. The school is very safe there are security guards all over the school grounds.", 'I would like to see more diversity in Northport. I love all of the programs that the high school has to offer. All of the teachers are passionate about teaching and teach well. Northport is a great place.', 'There is a place for everyone. Clubs and activities in all areas, advanced courses in all areas, Northport provides EVERYTHING. Also they have the best marching band in the country.', 'Although I have not graduated or had much time to reflect on my  experience at Northport, I had so far been loving being a student here.', 'The school is a very progressive nurturing environment. The teachers really care about the students. The music and art courses are very enjoyable, and the talents are brought out in the students.']
column6: ['Great school, little diversity, very helpful guidance counselors, abundance of classes and clubs, good teachers for the most part', 'Northport Senior High School is a very relaxed environment which allows the students to feel comfortable speaking their minds and using the resources in the school. The teachers are generally very helpful and seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs, many if not all of my teachers have offered their personal help to me on several occasions and I have watched teachers lend a helping hand to struggling students who would otherwise have failed the course. Besides academics the school offers countless courses and clubs for the arts taught/led by staff whom clearly enjoy the topics and watching their students grow. As soon as you walk into the building it is a very welcoming and fun environment truly unique comparative to most other schools.', 'What I like about Northport High School is that it gives many opportunities, the thing I\'d like to see change about Northport is its diversity. I\'m hispanic and when I moved into Northport High it was hard for me to find a clique. My older sister also went to Northport High and she was accused of plagiarizing an english paper because "it was too good, and a hispanic wouldn\'t be able to do it." My sister fought for that A very hard which eventually she got it. But the school needs help on its diversity big time even though it gives great opportunities for later in college life.', 'I had a great experience at Northport High School. It was a very accepting and kind environment for me and because of that, I have met some of my friends for life. One thing, however, that I would change would be to maybe work on introducing the college prep in junior year to give students a little more prospective on what it is like in order to give them a jump start.', "A lot of programs offered for students, helps you realize what you want to pursue in college. Some of the teachers were hit or miss (didn't have a good guidance counselor) but for the classes that I really cared about my teachers were amazing.", "Northport High School is overall a great college preparatory school, where students are constantly challenged in his or her rigorous courses. For the most part, the teachers put in a noticeable amount of effort into their lesson plans. Every day, I feel like I have learned something valuable that can later be applied to my work ethic. My school has shaped me as the hardworking and committed student that I am, and for that I am forever grateful. There is a vast amount of clubs available after school that do appeal to all students' interests. Although there is not much diversity in the student body itself, the faculty certainly promotes acceptance of all cultures and races. In conclusion, Northport High School is an excellent school that prepares all students for college and teaches valuable and irreplacable life lessons.", 'Northport High School is great High School full of amazing students and teachers in which really prepares you for college. Proud to be a Northport High School alum and grateful for the amazing education I received here. ', 'Majority of the teachers I have had have been very helpful and taught me a lot. I enjoy being in their classes and I was glad to find out I have them a second time for senior year.', 'I would choose Northport High School again because it is truly an amazing school. It presents students with so many opportunities with all of the electives and clubs they offer. This school is special because no other school gives their students so many different options with classes or extracurriculars.', 'The teachers at my school are great. They truly care for the students (for the most part) and help kids in any way that they can.', "I haven't seen a single guard actually armed. Most of them are obese old men that wouldn't be able to save us from a killer if her tried.", 'The level of commitment for most clubs are really low, which are good in my case because I take advantage of that and take leadership positions for them. I wish students participated more because it looks excellent for college!', 'I am very involved in my school, so it is safe to say that I have had the greatest experience. I grew up around a good group that encouraged me to grow and become more involved. This school has a lot of great things to offer if you go for it! It is a safe, happy environment that many including myself feel extremely comfortable in. The teachers are great, classes are awesome, and most people are friendly.', "I am part of the IB Diploma program in my school, so all my teachers teach rigorous, intense classes. Therefore, they are excellent teachers because of how intelligent they are. All of my IB teachers are extremely willing to engage with all my classmates and encourage extra help. Most of my teachers have gone above and beyond to help me conform to the tough IB program. While my IB teachers are excellent, I cannot say the same for regular or honors class teachers. Most of my friends complain saying how their teachers never teach or care enough, which is completely opposite of what I have experienced from my IB teachers. Overall for me, it's great, but I cannot say the same for the other teachers in my school.", 'There are several clubs and after school activities. It was great to be able to participate in the before and after school extra help as well as all of the sports programs. Our school offers a baseball camp and i had the opportunity to volunteer. It was a wonderful experience.', 'Northhport High School not only has wonderful teachers but also offers a variety of programs for the curious student who is not yet certain what path to follow. There are tech classes, Academy of Finance, Law classes and clubs, child care, sports medicine and so many more. It was great to know that I had so many choices. I was able to try several courses. The experience was great!', 'The Teachers at Northport High School are very knowledgeable and excited about their teaching. They want their students to learn and succeed.', 'The school certainly had its problems, but I had a pretty positive experience there. The environment is pretty positive, and most of the teachers care genuinely. We were offered a surprising amount of freedom, but administration always seemed to want to take that away from us. Things do seem to have gotten worse since I graduated.', "There are a lot of really great teachers here. Every year I attended, I had at least 2 or 3 really great teachers, and I can only think of a few that I'd say were bad. Not bad statistics at all.", 'The teachers are very engaging with their students']

column2: ['What I would like to see change is in the involvement in sports and clubs. Also the food and the teaching ways can improve.', 'This is an International Baccalaureate (IB) school.  Instead of AP classes it offers IB classes.  Colleges regard these courses highly as they prepare students well for college and beyond.  The teachers are invested in the students doing well, and it is a welcoming environment.', 'I liked how involved the teachers were with the students. Since this is a small school organizations and extracurricular activities are very limited. Not too boring but also not so exciting school.', 'Being a newly indoctrinated alumni of Dobbs Ferry High School, I feel that I can give a realistic perspective on Dobbs Ferry High School. Being a small town that prides itself on academic as well as athletic achievement, Dobbs Ferry High School supports these values heavily. Administrators in addition to teachers and other staff ensure that students at DFHS excel in the classroom and out on the field if they choose to participate in sports, as well as other extracurricular activities. Looking back on my experiences at Dobbs Ferry High School, I feel that majority of the teachers and coaches I have played for across three different sports prepared myself as well as my classmates for the challenges and hardships of college as well as the real world.', 'The school is absolutely tiny and focuses on doing the IB diploma, which would be nice if not for the fact that, as a US based school, most potential colleges will give almost no credits for doing well in these classes. Additionally, the administration actively takes measures against things that would otherwise foster senses of school spirit. We had a one hour long assembly about new recycling methods (there are three cans instead of two, it doesn\'t take that long to explain) and a fifteen minute assembly about gun safety after the Parkland school shooting. Those fifteen minutes were pretty much "we\'re an IB school rah rah so we care about you more than other schools so there\'s no way anything bad will happen". Enough said.', "Tell others about your experience. What did you like about Dobbs Ferry High School? What would you like to see change?Everyone says that high school is the best four years of your life. Now that I am months away from graduation, I can honestly say people were right! Dobbs Ferry High School gave me confidence in myself to reach higher goals. The high school consists of about 100 students per grade and the feeling of being with family resonated with me every day. Living in a small community has many benefits to teaching us the value of friendship and loyalty. I wouldn't change a thing!", 'The school is small due to the small town but it’s fun. Thankfully bullying isn’t a part of the school. Academics are overall great.', "There is so much obvious bullying that goes on that the teachers don't notice. The teachers give way too many assignments in a short amount of time and give ridicuoulous tests on things we have not learned.", 'I love my friends and most of my teachers in Dobbs. Lots of the teachers are very helpful and accommodating. The school allows for so many opportunities. The theatre program and teacher is amazing. I am not the biggest fan of my guidance counselor, because I do not feel like she is any help to me, but this particular counselor is not the only one that works for the high school, I believe there are 3 more counselors for the high school. Overall Dobbs is a great school to attend.', 'A pretty good (though very small) IB school with engaging teachers and an excited student body. The administration makes some strange budget choices, but the academics are good and the school itself is beautiful, with the hallways adorned with artwork from decades past. Great area, very safe and the school is a two-minute walk from downtown and Dobbs is only a short train ride away from NYC.', 'I love Dobbs. The student population is diverse, with different types of people. Everyone finds their friends here. The athletics are good, especially football. School spirit is good as well. Academics are amazing, the IB program prepares you for college like nothing else. You can take courses that will make college feel like a breeze, or you can take easier classes.', 'Dobbs Ferry High School is a great school for academic success. Technology is used throughout the building (even though some teachers do express their dislike for it), it is mandatory to use chromebooks in some way. The school puts a lot of their money into football and basketball but not really anything else which is one thing that they should change. Overall, DFHS is a good school and I recommend it.', 'Dobbs Ferry High School is a small but excellent school with an IB program. There are a lot of clubs and the athletics program is diverse and wonderful. The football team, that has a great cheerleading team, has just reached the play-offs again!', 'Offers a variety of levels of rigorousness, from very challenging IB courses to regents, to non-regents.', 'Dobbs Ferry High School is a small school with an average of 100 students/grade. Class size is fairly small between 17-22 students. It is an "IB World School" which allows the student to get a full IB Diploma. It is a prestigious program and colleges like students who have challenged themselves with IB courses. Students also have the option to take as many or as few IB courses, if they don\'t care for the rigor of the diploma program, but want challenging classes. The IB Film course at this school is particularly rigorous. It is taught and lead by 2 great English teachers, who are inspirational. Personally, I would go to this school again because of that program. Through them a  spark was lit and, film and filmmaking has become my passion, which I plan to pursue in college and in my future career.', 'For the most part, the teachers are good, a few are great, and a few are just average. I would say that all teachers care about their students and are approachable.', 'The school is very protective of their students due to the threats all around us with the school shootings.', 'Kids always say they hate school because of homework and the "mean teachers" but I thank those teachers everyday because I wouldn\'t be where I am now, without them pushing and wanting me to strive for what I deserve.', "The teacher are fantastic. If I didn't have most of the teachers i had although high school, I wouldn't have excelled in most of my classes.", 'Lots to choose from afterschool - from athletics to arts to clubs']
