column6: ["I would say that there's almost something for everyone here. If you love discussing world issues, we have the debate club. If you love acting and music, it's here. If you're a sports person, you have an endless amount of options, which is ultimately Dobbs Ferry's downfall. \r There is a ton of funding that goes into the DFHS sports teams that there is barely any funding left for other programs, particularly our art programs. These art teachers have a designated amount that they are given, but are forced to pay out-of-pocket for the rest of the needed materials. It's ridiculous.", 'A lot of the teachers at Dobbs Ferry High School generally care about their jobs, and want nothing more than to see their students succeed. Most are very approachable and kind, and are open to offering any extra help a student may need. \r However, some teachers are still sticking with their jobs for the paycheck. They truly do not care and just do the bare minimum to collect their cash at the end of the day, instead of taking the extra step to make sure their students have retained the material.', 'For the most part, I generally feel safe here. There are many students who advocate to "stomp out bullying", but will then turn around and verbally torture an innocent person. While many students claim that bullying is not prevalent in the district, it most certainly is. This proves that really anyone is susceptible to bullying here, which is still unfortunate.', "The academics at Dobbs Ferry High School are alright. The IB program is extremely beneficial, as we learn to think differently and to see multiple viewpoints to a subject. \r A lot of the teachers here are great too, but there are some that really need to be let go. While they have tenure (meaning it's very difficult to get them fired), some of the tenured teachers simply don't care, and still perform the job simply for a paycheck.", 'My overall experience at DFHS has led me to believe that the administrators and staff are not very helpful to the students. They try and do things that make the school look best and not do what is best for the students. The reason I did not give the school a terrible rating is because on some rare occasions the teachers have proven me wrong. The amount of effort some of the teachers at DFHS put in to help students really shows that they care; and their effort makes up for most of the problems at DFHS.', "DFHS is a really nice school. The teachers are really great, with most of them being very accommodating and helpful, wanting you to do your best. I'm not crazy about how big the school is on sports, as I'm an art student.", 'A big problem in multiple high schools is under age drinking. It is illegal and dangerous yet students participate. Not all but at least half. Resources to talk about it are good. The only bullying problem is slight cyber bullying. The school is 100 percent safe, never a problem on school grounds for anyone.', 'Salad, sandwiches, wraps, and hot lunches are mainly good. Biggest student complaint was when they took away the muffins because they were too many calories;but were delicious and easy! Going into town for lunch is the best; bagels, salads, specialty hot dogs, Chinese, smoothies, grocery store; all around the block! Snacks are expensive in school as well.', 'I think the guidance counselors are great helping students through the college process, and they are even adding a  great new one! If students need to talk about personal problems they can go to the guidance office or a student psychologist. The principal is ok, 95% of the teachers are good or great. We have a gold star in anti-bullying, no dress code, and the school is changing policies to fit students needs. We have an IB program which the board loves and students generally dislike. AP is a much easier and more logical system, and most students wish this was in place and not the overrated IB.', 'I generally have had a great experience with all of my teachers. Definitely better relationships that worse. They care that we understand the curriculum and work with us if we do not. We have a great teacher-student relationships simply because we are a small school, where each teacher has the opportunity to know each of their students. I can only think f 3 teachers that students complain about, and the two that I have had I enjoyed having them.', 'DFHS has a strong tradition and value to sports teams, especially compared to rival schools. Many students have an opportunity to participate on one or more sports teams, definitely for track. Best sports (with winning seasons) include Football, Basketball, Volleyball, Cross Country, Track, Softball, and Baseball. Worst sports: Soccer, Lacrosse and Tennis.  Athletic facilities are pretty bad, Soccer/Lacrosse field is located at the other side of town on a patch of grass, while the turf located at the school is not regulation size for many of the sports. No track, Tennis Courts are at the nearby college, yet has access to a great aqueduct for Cross Country runners. School Spirit is pretty good, usually for basketball, volleyball and football (at most 10 students support other sports games).', "DFHS has multiple sports and clubs for students to participate in. There are positives and negatives to being such a small school for these clubs and sports. Due to lack of numbers, most of the sports teams do not have cuts, with players getting lots of playing time, and can always join track if not getting playing time in other sports. However most sports teams are used to losing seasons simply because there are not enough bodies. The girls soccer team won one game the entire season, for example. The football team usually wins games simply because their schedule has worse and smaller teams than Dobbs does. Basketball, Cross Country, and Volleyball, however, always have good programs. All in all, students are generally happy with the teams they participate  in. Clubs are pretty good at Dobbs, but like most other schools, they are as good as the students make it, reach out and get active. Students are also able to start their own clubs that interest them as long as a teacher is available. I started the FUNdraising club, another student started the international club, and another started a video game club. There is always a cub students can join, such as Wilderness Club, Activities Branch, Rat Pack, Dance Team, Feminist Club, etc. The commitment levels of most clubs are fairy low. Most will meet once a month, while others meet weekly. I am a representative in Legislative Branch, where commitment is strong with weekly meetings, however only four students per grade are admitted. Multiple clubs also fund raise for various charities, something very rewarding. For example, The FUNdraising club raised enough money to feed four families in a year through the organization Blessings in a Backpack, Feminist Club raised $150 for women shelters, and Legislative Branch raised $1,500 for a local Children's hospital; something I am personally proud to have a school so committed to raising money to help others. Overall, I think DFHS has a solid list of extracurricular for students.", 'Our science department is absolutely amazing, but that is not a correct description for all of the departments. Our weakest one is math, which I personally find very troubling. Both the English and Social Studies departments are mixed in skill, some teachers are excellent while others are terrible. Most seem very interested in their topics. They are consistent in their habits of grading.', 'My school has a variety of club options, some of which need a lot of commitment and others almost none. The school seems to favor sports; they get the most funding and are very popular. Our music program is budding, but under funded.', 'I have enjoyed my time at Dobbs.  Sure, there are some downsides; The same few families sit at the top of the Dobbs hierarchy.  Yet, despite this, Dobbs has its advantages.  The IB Program at Dobbs is as rigorous as any high school program in the country.  The teachers are extremely knowledgeable.  The students are awesome and fun.  The sports teams are great and everyone gets involved.  The school is diverse, both economically and ethnically.  If I had to do it all over again, I would (even though it would be a lot of work).', "The computers are perfectly accessible.  The parking is not available to students, so you have to park on the adjacent streets, which is perfectly doable.  It's just inconvenient.", 'The cafeteria food is not good.  Especially the hot lunch options.  Luckily, the cold sandwich and salad bar is ok.  In addition, the school lets students eat out for lunch, so students get to eat out at the various restaurants and shops in downtown Dobbs and the surrounding area.  A favorite spot of mine is Battaglia Brothers, which has absolutely fantastic sandwiches.', 'Ever since the new administration took over a few years ago, everything at the school has improved.  Before my freshman year, we got a new principal, superintendent, and school board president.  They have worked tirelessly to improve the high school.  Specifically, they completely changed the cafeteria, which at one point was one of the ugliest places in the school, and made it a place where students like to hang out.  My guidance counselor has been nothing but helpful, and the principal is the nicest guy in the world.', "We here at Dobbs Ferry are really involved with the varsity sports teams.  Because the high school is so small, almost anyone with reasonable talent who is an upperclassmen can join the varsity team and gain an athletic experience.  Even if you're not on the team, the school spirit at Dobbs is exhilarating.  Most students attend games for all of the major sports teams, but football is what really excites Dobbs Ferry High School.  We have a tradition for having an excellent football team, and whether you like football or not it becomes a tradition to attend the weekly football game in the fall.  It's an enjoyable experience.", "The school is very healthy and active.  There is little to no obesity within the school, and at the same time anorexia isn't a problem.  In terms of safety, we've never had any problems.  We have had a few lockdowns over the years, but mostly as precautionary measures. Bullying was a much larger problem at Dobbs Ferry Middle School than it is in high school, where everyone basically keeps to their self."]
column8: ["I would say that there's almost something for everyone here. If you love discussing world issues, we have the debate club. If you love acting and music, it's here. If you're a sports person, you have an endless amount of options, which is ultimately Dobbs Ferry's downfall. \r There is a ton of funding that goes into the DFHS sports teams that there is barely any funding left for other programs, particularly our art programs. These art teachers have a designated amount that they are given, but are forced to pay out-of-pocket for the rest of the needed materials. It's ridiculous.", 'A lot of the teachers at Dobbs Ferry High School generally care about their jobs, and want nothing more than to see their students succeed. Most are very approachable and kind, and are open to offering any extra help a student may need. \r However, some teachers are still sticking with their jobs for the paycheck. They truly do not care and just do the bare minimum to collect their cash at the end of the day, instead of taking the extra step to make sure their students have retained the material.', 'For the most part, I generally feel safe here. There are many students who advocate to "stomp out bullying", but will then turn around and verbally torture an innocent person. While many students claim that bullying is not prevalent in the district, it most certainly is. This proves that really anyone is susceptible to bullying here, which is still unfortunate.', "The academics at Dobbs Ferry High School are alright. The IB program is extremely beneficial, as we learn to think differently and to see multiple viewpoints to a subject. \r A lot of the teachers here are great too, but there are some that really need to be let go. While they have tenure (meaning it's very difficult to get them fired), some of the tenured teachers simply don't care, and still perform the job simply for a paycheck.", 'My overall experience at DFHS has led me to believe that the administrators and staff are not very helpful to the students. They try and do things that make the school look best and not do what is best for the students. The reason I did not give the school a terrible rating is because on some rare occasions the teachers have proven me wrong. Athletic facilities are pretty bad, Soccer/Lacrosse field is located at the other side of town on a patch of grass, while the turf located at the school is not regulation size for many of the sports. column2: ['You get what you put into it at Madison High School. The ymteachers and resources are excellent but sometime the school administration gets in the way. When I graduate I will be proud to say I came from this school and I expect the courses and knowledge I gathered will help me in college.', 'This is a very friendly school. It has the same problems that all other schools encounter but nothing out of the ordinary.', "Madison High School had its pros and cons. It was a predominantly white community that didn't look out for minorities and the teachers were subpar. However, the average standardized test score range is fairly high and the athletics are excellent.", 'My daughter is much better prepared for college than most of her peers, especially when it comes to writing. The teachers at Madison High School truly care about their students and make sure they are learning the material.', 'At Madison High School all the teachers are always there for you with help, feedback, and extra resources. There are many opportunities to get extra help when you do not understand something. All the staff is always welcoming at Madison High School.', "Madison High School is full of seemingly endless possibilities with clubs ranging from our champion marching bands to the Gay-Straight Alliance club to the ping-pong club - there's something for everyone here and everyone is accepting of that.", 'A quality education; offers tons of APs; pretty decent teachers; most students actually want to learn; too homogenous; pretty good resources and facilities', "A good school with a lot of teachers that I like but also some i dont, really bad food, awful diversity, mice running around everywhere, but it's fun to make fun of I guess? and I like most of my classes", 'Madison High School has extremely impressed me ever since I began studying here. Even though I entered in the middle of high school, everyone was so welcoming, and already in the first month I made great friends.', 'Madison high School is a school where the teachers are eager to teacher the students and help them with anything, whether it be college applications and writing recommendations letters or helping the student prepare for the test in class or AP tests.', "I've always liked attending Madison High School.  It's a small community so everyone knows each other.  The majority of the teachers are very good and really care about the students.", 'Overall a good experience I’ve had. The teachers are good however the small town feeling leads to a lot of exclusive social life but once you find your people it’s a great expirience!', 'i really enjoyed my time there, i miss it a lot. Not everything was perfect of course, but i connected with a few of the staff and i still miss them today.', 'I have enjoyed my years at MHS thoroughly. It is just awesome living in "Small Town USA - The Rose City" and being a part of our amazing school system.  I know I am prepared to go on to my higher education and my future life.', 'I would like students with disabilities to be better prepared for life, both academically and socially.', 'Academics and Safety are second to none at Madison High School. With excellent athletics and great teachers, Madison High School has prepared me for college at the highest level.', "Teachers here are fine. Some are definitely better than others but chances are you'll at least find one or two that you really like while you're here. The workload depends on what courses you take; the AP students and honors students do a lot of work while the enriched fall in between and standard does nothing. However, even if you do have a lot of work, people are happy once they get to college that they don't feel as overwhelmed as their classmates. The people who go here are okay individually but once in their respective groups kind of terrible. An you'll find a handful of rich and entitled kids but they don't make up the majority of the school.", 'One thing I would definitely change is the value of the school lunches. They are very unhealthy, and unappetizing. One thing I love in the district is the way that there is always a teacher to have a true connection with, and who is always open to help you not only in your educational life, but your social life if you are having troubles.', 'great school academically and most dedicated students should have no problem succeeding. minimal diversity, and most minority kids generally form their own clicks. good sports for the school size.', 'Madison High School offers a wonderful learning environment where the students are supported. One of my favorite aspects offered at the high school are daily tutorials in all core subjects. Help is always available! My children have benefited from this service greatly and I do not have to pay a private tutor. ']

column6: ['I rarely got homework in the standard classes.', "Every teacher is white, which I don't mind at all its not an issue, but like 5 people seemed to really have a problem with it", 'Some teachers would see things and not say anything if the student doing the bullying is "popular" or well known.  But if it was anything physical obviously they were brought into the office.', "I was apart of the student principle advisory and we really didn't get anything done we just talked about what we were going to do and sat there two times a month wasting time, which was really annoying.  I don't really know people that are in other clubs but I've heard some good things here and there.", 'For fall sports/ the sports that were popular we would get a really big turn out.', "Regarding the topic of controlling the classroom, some teachers would have students cursing or being inappropriate and wouldn't do anything about it.  Maybe they would say to stop once in a while but they wouldn't make a real effort to put an end to it.", 'The school itself takes care of safety measures perfectly fine however certain students in the past have caused trouble on their own that would not have been something the school could have prevented.', 'PGC is fun but perhaps not very effective, Student Ambassador Club is very helpful for incoming students, the musical is directed by a fantastic director and the shows always look amazing, sports push you to do better and are played at a fairly high level of competition at the school.', 'Sometimes the school can get carried away in the importance of state testing and things of that nature like the PARCC which did not allow us time for mid-terms, forcing us to take cummilative finals which is much more stressful and students do not perform as well on. Parents likewise are not always as focused on their children receiving an enlightening education, rather that they are getting good grades to make it into a name brand college.', 'The teachers I have had are very kind and always available for extra help if you need it but I have heard of other teachers that are not as pleasant. Overall, I have had many that will go above and beyond in the classroom.', 'There are variety of extracurriculars, and they have great funding.', 'This school has the best resources and people.', 'This school is wealthy, therefore has some of the best teachers and teachers from elite schools.', "They are always willing to meet for extra help and reply usually within 24 hours to parent emails. A lot of them are involved with students' extra curricular activities.", 'good choice for my son', 'feel safe at the school', 'The workload is a very managable and easy to handle but it depends on what level classes you are in.', 'The school nurse is the best school nurse I have ever had she is an amazing nurse and a very kind person.', 'Most of the food served is okay, but the burgers are the worst.', 'Some of the teachers at Madison High School are excellent while others do what they have to do being very strict.']

column2: ['PV high school is the breeding ground for racist ,rude, privileged kids and parents. With bullying and constant harassment. If your not part of the popular crowd, you can become a target. From the constant drug and alcohol use.', 'Overall the school is pretty good. There are a large varity of classes, from enginering to cooking. There are many school wide activities and events.', 'Very great school to attend for education. This school provides everything you need, from counseling to extracurricular activities and sports. The environment is very welcoming and fair. Teachers get to know their students very well, making the classroom feel safe and comfortable.', 'Pascack Valley high school is an excellent all around school. The counselor’s, teacher’s and administrators are there 100% to help with any situation your child may be dealing with. I have a senior and a sophomore attending PV and they are doing great. I am so grateful for the support and guidance they are receiving. I feel that my children are in a healthy and safe environment which puts me at ease everyday. These years in a child’s life are challenging and PV has met that challenge and I am so grateful to each and everyone of them.', "PV is a pretty okay school depending on what you value. Academically, I have almost no complaints - although some teachers can seem like they have absolutely no idea what they're doing. There's a pretty decent variety of classes you can take, however I can think of some essential ones missing.     Academics aside, the rest of the school is meh. I think the culture can be pretty toxic. PV has scandal after scandal whether it involve white supremacy, rape, or whatever else. People who get involved with these things aren't punished at all. The school's not that diverse and is pretty much 90% white with a few Koreans and Latinx mixed in there. There are a lot of wealthy, sheltered, and privileged people.      I say as long as you surround yourself with the right people and make the most out of what the school has to offer, it'll be alright.", 'I appreciate that the school incorporates technology in the classroom. I think students should be better prepared for college. In addition, the faculty and the students are nice and I would recommend this school.', "Where do I start. Pascack Valley is a great place to learn, while you are surrounded by great teachers, give or take a few bad ones. That's about it. The social life is average, just like any old high school. The thing that turns me off is the sports and clubs. I am a honor society member, I played football, basketball, and soccer throughout my stay and I hated every moment of it. Every since my freshman year, sports at PV went on a huge decline and the only successful sports teams were the girls basketball and softball, and boys baseball. I strongly hated almost every coach I had because they had no experience, or just lacked the coaching trait.", 'Pascack Valley High School allowed me to choose many different classes to see what I was interested in. I could talk to my teachers easily and was able to learn a lot. Taking the AP courses really prepared me for college. I would like to see more school spirit and more support for different groups of sports and clubs in the school.', 'Pascack Valley high school offers great academics and opportunities for children. They also have many clubs to get involved with. My daughter plays 3 varsity sports, Peer leader and National Honors Society.', 'We have a very welcoming community within the school district. We are very big in coming together as a whole to support each other at sporting events, plays, etc. We also have a very good academic program.', 'Pascack Valley High School has really prepared me for college and my future. From offering interships, sports, great teaching, high tech education and so much more.', "Teachers at Pascack Valley High School are amazing at preparing their students for college. Not only are teachers always available and willing it help, the kindness and effort extends into other faculty such as guidance counselors. The college process can be tricky and tedious but with their help it makes it so much smoother. I think Pascack Valley can be a little healthier when it comes to food. Although it is a high school cafeteria the processed food and unhealthy snacks shouldn't be taken away but they should be limited. Pascack Valley does offer you to order salads and sandwiches so it's not all bad.", 'Pascack Valley is a wonderful school. The academics and teachers are stellar, and the administration does its best to accommodate each and every kind of student. I felt challenged yet comfortable in this environment.', 'I like the school ! There’s a lot of opportunities for all students ! The food at PV is AMAZING especially the sandwiches there ! The teachers are also amazing and fun ! I love how the teachers here try to connect with the students and make the classes more amusing and not boring !', "I liked how we were all one big community and no one was harsh to one another. Teachers always make time to help you out if you were struggling. There's a lot of school spirit at every game or event. Overall it was a great community and stress free.", "My child is very happy, the teachers are very good developing the children's academic skills as well as social interaction and productive play", 'PV is a wonderful school located in suburban town of Bergen county in NJ.Teachers are energetic and highly regarded in their core teaching subjects. Holistic approaches are carried out for students who will be equipped for college readiness at this excellent school.', "PV is a great school. Everyone is very involved whether it's for athletics or clubs. All students here focus on their education while also having a good time. The teachers are very supportive and would love to help you when you ask them.", 'PV is a wonderful community of people who come together in good times and bad and support each other. Some of the teachers are rude and some are your best friend. Overall amazing school.', "The guidance counselors are great They make sure that you are tracking in the right direction. If you are on a sports team, I believe your experience at this school will be better then if you don't participate in a sport. As a football player, even though we aren't the strongest team, we are a united team with nice coaches. The class sizes are small enough so that you don't get lost amongst the other students. For a public school it is top notch!"]
column4: ['PV high school is the breeding ground for racist ,rude, privileged kids and parents. With bullying and constant harassment. If your not part of the popular crowd, you can become a target. From the constant drug and alcohol use.', 'Overall the school is pretty good. There are a large varity of classes, from enginering to cooking. There are many school wide activities and events.', 'Very great school to attend for education. This school provides everything you need, from counseling to extracurricular activities and sports. The environment is very welcoming and fair. Teachers get to know their students very well, making the classroom feel safe and comfortable.', 'Pascack Valley high school is an excellent all around school. The counselor’s, teacher’s and administrators are there 100% to help with any situation your child may be dealing with. I have a senior and a sophomore attending PV and they are doing great. I am so grateful for the support and guidance they are receiving. I feel that my children are in a healthy and safe environment which puts me at ease everyday. These years in a child’s life are challenging and PV has met that challenge and I am so grateful to each and everyone of them.', "PV is a pretty okay school depending on what you value. Academically, I have almost no complaints - although some teachers can seem like they have absolutely no idea what they're doing. There's a pretty decent variety of classes you can take, however I can think of some essential ones missing.     Academics aside, the rest of the school is meh. I think the culture can be pretty toxic. PV has scandal after scandal whether it involve white supremacy, rape, or whatever else. People who get involved with these things aren't punished at all. The school's not that diverse and is pretty much 90% white with a few Koreans and Latinx mixed in there. There are a lot of wealthy, sheltered, and privileged people. column6: ['I had a overall good experience at Pascack Valley. I feel prepared to enter the next chapter of my life in college. The teachers vary from excellent to horrible, but everyone in the school seems like they want you to succeed. I was more of an arts student, so I do think more funding should go to the arts because it is no where near comparable to the funds given to sports.', 'I wa fortunate to have great teachers during my 4 years. They were all approachable for extra help! They offer many trips abroad, not just language classes. I’ve been lucky enough to travel to Ecuador, the Galapagos, IceLand and now New Zealand, and Hawaii! I love  the diversity and math courses I wish the theatre budget was higher.', 'Amazing community, great athletics, almost all the teachers are super nice and helpful. School itself is nice and fairly up to date. The use of laptops is awesome.', 'I liked that there were very amazing teachers, at least the ones I had. Our school has excellent safety measures which ensure that no student gets hurt in the process of any disaster.', "Very inclusive community and teachers are committed to the students. The community is here is great, everyone is super supportive. Its not like other high schools where there's a lot of bullying and people are cliquey. There are some cliques but its not that bad.", "Academically, it is a very good school and so are the teachers who work there. However, there is not much diversity at all. Additionally, the administration does not show much support for students who participate in activities outside of the school. In my freshman year when I told my guidance counselor that I competed in Taekwondo, he told me I should cut back on that a little and start playing a real sport, a school sport. I also told him I played piano. Again, he told me I should play an instrument with the school. Lastly, when I said I volunteered for the hospital, he asked why I didn't volunteer for the school. Whenever, I go to travel for a competition, the administration will mark me as unexcused, even when the national team wrote them a letter about my upcoming absence.", 'Teachers and administration complacent. Emphasis on creating innovative teaching opportunities at expense of teaching basics. Success of student requires strong parental intervention and support.', 'Pascack valley is a place where I enjoy going everyday. The school is welcoming and for the most part the teacher are easy going. The school is fairly easy if you do all your work.', "Pascack Valley has a great community with in. The people that go there are all nice and out school is one big community whether it's going to sporting events or supporting each class and their class causes. The teachers that work at Pascack Valley are always there to help you. If you need to talk to them personally or going to them for extra help they always make themselves available.", 'Pascack Valley High School is a school like no other. Never once have I felt like an outsider or like someone that does not belong. Not only do the students display a positive attitude when it comes to involvement, but the teachers and all of the staff do too. Our education has prepared me so much for college and the resources available have helped as well. Each year of high school the students have been able to take home a Mac laptop for the entire year. This opened a variety of opportunities of learning and made it much easier when it came to research and projects. Despite everything so positive about my school, the one aspect that needs some work is our student diversity. Pascack Valley is located in a predominitely white are, so I have not got a chance to get invovled and know others that come from a different background than myself.', 'Pascack Valley is a great experience for students. A student there will have all the necessary resources to be prepared or college.', 'PV was a great place to go to High School. The school spirit here is unmatched: everyone is proud to be an Indian. Along with the sports, people love going to the school plays and musicals. On top of this, all the teachers are amazing and super helpful.', 'Great high school experience. Some great teachers providing academic rigor that well prepared me for college.A lot of school spirit, good for sports.Faculty fostered a welcoming community', 'I liked the environment of the school but there are some serious issues that should be addressed so everyone could have a safe experience.', "Good academics, there were a lot of people I didn't like, but I guess that would be the same in any other high school.", 'Pascack Valley High School is a great school. There is a wide variety of classes and the teachers are very supportive. It is very easy to form good relationships with teachers since they are very reliable and approachable. PV also offers a wide variety of clubs and activities that give plenty of opportunities to make great friends and memories.', 'Pascack Valley High School is overall a great Bergen County High School that provides all students a great background and a foundation to succeed in college and in whatever future path they decide to take.', 'Pascack Valley is a great high school with a lot of spirit and great academics. It has been a pleasure to attend the school for four years.', 'It is an amazing school. I love it there because everyone is so nice to one another and there is amazing school spirit everywhere you go.', "I love my time at Pascack Valley. All teachers are very helpful and try their best to help you to become the best student you can be. I like the scheduling and how there is a period for 88 minutes on Wednesday where students can take different classes that aren't offered or catch up on other studying and homework."]

column2: ['Amazing school, people and great atmosphere. There’s a sense of family and teachers genuinely care about their students.', "I love my high school so much. Web truly are a family. I have been with my classmates since pre-k and I also got the opportunity to meet new kids through the magnet program and zoning. The school pride here is amazing. I wouldn't trade it for the world.", 'Very good school. Many excellent teachers and a few not so great. It is a magnet school district and the school offer comp. sci., med sci and culinary programs.', "Although it's an old school I still enjoyed going here. I found a good, supportive group of friends and a welcoming environment after initially not knowing anyone. My only problem is that it's a bit crowded and some of the teachers aren't very helpful but compared to other schools it's a great place to go.", 'My experience at Freehold Borough High School was mediocre. I enjoyed my classes and teachers, however it was not perfect.', 'I attended Freehold Boro from my freshman to junior year of high school. I can genuinely say that Freehold Boro has a lot of school spirit and a ton of ways to get involved. The teachers are really helpful and care about their students a lot. The students do have a lot of affection for one another but I think that there are a lot of cliques.', 'My experience at FHS was wonderful. My teachers went above and beyond and I have made life long friends. I could not be happier with where I went to high school.', 'I love my school’s diverse group of students and strong foundation for academic success. Teachers really do care about us and are always willing to go the extra mile and stay behind before or after school to work with anyone needing extra help. Overall, FHS is a very supportive tight-knit community that truly feels like a family. I am proud to call myself a Colonial for life!', 'Good experience, but was not offered many resources/opportunities for my specific interests. Only a handful of teachers were helpful and made a lasting impact on my education.', 'I liked how passionate and engaged some of the teachers were. They really wanted their students to succeed. On the other hand, I did not like how rude and unprofessional some teachers were to their students.', 'Freehold Borough is the perfect place for students to excel; provided the tools for success, students are encouraged to do and to be their best both during and outside of school hours. The environment is extremely friendly, and as a student  coming from another town it was very easy to acclimate, make friends, join clubs and sports teams, and most importantly, become a true Colonial! The academics are outstanding; though the infrastructure of the school may be dated, the academics remain sturdy, firm, and easily accessible for all kinds of students. Freehold Borough High School prides their existence on creating an experience for students and faculty alike which feels like family; at Freehold Borough, we are a family.', 'The best part of Freehold Borough High School was its heterogenous nature. The school is equipped with a Medical Science, Computer Science, and Culinary program. It is also on the border of Freehold Township and Freehold Borough, two areas with drastically different socio-economic statuses and cultural backgrounds. These factors among other created an environment in which people from all backgrounds and cultures seemed to be accepted for who they were. It allowed me to develop into a much more well-rounded and open-minded man.', 'Freehold Borough High School is a great school to go to because of the diversity and warmness of the school. Despite the school itself being in very poor condition, the people there are unforgettable, and some of the teachers are really amazing. The one thing I would change is how the school budgets themselves, as I would try to make internal school improvements like a good heating/AC system rather than buying useless flat screen TVs for certain teachers.', 'I truly enjoyed going to Freehold High School so much. I believe that that teachers and other faculty really cared about all of the students, and it showed through all of the work they did. I also thrived in the smaller classroom settings, as Freehold High School is one of the smaller schools in the regional high school district.', 'I loved Freehold High School because of its opportunity to allow me to explore who I am as a person. Giving me an array of AP science classes that I was able to take starting freshman year, I was able to explore my academic interests wholly at Freehold. The people are what really define the experience. Growing up in a competitive environment, I was shocked to find that all the students at Freehold work together to make each other better people.', 'I was always involved in sports and activities at Freehold Borough High School so I always had school pride! School staff was always encouraging for us students to do more, as in higher levels courses and extra curricular activities.', "This school is wonderful! From the friends to the various programs (Culinary, Medical Science, and Computer Science, of which I am happy to be in) we have a wonderful student body. Don't believe what people say about us. They're just jealous! We are a wonderful school that anyone would be lucky to attend.", 'Most of my teachers are good and I enjoy talking to them. The academics are pretty good with options of taking more challenging courses. Going to school sporting events are pretty fun. The school is very diverse. I feel that I am ready to move on to college because of my high school years', 'The education is great and the teachers are fantastic. The school offers tons of classes for all levels. It has many AP classes that prepare you for college. The community is very cultured and diverse. Bruce Springsteen went to this school!', 'What can I say about Freehold Boro, it is a small High School with caring teachers and administration and well diverse.']

column6: ['I attend this school and I like it. The academics are great along with the sports teams. This school is however fairly old as it was built in 1927', "I like the diversity in the school I was raised to treat people for who they are not by the color skin or their ethnic  background.   The teachers really care about the students and want to see them exceed, when I principal talks about the school being a family she's 100% right as much as you can't wait to be a senior when you're in high school now that it's here , I would do anything to go back and relive all my memories all over again it's a refill experience and I will miss it", 'I would say one thing I really like is the diversity and how everyone gets along well. We are not a school that has cliques and groups, everyone gets along and is welcomed. I would change some of the classes and add more electives with a wide range of interests.', 'Freehold Borough High School is a "hidden treasure" in our regional district.  It is a diverse school, and the teachers are amazing.  My daughter has received a great education at Boro and has lots of great friends!  The school offers Medical Science, Computer Science and Culinary courses of study for students interested in a future career in these fields.  My daughter did "regular" high school, and we felt that she received a well-rounded education and lots of opportunities for AP, IB and Dual Enrollment with our local community college.', 'Loved this school miss it so much and my teachers as well especially my guidance teacher ! I never really had any bad experience here. Teachers are awesome . The really are their to help you work with you learn more and grow with you .', 'It is an overall very diverse school. There are a lot of clubs and activities that you can do. You can play many sports. The teachers are very involved.', 'In freehold high school, just about everyone knows everyone within the grade. There are opportunities left and right to get to know even more people and be involved with your interests. The only thing I would change is for there to actually be air conditioning.', 'Freehold High School is a good school . The teachers in this school want you to succeed and there are so many resources and people who are willing to stay after school with you to help you with homework or  study for a test. Another great thing about this school is that there are so many clubs and sports you can join its kind of hard to not be involved in something .', 'This school is the best and I am lucky that I could even apply to this school and I hope I get in very much.', 'I love Freehold Borough High School because it is like a home to me. A lot of the school staff make me feel welcome there. The classes I take are very fun so is the school itself. There are so many classes to choose from for every high school year and I would pick the ones that are required for my future career and are fun/interesting. The building itself is very beautiful, its surroundings are very lovely, and the people I met there are very nice. When it comes to doing my homework, quizzes, or tests, I would always make sure that my teachers are positive about me getting a good grade. The guidance counselors are very helpful when it comes to college planning and such.', "Teachers with different teaching styles might be confusing at first, but it is easy to get used to them and they're style of grading. The curriculum is very diverse with many subjects available. There are at least 5 choices of a course per state requirement, and plenty of other pure elective classes that you can take if they interest you. There are also alternatives like Brookdale Community College courses, that give you college credits as long as you pass the class. The schedule process is easy, as you are called down to the guidance office and the guidance counselor will tell you your options and give you the list of what you can pick from. The workload varies depending on which classes you take, but no classes will require more than 2 hours of homework as long as you stay focused while doing it. Teachers always schedule days after school to be an aid in studying or understanding lesson concepts. There is also National Honors Society tutoring by upperclassmen to help you out with subjects if you need. All classes are fairly popular depending on your interests, but a good one to take is AP Microeconomics/Macroeconomics to fulfill your financial literacy requirement, as it is a challenging yet rewarding course with a great teacher as of right now.", 'Everyone is usually very open to talk to, whether you ride in the same "social circle" or not. You can be friends with someone who loves to shop and go out while being friends with a quiet guy who enjoys comics. As long as someone isn\'t going out of there way to be disliked by everyone, all walks of life are accepted by the general student population. A lot of students are involved in the school in terms of clubs, but there is no pressure to join anything if you aren\'t comfortable. Many students will walk to town, which is about a 10 minute walk from the school to hang out or go out to eat. Most peer pressure that I have seen is positive, where students are pushing others to improve themselves. However, when negative peer pressure is seen there are usually people beside you to back you up and stand your ground. There is a lot of ethnic and racial diversity so it\'s not hard to fit in, and there are many open people who are respected for their sexual orientation or gender identity.', "There are over 100+ clubs to join, and you are always welcome to create a club. To create one all you need is signatures from friends and classmates and a teacher supervisor. There are clubs that are very lenient on attendance, while others that are very strict. There are clubs ranging from Magic: The Gathering to Yearbook to Drama to Cyber-security and even science league. There are things for you to join as long as you have interests. Clubs are also the easiest way to meet new people and befriend them. Some clubs have activities that will take you out of classes and attend competitions or field trips and they're all a lot of fun.", "I really love the open atmosphere at this school, and I don't regret my decision to come here at all. Most people are friendly and even those you don't have a lot in common with will talk to you and be very polite. The social circles that are commonly seen in stereotypical high schools don't feel as strong, which is nice because you get to befriend all different kinds of people. This school has people from all walks of life, from rich to poor to smart to a little bit challenged. There's a spot for everyone, if you just look hard enough. It's super easy to create a club if there isn't one that exists, and it's super simple to join the vast majority of clubs that are already there. Some teachers are very friendly and can even become one of your good friends, helping you out and providing you with valuable opportunities as long as you treat them with respect. This school has the Culinary Academy, Medical Science Learning Center, and the Computer Science Academy, providing specialized subjects that most other schools won't have. On top of all your high school requirements, you receive knowledge in more specialized subject that can help you later on in college whether you continue down that career path or not.", "The teachers all have varying teaching styles, but they are all very knowledgeable and most are willing to help. Once you figure out how to get the most out of each class, passing is a breeze. Almost, if not all teachers offer help certain days after school so that you can review lessons with them, or with other students. Grading is consistent, and they are fair when it comes to grades. So, if the entire class does poorly, many teachers will spend extra time reviewing the work and adding a curve to a test. While I can't speak for the teachers I've never had, all the ones I have encountered are very bright in the subjects they teach and are dedicated to helping their students succeed.", "Based on my personal experience, students are bullied everyday, but issues are quickly resolved with the help of security officers and the guidance department. In general, students are safe because evacuation and fire drills are practiced monthly, there is an intercom system to alert anyone in the building of possible threats, and the police department is within 5 minutes of the school. The nurses seem to care less about students if they think that they don't need immediate medical attention, but still take care of anyone when necessary.", 'I like the fact that every day of the week, there is always a club or organizational meeting that students can attend. Making friends is a lot easier than it is said to be, considering Lead for Diversity (LFD) and other clubs are utilized to help form bonds between incoming freshmen each and every year. No one is afraid to ask for help if they need it and everyone in the guidance office has always done their best to support the students.', 'Every year on the first day of school, teachers try their best to get to know their students on a one-to-one basis. It starts out with them remembering your name and as time goes on, they try to know you on a more personal level. If you ask any teacher, "no question is a dumb question" and bullying is to never be tolerated. Lesson plans range from inside the classroom to outside the classroom and technology usage, as well as student knowledge, is effectively used to help students grasp various concepts.', "Freehold has a mix of really smart kids and trouble makers. Bullying is sometimes seen but it usually doesn't turn into anything major. The school, especially in special events, is heavily protected by police to ensure maximum safety. I feel like the school is safe, however, there still is a few minor issues that could be improved.", 'There is a vast selection of extracurriculars at Freehold. There is art club, Italian club, Guitar club, Boro Fights Cancer, etc. There is something for everyone! Depending on the type of club, the commitment level varies.']
column8: ['I attend this school and I like it. The academics are great along with the sports teams. This school is however fairly old as it was built in 1927', "I like the diversity in the school I was raised to treat people for who they are not by the color skin or their ethnic  background.   The teachers really care about the students and want to see them exceed, when I principal talks about the school being a family she's 100% right as much as you can't wait to be a senior when you're in high school now that it's here , I would do anything to go back and relive all my memories all over again it's a refill experience and I will miss it", 'I would say one thing I really like is the diversity and how everyone gets along well. We are not a school that has cliques and groups, everyone gets along and is welcomed. I would change some of the classes and add more electives with a wide range of interests.', 'Freehold Borough High School is a "hidden treasure" in our regional district.  It is a diverse school, and the teachers are amazing.  My daughter has received a great education at Boro and has lots of great friends!  The school offers Medical Science, Computer Science and Culinary courses of study for students interested in a future career in these fields.  My daughter did "regular" high school, and we felt that she received a well-rounded education and lots of opportunities for AP, IB and Dual Enrollment with our local community college.', 'Loved this school miss it so much and my teachers as well especially my guidance teacher ! I never really had any bad experience here. Teachers are awesome . The really are their to help you work with you learn more and grow with you .', 'It is an overall very diverse school. There are a lot of clubs and activities that you can do. You can play many sports. The teachers are very involved.', 'In freehold high school, just about everyone knows everyone within the grade. There are opportunities left and right to get to know even more people and be involved with your interests. column1: Gen. Douglas MacArthur Senior High School
column2: ['Teachers and other staff members are very helpful and knowledgeable in their fields. The athletic program is amazing and there is many activities to get involved in like different clubs, honor societies spirit days and Battle of the Classes. All students are able to be included and allowed to participate in all these different activities.', 'The teachers are very nice and students are very friendly. I engaged in various activities and classes and the lunch is super delicious.', 'MacArthur is a pretty great high school! There are a lot of events that unite the community, such as the annual Pink Out breast cancer fundraiser football game, Lax for Autism, and more. Autism Awareness month is a big deal in the school and for the community, and MacArthur is fantastic at highlighting the wonderful students in the special ed programs. The school itself has a lot of class options, including many AP classes, though it can be very difficult to fit what you want in your schedule. Safety-wise, it’s very secure and students feel safe! Overall, it’s a great school!', "MacArthur has offered plenty opportunities for students to grow and develop their character. For example, MacArthur allows students to be apart of the 'Levittown Coalition for a better community', in order to get students perspectives on safety. Also every single one of my teachers is invested into not just our education, also our future. MacArthur has helped me thrive by allowing me to choose my schedule and was flexible in order for me to take all the AP courses I wanted to.  MacArthur encourages all students to participate in Autism Awareness and be involved with our ABA students.  One thing I would change about MacArthur is to add a community service project as a graduation requirement.", 'The teachers and staff are all very caring and always try their hardest to make sure us students are receiving the best education we when.', 'The teachers are amazing, they are supportive and care about your lives and your studies.  The sports and music programs are amazing. I loved all 4 years of my high school.', 'For the most part I had great teachers, good atmosphere, good people, okay funding! Loved being an athlete at this school and was very easy to be involved!', 'I like that at Gen. Douglas MacArthur Senior High School the students and staff are accepting of everyone. I also like that MacArthur has an aba program that involves students with autism and they are involved in so many activities at the school. The students on the sports teams are very helpful as well as the coaches and they make you feel like you’re part of a family. This school means a lot to me and it has helped make me the person I am today and I am very thankful for that.', 'I had an amazing time at MacArthur.  I have had great teachers and an amazing guidance counselor. There are a lot of clubs and sports.  I always felt safe at MacArthur.  Any one who goes to MacArthur should consider themselves lucky.', 'MacArthur High School has a very friendly atmosphere. The teachers are very great at what they do and are very willing to work with you, no matter if it’s an academic circumstance or a personal family related circumstance. The counselors/social workers/psychologists are very insightful and are engaged in helping you with your problems. The students are very friendly and welcoming, especially in the Advanced classes.', 'General Douglas MacArthur high school is an outstanding high school in Levittown, New York. I saw both academic and athletic success in my career at MacArthur high school and my teachers prepared me for college.', 'Very well educated teachers, safe environment for learning, provides vast amounts of clubs and sports for students to get involved. The school is very well funded providing students and teachers with new technology benefiting the learning process. However, the school does not have much diversity despite there being LGBTQ clubs and the school is inconveniently located on the corner of two major roads, so parking is an issue when picking up children from school.', 'Overall my experience at MacArthur was pretty good, the staff for the most part is caring and genuine and the academics are challenging depending on the course load you choose of course. Athletics were a main part of my life at Mac, and they were okay depending on the sport.', 'The staff is phenomenal and they are always supportive of your career choices and are always willing to lend a helping hand and give you advice to the best of their ability', 'Good sense of community; the school rallies around a good cause especially breast cancer awareness and autism awareness. The staff is for the most part very helpful and care greatly about the slogan "success for every student".', 'Gen. Douglas MacArthur Senior High School is an amazing high school! I thoroughly enjoyed every moment I spent attending this school. The teachers are fantastic and nice, and you will make many friends along the way!', 'MacArthur High School has prepared students well for college.  Many students are already taking college courses in their Junior year. The sports and activities are wonderful.  There is something for everyone.  Competitive sports teams, band, and cheerleading, successful science and math clubs.  The involvement of families is awesome.', 'The atmosphere is absolutely amazing! I made so many friends during my four years at Mac! the teachers are amazing and extremely supportive and helpful.', "My overall experience at Gen. Douglas MacArthur High School was amazing.  The school has a close community of classmates, teachers, parents and teammates.   I have a strong collection of friends that I've formed over the years thanks to my school community. My school district participates in many fundraising events such as Autism Awareness, Breast Cancer Awareness, as well as helping families with children or family members who are battling illnesses. These events have brought together all of the students, families, and faculty members in our community to form a united front. Over the years, we have grown side-by-side through ups and downs.The school has provided me with an education and the opportunity to participate in sports, teaching me life lessons, and building friendships. The only change that I would want to see is that they continue to make improvements to the facilities inside and outside of the school.", 'Over the past year I really appreciated all the safety measures they took to make the students feel safer in class']

column6: ["I loved all of my teachers that I had. they were always there if I ever needed help with work or if I wasn't getting a subject. the school is big on sports and going to football games every Friday was very fun.", 'As a student with a learning disability, my school has helped me achieve more than I thought possible.  I struggled until I was diagnosed in elementary school. With classroom accommodations and school support in place, I have managed to be a part of my school varsity soccer team and earn a NYS regents diploma. I am proud of my accomplishments and I thank my school system for that', "My experience at MacArthur High School has been a good one. In my senior year, I look back and reflect on all the great opportunities and times MacArthur has given me. Through sports, clubs and academics, I've dabbled in all of them and I have found my place in the school. Through these things and extra curriculars, I have found my friends and my home as a student and soon to be alumni. MacArthur is a great school and one I hope will continue to grow in the future.", 'My experience at my high school went pretty well. The community of our school cares about each and every one of us. Every faculty member makes sure the students are comfortable in the environment and reaches their fullest potential in classes.', 'MacArthur High School is like no other. Everyone gets along well and everyone has school spirit. The teachers are amazing and they really care about their students success.', 'I enjoyed my time at this school but to be frank I wish there was more celebration in diversity. The food choices were sub-par but what this school lacks in certain areas it retains in the academic field for obvious reasons. The faculty and staff are very helpful and truly display quality care to ensure a successful future.', 'Overall it’s a great school. The academics are amazing but I wish students would be nicer to each other.', "I loved MacArthur but I wish that sometimes it wasn't as strict about some rules. This yer they added the I'd card system that I believe isn't really needed", 'I loved how hard the faculty and staff push us to be the best we can be, it truly makes each student work harder. Sometimes the stress gets to me but i just have to remember to take a break, relax, and get back into the work ethic.', "I had quite the experience being a student in MacArthur. It was filled with moments that really made me feel great to be part of this school and moments that made me want to leave the school. One thing is I'd definitely change is the method for recruiting new staff. In my experience, I've found some teachers to not have proper teaching methods that have led to success. I feel the best option for recruiting new staff would be viewing how the teacher would be teaching and determining whether that  is an appropriate method. However one thing I enjoyed about going to MacArthur is all the school events. This served as a great time for me because I would be able to attend them and grow a strong friendship with teachers I would meet and along my four years of high school. In the end, being a student at MacArthur is something I truly don't want to forget. It has improved many things I've had a struggle with and increased my skills in multiple areas.", "I absolutely love MacArthur high school. The entire community is so welcoming, espicall for incoming freshman. The teachers are so nice and nurturing, always there to help anyone in need. The students and staff work so well together to create such an amazing academic experience. My four years of high school couldn't have gone any better. High school has been amazing and I have my community to thank for that.", 'Overall the experience has been good.  The teachers are great and education is good.  The only thing I would like to see change alittle is  give the academic kids as much attention as the sports kids get.', 'I would like to see the strict rules change and give more free time to students. There should be less homework per night and art and music programs should be as important as sports.', 'High school was an overall lovely experience, thanks to both the teachers, and resources available for the students. The instructors are intelligent, the guidance counselors are sweet and helpful, and the staff in general are wonderful people.', "High school was a great experience. The teachers and guidance counselors were very dedicated to the students' education. Students in my graduating class loved coming to school because the staff taught in a variety of ways that made learning fun.", 'so many things for students to do', 'I wouldnt have asked for anything better', 'the teachers are top notch', 'This is an average school.  The classes that are popular are due to friendships more so than the academics provided.  The homework is very light.  There is opportunity for tutoring.', "There is a nice turn out for school activities based on sports or teacher student events.  There isn't a lot of peer pressure and no issue with regards to ethnic/racial orientation.  The problem is that some middle schools were smaller than others and when entering high school you are broken up and that is where things start to be difficult.  But as time goes on you make friends."]
column8: ["The school is very proactive in special needs due to the fact that a lot of teachers' children suffer from this.  The school nurse is very approachable.  Safety is not an issue at our school.", 'There are a lot of opportunities to engage in many different clubs, however if you are an athlete you have to pick between clubs and sports.  There is not a lot of activities that will afford you the time to do sports and community service or clubs.', 'I was very disappointed in the click attitude surrounding the sports in this school.  It seemed that the sports team were a group of kids that were transported from one sport to the next with little room for other athletes to engage in the sport.  If the coach does not like you it is taken personally and reflected in your time in that sport.', 'It is like anything else you have your good and bad.  Some teachers are not tech savvy so they rely on books and handouts which is somewhat outdated.  Other teachers are not knowledgeable and use technology to fill in where they are inadequate.  There is some teachers who have gotten the right combination and are very comfortable using technology but not relying solely on it.  The best teachers give real life examples to help students better grasp what the message is.', "The teachers at this school genuinely care about their students. I would not have made it through my four years without the support of the teachers in this school. I think the teachers engagement and interest is just as important as their knowledge. If a student is struggling, and they feel like they can't talk to their teacher, then the student will continue to struggle and not reach out for help. I feel so fortunate that that was never the case at General Douglas Macarthur High School.", 'As far as health and cleanliness goes in the school, it is very obvious that the faculty and staff take precaution on being healthy and germ free. Security and staff are very ontop of who is walking in and out of the building and the reasonings behind it. I personally feel as though the school has a very clean and safe enviorment.', 'The after-school activities are great, it varies from athletic activities to educational activities and each of them come together and share such great experiences. Everyone is looked at as equal, and each individual plays a role and makes an impact.', "I've had an absolutley terrific experince in HighSchool thanks to the staff and my aqquaintances. There are no people left behind, all the events and sports are very inclusive whether or not you feel comfortable everyone makes you feel as though you are one. I would choose this school over any other because of how welcoming and warm-hearted everyone is.", 'The teachers at MacArthur HighSchool are the absolute greatest people to learn from, they make learning fun.\r  One teacher that is very devoted into what he does goes by the name of Vincent Causeman, he is in the social studies department and not only does he teach greatley in his department but he also teaches us students outside of the classroom. Mr.Causeman has two children diagnosed with Autism and he makes sure that everyone in school is aware of this illness and he is in charge of the great fundraisers, and school events pertaining to this. He is one of the many kind-hearted teachers.\r  As far as communication and consistency in grading goes all departments whether it be Math, Science, Social Studies, ect. they all seem to be very fair.', 'better since i left. i graduated in 2011 and since then it has improved', "there wasn't much to be involved in when i was in school", 'I wish my guidance counselor saw my potential. but i wound up going to community college.', 'MacArthur was alright when I went there. I hear it improved.', 'One could easily walk into this building with a weapon and kill hundreds. Cleaning practices are also unsanitary.', 'They have a lot of options, but most students arent interested.', 'I have had some wonderful times in high school; winning the county championship for soccer, battle of the classes, awareness events, prom, et cetera. Yet, my academic experience at this school has been sub-par.', 'There are so many different types of club and activities available at MacArthur High School.  Every student has the option of finding a club that best fits their interests.  The teachers and coaches for the various activities is what makes it special to be part of this great school.', 'What makes MacArthur High School unit is the fact that there is such school spirit.  From the pink out Football game to the various parades, the community comes together and it makes a difference in the students at the school.', 'All of the teachers are MacArthur High School have been wonderful.  I have connected with them and that truly helped me stay interested in the class which ultimately made me a better student.', 'Everything is great. There is no bullying, I always feel safe, the security cameras are always on, the nurse is always ready to help, and the health class informs us about a lot.']

column2: ['Smithtown High School East is a great school. There are many opportunities for clubs/activities as well as AP and college classes.', 'High School East provided me a wonderful education and school social life that has prepared me to become a bigger part of society. I am very happy I had the opportunity to attend this school.', 'Smithtown HS East as a school is great.  The teachers have been supportive and instructive.  The campus is clean and nicely kept.  Unfortunately, it is a very cliquey school and difficult to navigate socially.  The students keep to their own circles and not warm to new faces.', 'Smithtown High School East provides its students with support and many ways to better themselves whether it be academically or in any other aspect. Most of the teachers and staff put time and effort into their students lives to really impact them and prepare them for the future.', 'Smithtown East offers many extracurricular activities as well as many choices for electives. The business department offers a variety of classes, some of which can be taken for college credit. Each department of the school offers numerous field trips that are educational, but also fun. The symphonic music groups preform at Carnegie Hall every two years, which was an incredible experience.  All of the teachers (with a few exceptions) are very helpful and understanding. If you take advantage of all the school has to offer, your experience will be much more enjoyable and exciting.', 'Good education.  Good Teachers. Patents have more influence over administrators than they should. Very entitled community.', 'Smithtown High School East is a great school for academics! Almost all of the teachers are highly qualified and do a good job at preparing their students. We have an excellent music program that has been very successful. They go on a minimum of one trip per year (performed at Carnegie Hall, Six Flags, Coney Island, etc.). We have some successful sports teams, but we are definitely not the best. As a senior, I believe I am extremely prepared academically for college, especially as a STEM major. Now for the negatives:There is not a lot of diversity especially in the school. Vaping has become an epidemic in the school. So much so that they closed almost all of the bathrooms in order to prevent vaping in the stalls. However, this has done absolutely nothing to reduce the amount of vaping and has only inconvenienced the students. If you do good and stay out of trouble caused by vaping and drugs, high school at East will be a breeze.', 'SHSE allows students to be apart of any activity they want. Weather in be sports, music, or one of the core subjects, the students and faculty all try to make these areas as fun and inclusive as possible.', 'A rich school district with poor diversity, Smithtown schools offer great opportunities in the fields of music (particularly band), science (particularly in the Research Program, as well as the teachers in general), and business, with the DECA chapter.', 'I am an Alum from Smithtown High School East. I loved this school very much, I was prepared for college and felt as if I was given all the skills needed.', 'I love attending Smithtown East. There’s a variety of programs, lots of extra help offered for the students, and hard working staff. I feel as though I had many wonderful resources and was always encouraged to work hard and succeed.', "Overall my experience at Smithtown East has been excellent!  I've built relationships with teachers that I never though possible and with that my experience in the classroom was outstanding. The student body at Smithtown East is one of the most accepting and from my experience one of the best not only on Long Island but also in New York state. As an athlete, the sports teams I have been a part of were the most tightly knit group of boys that I've ever been a part of and that coupled with the athletic ability of the students contributed largely to our success.  This is a place that parents feel safe to send their children and trust that they are getting a great education.", "The school is near perfect in my opinion, but there are a few teachers that are problematic. I've only had a few problems here, but I generally had fun making friends and participating in sports.", 'the teachers are very friendly and are willing to help you. The clubs and sports are very important in the social life. highly recommend DECA.', 'I love the spirit and culture. Teachers could be better. Nurse is god awful and a witch. Field is beautiful and classrooms are great. Clubs are wonderful.', 'Smithtown HSE has one of the best faculty systems as well as various clubs and extracurriculars that facilitate us students to succeed at the highest level.', 'I enjoy my school and I don’t have negative things to say about it. It is a friendly atmosphere and we are provided with everything we need.', 'It was very good but it lacked a lot of school spirit and information was notcommunicated very well', 'I would try to diversify the school a bit more. The clubs and after school activities should be pushed onto the students more to create more of a community. Awareness about mental illnesses and more resources for students would be helpful.', 'It is easy to find a teacher to form a good relationship with at this school, as long as you are willing to put the effort in. Lost of great minds here. Joining a sport or club is the best way to find your people at this school']
