column6: ['Smithtown High School East has been a wonderful school to attend. All of the teachers that have instructed me have excelled in their field of study. There are plenty of opportunities for students to branch off to their growing passions with the many clubs and extra-curricular activities. In my experience, there have been very few issues regarding scheduling conflicts and student behavior. The administration is always on top of any issue and puts the safety of the students as their top priority.', 'Smithtown is a nice community, the teachers are great for the most part with a few exceptions) and has prepared me for college.', 'I loved Smithtown East! I was heavily involved in sports, clubs, and community service so I really made the most of my time there. The teachers are incredible and I still stay in touch with a few!', 'As a Smithtown High School East senior, I have experienced total access to a wide array of AP courses, teachers who are fluent in their curriculums, friendly peers that love and support one another, sports teams that claim some of the best athletes on Long Island, welcoming staff members, and counselors that are fully-devoted to making the college process easier. The school is usually very clean and organized, and the security guards ensure that it is as safe as possible. The food is not above-average, but certainly not below, as we do get a fairly-wide selection of lunch options. Students of many different ethnic backgrounds attend Smithtown East, and everyone seems to get along fine. Overall, Smithtown High School East is a warm and inviting campus for students who are seeking a great education and extensive college preparation.', 'The teachers and academics were mostly fantastic, but I wish it was more diverse. The administration was very helpful and friendly as well. The food was pretty in-edible at some points, but everything else always seemed very safe. In most aspects, it got me ready for college, and as a college sophomore with friends from all around New England, I feel that Smithtown got me ready for college more than some of my friends who are from different states and cities.', 'I have liked most of my teachers and the opportunities that are awarded to me. also, the robotics team is pretty amazing', 'East is beast. West is the best. There is celaings on the floors and floors on the Celling. This is not good. An elf ate my ham sandwich and a dwarf kicked me in the shins', 'I have spent the last 4 years at Smithtown High School East and it has been the best 4 years of my life!', 'Excellent teachers and education   My daughter attends wilson tech as and extra ability to learn a specific skill in which she selected early childhood education. Thanks to smithtown school district having this agreement with wilson tech she is excelling in the program', 'Smithtown East is a very good school. It is clean and up to date and the staff are very helpful and caring. I feel very lucky to be given the opportunity to go to such a great school that has opened up so many options for my future and have made me ready for the next stage of my life.', 'I would like to see the building updated. i would also like to see the visitors bleachers at the turf updated', 'I have enjoyed my experience at Smithtown high school As part of two varsity sports, I have gotten a lot of support from the school as well', 'I would like the music program and theatre program to be more funded. The musical brings in thousands of dollars each year, and I believe that more money should be put into the program in order to help further student involvement.', "I love Smithtown East! There are so many opportunities and outlets to advance your education. I was involved in a myriad of clubs. The food is great- it's basically an in-school Boar's Head Subway!", 'Smithtown High School East is a great school. The Smithtown district works hard to make sure every student is getting the education they deserve. Teachers offer countless extra help sessions to make their students feel better about their knowledge of the material. There is a wide variety of courses students can take. All the teachers are very friendly. While the homework can be excessive sometimes it is all for the students best interests. The teachers care about the students and want to see them excel. Overall I love my experience at Smithtown East', "Personally and honestly my three years at Smithtown High school East weren't always the best. I came to that school in the 10th grade and coming from a school that was diverse to a school that so much isn't is a huge change for me. Academic wise it wasn't so bad I was able to get the work. But student wise not my favorite, but I don't mind the school it's just the people who get to me. And being of Haitian decent and where the world is today with racism and Donald Trump being president is not always a cake walk in the school. I'm even surprised that I made it through the year but thank Goodness I did.", "I like that the teachers really get involved with the students.  I have had wonderful teachers that have helped me after my concussion.  The principal is amazing and very involved with the students.  The music Dept and athletics  dept are both great, especially since I'm involved in both! The one thing I would love to see a change in is the food , it is not very good.  More security to cut down on drugs and vaping in the bathroom.  I don't use the bathroom sometimes because of this and I don't want to be in there while drugs are being used or passed around.", 'Smithtown High School East is a good school to develop and learn from which prepares you well for college', 'I loved everything about Smithtown East. The teachers were the best part about attending school everyday. They all really care about each of their students and it makes learning a lot easier.', 'Smithtown High School East was a great high school.  They gave me opportunities to work in the main office and join many clubs.  The staff in attentive and helpful.']

column2: ["It's basically a liberal arts institute without the amenities. The independence that is offered to students, whether it be the choice of courses or letting students explore into different disciplines and not restricting them with unnecessary requirements is what makes the school so appealing. The building is lacking, truth be told and we don't have the best facilities. But at the end of the day, we are one of the most diverse schools NYC has to offer. And certainly one of its best.", 'The NYC iSchool offers many great opportunities. Students are able to choose their own classes which creates an individualized high school experience.', 'This school is amazing. The teachers are very helpful and caring. The work students do is meaningful to them because they choose their courses, which makes them more engaged with what they learn. It prepares students for college through advisory and college prep meetings. The academics feel interesting and challenging. Aps are offered too. The administration put a lot of work into weekly emails that offer updates and program oppurtunities. You can go to anybody working here for help academically or emotionally. The people are also nice and supportive, and there are a bunch of clubs offered. The sports facilities are not too strong, seeing as there is a weight equipment room and a half gymnasium thats shared with the auditorium. Besides that, it is a great school in a great area.', "After being at the school for 4 years, I have grown to love the NYC iSchool in all of it creative, weird, and unique qualities it displays. From the courses provided such as The Science of Yoga and Meditation and Happiness 101 to the amazing faculty and staff, I can confidently say that this school provided me with high school experience that's paralleled to none. The curriculum goes beyond testing a student's ability to memorize facts and formulas, but rather pushes students to think critically about the information they're taking in and make informed decisions about how they perceive the world around them. Each grade has support systems that will allow the student body to remain motivated and eager throughout their high school career. If I hadn't gone to this school in 9th grade, it's hard to envision my being the current person I am today.", "I believe that this school is a very good school for students that want a diverse and smaller learning experience. This school isn't too big when it comes to student size. You are able to connect with teachers and they are always available to help you as they are flexible.", "The academics at iSchool are truly great. The school offers a wide range of classes to challenge students in the best way. Personally, I really thrived in the academic environment at iSchool. The majority of the teachers are wonderful as well, always willing to help students. However, the administration isn't always as accommodating or kind, and the facilities are less than amazing.", "I had an astounding experience at the NYC iSchool! The way that the modules intertwined DOE's academic curriculum and real-world issues is ingenious, and really serves for the non-contemporary student.", 'The NYC iSchool offers a unique high school experience for students. The curriculum in the courses allows students to break from the usual standard of teaching and allow them to think deeper on subjects in order to display "mastery" on that specific subject. One of the core beliefs of the iSchool is that a student\'s worth is not determined by a grade they receive, but on the work, they put in.', 'NYC iSchool prepares students to go to college very well and gets students ready for their future. The students are encouraged to attend programs outside of school, think critically, and do more than just school work. My one problem is there is a lack of clubs at school.', 'Throughout my four years at the NYC iSchool, I had nothing but positive thoughts about the school. The teachers truly care about each individual student and they want to help everyone be successful. The classes are tailored to meet the needs and interests of the students. I have felt the strong sense of community that bonds this school together. At the iSchool, the students are encouraged to work with each other and build off of one another. I have made a lot of friends throughout my time at the iSchool. Every time I have needed to talk with someone, whether it was my advisor, a teacher, or even another student, they have always made time to help me in any way they can. They are truly excellent resources to have as you move along your four years of high school and even start preparing for college. I can honestly say that the NYC iSchool has brought me the happiest four years of my life.', 'the administration is agreeably the most disappointing part of the school, diversity is low, otherwise a fantastic school', "I love the iSchool. Great teachers, great admin, amazing opportunities, unique courses, diverse student body, student-led clubs, fantastic location, small close-knit environment. This school is home to students of all levels, from ivy league to liberal arts to community college students go everywhere. There is no 'one' ischool experience. Everyone takes different classes because there is a large emphasis on choice and individuality.", "I have had an excellent experience at school so far. It varies so much from your typical high school. Students can pick their classes while still having core classes such as math, English, science, etc. This is the school for the student looking for something different. We don't have a big gym or have football games, but we are a very inclusive community looking to accept and embrace diversity. While it can be challenging being a minority student attending an excellent school, the school is very diverse, and even if you feel like you may not fit in, there are a variety of clubs.", 'I loved my experience at the iSchool a lot. The best part is all the amazing teachers here. They all care so much and are really good at their jobs. It is such a great community, and I really learned how to take control of my own education and be a self driven student. It is very clear that the students who are successful here are the students who want to be.', 'Overall, my experience at the NYC iSchool was enjoyable. One thing I loved is that the classes were unique, which made for an interesting hands-on learning experience. The teachers were amazing, and I always felt like we were on the same team. I was never intimidated or scared to ask for help because I knew they were on my side. If I could change one thing about the school, it would be our culture and traditions. Our school is very small and I feel like its the perfect size for a tight knit community, but the school spirit is very low and I feel as if I missed out on that throughout my high school experience.', 'The NYC iSchool is an amazing school where every student will work hard and do well for the time they are here. This schools offers a mastery policy, meaning you are allowed to retake tests and redo assignments until you show mastery in that subject area. Furthermore, this school offers an array of classes you can apply to, and some very unusual classes at that. Currently, I am learning about history through movies in a class called "Reel Global History", but last year, I took a class called "Food Revolution" in which we learned about nutrition and eating healthy, and even went down to our own garden in Battery park! One this I would change is how much work you get. Some students might be in shock in college especially because you are not required to take any AP classes in this school, and if you don\'t, you can have little to no work.', "So far, my years at the NYC iSchool have been much better than I could have envisioned high school to be. The iSchool's uniqueness is what makes it stand out, in terms of allowing students to choose their classes and offer some classes to be taught by the students themselves through online classes. iSchool, however, doesn't  make me feel super prepared for college, as it does not give a lot of homework. While some people may feel thankful for not having much homework, it doesn't prepare us for the excessive studying and workload of college.. But the iSchool does a good job of providing programs and opportunities in addition to clubs and some sports.", "Incredibly innovative high school. Perfect population size- close community, but you're often meeting new people or getting closer to acquaintances. The teachers are incredible! So dedicated, they listen to the students, and they put a lot of effort into creating engaging and impact classes. Our strongest departments are English and Science. Art and PE departments could be improved. The college office is one of the best of any high school I've seen, so helpful! Diversity isn't outstanding but the administration is making a huge effort to reach more prospective students of color. There are a lot of stairs but its worth it. I've had an amazing experience, I highly recommend it.", 'The teachers at the NYC iSchool are invested in you and your success. They are helpful resources for how to navigate high school and how to excel in higher-education. I feel that the structure of the iSchool prepared me very well for college. The modules gave me real world experiences that have influenced my studies in college and the freedom I had to choose my classes made the process of doing so in college much easier.', 'Such an amazing school, where you are treated as an individual. You will be taught how to be a citizen of the 21st century. You will also take a creative approach in obtaining problem-solving and critical thinking skills. The administration and the teachers really care about students and their well-being. They will motivate you in every way possible. A plus is that you get to go out for lunch. Your voice will definitely be heard here. The support here will go beyond your high school years. Great school.']
column4: ["It's basically a liberal arts institute without the amenities. The independence that is offered to students, whether it be the choice of courses or letting students explore into different disciplines and not restricting them with unnecessary requirements is what makes the school so appealing. The building is lacking, truth be told and we don't have the best facilities. But at the end of the day, we are one of the most diverse schools NYC has to offer. And certainly one of its best.", 'The NYC iSchool offers many great opportunities. Students are able to choose their own classes which creates an individualized high school experience.', 'This school is amazing. The teachers are very helpful and caring. The work students do is meaningful to them because they choose their courses, which makes them more engaged with what they learn. It prepares students for college through advisory and college prep meetings. The academics feel interesting and challenging. Aps are offered too. The administration put a lot of work into weekly emails that offer updates and program oppurtunities. You can go to anybody working here for help academically or emotionally. The people are also nice and supportive, and there are a bunch of clubs offered. The sports facilities are not too strong, seeing as there is a weight equipment room and a half gymnasium thats shared with the auditorium. Besides that, it is a great school in a great area.', "After being at the school for 4 years, I have grown to love the NYC iSchool in all of it creative, weird, and unique qualities it displays. From the courses provided such as The Science of Yoga and Meditation and Happiness 101 to the amazing faculty and staff, I can confidently say that this school provided me with high school experience that's paralleled to none. The curriculum goes beyond testing a student's ability to memorize facts and formulas, but rather pushes students to think critically about the information they're taking in and make informed decisions about how they perceive the world around them. Each grade has support systems that will allow the student body to remain motivated and eager throughout their high school career. If I hadn't gone to this school in 9th grade, it's hard to envision my being the current person I am today.", "I believe that this school is a very good school for students that want a diverse and smaller learning experience. This school isn't too big when it comes to student size. You are able to connect with teachers and they are always available to help you as they are flexible.", "The academics at iSchool are truly great. The school offers a wide range of classes to challenge students in the best way. Personally, I really thrived in the academic environment at iSchool. The majority of the teachers are wonderful as well, always willing to help students. However, the administration isn't always as accommodating or kind, and the facilities are less than amazing.", "I had an astounding experience at the NYC iSchool! The way that the modules intertwined DOE's academic curriculum and real-world issues is ingenious, and really serves for the non-contemporary student.", 'The NYC iSchool offers a unique high school experience for students. The curriculum in the courses allows students to break from the usual standard of teaching and allow them to think deeper on subjects in order to display "mastery" on that specific subject. One of the core beliefs of the iSchool is that a student\'s worth is not determined by a grade they receive, but on the work, they put in.', 'NYC iSchool prepares students to go to college very well and gets students ready for their future. The students are encouraged to attend programs outside of school, think critically, and do more than just school work. My one problem is there is a lack of clubs at school.', 'Throughout my four years at the NYC iSchool, I had nothing but positive thoughts about the school. The teachers truly care about each individual student and they want to help everyone be successful. The classes are tailored to meet the needs and interests of the students. I have felt the strong sense of community that bonds this school together. At the iSchool, the students are encouraged to work with each other and build off of one another. I have made a lot of friends throughout my time at the iSchool. Every time I have needed to talk with someone, whether it was my advisor, a teacher, or even another student, they have always made time to help me in any way they can. They are truly excellent resources to have as you move along your four years of high school and even start preparing for college. I can honestly say that the NYC iSchool has brought me the happiest four years of my life.', 'the administration is agreeably the most disappointing part of the school, diversity is low, otherwise a fantastic school', "I love the iSchool. Great teachers, great admin, amazing opportunities, unique courses, diverse student body, student-led clubs, fantastic location, small close-knit environment. This school is home to students of all levels, from ivy league to liberal arts to community college students go everywhere. There is no 'one' ischool experience. Everyone takes different classes because there is a large emphasis on choice and individuality.", "I have had an excellent experience at school so far. It varies so much from your typical high school. Students can pick their classes while still having core classes such as math, English, science, etc. This is the school for the student looking for something different. We don't have a big gym or have football games, but we are a very inclusive community looking to accept and embrace diversity. While it can be challenging being a minority student attending an excellent school, the school is very diverse, and even if you feel like you may not fit in, there are a variety of clubs.", 'I loved my experience at the iSchool a lot. The best part is all the amazing teachers here. They all care so much and are really good at their jobs. It is such a great community, and I really learned how to take control of my own education and be a self driven student. It is very clear that the students who are successful here are the students who want to be.', 'Overall, my experience at the NYC iSchool was enjoyable. One thing I loved is that the classes were unique, which made for an interesting hands-on learning experience. The teachers were amazing, and I always felt like we were on the same team. I was never intimidated or scared to ask for help because I knew they were on my side. If I could change one thing about the school, it would be our culture and traditions. Our school is very small and I feel like its the perfect size for a tight knit community, but the school spirit is very low and I feel as if I missed out on that throughout my high school experience.', 'The NYC iSchool is an amazing school where every student will work hard and do well for the time they are here. This schools offers a mastery policy, meaning you are allowed to retake tests and redo assignments until you show mastery in that subject area. Furthermore, this school offers an array of classes you can apply to, and some very unusual classes at that. Currently, I am learning about history through movies in a class called "Reel Global History", but last year, I took a class called "Food Revolution" in which we learned about nutrition and eating healthy, and even went down to our own garden in Battery park! One this I would change is how much work you get. Some students might be in shock in college especially because you are not required to take any AP classes in this school, and if you don\'t, you can have little to no work.', "So far, my years at the NYC iSchool have been much better than I could have envisioned high school to be. The iSchool's uniqueness is what makes it stand out, in terms of allowing students to choose their classes and offer some classes to be taught by the students themselves through online classes. iSchool, however, doesn't  make me feel super prepared for college, as it does not give a lot of homework. While some people may feel thankful for not having much homework, it doesn't prepare us for the excessive studying and workload of college.. But the iSchool does a good job of providing programs and opportunities in addition to clubs and some sports.", "Incredibly innovative high school. Perfect population size- close community, but you're often meeting new people or getting closer to acquaintances. The teachers are incredible! So dedicated, they listen to the students, and they put a lot of effort into creating engaging and impact classes. Our strongest departments are English and Science. Art and PE departments could be improved. The college office is one of the best of any high school I've seen, so helpful! Diversity isn't outstanding but the administration is making a huge effort to reach more prospective students of color. There are a lot of stairs but its worth it. I've had an amazing experience, I highly recommend it.", 'The teachers at the NYC iSchool are invested in you and your success. They are helpful resources for how to navigate high school and how to excel in higher-education. I feel that the structure of the iSchool prepared me very well for college. The modules gave me real world experiences that have influenced my studies in college and the freedom I had to choose my classes made the process of doing so in college much easier.', 'Such an amazing school, where you are treated as an individual. You will be taught how to be a citizen of the 21st century. You will also take a creative approach in obtaining problem-solving and critical thinking skills. The administration and the teachers really care about students and their well-being. They will motivate you in every way possible. A plus is that you get to go out for lunch. Your voice will definitely be heard here. The support here will go beyond your high school years. Great school.']

column8: ['The classes and creativity around the school is amazing.  I look forward to class everyday and propel myself to work hard and stay focused.', 'Overall, this school is easy to fit in and be independent. Its great knowing that your school is unique compared to other typical NYC schools because they have modules (quarter long classes related to 21st century) and we are able to choose out our classes every quarter depending on what we want rather than what the school wants. They offer online classes like for US history which was a great way to self-teach. The teachers here are really friendly and passionate about their job with a lot of ambitious energy! They also have advisories, which are somewhat like homerooms but we do many engaging activities with my classmates. I would definitely recommend this school if you are look for a creative way to challenge yourself.', "NYC iSchool is a comfortable learning space for students to branch out and build strength. Not only does this school prepare you for college, but also gives the essential tools for real life situation. At this school you'll learn the importance of communication, respect, problem solving and more. This is a safe place, acceptance of all communities no matter gender, sexuality, or nationality. Whichever category in which you fall, you are assured to feel included.", "The thing that I like most about the iSchool is that since it's a small school, you get to know the teachers, staff, and students well. You get to form strong connections with teachers which is a good thing because not only are they your teacher but they can become a role model or someone you can trust in which also applies to other staff as well. As for the students, since it's such a small amount of students we help each other out if needed, a lot of the students at this school are really nice to each other and don't really get into problems with each other.", "It's alright. The environment and atmosphere is okay. I mean you can tell the people there don't really care about you they just care about their reputation. Some teachers are really amazing and some are just terrible. But you get to have good classes sometimes and have some fun. This doesn't feel like you traditional high school. Everyone does their own thing and has their own group. There's no jocks, cheerleaders and all that other crap -- little to no bullying. Some stubble racism here and there but nothing that can't be talked about or helped.", "I had a great time at the iSchool, the school really welcomes any student in open arms. It breaks the stigma that high school is daunting. The environment is peaceful, welcoming, and supportive. They aim to have students be as successful as they can with office hours and being able to make up important assignments . I wish that the sports teams were a bit more established, but that will come with time. The school soccer team just came into fruition recently. An excellent college ready program that helps students with the many parts of applying for college, be it financial aid, grades, recommendation letters, etc. The counselors make sure that every student is looked after with the time they need. The use of technology is unique as well, you don't have to be a tech wiz to go to this school. Just be familiar with Google Drive. The administration are very warmhearted and will greet you with a smile every day. Teachers teach in unique styles and formats that really engage the students.", 'NYCiSchool is a great school for people that want to challenge themselves. Teachers really look out for you and they support you each step of the way.', 'I absolutely loved my time at NYC iSchool. The teachers, the administration, and the students made my high school experience so incredibly comfortable and sweet. I enjoyed the many helpful reminders that the administration sent in their email newsletters and how they helped me during the college search process by sitting with me and discussing my interests and options. NYC iSchool helped develop me into the person I am today by allowing me to explore my interests in the module block, which is a section during the day where we take a class that we picked out of the course descriptions that deals with a problem the real world is currently facing. However, the one thing I would like to see change is the school having their own gymnasium as we only have a weight room that we share with another school in our building. Having said this, the NYC iSchool is a fantastic school everyone should check out as it has really changed my life for the better.', "The NYC iSchool is a unique high school that blends the learning styles of a small liberal arts college, with the resources of a Specialized High School. The iSchool allows for students to figure out what they like and introduces students to different teaching styles, learning styles, and ideas that would normally not be present in a high school. In my four years at the NYC iSchool, I've exposed to many different ideas, forced to play devil's advocate with my beliefs and have become prepared for college and life outside of high school. I would not change my decision to attend this school, as it will forever play a role in how I approach new situations in my life.", "This school is great because they give us active learning in many engaging ways like module. I do not regret applying for a great school like this because it gives you a 21st century experience with more online stuff instead of textbooks. The teachers here are really kind and the students here too. Not only do we get more freedom like going out for lunch but we also get our own personalized schedules. We also have this place called the commons which is really nice and advisories which help students bond together. The only thing I wish they would could improve on is their PE. They also don't give a lot of homework because they would rather have you be active in the community by joining programs or doing activities outside of school!", 'This school was very enjoyable and a great experience for me. I loved going here. The teachers are very excited to go to work and offer to help students when ever they get the chance.', 'I absolutely love the tight-knit community present at the iSchool. A unique aspect of the iSchool, known to students as "Advisory", allows students to have a strong relationship with a teacher (their advisor) at the iSchool throughout all 4 years. Their advisor assures the students re on track to college, and when the time comes, to complete the FAFSA and all other college applications.In addition, another unique aspect of the iSchool, known formally as "modules", is a 1 1/2 hr class that tends to incorporate students of all grades. Thanks to this, it is absolutely normal to see seniors be friends with freshmen, always being supportive and guiding them through the iSchool "ways".Of course, all things can be improved, and if anything, the iSchool should strive to attain their own school building. In doing so, more than enough space is opened for more varsity sports, clubs and the sorts. Nonetheless, great school!', "My experience in the iSchool has been a pleasant one. All four years that I've been there, they have been very supporting. The iSchool is very different from many other high schools, they give you more opportunities in your studies to get the grade you really want. In the school thats called Mastery, which you can make up whenever you want, and that includes exams, projects and also essays. Not only in academics do they help you with, but also experiences in the real world, the Vice-Principal sends out emails every week about new after school programs, internships and also clubs that anyone can join around New York City.", "This school has been the pinnacle of my teenage years since it's not your average 'get a diploma and graduate school'. It's a place where the student is given the freedom and ability to select the exact courses they want, while also developing skills and techniques that you would normally find in your typical College Freshman. The NYC iSchool is a community of teachers and students that work together in near perfect unison to ensure that both parties are learning what needs to be taught-- whether it be the derivative of a number or a certain life lesson that we must face sooner or later.", 'When I entered NYC iSchool as a freshman, I was met with independence and kindness. The teachers are extremely friendly and genuinely care for the well being of the students.  Their openness allows for close bonds to form, which in turn enable the students to do better in classes. The classes themselves were extremely interesting and these classes varied in topic and allowed the students to decide their own interests. The independence that iSchool offered me really helped me to become a confident young adult; I could experiment with different classes, set my own schedule, and reap the benefits of hard work. The relationships I formed with my teachers helped me to communicate better, both in employment and in regular social situations. This school had many clubs and had enough laptops for every student; even allowing laptops to be taken home overnight. This school is revolutionary and it has made me who I am today.', 'The NYC iSchool has been an amazing experience for me as a senior here at the iSchool. The faculty and staff have a great connection with their students. As soon as I walked into the iSchool I was very welcomed and felt safe.  I have enjoyed the four years at this school and wouldnt change it for anything.', "Its always a complicated but interesting story to tell when it comes to the NYC iSchool. Finding this school the first day was so difficult, since it shares a building with Chelsea, another highschool. After climbing 5 sets of stairs, you see familiar faces and administration who know your name. This highschool is like a small liberal arts college. You can choose your own classes and create clubs. There would be classes like Global Feminism, Robotics, Painting NYC, iSchool to Wallstreet, Astrobiology, etc. With unique classes, you have the option to explore different fields possibly changing your interest into something you'd never though you like. The academics aren’t top notch. Yet if you study in your own time & work hard, you might even be scouted by colleges. The NYC iSchool is great at creating open minded individuals with motivation, voice, and passion to create their own imprints in the world. If it wasn't for this school, I would not be half the person I am today.", "It's the most amazing high school in Manhattan. They are truly preparing you for life and college.", "Not many kids use drugs so there's no need for constant search of drugs. Kids using drugs is hardly noticeable", 'The school sends at least once a month a list of programs that have oppuritunities on them for you to do, such as internships, clubs, etc.']

column2: ['I enjoyed the higher-level classes and teachers and felt that they best prepared me for college. A lot of focus was on the ranking the school got in the state, so there were more and more standardized tests every year I was there.', 'I believe this school is exceptional in the programs they offer. I believe the administration can be better with being more diverse in racial opinion', 'The teachers were very caring. The school took pride in standardized test scores. High percentage of AP participants. The community is very affluent and clean. Great atmosphere and athletics.', 'Mount Olive High School academics get us more than prepared for college, are classes are more vigorous and challenge than most classes. The guidance counselors were not helpful at all, they were not involved and they were so slow at getting anything to my college.', 'Mount Olive High is a very good school with many resources and the community is also great. The teachers there are always there to help you. There are some great clubs and classes.', 'The school felt like a prison. Classes were not all that difficult and a few teachers were actually good. School was maintained well with new lockers, technology, and gym equipment frequently. It had a much better art program than most of the surrounding schools.', 'This school was just starting to change when I graduated, but overall I would say I had a typical high school experience. Average teachers, some great, and some really terrible. The students are variable, but some are definitely entitled. The food is average at best, and the curriculum seems to focus in on some useless information.', 'Good school you can go to. Have multiple opportunities to grow. This school is perfect for anybody, even if you have difficulty in a certain subject or you can understand at a faster pace, it is a school I recommend that you enroll in.', 'I loved my high school experience.  All of the programs and extra curricular activities that are available at Mount Olive High School make this a unique learning environment.', 'I enjoyed many teachers and certain classes and especially playing sports and meeting some of my best friends to this day. Administration can be rough at times but the school overall has everything you need to prepare for your future at college', 'Mount Olive is a great school if you want your child to be immersed into STEAM related activities. We have an amazing art program, where students get to work with our recording studio, and take classes dedicated to the arts. Aside from art, Mount Olive has amazing programs dedicated to STEM. We have a Millstone program where students are put into teams and they have to invent a project with a certain budget. When they are done, their inventions are presented to companies like Siemens. It is a great opportunity for students to learn about teamwork and what to expect when they enter the STEM field. The teachers at Mount Olive are amazing, they really want the children to succeed. The one thing that lacks in Mount Olive, is the community. It is a school with many cliques, and many students tend to feel left out. Unless you live in a large house and interact with your neighbors, your child will have a hard time making friends.', "I am very grateful for all the opportunities at Mount Olive. There are a lot of different electives and extracurriculars that peak students' interests. Students are also encouraged to take honors and AP classes to prepare us for college, and I feel like I have benefitted from this.", 'Mount Olive High School is one of the best high schools I have known. It not only educates students but also motivates and engages them to participate in extracurricular activities. Everyone is always ready to help and the school also provides programs that help students with their academics. The availability of awesome clubs and sports help the students get involved on campus, gain leadership skills and experiences, and also help the students make new friends. In general, this is an outstanding school that hits all the points of exceptionalism.', "Mount olive high school creates a safe and welcoming learning environment where the students are pushed to be the best they can be. There is a lot of support offered from each teacher and most of all there is so much  pride. It's great to be a marauder.", 'Mount Olive High School has great pride and opportunities. We have a beautiful campus with a big stadium, a track, football, soccer, softball, and baseball fields, inflatable dome, recording studio, Performing Arts Center, and a Mill where we have our very own 3D printers. The clubs provided are also extremely popular; ranging from National Honors Society, to Gay Straight Alliance, to Robotics. What I am most concerned with, is the fact that my school has an amazing art department. There are 5 art teachers focusing on different directions. They are very professional and guide their students to a successful art path. I started out high school not entirely involved with my artwork but the classes I took advanced my skills and introduced me to new ideas. The teachers provide a comfortable workspace where students can express their artwork freely. Without Mount Olive High School, I would not have become the artist I am today.', "Mount Olive is a great high school. There are so many opportunities for the students there. Whether it's sports, arts, clubs, stem, you name it mount olive has it. They are always looking for ways to improve the high school and make it better which is awesome.", "I loved my time at Mount Olive High School. As long as you find a way to get involved, the fun never ends! Mount Olive offers a wide variety of courses and resources so that as a high school student, you can succeed. My high school experience included fun times with my friends, great athletic gathers, and a lot of studying! It's a great day to be a marauder.", 'I have had a positive experience at Mount Olive High School. Since my freshman year the school has added and upgraded many facilities. I feel that I have been able to challenge myself with rigorous courses that have prepared me for college. Most teachers are well educated about the information they are teaching. The past year or so the school has taken many measures to ensure the safety of the students and staff.', 'I am Freshman in MOHS, this school is not bad but not good at the same time. The teachers don´t really care about your grades and put in the wrong grades all the time.', 'Mount Olive High School looks like a college campus. we have everything you could ever think of. from a football stadium, to a turf football field, to our turf soccer field, to our "dome" that covers the soccer field, to both baseball and softball fields, to our four basketball courts, to not one, two, but three gyms and two workout gyms, to our outstanding overall learning community, mount olive high school is truly the greatest school to graduate from.']
column4: ['I enjoyed the higher-level classes and teachers and felt that they best prepared me for college. A lot of focus was on the ranking the school got in the state, so there were more and more standardized tests every year I was there.', 'I believe this school is exceptional in the programs they offer. I believe the administration can be better with being more diverse in racial opinion', 'The teachers were very caring. The school took pride in standardized test scores. High percentage of AP participants. The community is very affluent and clean. Great atmosphere and athletics.', 'Mount Olive High School academics get us more than prepared for college, are classes are more vigorous and challenge than most classes. The guidance counselors were not helpful at all, they were not involved and they were so slow at getting anything to my college.', 'Mount Olive High is a very good school with many resources and the community is also great. The teachers there are always there to help you. There are some great clubs and classes.', 'The school felt like a prison. Classes were not all that difficult and a few teachers were actually good. School was maintained well with new lockers, technology, and gym equipment frequently. It had a much better art program than most of the surrounding schools.', 'This school was just starting to change when I graduated, but overall I would say I had a typical high school experience. Average teachers, some great, and some really terrible. The students are variable, but some are definitely entitled. The food is average at best, and the curriculum seems to focus in on some useless information.', 'Good school you can go to. Have multiple opportunities to grow. This school is perfect for anybody, even if you have difficulty in a certain subject or you can understand at a faster pace, it is a school I recommend that you enroll in.', 'I loved my high school experience.  All of the programs and extra curricular activities that are available at Mount Olive High School make this a unique learning environment.', 'I enjoyed many teachers and certain classes and especially playing sports and meeting some of my best friends to this day. Administration can be rough at times but the school overall has everything you need to prepare for your future at college', 'Mount Olive is a great school if you want your child to be immersed into STEAM related activities. We have an amazing art program, where students get to work with our recording studio, and take classes dedicated to the arts. Aside from art, Mount Olive has amazing programs dedicated to STEM. We have a Millstone program where students are put into teams and they have to invent a project with a certain budget. When they are done, their inventions are presented to companies like Siemens. It is a great opportunity for students to learn about teamwork and what to expect when they enter the STEM field. The teachers at Mount Olive are amazing, they really want the children to succeed. The one thing that lacks in Mount Olive, is the community. It is a school with many cliques, and many students tend to feel left out. Unless you live in a large house and interact with your neighbors, your child will have a hard time making friends.', "I am very grateful for all the opportunities at Mount Olive. There are a lot of different electives and extracurriculars that peak students' interests. Students are also encouraged to take honors and AP classes to prepare us for college, and I feel like I have benefitted from this.", 'Mount Olive High School is one of the best high schools I have known. It not only educates students but also motivates and engages them to participate in extracurricular activities. Everyone is always ready to help and the school also provides programs that help students with their academics. The availability of awesome clubs and sports help the students get involved on campus, gain leadership skills and experiences, and also help the students make new friends. In general, this is an outstanding school that hits all the points of exceptionalism.', "Mount olive high school creates a safe and welcoming learning environment where the students are pushed to be the best they can be. There is a lot of support offered from each teacher and most of all there is so much  pride. It's great to be a marauder.", 'Mount Olive High School has great pride and opportunities. We have a beautiful campus with a big stadium, a track, football, soccer, softball, and baseball fields, inflatable dome, recording studio, Performing Arts Center, and a Mill where we have our very own 3D printers. The clubs provided are also extremely popular; ranging from National Honors Society, to Gay Straight Alliance, to Robotics. What I am most concerned with, is the fact that my school has an amazing art department. There are 5 art teachers focusing on different directions. They are very professional and guide their students to a successful art path. I started out high school not entirely involved with my artwork but the classes I took advanced my skills and introduced me to new ideas. The teachers provide a comfortable workspace where students can express their artwork freely. Without Mount Olive High School, I would not have become the artist I am today.', "Mount Olive is a great high school. There are so many opportunities for the students there. Whether it's sports, arts, clubs, stem, you name it mount olive has it. They are always looking for ways to improve the high school and make it better which is awesome.", "I loved my time at Mount Olive High School. As long as you find a way to get involved, the fun never ends! Mount Olive offers a wide variety of courses and resources so that as a high school student, you can succeed. My high school experience included fun times with my friends, great athletic gathers, and a lot of studying! It's a great day to be a marauder.", 'I have had a positive experience at Mount Olive High School. Since my freshman year the school has added and upgraded many facilities. I feel that I have been able to challenge myself with rigorous courses that have prepared me for college. Most teachers are well educated about the information they are teaching. The past year or so the school has taken many measures to ensure the safety of the students and staff.', 'I am Freshman in MOHS, this school is not bad but not good at the same time. The teachers don´t really care about your grades and put in the wrong grades all the time.', 'Mount Olive High School looks like a college campus. we have everything you could ever think of. from a football stadium, to a turf football field, to our turf soccer field, to our "dome" that covers the soccer field, to both baseball and softball fields, to our four basketball courts, to not one, two, but three gyms and two workout gyms, to our outstanding overall learning community, mount olive high school is truly the greatest school to graduate from.']

column8: ["I love Mount Olive High School. The atmosphere and the environment of walking into school every single day is always welcomed by all the faculty. The sports program at the school is beyond phenomenal and I couldn't be happier to have been part of this school for the past 4 years.", 'MOHS has a good special education program. However,  the general education teachers need training on how to include these students in their class. As a parent, I find myself teaching some of the elective subjects to my son because the teacher was ineffective.  There are activities for the special needs students, but poorly communicated to their parents. Overall it is a good school for students with special needs. There needs to be books the students can access online or bring home to student for tests. Giving them study guides a week before quarterlies is not enough time to prepare.', 'Mount Olive High School provided a solid education preparing my for college. There is always room for improvement, but it is a good high school especially compared to many others.', "There are a lot of really unique opportunities for you to grow in almost any field you're interested in.", 'I liked how well-rounded the school district was. It taught me a lot about analyzing texts, to understanding mathematics, to musical and physical training. Plus, the studio is extremely nice and there is an amazing stadium to watch the games in.', 'Mount Olive has a very good education with teachers who are always willing to help you if you ask or they see you struggling. The athletics here are also very involved, with each team in every season excelling. Many athletic alumni have gone on to play D1, D2, and D3 sports. For new students, Mount Olive has counselors that are very helpful with classes, college planning, and scholarship opportunities. Mount Olive is also one of the most diverse schools in the area.', 'Mount Olive Highschool is a wonderful learning facility with amazing opportunities for everyone. The faculty members all have extensive knowledge of the subject they teach and are very helpful. The teachers at Mount Olive Highschool try to make themselves available to students as much as possible and dedicate much time and effort to the progress of students. Mount Olive Highschool has exceptional resources and materials. The students at Mount Olive Highschool are very kind and accepting.', 'Mount Olive gave me the best education possible, allowing me to further explore my career choice. There were a huge variety of electives to choose from. The staff are very supporting in leading students down the right path in education success.', "Has the most state-of-the-art facilities from the football stadium, to the recording studio and a MILL with more than 30 3-D printers. Focused on school spirit, academics, athletics, and has a large number of clubs. Some problems with high school guidance counselors. Overall, I know that if I hadn't attended the Mount Olive School District schools, I wouldn't be as prepared to excel in the future.", "I like the school itself, we are very lucky to have the courses we offer and many of the teachers genuinely care. Sometimes though they stress too much about the number you score on standardized tests making students feel like just a number. However, they do put a lot of effort into furthering our STEAM and robotics programs. We have 32 3D printers and a super cool innovation lab as well as a recording studio. While these things are cool, maybe MOHS should focus a little more on getting enough chrome books so that teachers aren't scrambling to get chrome books carts for their classes. The environment is pretty good, nobody really gives each other any trouble and for the most part, we are all really helpful. Recently, we have started the Air Force Jr. ROTC program and it is a lot of fun and I really hope more people join so that it can continue next year.", "I liked the amount of clubs and sports available that many other schools don't have. It is definitely something to take advantage of.", 'Mount Olive High School provides a warm, welcoming environment for all students who enter through its doors. It offers academic and extra-curricular opportuinites as well as important college and career preparation.', 'Our students have every opportunity possible to succeed the, parents, community, administration really work hard to make sure the kids have everything they need to be productive.', "I love everything about Mount Olive High School! The teachers and staffs are very helpful and available at anytime. And when it comes to resources, there are variety of resources that are available for the students and teachers. There are  various clubs and activities that keep students actively involved throughout the school year. Overall, I've had an amazing experience so far.", "Guidance counselor's  helping more with students getting ready for college.  Most students are unaware how to apply and especially how to apply for scholarship s.  It seems like only a handful was acknowledge or this.  Also be more greatful and aware of students who never missed a day of school and acknowledge them instead of parents having to make sure that each school be aware of this important fact.", 'Mount Olive High School is a very spirited and controlled school which I have had a very positive experience in, from the activities always planned, to the improvements that the school has underwent during my stay, I could not have asked for a better High School to graduate and study from. I find the teachers all very educated in their field, and the academics very challenging, pushing me to achieve potentials I did not know I was capable of.', 'The teachers were fantastic.  They would always make sure that you knew all your lessons.  If not they knew and would reach out to you.  The teachers would tutor you through their lunch break or stay after school sometimes even coming to work earlier the next day to meet with you.  Honestly, they were the best.  Plus we had a terrific Principal Standsberry.', "The staff and students there were very open and welcoming when I transferred there my junior year. The schedule was very easy to follow and the curriculum was strong and one of the best I've ever encountered.", 'Throughout all my years in school, the teachers have gone beyond their requirements to help me succeed and teach me what  I need to know. Also, a lot of my teachers create a good connection with their students where each student feels comfortable in engaging in all the activities that are planned in the classroom. Over the years  I have created a bond with some teachers where I can talk to them about concerns or problems and they will try to help me through it. One thing that I want to see a change in is how little attention the special needs program is given. I feel special education needs more opportunities for learning. Mount Olive had an amazing special education program but through the years it has been declining.', "I felt that my time at Mount Olive High School was definitely not wasted. I personally feel that the wide array of class offered here at Mount Olive can cater to any individuals interests and needs. However the school is also very focused on sports and test scores of their students, instead of the academic success, and satisfaction of their students. Throughout the future Mount Olive High School should focus more so on how student are performing academically, and recognize what other clubs and activities, that aren't sports, have accomplished. Overall, Mount Olive is a great school, with outstanding facilities and teachers, and I believe will be a great place for future students to attend and excel."]

column2: ['Overall, Colts Neck High School is a great school. I really enjoyed my time there. I met some of my best friends here, and I had a fun experience.', 'This is a good school overall, but the level of useful experience will depend on the courses you choose to take. Often, the AP and college courses are taught by the best teachers, and, while most are not really difficult, provide the best learning opportunity. Otherwise, staff in lower-related classes are not the best, and the administration is often incredibly frustrating.', 'Colts Neck High school was a great high school and definitely one of the best in the district. the academics at Colts Neck are great and many of the teachers are dedicated to their students success. Plus CNHS has air conditioning! The school could work on how much support the arts get, most funding goes towards a football team that is not very good :(', 'The students aren’t very friendly.  Some teachers are terrible, and you get stuck with them.  Some teachers take it out on the kids when a parent emails them with questions or asks for help.  This makes it hard for you to help your child with homework or studying.  Academically it’s very challenging and the school is beautiful.  The guidance counselors are excellent.  The principal is great.', 'The experience was quite exceptional. I was able to make new friends even though I transferred in during my junior year. The faculty was quite kind and welcoming and the students were as well. The academics prepared me for college l, putting me ahead as the teachers prepared me enough for me to place out of calculus one as well as physics one. Lunch was chaotic, I believe if they implemented two separated lunches, the experience may have been lighter on the staff at food service. Find a place to sit was difficult, especially for people who are not acclimated with the their classmates. The lunch lines were also quite long, taking up to twenty minutes of our designated lunch time. Sports are quite exhilarating as being part of a team, and dedicated to winning introduces an intimate relationship among students participating in sports.', "I thought Colts Neck high school was a great school. When I first attended, I recently moved from northern New Jersey, so I was on a completely fresh start. I knew not one person at all. I met friends quickly because everyone there is really nice but I jumped around friend groups until I hit senior year, that's when I found a good group of friends for myself. Overall, Colts Neck is an amazing school, and I would never regret moving there.", 'Provided a good high school education and a decent selection of AP classes in order to push yourself as a student. But high school is high school, no matter where you go.', 'If your child is a minority, I recommend you send them elsewhere. ESL students are constantly being accused of partaking in illegal activities by students. Little repercussion towards students who make threats or say racist slurs. There is a huge drug scene with Marijuana, Xanax, Adderall, and acid being common drugs of choice. Academics are very good. Teachers who are not tenured are seen as disposable and some who are are seen as angels despite serious allegations towards a few. This school is due for serious reform including an attempt to remove de facto segregation. Disadvantaged students at this school fall far behind other students in the state.', "The thing I like the most about this school is the people. Even though Colts Neck is known to be a rich town, the students are humble and create a sense of family; the students never fail to be there for each other during tough times. The teachers are impactful and provide students with an outlet to talk; they really do care and, the majority of the time, CNHS picks the most amazing ones out there. I'm proud to be called a cougar, not only due to my school's stellar academics, but also due to its familial aspect.", "It is a great school. Most of the teachers are very good. It offers many high level classes. It is very safe. The Law and Public Service and Navy Junior ROTC programs and English Second Language programs all add the the school's diversity. There are also a wide variety of clubs and sports offered.", 'Small school and small classes, the district is well funded, offering special programs in ROTC&  Law and Public Safety, amazing individualized sports programs, lots of opportunities for students to excel by taking advanced placement coursework, excellent staff and overall nice kids.  Kids who do not place high in mathematics and other classes have room for advancement by taking summer coursework and or additional support classes.  Beautiful campus is a gorgeous town and plenty of opportunity for extracurricular activities.', "Colts Neck isn't anything of a crazy school. It's straightforward, blunt, and gets what it needs to be done. It has an outstanding amount of sports, clubs, and programs, and provides plenty of opportunity for people to be involved. There is a very small amount of racially different groups, but there is never any instances of racism, outbursts, bullying, or any unnecessary violence or hatred. Colts Neck isn't bad, but it's pretty standard and gets the job done.", 'Colts Neck High School is an amazing High School that has outstanding teachers pushing kids to prepare them for college. Everyone in the school is kind, caring, and always understanding. The place felt like home the second I walked in.', "Good school. I live in Howell Township, but I was districted to CNHS. I expected to be a kid that wasn't invited because I lived in Howell. That was not the case though. All the students and teachers here for the most part are very nice and caring. I'm reaching the end of my senior year currently and it has been a good time throughout the four years learning here. I made a lot of friends, both peers and teachers combined.", "I am a senior at Colts Neck High School and I could not be happier where I am today. Colts Neck has shaped me into the person who I am today and I am super grateful! There is an amazing staff that helps you along every step of the way. the teachers always go out of their way to make sure you understand a topic because they want you to exceed in life. Also, I would not have been able to apply to any colleges if it wasn't for my guidance counselor, Mrs. VanDeVusse. She helps me with everything I need about college and she has helped me achieve my life long goal of being accepted into Louisiana State University. I will be starting in the fall of 2019. I am also involved in the NJROTC program at the school and that program is the best program out there! It teaches you leadership skills and you make so many friends through the process and I cannot imagine my life without any of the people I met throughout my journey.", 'Staff is very supportive of students and encourages students to reach their potential! There are so many opportunities to be Involved in clubs and sports.  Teachers are always available for enrichment and extra help.', 'Like many, I figured the transition from middle school to high school with completely different people would be a struggle. However, my peers and the staff themselve have all been very welcoming since I got here my freshmen year. I’m now a junior and I can’t phathom to think about leaving next year. The memories I have made here so far at Colts Neck High School are just unforgettable.', 'Colts Neck High School excels in most aspects regarding academics, school spirit, security, teachers, and clubs. Today, we wear Cougar Pride apparel to prove our loyalty and school spirit. We have various clubs from Free the Children which raises money for impoverished towns in 3rd world countries to Girls Who Code which inspired young women to join the computer science field. There are clubs for different professions such as DECA, JSA, and Book Club. Our security is top notch in that Officer McNamara, former Navy Seal, roams the building. Knowing someone like that is protecting our schools gives us all a sense of security. Always cheering her students on, Ms. Biddulph, our Latin teacher, always attends competitions in hopes to raise student morale. There are many teachers like her who care about their jobs. Teachers such as Mr. Phillips and Mrs. Manos are insightful and knowledgeable in their fields. This allows for a rigorous curriculum that fosters college readiness.', 'I was not overly impressed with the upper level/honors teachers. A few were excellent, several were not.  Teachers have expectations of their students, but students and parents have expectations of their teachers as well, especially at the higher levels, and those expectations were not always met.', "The environment of Colts Neck High School is extremely unique. Most of the people there are extremely accepting of everyone, even when their political opinions are extremely contradicting. One thing I would like to see change in this school is the amount of school spirit instilled in the student, and in order to do this, I'd suggest restarting Friday Night Lights, and allowing more student planned events to take place in and out of school. Another change I would make would be directed towards the teachers to also get more involved with the school and its events, as well as developing better relations with the students rather."]
