Colts Neck has shaped me into the person who I am today and I am super grateful! There is an amazing staff that helps you along every step of the way. the teachers always go out of their way to make sure you understand a topic because they want you to exceed in life. Also, I would not have been able to apply to any colleges if it wasn't for my guidance counselor, Mrs. VanDeVusse. She helps me with everything I need about college and she has helped me achieve my life long goal of being accepted into Louisiana State University. I will be starting in the fall of 2019. I am also involved in the NJROTC program at the school and that program is the best program out there! It teaches you leadership skills and you make so many friends through the process and I cannot imagine my life without any of the people I met throughout my journey.", 'Staff is very supportive of students and encourages students to reach their potential! There are so many opportunities to be Involved in clubs and sports.  Teachers are always available for enrichment and extra help.', 'Like many, I figured the transition from middle school to high school with completely different people would be a struggle. However, my peers and the staff themselve have all been very welcoming since I got here my freshmen year. I’m now a junior and I can’t phathom to think about leaving next year. The memories I have made here so far at Colts Neck High School are just unforgettable.', 'Colts Neck High School excels in most aspects regarding academics, school spirit, security, teachers, and clubs. Today, we wear Cougar Pride apparel to prove our loyalty and school spirit. We have various clubs from Free the Children which raises money for impoverished towns in 3rd world countries to Girls Who Code which inspired young women to join the computer science field. There are clubs for different professions such as DECA, JSA, and Book Club. Our security is top notch in that Officer McNamara, former Navy Seal, roams the building. Knowing someone like that is protecting our schools gives us all a sense of security. Always cheering her students on, Ms. Biddulph, our Latin teacher, always attends competitions in hopes to raise student morale. There are many teachers like her who care about their jobs. Teachers such as Mr. Phillips and Mrs. Manos are insightful and knowledgeable in their fields. This allows for a rigorous curriculum that fosters college readiness.', 'I was not overly impressed with the upper level/honors teachers. A few were excellent, several were not.  Teachers have expectations of their students, but students and parents have expectations of their teachers as well, especially at the higher levels, and those expectations were not always met.', "The environment of Colts Neck High School is extremely unique. Most of the people there are extremely accepting of everyone, even when their political opinions are extremely contradicting. One thing I would like to see change in this school is the amount of school spirit instilled in the student, and in order to do this, I'd suggest restarting Friday Night Lights, and allowing more student planned events to take place in and out of school. Another change I would make would be directed towards the teachers to also get more involved with the school and its events, as well as developing better relations with the students rather."]
column6: ['I was enrolled in the LPS program, was very rewarding except our senior year was the first year the internship program was implemented and we were essentially the guinea pigs working out the kinks of the program as we went along.', "The academics at Colts Neck are top notch, and teachers put a lot of effort into their classes. The food is ok, but lunch service has gotten worse with block scheduling this year. Colts Neck is one of the only schools in the area without a turf field, and it is difficult to play games in rainy weather as the grass cannot withstand a substantial amount of rain. Most students don't attend sporting events, with the exception of state tournament games. All in all a good school, but could use some work to improve facilities for students.", "Diversity is very much lacking. However, most students are hard-working and most teachers are passionate about their teaching and care about their students' success.", 'I like Colts Neck High School very much but I wish our school spirit was a lot better. All the other schools in our district go to all the big sports games but our school does not. Colts Neck is more of an academic school than a sports school.', 'let\'s go over the main points of my school, The best teachers in this school really are great and all of the teachers were supportive as long as a student makes an effort in their work. Dud teachers are either really nice but not great teachers or not particularly kind but frankly alright teachers, but seldom ever both. While culturally, it\'s 90% wealthy white kids, mentally and subculturally quite diverse. There\'s a pretty healthy nerd culture, with a lot of hobby clubs. That being said, while there are kliks, there isn\'t any one "popular group". The school never has physical fights, which I think is pretty impressive. Acedemicly, there\'s a number of teirs which allow most students to be challenged but not overwhelmed. There\'s plenty of honors and AP choices. The hardest class I\'ve taken so far is honors biology, as well as rough and medicore world language courses. LPS Magnet program is somewhat isolated but Rotc is pretty included.', 'I like the fact that the school challenged me. I really had to work for my grades which I know will benefit me for college.', 'My daughter is now graduating from CNHS and she had the best experience. ThebAdministration including teachers all have been extremely kind and helpful.', "After my four years at Colts Neck High School I have come to love the school and the people within it. From coaches, to teachers, to all the other staff members, I have nothing but good things to say. The school keeps on improving and I can't find anything that would need changing. I couldn't have asked for a better high school experience.", 'Colts Neck is the perfect place for me to go.  I feel at home and I feel comfortable with all the teachers and students around me.  School makes me so happy and Colts Neck suits all of the needs I have.', 'Colts Neck High School has a network of dedicated (for the most part) teachers who are often willing to go out of their way to help you. However, the administration is very busy and often lacks time to aid students on an individual basis. The guidance department is inattentive when it comes to aiding with the college application process, especially when students are doing fine academically. The culture of the school is average in that students are kind but lack school spirit. Academically, students are challenged more than one would think as most students do not cause trouble, allowing for a purely educational time.', 'Everyone at Colts Neck was very warm and inviting. The school was always clean. The only one in the district with air conditioning/heat was a huge plus.', 'I love this school very much. I do not want anything to change.  It is safe and everyone is happy here.  We get to learn a lot, but still have fun at the same time.  I do not want to leave this school ever.', 'The school is very clean and has a lot of course options. They offer many AP and Honors level classes, which was helpful for students that like to challenge themselves and take more in depth classes. There are many fun extra-curricular activities available as well, such as JSA, Drama Club, and Free the Children.', "Not a great environment. Administration doesn't care about students. Advisors are little to no help.", 'The school is the most modern school and is fully weather controlled. However,  some of the rooms clearly become too hot or too cold too often. Also, the teachers at the school are great and some of the best in district- most of them at least. Besides this, the school technology wise and rule wise are the same throughout the district. With recent change in the principal and vice principal, some the rules have gotten somewhat stricter and have annoyed student like myself a lot more.', 'I came from another country last year, My sophomore year was my 1st year in this school and I loved it because the teachers are very nice and caring and they also gives a really good understanding in Academics as well.', 'Before coming to Colts Neck High School, I was previously in the Union Township Schools. I can definitely say that this school has prepared me so well for college and has some of the kindest people I know. I enjoyed all the time I had here and I would definitely recommend it to any student.', "Colts Neck High School is a school where students can go unnoticed. Problems within peers tend to hold more awareness than struggling students who need help. The level of drama at this school is fueled by the teachers unawareness to the classroom conversations. Some teachers do care for their pupils, while others don't.", 'Amazing school. The Staff is amazing, they prepare you very well for college. Great in academics, clubs and activities, safety, and pretty diverse.', "During my time at Colts Neck High School I was involved heavily with my academics, activities as well as socially. I may not have been the most popular girl at school nor the most unpopular girl at school but I cannot say my time during high school was wasted. I enjoyed being as involved as I was during my four years. One thing I would like to see changed within my high school would be the involvement of the teachers and staff with students who see potential. High school is about finding yourself and your own path but most are still just children and need that guiding hand. Teachers and staff should be more involved with students who are going through the college application process, especially for some who's parents are not as involved it can make the world of a difference."]
column8: ["Colts Neck High School is a great school with a variety of courses to take as well as people to meet. There are many programs to get involved in includin ROTC, LPS, and many sports. Being a student athlete, I was able to work with my teachers to rearrange certain schedules including when to take tests I've missed, project deadline extensions, etc. I have had a great (almost) four years and wouldnt change them for any other experience at any other high school. The teachers, classmates, and overall vibe of the school is what made my high school experience so memorable.", "While my daughter is getting a decent education, I think the school is lacking good teachers. There are too many complaints about how they aren't learning the things they need to to take tests. The teachers seem lazy and content with handing out reading assignments and not actually teaching a lesson.Also, my daughter is a musician. The music department is lame. The director seems checked out and doesn't keep it current. This attitude has kept most of my child's middle school peers out of the program in the high school. It's a shame for the kids that are still playing.", "I loved my four years at Colts Neck. I have build such close relations with so many of my teachers that have truly had such an impact on me. Each teacher genuinely cares about their class and providing students with the best education possible. Sports are great at this school they allow students to build close relationships outside of the classroom and allow to share similar interests with peers. The school is very diverse and accepting of all races and sexualities. I'm so happy I got to spend four years here", 'My experience at Colts Neck High School has been great.  The principal, Mr. Simon, really cares about the students, the classes are small, giving you more individual attention, the football program, lead by Superbowel winning Coach Darian Barnes, has helped me develop as a student-athlete, and I have made lifetime friends.  The school is equipped with state of the art technology, and there are activities for everyone.  The Naval JROTC program I have been in these four years has taught me valuable leadership skills.', 'I truly enjoyed Colts Neck High School. It was a safe haven that was free of all bullying, had amazing academics, and even better air conditioning.', 'My experience at colts neck high school was the typical high school experience. Many opportunities to excel in studies, clubs and activities were given as resources for a better college outlook, and even sports that had contributed to the school spirit aspect. Nevertheless i feel as though some diversity in clubs, and even the school itself would help with the atmosphere and spirit within the students. There were many beneficial factors i have received from my education here that i am thankful for, being that colts neck was and still is a substantial school.', "Colts Neck High School is mainly the typical high school. However, it is the teachers that make this school special. All of them encourage a great learning experience in which many thrive. Also, there are so many extracurricular activities and opportunities it's academics!", 'The course selection options are great as the school is college preparatory. They offer great electives as well as the core academic classes. My daughter has been able to take 6 honors and 6 AP classes that have really challenged her where my other daughter will enjoy all of the academic courses offered.  Its great for all kids of various paths.  The popular classes are math, science, social studies and english.  They have a great business management class, excellent art classes and home economics classes too.  The teachers are there to teach and encourage creativity.', 'Colts Neck High School really promotes school spirit and offers a club for everyone. In the morning before school begins they have kids there 20 minutes early where they can meet with clubs or socialize with friends.  There are over 50 (+)  clubs offered at the school.  From the chess club to DECA, My Hometown, Free the Children, SADD, and a variety of others it gives students the opportunity to connect with kids with similar goals and interests. Each club has an advisor which is a teacher who gives extra time to help out.  The teacher offers their classroom for meetings either before or after school. Once a student is in National Honor Society they are required to do community service and many of the clubs offer opportunities to obtain this.', 'I have mostly come into contact with well educated and informed teachers who have the students best interest at hand. Most teachers offer extra help both before and after class. The teachers are well educated and have high expectations for their students. When I attend back to school night a majority of the teachers have strong communication skills, a teaching style that connects with the kids, and a grading system that is fair. I believe Colts Neck High School only tries to hire teachers with solid experience and ones that can work well with the student population.', "Colts Neck High School is an environment where the kids are  pushed to be all they can be!  They are encouraged to be independent and work hard for their individual success and for their entire student body. The school offers all types of classes that can appeal to all types of students including AP classes. The school has many clubs and a lot of school spirit including Battle of the Classes. The staff offers many meetings throughout the year to inform parents of any important updates regarding their child's academic and social experience.  The lines of communication are open. My daughters are both involved in the school and want to best for all students involved.  This is a college prep focused school where I believe most students are moving towards a four year degree.  I couldn't sat enough great things about CNHS, the leadership, the staff and the students!", 'The teachers are great, the curriculum was well laid out and  scheduling did not seem to be an issue.', 'There  did not seem to be much pure pressure and everyone got along well.', "I didn't  participate in any  extracurricular activities.", 'Colts neck was a great high school and if I had to go back and  redo it I would want to be there.', 'The teachers at colts neck are great, most go above and beyond to make sure the students and learning in a safe environment.', "The classes are fantastic.  The workload is heavy, but it's worth it for how much you learn.", "When it comes to race or religion, it isn't terrible.  When it comes to being either part of the LGBT community or female, it is.  We had an incident in our school where students were saying rape is okay.  GSA put up Caitlyn Jenner posters and they were graffitied on.  As a trans person, I feel that I'm not accepted at all here.", "I'm involved in both Gay-Straight Alliance and Junior Statesmen of America and I'm very happy with them.  I wish they were funded better.", 'The school is pretty good when it comes to quality of classes, organization, etc.  However, their policies regarding bathrooms and changing rooms are not transgender friendly.']
